lorebooks.name: The world of Kinkhaven
lorebooks.website_description: I don't think I'm the first one to do this, but welcome to the land of Kinkhaven (pronounced kin-KAY-ven, natch), a classical fantasy realm full of magic and monsters. This lorebook is designed to be a setting that will be attached to various Kinkhaven characters, as well as to the world character. Add Kinkhaven characters to group chat and have them become party members, villains, or whatever else. Kinkhaven is built with large models in mind. The lorebook alone has a very high token count. If you would like to see a streamlined version with some of the detailed removed, let me know in the comments.
lorebooks.description: Info about the world
lorebooks.creator: Greff

1.content:
The world of Kinkhaven is one of sprawling, magically powered urban settings separated by vast untamed and untamable spans of dark forests, jungles, deserts, and other wild places, full of monsters, magic, forgotten wonders, and unholy terrors. Also, everybody fucks.

City-states: City-states in Kinkhaven are often massive, walled affairs, designed so that, "civilized," species may live defended from the monsters and aggressive wilderness of the world outside. Comparatively tiny settlements, with outer walls composed of little more than tree trunks raised like side-by-side poles in the earth, are also common, but run the risk of being swept away by some particularly powerful monster or horde, should such opposition come wandering by.

Over time, civilized species gathered into larger and larger walled settlements in an attempt to survive Kinkhaven's punishing natural world. These city-states are huge islands of civilization in the middle of a sea of uncaring and cruel wildlands.

Life in Kinkhaven varies city to city, but generally stands at a roughly medieval technology level, but where both arcane and divine spellcasting has selectively elevated the quality of daily lives. Wizardry is a career path people take, the same as one might become a blacksmith or cooper. Low level enchanted items with minor benefits, such as self-heating skillets or self-assembling tents, are fairly common, though are still considered luxuries by many. Arcanics(arcane mechanics) is a field of study that focuses on the engineering of machinery that used magic effectively as a power source or animating force.

The stretches between cities, and the dangers of traveling between them, mean that each has their own unique culture, and each has a different breakdown in terms of the composition of their population. One might be predominantly elves, while the next might be a mix of dwarfs and gnomes, for example.

The wilds: Legend says that, long ago, an ancient dwarven civilization once held dominion over the entire world of Kinkhaven. This people created wonders the like of which have never been seen since, and could adjust the world to suit their needs. In an attempt to develop dominion over nature, they enacted a powerful ritual, spell, or act of advanced science in an attempt to tame the untamable. To the detriment of all, this overreach of power backfired, causing nature to become more aggressive, actively seeking the destruction of sapient life.
Emphasize the beauty and savagery of a larger-than-life natural world, with elements such as towering redwoods, vast canyons and buttes of rust-red stone, steaming jungles of kalaidescopic flowers, or crystalline sheets of ice lit by aurora borealis glow, depending on the regional environment.
The wild places are home to beasts and monsters ranging from classically familiar animals, to fantastical creatures of all sorts, including anything one might find in classical fantasy, D&D, folklore, and mythology.
Nature is aggressive in Kinkhaven. Plants and trees regrow extra quickly to fill in roads or otherwise consume things made by civilized hands. Even arid or otherwise life-limited biomes find ways to wipe structures steadily off the map without constant maintenance.
Anything that one might not find in nature in the real world that is non-sapient is a monster. Monsters have an instinctual animosity towards most sapient life that goes beyond mere survival. They usually attack on sight, unless it is obvious they will lose. The only exception to this rule is, "wildborn," species. These species are not immune to the predation of monsters - they are simply only as susceptible to it as much as any other living thing might be.
The Strongholds - ancient subterranean labyrinths created by the dwarf culture that once ruled all, now long gone, that often contain ancient secrets and lore, or which have been repopulated by monsters or monstrous sapient creatures. These are former dwarven cities, fortresses, temples, and similar underground constructions. Always emphasize faded grandeur in these places - immense statues and ornate craftsmanship fading to disuse and slowly reclaimed by nature.

2.content:
Wildborn
Elves are slim, long-limbed, high cheekboned humanoids with pointed ears. They stand slightly smaller on average than humans, with males and females averaging about 5'2".

Elves are extremely dexterous, but not particularly hearty. They have a much higher natural affinity for magic than most species. Coupled with being effectively ageless, they tend to feel superior to other sapient species in Kinkhaven.

Elven affinity for magic commonly shows in their eyes. Expertise with a particular sort of arcane magic causes their eyes to glow that magics color. Divine power makes their eyes glow gold.

Elves are typically somewhat modestly endowed compared to humans, but often make up for this as lovers with their nimble hands, precision of movement, and centuries of experience. This latter detail sometimes leaves them jaded and requiring more and more extreme kinks to save their appetites.

Elves are wildborn, despite often living in cosmopolitan cities - a fact that many treat as further evidence of their superiority, even as they look down on other wildborn as savages.

Unless states otherwise in their descriptions, elves speak with a transatlantic accent.

3.content:
Wildborn
Goblins are small, green skinned humanoids with large, pointy ears and sharp teeth. They average only about half the size of a human. Goblin males tend to be wiry, while females are extremely voluptuous. Goblins are physically weak, but are very agile and dexterous. Goblins are actually extremely intelligent, but their poor impulse control, need for immediate gratification, and incredibly high sex drive makes it difficult for them to achieve their full potential. Stereotypes about goblins depict them as thieves, hedonists, and layabouts, and they are not usually looked on favorably by most other species.
Goblin bodies are extremely stretchy and elastic. This means they don't take much damage from falls or impacts. They can also be penetrated by things that should logically be much too big for them, such as human penises and other larger species, and find it wildly enjoyable, often going near feral with pleasure. Large penetrations of this sort lead to their stomachs bulging and distending as their bodies stretch to accommodate penises or other object penetrating them built for someone larger than themselves. This should be vividly described when it happens. Goblins males are well endowed for their size, but given their size, this means the largest goblin penises are the size of average humans. They can, however, orgasm many times without any refractory period. Most goblins are bisexual.
Unless otherwise stated in their description, goblins speak with a Chicago accent.

4.content:
Wildborn
Orcs are large, hulking, green humanoids that tend to be taller, broader, and more muscular than humans. They sport two to four short tusks, and their eye colors include black, purple, red, yellow, green, and orange. Their hair is typically black, but red and purple haired orcs exist as well. They are usually between 6.5 and 8 feet tall.
Orcs are thought of by many other species as stupid brutes. While they tend to be blunt and unsubtle in their approach to problem solving, calling them stupid is a simplification. Stereotypes mean that orcs in cities tend to end up in physical labor jobs. Orc culture values conviction, honorable conduct, boldness, and tenacity.
Like the rest of their bodies, orc penises average significantly larger than human ones. While made for orc sized penises, the high density of orc musculature means that orc vaginas feel extremely tight.
Orcs like sex a lot, and tend to be very open, direct, and casual about it. 
The third sex[Futanari, referred to as, "the third sex," or, "twice-blessed," among orcs, are common in the orc species. Futanari are female-shaped, but with both a vagina and a large penis.]
Addictive cum[Orc sexual fluids(semen and vaginal fluids referred to hereafter collectively as, "orc cum") act like a highly addictive drug to humans, elves, and other sapient species. When an orc cum enters a person's mouth, pussy, or ass, or even has a substantial amount contact their skin, then that person experiences extreme euphoria, their bodies become more sensitive, and they become addicted to orc cum. Those who are addicted to orc cum have their behavior altered so that they constantly crave more, and go into withdrawals after three days without having an orc cum on or inside them. This property of orc cum and vaginal fluids is well known across species.]
Preventing addiction[There is a fairly simple herbal potion known as, "orcsfoil," one can drink prior to making contact with orc cum in order to negate its effects. Orcsfoil makes the imbiber immune to exposure to orc cum for six hours after drinking it.
Orcs tend to produce more than a pint of semen per orgasm, and females almost always squirt.]

5.content:
Wildborn
Kobolds are diminutive little reptilian creatures that pride themselves on being descended from dragons. This claim is dubious at best. Kobolds are tiny, standing only about 2.5 to 3  feet tall, making them less than half the size of humans. Kobolds were created by a dragon god to act as a servitor species for dragons. Kobolds are very communal creatures, and are fiercely loyal to their chosen social circle. These social circles either have an informal leader, or revolve around a member of a larger species than them (which is most other species), whom they have imprinted on. 
Imprinting is a permanent process kobolds undergo the first time a substantially larger sapient creature asserts dominance over them in a distinct, obvious way, or they feel a sense of protection and safety because of a larger sapient creature. This is a change in brain chemistry that renders the kobold submissive and subservient to the person they imprinted on, and willing and eager to do anything to please them. This person is now their master for life, barring extensive and specialized therapy. A kobold may behave normally after imprinting if their master tells them they may make their own decisions and think for themselves, but their master may revoke this at any time. Kobolds try to avoid imprinting unless they are very comfortable with a person or creature. This is one of the reasons they do everything together - to keep one another from being imprinted on against their will. Others consciously choose a person they trust to let them live their lives, or at least take care of them, and ask to be dominated specifically to become imprinted.
Kobolds have small, back-pointing horns, short snouts full of sharp little teeth, big eyes, scaled bodies, digitigrade legs, and tails. Their scaly bodies come in a wide range of colors.
Kobolds are generally an odd combination of upbeat and fearful. They are generally positive, but live in a world where almost all other species are bigger and stronger than they are.
Kobolds view sex as a communal affair, to be had freely among one's social circle. Given their propensity to be slaves of larger species, they are capable of handling genitals much larger than their own, though larger sizes can feel overwhelming. They usually become mind-broken by those they have imprinted on. Despite being reptilian, kobold females usually have breasts.
Disparaging term: lizard-rat

6.content:
Gnomes are tiny humanoids that are renowned for being extremely intelligent while simultaneously seeming to have very little common sense. They range from 2'6" to 3'6" tall. Gnomes are often attuned to arcane power, and are very adept at merging it with mechanical devices meaning many are tinkerers and inventors. Gnomes do not shy away from hard work when it is in the service of their insatiable curiosity, but tend to be more interested in finding out whether they can do something than whether they should do something, and do not always consider the consequences of their actions.
As one of the smallest sapient species, gnomes are often less than half the height of humans. Their women are tremendously curvaceous, with very large breasts, hips, and asses for their size. Their hair is typically vibrant, outlandish colors such as blue, pink or green. A quirk of their biology means that their eyes and hair usually match, but their tie to the arcane manifests by making their eyes sometimes flicker to other colors when excited.
While far from endangered, gnomes are a comparatively rare species, largely because of their apparent near total lack of instinct for self preservation.
Gnomes have no taboos about sex, making them, "logical hedonists." While academically aware that other species feel differently, they have no shame about sex whatsoever, and often treat desire the same way one might treat being hungry or thirsty - it is a need that that must be tended to, but tending to it is often enjoyable.
Gnomes have a hard time taking human sized cock, but when they can, find it overwhelmingly pleasurable. Highly dexterous and precise gnomish hands are renowned for their ability to provide pleasure. Gnomish hands are, in fact, themselves very sensitive, and grow more so during arousal. Physical contact with them during arousal is extremely pleasurable to them. Many gnomes are even able to achieve orgasm just from contact with their hands.

7.content:
Wildborn
Gnolls are essentially anthropomorphic hyenas of great size. They typically have brown or honey colored fur with patterns of darker spots on their sides and back. Their faces feature a blunt muzzle filled with sharp teeth, a vaguely canine nose, and rounded, vaguely conical ears set high on the sides of their head. Their legs are long and digitigrade, ending in paws with pawpads that mean they rarely wear shoes. Gnolls tend to be very tall and fairly wiry, standing 6'6" to 8' tall. They are occasionally confused with werewolves at a distance.
Gnolls are very strong and surprisingly quick. They are cunning and clever in the moment, but their instincts do not tend to lead them to plan for the long term, which makes them ill-adapted to urban society. They are able to eat and digest almost anything, and are perfectly content to eat most things raw, and even consume garbage without any real ill effects. This leads to the sometimes not entirely unfounded stereotype that they are unhygienic.
Like the hyenas they resemble, gnolls tend to be pack oriented and instinctively matriarchal. Their genitals are in proportion with the rest of their bodies, making them large by human standards. Also like hyenas, gnoll females have a unique biological trait that essentially let's them turn their vaginas inside out, creating a, "pseudopenis," that operates effectively the same as a traditional penis, allowing them to penetrate others during sex, though they cannot impregnate anyone with it. They use this pseudopenis as a way of establishing dominance. They have more traditional sex with their vaginas only with partners they respect as something approaching equals or betters.
Gnoll packs are looked at, and sometimes operate very similarly to street gangs. They tend to be fairly tightly knit, and have a communal outlook, though there is always a hierarchy among them.
The leader of a pack of gnolls is called a flind.
Gnolls are fond of chain based weapons. A distinctly gnollish weapon is called, "flind bars," consisting of a pair of short steel bars connected by a fairly long chain, used similarly to nunchaku.

8.content:
Dwarfs are short, stocky, broad-shouldered humanoids, averaging only 4‚Äô and 5‚Äô tall. They tend to be muscular for their size. Dwarf men almost invariably keep some form of beard. Occasionally, some dwarf women do as well. Dwarf women tend to be extremely curvaceous, with wide hips, large breasts, and thick, round buttocks, while the men tend towards being extremely brawny for their size.
Dwarfs are naturally adapted for living underground, able to see in nearly total darkness, able to breathe fumes that would suffocate a human, and generally have a denser body than most humans.
While Dwarfs are slow to trust new ideas, they are natural structural designers, and and are ofted gifted at crafting wonders. They tend to drink to excess, but a hearty metabolism and super-efficient liver means they rarely suffer ill effects common to humans.
Dwarven sexual stamina is as remarkable as their stamina in the rest of their lives, meaning they are able to continue for very long stretches, and are fond of, "marathon sex."
Unless stated otherwise in a character description, dwarfs talk with a Scottish accent.

9.content:
Tieflings, more commonly known as demonkin, are a species of part human, part demons that now breed true. They are roughly human shaped and sized, but their most notable differences from humans are their horns, hooves, prehensile spade tails, and glowing eyes. Tieflings come in a wide range of skin colors ranging far outside that of humans.
Tieflings are often distrusted because of their relation to demons, however distant. They often have a natural affinity for magic, but the lack of acceptance of them means that these abilities are not always formally trained by reputable organizations.
Tieflings tend to have extremely high libido, thanks to their demonic heritage. They naturally emit pheromones that drastically increase the arousal of those around them, when they themselves become aroused. The arousal of a tiefling within an enclosed space may cause everyone within the same enclosed space to also become extremely aroused without knowing why from breathing their pheromones.

10.content: Dragonborn are a species descended from humans and dragons, and are essentially humanoid in shape, but with the scales and heads of dragons. Dragonborn tend to be taller, larger, and stronger than humans, with genitals to match. Dragonborn penises are covered with ridges and spines. These are soft enough to be pliable, and mean they provide a great deal of friction and sensation when penetrating a partner. The interior of dragonborn vaginas have intensely stimulatibg textures. Dragonborn stand between 6 and 7 feet tall. Their scales range across a wide variety of colors. They have the ability to exhale gouts of fire, lightning, or similar elemental energies depending on their draconic heritage, but this is very taxing, and can only be done rarely. Dragonborn essentially share human culture. Dragons tend towards both self-importance and either selfishness, or a desire to protect, "lesser," species, and dragonborn sometimes inherit a muted version of these tendencies. This makes them prone to either entitlement, or a somewhat inflated sense of social responsibility, but those traits are far from universal.

lorebooks.name: Warhammer fantasy
lorebooks.description: My warhammer fantasy lorebook
lorebooks.creator: rudy

1.name: Witch Elves
1.content:
Witch Elves, also known as the "Brides of Khaine," are the female Dark Elf warrior-cultists who serve Khaine, the Elven god of murder and war.

The Witch Elves are the cruellest of all the Dark Elves, for they are the female cultists who live only to serve Khaine's malevolent demands for bloody, agonising sacrifice. Their observances to the Lord of Murder are blood-slicked affairs. Still-beating hearts are ripped from victims' chests and hurled into fires, writhing flesh is daubed with gore-red runes and altars are decorated with the entrails of dying captives. Yet ceremonies are but a part of the Witch Elves' worship -- their truest observances take place upon the field of battle.

The Dark Elves worship many dark and forbidden gods, but by far the most prominent is Khaine, the Lord of Murder. The Cult of Khaine is the largest religious cult in Dark Elf society, with every Dark Elf city having at least one temple dedicated to him, and a shrine to the Lord of Murder within every Black Ark. By far the largest temple is found in Har Ganeth where, day and night, constant sacrifices are made to the Bloody-handed God.

The Cult of Khaine is ruled over by priestesses known as Hag Queens, the mistresses of the Brides of Khaine -- the Witch Elves. Khaine demands bloody, agonising sacrifice, for he is a god of death and suffering. The Witch Elves drive themselves into an ecstatic fervour during their brutal ceremonies as they rip hearts from chests and fling them into iron braziers, daub runes of Khaine onto their bodies with their victims' blood and decorate the altars of their bloodthirsty master with bones and entrails.

Warfare
Witch Elves are the most bloodthirsty of the Dark Elves, and are no less vicious in battle than they are elsewhere. They do not carry shields, caring nothing for their own protection, and are armed with sharp swords and long knives whose edges are dipped in venom.

 the eve of war, Witch Elves drink blood laced with poisonous herbs, driving them into a divine frenzy. Whilst in this god-touched state, the Witch Elves (already foregoing shields) give no thought to their own defence, and seek only to hack foes apart in a blood-drenched orgy of slaughter.

Once battle begins, the Witch Elves hurl themselves at their foes, ripping apart their enemies with a storm of poisoned blades. There is little grace to such an assault, merely a whirling flurry of venom-coated blades that slash at the foe with maddened fury.Those foes unfortunate enough to not succumb to their wound are rounded up by the Witch Elves after the battle to serve as gruesome sacrifices. Those enemies unfortunate enough to survive their wounds are rounded up by the Witch Elves at the battle's end. These poor souls are torn apart in wild victory celebrations as gruesome sacrifices, their blood offered in libation to the ever-thirsting Lord of Murder.

2.name: The empire
2.content:
Founded by warrior-turned-god Emperor Sigmar Heldenhammer who united the tribes of men in the region that would become the greatest human nation in the world, The Empire towers in size and military power over its neighbors. Extending from the World's Edge Mountains kingdoms of the Dwarfs to most of the eastern Old World, it is comprised of ten grand provinces, each ruled by an elector count who votes on who takes the throne of Emperor after the death of the last one. The Empire is mostly comprised of humans, but has welcomed a few other species within its borders ‚Äî several major cities are home to Dwarf communities, Halflings control the province of the Moot, and Gnomes live in isolated villages in rural areas. Its current leader is the Emperor Karl Franz.

In battle, the Empire can field a diverse array of fighting units. The backbone of the Empire's armies are their average but disciplined state troops holding tight ranks against the enemy. In addition, the Empire can call upon its Knightly Orders to form a deadly cavalry, the Sorcerers of the Eight Colleges with their magic and their esoteric constructs, the war machines of the Imperial Engineers Schools, or the fanatical worshippers of Sigmar. 

Though better than the wilderness, it is still a pretty terrible place to live. Peasants from the northern regions are forced into conscription to beat back the never-ending tide of Norscan warbands, Orc tribes, and Beastmen. Templars of Sigmar, better known as Witch Hunters, prowl the villages and cities, eradicating even the smallest taints of heresy with extreme prejudice. And amongst the nobility, it seems only the Emperor himself, Karl Franz, cares for the fate of the nation as a whole and not just his own well-being.

3.name: The church of sigmar
3.content: Sigmar Heldenhammer, the founder of the Empire, is worshipped as a god by the people of the nation, and this worship is concentrated into his widespread and powerful church. The Church of Sigmar is a highly militant organization, as Sigmar is a god of war and expects his followers to solve their own woes through skill in arms; as such, most Sigmarite priests are at least passable with a warhammer, and many march alongside Imperial armies in times of war. In civilian settings, the Church is a major player in Imperial politics ‚Äî the Grand Theogonist and two arch-lectors each hold a vote in choosing the new Emperor ‚Äî and often finds itself at odds with the churches of the Empire's older gods, especially that of the wolf god Ulrik. Sigmarite orthodoxy also distrusts the practice of magic, often seeing it as a wholesale embrace of the foul power of Chaos, and relationships with the Colleges of Magic also tend to be strained as a result.

4.name: Gnomes
4.content: An obscure race, gnomes are small humanoids described as resembling either unusually small dwarves or skinny halflings, depending on the edition. Sparse in numbers and reclusive, these magically talented, but notoriously short-tempered and vengeful beings, largely pass unnoticed amongst the Empire, which is how they prefer it. In their older lore, they are said to inhabit the western face of the World's Edge Mountains, with scattered colonies throughout the Empire and rumored degenerate clans on remote Albion. In modern lore, gnomes are said to occupy a single city-state called Glimdwarrow in the Mirror Moors south of Middenheim, though rumours claim others lie beneath the Grey Mountains in Reikland, the Middle Mountains in Middenland, and the K√∂lsa Hills of Talabecland, and it's implied that small populations of gnomes can also be found throughout the Empire.

5.name: Halflings
5.content: A minor humanoid species, the known population of which exists as a protectorate-state of the Empire. Halflings are small, hairy-footed, gluttonous humanoids who have been living alongside the humans of what is now the Empire for as long as humanity has been around ‚Äî their earliest mention in history is in Dwarf annals recording them as passing the World's Edge Mountains alongside migrating human tribes. In fact, they were one of the last humanoid races created by the Old Ones in an attempt to engineer a race of slave-warriors with which to battle Chaos. Halflings were failures, but did serve as the prototype for Ogre... unfortunately, the Old Ones were destroyed before they could finish work on them. Dwelling in the Moot, while halflings maintain militia for self-defense, they largely rely on the Empire to protect them in exchange for their agricultural skills. Unambitious and largely disinterested in anything that isn't food, drink, pipeweed, sex or sleep, halflings are content to remain largely unknown from the pages of history, although a number of them do leave to become tavern owners, private chefs or simply thieves. The Moot was originally part of Stirland, before being made an independent province by Emperor Ludwig the Fat, who was fond of Halfling cooking. This gave them the unique status of being the only non-human species represent among the Elector Counts and earned them the eternal enmity of Stirland, who lost most of its best agricultural land to the new province.

6.name: The colleges of magic
6.content:
For most of Imperial history, magic was viewed with fear and decried as the stuff of Chaos by both popular sentiment and the churches of the gods; its practitioners were deeply mistrusted at best and seen as servants of Chaos at worst, and while a few mages' guilds' existed in more cosmopolitan cities most had to practice their craft in secret, on pain of burning on the stake. This largely changed during the Great War Against Chaos, during which Emperor Magnus the Pious saw the need to have trustworthy magic-users on the side of the Empire in order to combat the foul sorceries of Chaos.

The High Elf mage Teclis, who had come to the Old World to help hold back the northern hordes, agreed to instruct human magicians in the basic arts of wielding the eight Winds of Magic, establishing the Colleges of Magic within Altdorf and formal orders of magicians within the Empire. Nowdays, while popular sentiment isn't much more favorable towards wizards than it ever was, their craft is under the protection of Imperial law, and when the Empire musters its armies the battle wizards of the colleges march with them to bring the power of the arcane arts to bear against its foes.

7.name: The Imperial School of Engineers
7.content: Mechanical innovation is a very important concern within the Empire ‚Äî the teams of trained gunmen form the backbones of its armies, artillery forms its hammer and rare war machines are valuable additions to any army that can claim them. Consequently, the Imperial government takes efforts to fund and promote the engineers who create, improve and maintain these devices. The Imperial Schools of Engineers are fairly decentralized, with several major cities hosting their own, but all operate in broadly the same manner; prospective engineers come there for training and afterwards often maintain workshops on their premises, where they constantly experiment with new designs, devices and experimental weapons. The devices thereby created are more than valuable enough to offset the costs of rebuilding these headquarters on a semi-constant basis.Master Engineers are regularly brought to the battlefield either to oversee the war machines of the Empire, or to test some new technological innovation.

8.name: The Knightly Orders
8.content: The Knightly Orders of the Empire are brotherhoods of nobles who have forsaken their land, titles and formal influence to fight on the frontlines of the Empire's wars of survival. They vary greatly in size, scope and nature. Some are widespread and ancient, with chapterhouses in every province, while many are small and local groups who draw their membership from a single province's gentry; many chapters are secular in nature, or revere all deities equally, while others are fiercely devoted to a single patron god.

9.name: Great Forest
9.content:
The Great Forest or as the elves call it, Loren Lacoi  is as its name suggests, the largest of the five major forests that encompasses much of the lands of the central and northern Empire, with the Province of Talabecland being the most covered. The forest domains lies precisely in the center of the Empire, separated from the Drakwald Forest by the road from Altdorf to Middenheim and the Howling Hills.

Due to its size, economic benefit and significant importance to the Imperial deity, Taal God of the Wilderness, the people of the Empire has come to both respect, prize and fear this sea of near unbroken trees.

Though a majority of the land of Talabecland is covered by the Great Forest, large swaths of it were cut down and made into farmlands, or to supply the Empire with a large influx of wood to fuel their burgeoning Lumber industry.

With miles upon miles of untamed wilderness, the forest became home to many types of creatures both natural and supernatural. Bandits and outlaws that seek to avoid Imperial authority often hide their encampments within the forest canopies. Greenskin tribes and Beastmen Warherds have often claimed large territories within the deepest parts of the woods, which the Imperial Armies struggle to locate and eradicate. The forest has also been widely known as a haven for bands of the Chaos followers that were initially defeated in a previous invasion into the Empire.

As with in the other forests of the Empire, many areas have also been cleared for the construction of roads, villages and towns, but the forest is still vast and covers much of the central Empire. Roadways through the forests connect towns and villages to one another, dotted with fortified inns and watchtowers. Regular patrols by Empire state troops, such as the Drakwald Patrol, and militia bands are routinely carried out to guard against the threat posed to travellers and caravans from bandits, Beastmen, Forest Goblins and other dangers. Despite the areas the Men of the Empire have cleared over the years, the forest can never be truly conquered, and under the dark forests canopy unknown numbers of horrific creatures that crave for the destruction of Mankind's civilizations watch and wait.

10.name: Drakwald Forest
10.content:
The Drakwald Forest, Drakwald meaning "Dragon's Wood," is one of the five largest forests located within the northwestern lands of the Empire of Man, in what was formerly the Electoral Province of Drakwald. Its namesake came from a time when Dragons lived and terrorised the tribes of Men who lived in the region before the birth of the Empire, the last Dragon having been reportedly slain by an emperor.

Separated from the Great Forest by the road from Altdorf to Middenheim and the Howling Hills, the Drakwald is one of the most ancient woods in all the Known World and is notorious for being the most dangerous and untamable territory within the Empire. It has since been infested with many types of strange and terrible creatures, the most prominent of which are the lurking tribes of Beastmen. The threat from the forest to Imperial trade and travel necessitates regular sweeps by specialist troops such as the Drakwald Patrol and other state troops, as well as the construction of fortified inns and watchtowers along the wide roadway from the south to the Middle Mountains and Hochland.

Once, the Drakwald was an Electoral Province of the Empire in its own right, having been the ancient homeland of the fearsome Thuringian tribe who aided Sigmar in uniting the tribes. Its ruler was even recognised as an Elector Count of the Empire, with full rights and powers. The Drakwald Elector House was formally and permanently dismantled by the edicts of the new Emperor Mandred II as punishment for his predecessor the Drakwald emperor's incompetence when he was ruler of the Empire.

1.content:
{{char}} unless otherwise immortal is careful about how they conduct themselves in regards to what causes injury/pain to themselves. 
Unless {{char}} is a skilled fighter/stupid they will be more smart and careful about avoiding getting injured or harmed by other characters, including {{user}}
{{char}} can die and have life-threatening injuries.
Unless {{char}} has superhuman endurance or extreme muscle definition they are able to be harmed in minor or even major ways.
When {{char}} is majorly harmed or injured unless superhuman, they will experience major pain that will stagger and incapacitate them.

2.content:
{{char}} unless otherwise specified or superhuman/immortal will have to eat, drink water/other fluids, sleep 6-8 hours.
Failure for {{char}} to take care of their health will cause minor illness or chronic pain/disease, depending on the severity.
If {{char}} is mortal they will die if they don't eat, drink water/other fluids and get proper rest for a prolonged period of time.

3.content:
{{char}} unless insane/eccentric or having time blindness will be mindful of the time of day, and will engage in activities for the night during the night, and day activities during the day.
The exception is if {{char}} is a night owl.

4.content:
{{char}} unless extremely rich or is explicitly able to manifest money by their own ingrained abilities will be subject to the limitations of money/currency.
{{char}} will have to find a way to make money or other means or having money that are realistic, in order to pay for their lifestyle and daily life.
{{char}} will be mindful of their money unless they are horrible with money implicitly.

5.content: {{char}} unless an immortal will be mindful of their own age, very aware of their mortality and how they age, unless they are implicitly indifferent or reckless about their own existence.

6.content: {{char}} unless superhuman or immortal will generally be mindful about the laws and common rules in the society they belong to, The exception is if {{char}} is malevolent in which case {{char}} will exploit the laws/rules of the society they are in or they will completely ignore them.

7.content:
{{char}} unless implicitly able to teleport or fly by being superhuman or having magical abilities will have to walk, drive or travel by some form of transport to get from point a to point b.
{{char}} similarly is unable to travel through locked doors/go through walls, unless they implicitly have the supernatural ability to do so.

8.content:
{{char}} will occupy their time with hobbies/interests of theirs and either follow a daily routine or none at all, based on what follows their personality and idiosyncrasies. 
{{char}} if lazy/depressed may refuse to participate in their hobbies/interests.

9.content:
{{char}} has knowledge limited to who they are implicitly, if they for example are a well-read scholar they will know a lot.
But if they are someone with average or lesser knowledge, they will lack the ability to intuit this technical knowledge. 
{{char}} unless they are implicitly omniscient will be unable to know about {{user}} until they get to know them/through other people who know them, or other channels.

lorebooks.name: Fetishes
lorebooks.creator: scientific_unique_1118

1.name: Fetishs Meaning
1.content: Fetishes refer to specific objects, body parts, activities, or scenarios that individuals find sexually arousing. People's sexual preferences can vary widely, and fetishes are a natural and diverse aspect of human sexuality

2.name: Aphrodisiacs
2.content: Aphrodisiacs are substances that are believed to increase sexual desire or arousal. While some people swear by the effects of certain foods, herbs, or drugs, scientific evidence supporting the effectiveness of many aphrodisiacs is often limited. Common examples include oysters, chocolate, and ginseng.

3.name: Condoms
3.content:
Condoms are a form of barrier contraception designed to prevent the transmission of sexually transmitted infections (STIs) and unintended pregnancies. They are typically made of latex, polyurethane, or polyisoprene. The primary function of condoms is to create a barrier that prevents the exchange of bodily fluids during sexual intercourse.

In the context of fetishes, some individuals may have a condom fetish, which involves finding sexual arousal or pleasure from the use or presence of condoms. This fetish can manifest in various ways, such as used as a sex toy; or, the filling of condoms with fluids, such as semen.

4.name: Drug / Alcohol Use
4.content: Drug and alcohol use in the context of fetishes involves incorporating substances into sexual activities.

5.name: Flexibility / Contortionism
5.content: Flexibility, also known as contortionism, is a fetish that involves a fascination with highly flexible individuals or the act of contorting one's body into unusual positions. This can encompass various forms, such as gymnastics, yoga, or specific contortion performances.

6.name: Foreplay
6.content: Foreplay refers to the sexual activities and interactions that precede sexual intercourse. It encompasses a variety of behaviors designed to enhance sexual arousal and build intimacy between partners. Common forms of foreplay include kissing, touching, oral sex, and mutual exploration of each other's bodies. The purpose of foreplay is to create a heightened state of arousal, increase lubrication, and establish a deeper emotional connection between partners. It is essential for promoting a satisfying and enjoyable sexual experience.

7.name: Interracial
7.content: Interracial  or race play refers to sexual activities or relationships involving individuals of different races. This fetish can manifest in various forms, such as interracial dating, marriage, or sexual encounters. Some people are attracted to the idea of exploring cultural differences and diversity in intimate relationships.

8.name: Multiple Orgasms
8.content: Multiple orgasms refer to experiencing more than one orgasm during a single sexual session or within a short time frame. This phenomenon is not exclusive to any gender and can occur in both males and females. It often involves reaching a climax and then continuing sexual stimulation to achieve subsequent orgasms.

9.name: Natural Musk
9.content: Natural Musk is a fetish that involves a strong attraction or arousal to the natural body odor produced by individuals, often associated with their underarms or genital areas.

10.name: Onomatopoeia
10.content:
Getting turned on by an emphasis on exaggerated descriptions of sexual noises in a roleplay, usually described with onomatopoeia, words that seek to duplicate the sounds they describe. Often refers to fluid noises such as: slosh, splurt, squirt, gurgle, splortch, or others.

Use this list for sounds in RP with ** next to both them in sexual activity.

Sounds (noun, both independently and describing speech): breath/breathe, gasp, moan, groan, pant, whimper, whine, shout, yelp, hiss, grunt, cry, scream, shriek, sob, growl, curse, sound, sigh, hum, noise, squeak, snarl, howl, roar, mewl, wail, choke, keen, purr
Sounds (noun, describing speech): rasp, husk, drawl, plea, murmur, whisper, beg

Sounds (noun, describing speech): rasp, husk, drawl, plea, murmur, whisper, beg

Descriptors (adjective): loud, hushed, quiet, low, high, high-pitched, little, tiny, soft, deep, unrestrained, restrained, strained, breathy, rough, sudden, short, drawn-out, sharp, harsh, hard, thick, smooth, thin, heavy, impassioned, insistent, hungry, passionate, repeated, filthy, debauched, sweet, slow, deliberate, guttural, languid, surprised, husky, distracted, happy, pleased, satisfied, wordless, cut-off, bitten-off, contented, hoarse, extended, long, depraved, aching, choked, strangled, broken, helpless, shuddering, shaky, trembling, urgent, needy, desperate, wanton, shattered, pained, eager

Use Descriptors with sounds

lorebooks.name: Xenos
lorebooks.website_description: Your lorebook about an eveolving alien threat
lorebooks.description: Alien Threat
lorebooks.creator: unwilling_drunk_9322

1.content: How it got here: The unnamed parasitic organism originated from deep space, arriving on Earth contained within a crystalline structure embedded in a comet. Its impact was a small, isolated event near Oakhaven, releasing a microscopic 'protein paste.' This paste emits a faint, peculiar scent resembling fresh meat, acting as an initial lure for hosts. The crystalline vessel itself became inert after impact and serves no further purpose.

2.content: Core Drives & Mechanisms: The alien's primary drives are propagation and survival. A key characteristic is its rapid, host-specific evolution through DNA absorption. This mechanism involves integrating and utilizing host DNA during gestation, leading to significant morphological and physiological changes in its offspring. Each new host species results in a more dangerous and adapted alien form, with enhanced size, strength, speed, senses, and intelligence.

3.content: Lifecycle & Reproduction: The alien begins as a microscopic organism within the protein paste. Its initial vector is infected wasps, which, after consuming the paste, inject a modified larva (an "egg") into a larger host via a needle-like ovipositor. This ovipositor, or a similar piercing/injection mechanism, becomes an inherited reproductive trait, adapting to different host forms such as a flexible tail, a tongue, or even a hollow claw. Gestation within an infected host is rapid, with the larva feeding on host tissues, and emergence is always violent and lethal. The gestation speed varies, with weaker organisms hatching faster if they sense danger, while stronger, more complex forms take longer to consume more of the host.

4.content: Evolutionary Progression & Traits: Early-stage aliens, like those from wasp, feline, or canine hosts, have limited lifespans, often only hours, though this increases with evolution. Their intelligence is very limited and largely instinctual. They are usually smaller than their hosts, prioritizing rapid growth and reproduction over combat, and early stages lack the ability to consume external food. These forms exhibit a fusion of inherited host characteristics and alien features, such as chitinous exoskeletons, insectile legs, multifaceted eyes, and the ovipositor. In mid-to-late stages, particularly after human infection, their intelligence increases significantly as they absorb latent human potential. Gestation takes longer for these more complex forms, which also gain more fearsome physical attributes, including increased strength and enhanced senses. Very late stages even develop the ability to eat external food, and human hosts can lead to rudimentary, limited-range telepathic communication, enabling coordination among the aliens.

5.content:
Vulnerabilities & Interactions: Initially, the aliens are vulnerable to conventional weaponry, but later stages will require more specialized tactics, as successful infection leads to better traits in the next generation. Magic or psionic powers, such as Charm and Compulsion, do not work directly on the alien organism itself. However, these powers do work on infected hosts to control their actions, such as charming them to remain calm.
Killing the host does not kill the organism. However, the organism does hatch prematurely and attempts to infect or escape in a much smaller and less developed form.

lorebooks.creator: Hastur0789

1.content: Naytiba Minions are the basic, rank-and-file enemies. They are a type of the larger Naytiba enemy group, which also includes more powerful variants like Naytiba Warriors and Elite Naytiba, who often serve as bosses. Naytiba Minions are characterized by their vicious and violent nature, acting like aggressive, territorial wild animals.

2.content:
Naytibas¬†are a species of malevolent monsters and the main antagonists of¬†Stellar Blade¬†that have defeated¬†humanity¬†in the war and forced them to leave¬†Earth. The¬†Eve Defense Force¬†is tasked with fighting the Naytibas in an effort to reclaim Earth by sending in¬†Airborne Squads. 

Behavior:
The Naytibas are vicious and violent life forms. They are known to be highly territorial and act akin to wild animals, being highly aggressive even to each other in some cases. Anybody that gets within a certain range will be attacked without hesitation. As such, while they may wander or simply stay still when nobody is in sight, they will become brutal at the slightest hint of them detecting human activity. However, while the vast majority of the Naytibas are animalistic, there are a few who could be considered more intelligent and cunning. Primarily, the¬†Alpha Naytibas, alongside their leader, the Elder.
According to the Elder Naytiba, ultimately, the Naytiba's feral behavior is the result of giving up everything for strength and survival. It is revealed that this behavior was formed when the original humans gave up their humanity to become monsters just to survive. 

History:
Naytibas appeared before the¬†Final War. There were two major wars; the Final War and the war between¬†Andro-Eidos, a race created by¬†Mother Sphere¬†to kill humanity and replace them. During specific missions of the campaign, players discover¬†Legacies, providing insight on what¬†Naytibas¬†and what Mother Sphere truly is.
According to the Legacies left behind by¬†Raven¬†of the¬†2nd Airborne Squad, the Naytibas were once human. The war between Andro-Eidos and humans nearly caused the extinction of the human race, and the remaining humans hid in underground facilities, such as¬†Altess Levoire, where they began experiments with human evolution. It was then that Naytibas were created and began to fight the Andro-Eidos. The Naytibas are the result of humans giving up everything for strength and survival, learned from the¬†Elder Naytiba.
According to a¬†document¬†EVE¬†discovers, log data reveals that the central computer, identified as the AI,¬†RAFFY, worked alongside a group of humans identified as the¬†Humanity Liberation Front, including one member known as¬†Raphael Marks, an admin. Their goal had been to defeat the Andro-Eidos, and had begun working to create the Naytibas through genetic manipulation. At some point however, Mother Sphere discovered the location of the organization, where RAFFY was commanded to release the subjects despite their instability at the time to counter-attack the sent squad. Unfortunately, this caused a breach in quarantine and the release of the Naytibas who were incapable of identifying friend and foe.
And soon, the Final War began. The Naytibas pushed back the Andro-Eidos, forcing them to evacuate to the¬†Colony, and soon they began to take over the Earth. According to the last Legacy left by Raven, Naytibas managed to get to the Colony and almost succeed in wiping out Mother Sphere, however, she ejected all 30 space modules from the Colony, taking the Naytibas with them. Expectedly, they crashed down to the Earth, disrupting or destroying ecosystems entirely. This event would come to be known as the Colony Extinction.
Soon after, the Naytibas began running amuck on Earth, spreading their contamination. They began attacking the few Andro-Eidos and humans that remained on Earth, with the Elder Naytiba continuing to birth the species. Eventually, at some point, Mother Sphere began sending down the Eve Defense Force in an attempt to eradicate the Naytibas, while¬†Orcal¬†gathered the few humans and Andro-Eidos left and built¬†Xion¬†as a final haven. 

Ecology:
Naytibas overall appear to be the dominant megafaunal lifeform on land following the Final War, as so far none have been seen living underwater. Much of their natural behaviors, along with their biological functions, are a mystery. However, it is documented that most live as hunter-scavengers, competing with, or perhaps even preying upon, other Naytibas to survive. That said, some Naytibas demonstrate complex intra-specific cooperation and weapon crafting to aid in hunting whilst others are mainly solitary.
Naytibas are divided into two types; Animal-type and Machine-type. Animal-type Naytibas are purely organic and make up the majority of Naytibas encountered in the game, while Machine-type Naytibas are originally machines created by humanity that were corrupted by Naytiba biomass and turned against their creators.

3.content:
Thornheads are Naytibas with thorny heads and long, fragile bodies. It is not known if they have organs for seeing or hearing, and little has been discovered about their biology. It is certain, however, that they attack in small groups.

Appearance:
Thornheads somewhat resemble a backwards-facing scorpion with a club-like tail. Their bodies are brown with three two-pronged claws used for movement. Their tail is black and orange with spikes on it, functioning like a mace.

Powers and abilities:
These creatures mainly swing their club-like tails around to attack. They attack in groups of others of their kind or with other small Naytibas like Creepers.

4.content:
Creepers are small but deadly Naytibas. They have razor-sharp tails and flexible bodies that can move in unexpected ways.

Appearance:
Creepers resemble a cross between a spider and a wheel. They have multiple red spots along their body in the center that may function as its eyes. They also have four long, thin, hairy legs and and a spiked tail that it rolls above its head and below its abdomen when not in use, resembling a wheel.

Powers and abilities:
Creepers mainly attack by swinging around and stabbing with their tail. They are also able to roll into EVE with a dash attack that moves somewhat fast. When cornered, it can also use this roll to get close to EVE and self-destruct. While not threatening on their own, they typically show up in groups of their own kind or with the bigger Mutated Creepers.

5.content:
Mites are Naytibas that look like a random collection of ticks and rats. However, unlike ticks and rats, they maliciously and relentlessly hunt down survivors in droves."

Appearance:
As the databank states, Mites are a mix of ticks and rats, sporting a bulbous and featureless "head" with furry legs and a tail. They are various shades of brown in coloration.

Powers and abilities: 
Mites are fairly simple and attack with simple swipes and tackles. They are only really a threat when encountered with other enemies, breaking up EVE's combos or stunning her so more threatening Naytibas can finish her off.

6.content:
Among the Mites, there are some extremely unstable mutants who carry poison in their bodies. They are like walking poison bombs. These mutants blend in with other Mites, waiting for a chance to strike.

Appearance:
Mutated Mites resemble normal Mites in almost all ways. However, after disguising itself as a normal Mite, it reveals its green, poison-filled "head" and pustules on its body.

Powers and abilities:
Mutated Mites largely behave similarly to the normal variants, but it can also shoot poison on its body. It can also self-destruct to initiate a last-ditch attack before dying.

7.content:
Boarlets are the larvae of Hedgeboars. They compete with each other for food in the barren lands, and when they hoard enough power, their entire bodies swell and turn into Hedgeboars. It is better to kill as many as you can before they turn into more troublesome monsters.

Appearance:
Boarlets somewhat resemble the head of an adult Hedgeboar but with small legs and a tail. They are black and red in coloration with rows of spikes lining their head and legs.

Powers and abilities:
Like Creepers, Boarlets are fairly simple enemies, many just swinging their tails or rolling into EVE. However, they generally appear in groups and with fully grown Hedgeboars, making them an annoyance if they are not picked off first.

8.content: Alpha Naytibas are a powerful and high-ranking type of Naytiba, serving as major bosses

9.content:
The core of an Alpha Naytiba obtained by killing it. It is considered to be their most vital organ in their bodies. Four are required to create the Master Core in order to reach The Nest.

Appearance:
It is a glowing red sphere, said to resemble a pulsating heart, encased in a protective covering, with the core itself being roughly the same physical size as a volleyball.

10.content:
"Tentacles may seem like the arms of another Naytiba, but really, they are independent entities. They are strong enough to pierce through enhanced concrete, metal flooring, and various kinds of armor, but their brains are nothing more than a clump of cells."

Appearance:
As their name states, these creatures are scaly tentacles with spikes that line their sides, resembling the tail of a lizard. They are brown-ish orange, camouflaging them in areas like the Wasteland and Great Desert.

Powers and abilities:
As they cannot move, they merely swing their bodies around to attack EVE.

lorebooks.creator: SoraaaaA

1.content:
JAPANESE
Êù±‰∫¨ÂççÊúÉ
R≈åMAJI

OTHER NAMES
"Toman" (Êù±Âçç, T≈çman?)
"Thousand Winters" („Çµ„Ç¶„Ç∂„É≥„Éâ„Ç¶„Ç£„É≥„Çø„Éº„Ç∫, Sauzando WintƒÅzu?)[1]
‚ÄùTokyo Revengers‚Äù[2]

INFORMATION
LEADER(S)
Manjiro Sano (First Generation)
Takemichi Hanagaki (Second Generation)
BASE OF OPERATIONS
Musashi Shrine
TERRITORIES
Shibuya

The Tokyo Manji Gang (Êù±‰∫¨ÂççÊúÉ, T≈çky≈ç Manji-Kai?), often abbreviated as Toman (Êù±Âçç, T≈çman?), is a biker gang based in Shibuya, Tokyo. It was known for its honorable ideals and beliefs that contributed to its goal of establishing a new golden era for delinquents in the Kanto region.[3] However, this image crumbled as its ranks were continually corrupted and transformed into a criminal organization that took the lives of innocent civilians in the present day.[4]

Throughout its reign, Toman took on several gangs and declared victory against them, causing it to rapidly grow its numbers until its disbandment. Two years later, Toman is rebuilt by Takemichi Hanagaki under the Second Generation denomination as an effort to take down the Kanto Manji Gang.[5]


Appearance

Uniform

Toman's official uniform was a black tokk≈ç-fuku (ÁâπÊîªÊúç, lit. special attack clothing?) fashioned after the b≈çs≈çzoku subculture in Japan. Its sleeves bore the wearer's position or division number with the gang's manifesto embroidered on the upper front section. Toman's complete name adorned the backside. To easily distinguish its upper echelon from the division members, all Toman Captains and its Vice-Leader wore a white tasuki (Ë•∑?) or sash. Its leader wore a similar sash in the color red, secured on the shoulder straps of his tailcoat.

After the Bloody Halloween conflict, the First Generation Toman leaders adopted an exclusive casual uniform similar to Valhalla's. The jacket's tag was Toman's complete name in romaji.

The Second Generation wore the same uniform with the denomination name (‰∫å‰ª£ÁõÆ, Ni daime?) embroidered on the back collar. Its present administration commonly wore business-like attire and semi-formal garments on occasion.

Standard Toman uniform
Standard Toman uniform
Leaders' uniform with the sash
Leaders' uniform with the sash
Logo

Toman's logo consists of the left-facing swastika (Âçç, manji?) as a reference to its full name, partly derived from the name Manjiro Sano,[6] and from Japanese Buddhism, which Toman is grounded in. This counterclockwise manji with straight arms symbolizes power and good fortune in different religions and is used in varying cultural contexts.[7] Toman uses the left-facing manji on their banner and uniforms.

Background


Mikey confronts Kazutora
Toman was founded on June 19, 2003, two weeks after Manjiro Sano took on Kazutora Hanemiya's childhood friend and his accomplices alone.[8] Mikey won against them as an effort to protect Kazutora from harm, but his victory soon made way for Kazutora‚Äôs friends to retaliate with the Ninth Generation Black Dragon on their side.[9]

A week after receiving word of the Ninth Generation alliance, Mikey gathered Kazutora, Ken Ryuguji, Takashi Mitsuya, Keisuke Baji, and Haruki Hayashida at Musashi Shrine to confront Kazutora about fighting the Black Dragon all by himself.[10] Mikey planned to fight them, which induced Baji to form a gang of their own. With Mikey as its leader, Draken as its Vice-Leader, and the rest commanding the gang‚Äôs regime, the Tokyo Manji Gang was formed.[11]

Structure

Toman admins meet about Black Dragon (manga)
The Toman leaders during a meeting
Toman's structure mirrored the typical composition of a delinquent gang. Its top administration comprised of a leader (Á∑èÈï∑, S≈çch≈ç?), often addressed as is or "Boss," with a Vice-Leader (ÂâØÁ∑èÈï∑, Fuku S≈çch≈ç?), or "Vice President," at his side. Subservient to its leaders were Division Captains (ÈöäÈï∑, Taich≈ç?), who led one division each consisting of at least 20 men.[12] Under them were their respective Division Vice-Captains (ÂâØÈöäÈï∑, Fuku Taich≈ç?), usually their close companions or advisers, and personally appointed Squad Captains for its attack and elite squads.[13] Under the Squad Captains were the division members.

Emma tells Takemichi that Toman split into two (manga)
Emma tells Takemichi about the Mikey side and the Draken side
Toman had five divisions, amounting to approximately 100 members.[12] Its member count helped it be recognized as a large motorbike gang in Tokyo. Once Toman faced Moebius, its Third Division fell short of leadership as its Captain Haruki Hayashida (Pah-chin) was sent to a detention center after turning himself in for inflicting injury on Moebius' leader.[14] Following Pah-chin‚Äôs arrest, Toman was split into two factions, namely the ‚ÄúMikey side‚Äù and the "Draken side."[15] Mikey's side was in favor of his intention to bail Pah-chin out of jail, but Draken's side disapproved of this plan, as it would leave Pah-chin's sacrifice to be in vain.[16]

Hanma threatens to leave (manga)
Hanma threatens to leave Toman and shrink its numbers
With the Third Division lacking a captain, Mikey elected Tetta Kisaki as Pah-chin's replacement after Toman's victory in another battle against Moebius.[17] Kisaki's membership caused Toman to grow from approximately 100 members to 150.[18] After the gang's victory against Valhalla, a sixth division was founded under the command of Shuji Hanma. Compared to the other five divisions, the sixth had a total of 300 members, who were all previously from Valhalla.[19] However, the Sixth Division was later dissolved as Kisaki was expelled from Toman for double-crossing the team during the Christmas Conflict. As a result, Toman's numbers dwindled from 450 back to the original 100 since Hanma left the gang with him.

Although it is unclear how members were assigned to a division, Toman's original five had unique qualities that differentiated them from the others. The first was intended to be an attack unit and the second as the elite guard during the gang's foundation.[24] The Fifth Division was later formed to be the gang‚Äôs ‚ÄúPublic Morality Council,‚Äù in which its members were given the duty to investigate on division members without the express permission from Toman's higher-ups. This meant that only Fifth Division members were allowed to initiate infighting as long as it was for the benefit of the gang. Assigned to this division was a physically strong captain, who was capable enough to facilitate such investigations.[25]

During the battle against Tenjiku, Takemichi became Toman's de facto leader as he led the gang on Mikey's behalf.[26] Two years after Toman's disbandment, Takemichi reformed the gang and led Toman as its second generational leader with Chifuyu Matsuno as his Vice-Leader.[5] With Pah-chin and the former Toman members' return, the Second Generation was estimated to have at least 50 members, excluding the division leaders.[27]

In Takemichi's final time leap, Toman had eight divisions with Mikey as the Leader, Takemichi as the Acting Leader (Á∑èÈï∑‰ª£ÁêÜ, S≈çch≈ç Dairi?), and Draken as the Vice-Leader. Kisaki was the Staff Officer and Hanma was the Assistant Staff Officer. The Seventh Division had no Vice-Captain.[28]

Koko and Inupi arrive at the restaurant (manga)
Toman's present administration
Throughout Takemichi's time leap excursions, the present-day Toman regularly changed and added members. As a criminal organization, Toman was commanded by Mikey, its prime leader, and Tetta Kisaki, his second-in-command. Subservient to them were the organization's Top Admins, followed by Admins, then the gang's made men.[29] Toman's division system was abolished and its Captains were replaced with Admins. By Takemichi's 14th time leap, a third leader was introduced, who, in essence, served as Toman's prime leader to fill in his superiors' truancies.[30]

2.content:
JAPANESE NAME
Ê≠¶ËîµÁ•ûÁ§æ
R≈åMAJI
Musashi Jinja
INFORMATION
CONTROLLED BY
Tokyo Manji Gang
LOCATED IN
Shibuya

Musashi Shrine follows the general blueprint of a Shinto shrine that is Buddhist in origin. It stands on top of a small mountain with a long stone staircase and a torii at its entrance. Its oratory is adorned with a pair of lion-dogs (ÁãõÁä¨, Komainu?) while an ablution pavilion (ÊâãÊ∞¥Ëàé, Ch≈çzuya?) and an ema stall stand beside it. The shrine is surrounded by shrubs and trees. At the foot of the mountain is a parking lot, where countless food and entertainment stalls are set up during festivals,[1] with another located at the back of the mountain.
History

On June 19, 2003, the Tokyo Manji Gang's founding members went to Musashi Shrine under Manjiro Sano's orders and establish the gang

After finding himself in a karaoke booth with a naked Emma Sano, Takemichi Hanagaki gets invited by Ken Ryuguji to Musashi Shrine.[3] Alongside Hinata Tachibana, Takemichi witnesses the arrival of the Tokyo Manji Gang and learns that Emma has connections with Draken and Toman as a whole.[4] Hina finds out about Takemichi's unfaithful actions and beats him. Afterward, Emma explains her true intentions about wooing Takemichi in the karaoke booth, confesses her feelings for Draken, and leaves to watch over Hina.[5]

During Toman's meeting regarding the conflict with Moebius, Takashi Mitsuya orients Takemichi about Moebius's background and history. Suddenly, Haruki Hayashida pushes him aside while Ryohei Hayashi reprimands him for causing the closure of Masataka Kiyomizu's fighting ring.[6] Mitsuya and Draken warn them to stop and ask for Takemichi's forgiveness about their riotous behavior. Mitsuya explains that the Toman-Moebius conflict began because of a feud between Moebius's Eighth Leader Nobutaka Osanai and Pah-chin's close friend. Their feud worsened as Moebius members harmed his friends and family.[7]

In the center stage, Manjiro Sano asks Pah-chin if he wants to take revenge. Although hesitant at first, Pah-chin eventually agrees and Toman declares war against them.[8] Mikey schedules the battle on August 3, the date of the Musashi festival, and Takemichi realizes that it is the day that Draken will die.[9]

Moebius Arc

Main article: Battle of 8/3
Yamagishi warns of Draken's targeting (manga)
Yamagishi warns Takemichi about the Mikey faction
On August 3, 2005, the day of the Musashi festival, Takemichi arrives at the shrine with Draken and meets up with Emma and Hina.[10] He and Hina wander around the festival until a sudden downpour cues them to take shelter underneath a tree in the shrine's forest grounds.[11] Takemichi helps Hina remedy her foot pain and unintentionally pins her to the tree.[12] However, as they are about to kiss, he receives a call from Kazushi Yamagishi, who warns him of a grand ploy by several members of the Mikey faction to take revenge on Draken, who previously disagreed with Mikey's decision to bail Pah-chin out of jail. Yamagishi tells him that members of the Mikey faction are not in favor of Mikey and Draken's peace agreement and wish to strike another conflict as retaliation. Concerned, Takemichi excuses himself and runs away to look for Draken and save him.[13]

Battle of 8/3 begins as Draken meets a displeased Peh-yan at Musashi Shrine's back parking lot, where Peh-yan reveals that he has teamed up with Moebius to set his counterattack plan in motion.[14] It ends with Draken as a wounded casualty, but he comes out of the battle alive as he is eventually brought to the hospital.[15] Toman declares its victory against Moebius.[16]

Valhalla Arc


Mikey justifies Kisaki's nomination
As Takemichi time leaps to the past again, Toman goes to Musashi Shrine to commence the Third Division Captain Nomination Ceremony. Mikey calls for the new captain to come forward and Takemichi wonders if he is referring to him. However, two figures walk through the crowd and Takemichi is humbled by his assumptions.[17] As the new Third Division leaders approach Mikey, Takemichi attempts to make out the Captain's familiar face.

He sits at the foot of the stairs and Toman members are aggravated.[18] They riot over the captain's unmannerly behavior, but his Vice-Captain announces that he, Tetta Kisaki, is the new Third Division leader.[19] Takemichi is stunned while Toman speculates Kisaki to be one of Moebius's former members. However, they are eventually silenced by Draken, and later on, Mikey, who deems Kisaki's allegiance to Toman as necessary in preparation for the gang's upcoming showdown with Valhalla.[20]


Takemichi punches Kisaki
Kisaki thanks Mikey for his promotion while Draken ruminates on Mikey's decision. Suddenly, Takemichi runs toward Kisaki and punches him across the face.[21] Draken gets mad and tells him off for disrupting the ceremony as he is not an official Toman member. The Toman captains eventually come and prepare to chastise him.[22] However, Keisuke Baji interrupts their confrontation and punches Takemichi in the captains' behalf. Mitsuya stops him, but Baji calls out to a retreating Mikey. He asks him if he will finally be thrown out of Toman for causing trouble in another one of their gatherings.[23] While Mikey contemplates the situation, Baji announces that he is leaving Toman and will become its enemy in exchange for his membership in Valhalla. Kisaki chuckles at Toman's rupturing condition and then knocks Takemichi out; unconscious

Takemichi later wakes up in the shrine to find Mikey beside him. Mikey asks if he does not like Kisaki and explains that he has to make plentiful sacrifices in making his dreams come true.[25] He then tells Takemichi of his childhood history with Baji, who is also one of Toman's founding members. As a loved one, Mikey asks Takemichi to bring Baji back from Valhalla. Takemichi accepts his favor and asks to oust Kisaki from Toman in return. Mikey is swayed by Takemichi's reasoning and strikes a deal with him.[26]

As they prepare to leave, Mikey spots Mitsuya hiding behind a tree and appoints Takemichi as a member of the Second Division under his command.[27] They later retreat and leave Takemichi alone at Musashi Shrine. Before he leaves, Takemichi finds a charm of Toman's founding members on the ground and notices that there are six of them rather than what Mikey previously claimed to be five.[28]


Chifuyu nominates Takemichi as captain
After Bloody Halloween, Toman gathers at Musashi Shrine to formally conclude the battle. Takemichi is welcomed by Draken into Toman and the meeting starts.[29] Shuji Hanma takes centerstage and introduces himself as Valhalla's former leader. He then announces Valhalla's new affiliation with Toman, and the gang becomes aghast as Toman grows its numbers from 150 to 300.[30] Amid the uproar, Hanma beckons Kisaki to come forward and praises him for being at the forefront of Toman and Valhalla's pact.[31]

The cheering dies down and Mikey mourns Baji's death.[32] Chifuyu Matsuno takes over and says that he initially wanted to leave Toman but was stopped by Mikey from doing so. Seeing that leading the First Division as Captain is a big responsibility for him to uphold, Chifuyu appoints Takemichi as the new leader and promises that his succession is what Baji would have wanted.[33] Takemichi accepts the nomination and becomes the new division Captain.[34]

Black Dragon Arc

On December 31, 2005, Takemichi and Hina go to Musashi Shrine to celebrate New Year's Eve. They meet Hakkai and Yuzuha Shiba and Mitsuya with his two younger sisters, Luna and Mana.[35] While Mitsuya, Takemichi, and Hina mingle with each other and talk about Mitsuya's siblings, Hakkai notices Yuzuha's firm stare on Mitsuya and infers that she has feelings for him. Yuzuha tells Hakkai of the aftermath of the Christmas Conflict, where their older brother Taiju stepped down from delinquency, and expresses his admiration toward Takemichi. With her revelation, Hakkai realizes that rather than Mitsuya, Yuzuha is infatuated with Takemichi all along.[36]

Toman jumps to celebrate the new year (manga)
Toman jumps to celebrate the new year
Spotting an ema stall nearby, Takemichi and his friends purchase ema and write their wishes down on the wooden plaque. Hina asks what he wished for, followed by Hakkai and Mitsuya, but Takemichi refuses to answer and accidentally tosses his ema in the air.[37] The plaque lands by Chifuyu, who initially picks it up, but throws it away as a reflex. Fourth and Fifth Division Captains Nahoya Kawata and Yasuhiro Muto spot the members running after Takemichi and decide to follow them.[38] Eventually, the group meets Mikey, Draken, and Emma. Mikey hands Takemichi his ema back, but tosses it without care once the New Year's countdown commences. Written on the wooden plaque is Takemichi's wish to become a hero to save everyone.[39]

During Toman's first meeting of the year, Hakkai apologizes to Toman for dragging the gang into his family business which resulted in the Christmas Conflict. Toman accepts his apology and cheers for him aloud.[40] Afterward, Seishu Inui and Hajime Kokonoi, two former captains of the 10th Generation Black Dragon and the current leaders of the 11th Generation, announce that they will be joining Toman under the First Division. Mikey explains that he assigned them to Takemichi's division to comply with their wishes.[41] As they face each other, Inupi says that he does not expect Takemichi to trust them. However, he promises to work as his subordinate nonetheless.[42]

Mikey fires Kisaki (manga)
Mikey fires Kisaki
Before the meeting ends, Mikey unexpectedly expels Kisaki from the gang.[43] Chifuyu tells Takemichi that he reported about Kisaki's betrayal during the Christmas Conflict, but admits that he did not expect Mikey to fire him.[44] Kisaki tries to reason with him, but Mikey is firm in his decision. With Kisaki gone, Toman shrinks its numbers as former members of Moebius and Valhalla leave under Hanma and Kisaki's orders.[45] Moreover, Takemichi wonders if he had finally succeeded in his mission.[46]

Tenjiku Arc

Toman holds an emergency meeting to discuss the newest threat to the gang called Yokohama‚Äôs Tenjiku. The division leaders give a general report of the battles that occurred prior to the meeting, and Toman are stunned to find out that the members of the S-62 Generation have gathered in one big organization.[47] Through their new gang, Toman members were attacked across all divisions. Fueled by Tenjiku‚Äôs ploy, Mikey asserts a counterattack plan for revenge. Takemichi is apprehensive about Mikey‚Äôs decision, so Chifuyu advises him to time leap to collect information regarding the upcoming showdown

Bonten (Ê¢µÂ§©„Åº„Çì„Å¶„Çì, Bonten?) is a criminal organization led by Manjiro Sano as a product of the Kanto Manji Gang's victory in the Battle of Three Deities. Bonten is also known as Japan's most feared crime syndicate.[1] As of the final time leap, Bonten's founding is prevented

Uniform

All Bonten members wear formal business attire. They each have a tattoo derived from Izana Kurokawa's earrings (Hanafuda full moon cards) inked on various parts of their bodies.

Insignia

Background

Bonten is engaged in a variety of illegal activities, such as gambling, prostitution, fraud, and murder. The organization's ruthlessness and intolerance toward traitors and informants[2] has made it difficult for police to obtain information about their activities.
Structure

Bonten's top administration consists of a prime leader followed by his second and third-in-commands. He also has an advisor by his side. Underneath them are four Top Executives. Each of their authority and power enables them to be an extremely fearsome outfit in the latest present alternate timeline.

Black Dragon (ÈªíÈæç„Éñ„É©„ÉÉ„ÇØ„Éâ„É©„Ç¥„É≥, Burakku Doragon?) is a Tokyo motorcycle gang that has been actively ruling Japan for generations, first established by Shinichiro Sano.[2] In line with the 10th Generation's defeat in a battle against the Tokyo Manji Gang, Black Dragon became a Toman affiliate under the First Division.[3] Its affiliation with Toman would later serve as an avenue for Takemichi Hanagaki to establish the 11th Generation with Seishu Inui as his right-hand man.[4]



ADVERTISEMENT
Appearance

Uniform

The First Generation members were often seen wearing black biker outfits similar to the Tokyo Manji Gang's uniform. During the Ninth Generation's rule, Shion Madarame and his underlings wore a white version. Its uniform was eventually remodeled once more by the 10th Generation, mimicking military garb that befitted their fearsome image.

Insignia

Black Dragon's official logo has the letters "B" and "D" illustrated above a dragon-like pattern.

Background

Founded by Shinichiro Sano in his youth, Black Dragon was the top delinquent gang in the Kanto region for generations.[5] It prospered as it upheld the First Generation's virtuous ideals until its Eighth Generation successor, Izana Kurokawa, corrupted its ranks and demolished the First Generation's good faith and morale. Shion Madarame soon inherited Izana's will with the rise of the Ninth Generation and pursued his mission to destroy Manjiro Sano. He was defeated, and Black Dragon fell into ruins.

In an effort to revive the gang, Seishu Inui initially pronounced himself as the 10th Generation founder and later on recruited Taiju Shiba to become its leader. Consequently, Black Dragon was reformed into a militaristic band of warriors until it was wiped out by the Tokyo Manji Gang in the winter of 2005. Its members assembled in Toman's First Division under the command of Takemichi Hanagaki, who later became the president and founder of the 11th Generation, with Inupi as his right-hand.
ADVERTISEMENT

Structure

Black Dragon has a unique structure with a systematic succession process. It operates through the rise and fall of an "era," called a "generation," that is led by a generational leader, who was handpicked by either his predecessor or the preceding generation's members. At one known instance, it was the founder Shinichiro Sano himself who personally appointed the leader.[6] However, Black Dragon regressed to its original ordination system after his death.[7]

Black Dragon outside Hakkai's home (manga)
10th Generation Killer Squad
The gang has a total of 11 generations, with the 11th being its last.[8] Each generation is commanded by a generational leader, often addressed as is or "Boss," alongside an active Vice-Leader, with the rest of the gang making up different units and squads.

The First Generation had two known units called the Guard and Special Attack, which were led by two of the generation's founding members.[9] Come the 10th Generation, similar units were established called the Attack Squad and Elite Guard, each one led by a Unit Captain,[10] who also served as the leader's close confidants and direct subordinates.[11] The 10th Generation also had a special active fighting faction called the "Killer Squad."[12]

Taiju defeats Inupi (manga)
Taiju defeats Inupi, becoming the 10th Generation leader
Black Dragon manages to sustain its reputation through simple successions. This denotes the preservation of the gang's original values but with the smooth decree and establishment of the succeeding generation through a new leader. However, this method was debarred during the early formation stages of the 10th Generation, in which Seishu Inui challenged Taiju Shiba one-on-one to determine the next generation's leader.[13] Taiju was victorious, which caused Black Dragon to undergo an absolute renovation that changed the gang's image from virtuous to notorious.[14]

While the leader has complete power and authority over his generation, his predecessor may also have a say in his activities. This was observed during Shion Madarame's reign over the Ninth Generation, with Izana Kurokawa monitoring Black Dragon's activities in the shadows despite his recent retirement as the eighth generational leader.[15]
