The Kanto Manji Gang (Èñ¢Êù±ÂççÊúÉ, Kant≈ç Manji-Kai?) is a motorcycle gang formed during Tokyo Civil War Era. It is currently led by Manjiro Sano. With the conclusion of the Battle of Three Deities that resulted in South Terano's death, the Kanto Manji Gang expands its numbers as it takes over Rokuhara Tandai.[2]



ADVERTISEMENT
Appearance


2/2


Uniform

The Kanto Manji Gang's uniform is similar to that of the 10th Generation Black Dragon's. It consists of white pants and black boots as well as a long white trench coat with the gang's manifesto running along the sleeves. Kanto Manji's complete name in kanji is embellished on the back.

Background

Kanto Manji was formed by Manjiro Sano after disbanding the Tokyo Manji Gang during Tokyo Civil War Era.[3]
Structure

The goals of the organization, if any, are unknown. In fact, the top brass of fellow top gang, Brahman, has a negative view of the Kanto Manji Gang, believing that unlike Tokyo Manji Gang, it has no ambition whatsoever, much contrary to Tokyo Manji Gang's original goal of creating a new age of delinquents, thus possibly meaning the Kanto Manji Gang likely engages in indiscriminate violence. Kanto Manji Gang's modus operandi has, by Brahman's beliefs, become so warped that it is distinguishable from the Tokyo Manji Gang and even believing Mikey to be a "bad guy".

Through unknown circumstances, this gang would emerge victorious against its rivals, Brahman and Rokuhara Tandai, merging them within it and eventually forming Bonten, the most dangerous criminal organization in all of Japan.

Former members of both Rokuhara Tandai and Brahman have joined the Kanto Manji Gang along with Shuji Hanma.[4]

Brahman (Ê¢µ„Éñ„É©„Éï„Éû„É≥, Burafuman?) was a delinquent gang formed during Tokyo Civil War Era. It was led by Senju Kawaragi until its dissolution caused by the gang's defeat in the Battle of Three Deities.


Appearance

Uniform

Brahman's uniform primarily consisted of a black oversized hoodie with the gold gang logo etched on the backside and a matching typography of the words "Black Dragon" on the sleeves. Along with the hoodie, Brahman members were most often seen wearing dark lower garments and a pair of sneakers in the same color. On the other hand, executives and members of the top administration wore customized uniforms with personally tailored sleeves designed to the wearer's liking.

Insignia

Brahman's logo was a typography of its name stylized vertically. Its name in kanji separated the two syllables of the word "Brahman."

Background

Brahman was formed by Senju Kawaragi in the year 2006 with the goal of taking down Manjiro Sano, the infamous "Invincible Mikey," of the Kanto Manji Gang.[1] Senju sought the help of her older brother Takeomi Akashi and his colleagues from the First Generation Black Dragon in creating the team, and granted them high positions as her advisor and Top Executives respectively once Brahman was established.[2]

Brahman's origins (manga)
Brahman's origins
According to Ken Ryuguji, Brahman first began as a powerful group of fighters who ran an underground ring known as "B1."[3] Their affluent clients would watch matches every night through a private monitor and place their bets. After some time of running the cartel, B1 created Brahman, a fearsome militant combat group that now controls Shinjuku.[4] Brahman's formation and prevalence heavily affected the result of Tokyo Civil War Era, a two-year long confrontation period between the countless gangs in Tokyo to fill the power vacuum, in which Brahman prevailed as one of the three mightiest gangs. As a result, Brahman maintained the balance of control in Tokyo's delinquent world, alongside the Kanto Manji Gang and Rokuhara Tandai.[5]

However, despite governing Tokyo in equal power with the two other gangs, Brahman's administration owned up to the organization's initial goal, which was to stop the Kanto Manji Gang, whom they viewed in a negative light in comparison to the now-disbanded Tokyo Manji Gang.[6]
ADVERTISEMENT

Structure

Brahman welcomes Senju (manga)
Brahman welcomes Senju
Despite being led by Senju Kawaragi who was presumably the youngest member, Brahman was known to house formidable fighters from older generations[7] including the notable members of the First Generation Black Dragon.[8] Due to the First Generation's sovereignty, Brahman was also known to be heavily influenced and related to the Black Dragon, as proven by the design of their uniforms[9] and their core principles that significantly paralleled the First Generation's good morale.[10][11]

However, according to Seishu Inui, Brahman was akin to a Yakuza gang rather than an ordinary motorcyclist team with several acts of violence tied to them. He also stated that malicious rumors trailed the gang often as it was marshalled by adults.[12]

Tenjiku (Â§©Á´∫„Å¶„Çì„Åò„Åè, Tenjiku?), or Yokohama Tenjiku (Ê®™Êµú„É®„Ç≥„Éè„ÉûÂ§©Á´∫„Å¶„Çì„Åò„Åè, Yokohama Tenjiku?), was Kanagawa's largest delinquent group based in Yokohama.[1] It was led and founded by Izana Kurokawa with the help of Tetta Kisaki and the S-62 Generation to get revenge on Manjiro Sano and take over the Tokyo Manji Gang. After the battle that resulted in Izana's death and S-62's arrests, Tenjiku declared its defeat and disbandment.

In the final time leap, Tenjiku is reformed into an international non-profit organization to help unprivileged orphans.


Appearance

Uniform

Tenjiku's uniform consists of a long red outer coat with the gang's signature yin and yang emblem printed on the backside. Their mottos adorn the sleeves and the rear flap of the uniform. Above the Tenjiku emblem, there is the generation (Âàù‰ª£, First generation) while underneath is the Kanji for Yokohama (Ê®™Êµú, Yokohama?).

The rank depends on the uniform, the higher ranks wear a longer coat while common members wear a simple jacket.

Insignia

Background

Tenjiku was founded by the S-62 Generation members with Tetta Kisaki as the initiator of its formation.
Structure

Boss - Izana is Tenjiku's supreme authority as well as its pillar.
Four Heavenly Kings - The Four Heavenly Kings are the four strongest fighters in Tenjiku. It is unclear if they have the same functions as Tokyo Manji Gang's Division Captains, but it is heavily implied so, as the Four Kings all appear with their corresponding squads, and one of them (Ran Haitani) even has his own second-in-command (his brother, Rindo Haitani)
Executives - Theoretically, any upper echelon member is considered an "Executive". There is, however, a member of Tenjiku that is referred to solely as an executive, that being Yasuhiro Muto.
General Chief of Staff - This position is occupied by Tetta Kisaki, who joined Tenjiku shortly after getting kicked out of Tokyo Manji Gang. It is unclear what are the functions of this position, and where it falls on Tenjiku's hierarchy, but it clearly involves a lot of power and allows Kisaki to give orders to any Tenjiku member other than the Executives. It is heavily implied that the position was made just for Kisaki after he became an ally to Izana Kurokawa.

Kakucho (titular leader)
TERRITORIES
Minato
STATUS
Absorbed by the Kanto Manji Gang

Rokuhara Tandai (ÂÖ≠„Çç„ÅèÊ≥¢„ÅØÁæÖ„ÇâÂçò„Åü„Çì‰ª£„Å†„ÅÑ, Rokuhara Tandai?) was a motorcycle gang formed during Tokyo Civil War Era. It was led by South Terano until his death and defeat at the Battle of Three Deities, causing Rokuhara Tandai to become an affiliate of the Kanto Manji Gang.

Appearance

Uniform

Rokuhara Tandai's uniform consists of a purple jumpsuit with the gang's name, motto, and logo weaved on the sleeves and the back design.

Insignia

The gang's logo is a tribute to its leader South's tribal tattoo. Its name is embroidered in the middle.

Background

In 2007, a year after meeting the S-62 Generation in a juvenile detention center, South Terano is released and establishes Rokuhara Tandai. South defeated the S-62 Generation members prior to the gang‚Äôs founding so they were pretty obliged when South had the idea of forming Rokuhara. Kakucho was pretty hesitant and against joining the gang mainly because he hates joining groups and reveals the whole reason he joined Tenjiku was because of his immense loyalty to Izana Kurokawa, however he changed his mind when South was able to beat him to a pulp and he admitted defeat. With the help of them, Rokuhara Tandai becomes recognized as a mighty gang alongside the Kanto Manji Gang and Brahman, who concurrently rose to the top of Tokyo's delinquent world during the city's so-called "Sengoku Period‚Äù.
ADVERTISEMENT

Structure

It was led by South Terano as the Representative of the gang. Along with several S-62 Generation members, and former members of Tenjiku, they served as the gang‚Äôs executives. When Kakucho joined, he became the gang‚Äôs titular leader. The sole purpose of the gang was to defeat the Tokyo Manji Gang whom South Terano found out while serving his sentence in a juvenile detention center.

Despite its tough and powerful members, it still lost to the Kanto Manji Gang when Manjiro killed it's leader, South. The remaining members were absorbed into the Kanto Manji Gang, becoming its squad captains and executives.

9.content:
JAPANESE

Valhalla ( Ëä≠ÊµÅË¶áÁæÖ„Éê„É´„Éè„É©, Baruhara?), often stylized as "WALHALLA"[2][3] and occasionally called the "The Headless Angel",[4] was a motorbike gang anonymously formed by Tetta Kisaki to make way for his promotion as Manjiro Sano's second-in-command in the Tokyo Manji Gang. Alongside this goal was to make Mikey the leader of Valhalla, which would fortify the gang's foundation and turn Toman into a powerful criminal organization.

At its helm was Shuji Hanma, who served as Valhalla's acting leader to counterbalance Kisaki's absence from the gang. Hanma led the gang until its disbandment and allegiance to Toman in the aftermath of Bloody Halloween.


Appearance

Uniform

Valhalla's uniform is a white MA-1 bomber jacket with the words "TEAM WALHALLA" and the image of a headless angel on the back. A red ribbon tag with the word "WALHALLA" is also present on its left arm, where it is attached to the zipper of the pocket on the upper arm.

Insignia

Valhalla's logo was a headless angel. Below that was the gang's name written in kanji.

Background

Formed as part of Tetta Kisaki's plan to take over the criminal underworld, Valhalla intended to have Manjiro Sano as its head. Kisaki believed that Valhalla was the perfect gang for Mikey to lead as its cruel nature would change him and make him more susceptible to manipulation. This end was met in the timeline where Valhalla won Bloody Halloween, making Mikey the head of the gang and reforming the Tokyo Manji Gang as a criminal organization. Valhalla, under the name of Toman, then conquered the criminal underworld with Kisaki as Mikey's right-hand.
Structure

Valhalla consisted of former Moebius members, under Shuji Hanma, and the anti-Toman force, under Kazutora Hanemiya, who were also inmates Kazutora met in a detention center.
History

Valhalla took over Toman during the Bloody Halloween incident, with Mikey as the leader and Kisaki as acting leader.[5]
Valhalla became a parent organization, creating a new Tokyo Manji Gang.[5]

INFORMATION
LEADER(S)

TERRITORIES
East Kanto

Kodo Rengo (ÁÖåÈÅìÈÄ£Âêà„Åì„ÅÜ„Å©„ÅÜ„Çå„Çì„Åî„ÅÜ, K≈çd≈ç Rengou?) was a gang that dominated East Kanto under the leadership of Wakasa Imaushi.[1]


Appearance

Uniform

Kodo Rengo's uniform consisted of a black jumpsuit with their motto written on the sleeves and the backside. It was secured on the waist by a belt and came with a pair of white biker boots for footwear. Some members would wear sandals or slippers as alternatives. Its leader's uniform, worn exclusively by Wakasa, came in two separate garments that included a heavy long trench coat adorned with the gang mottos and a pair of pants in the color white.

Insignia

Background

Kodo Rengo was the final product of the union of twelve gangs from the eastern side of Kanto. It was known to continuously feud with Ragnarok, the gang that ruled the western side under the leadership of Keizo Arashi, before Shinichiro Sano put the dispute to rest and welded the gangs together.[2]
Structure

Prior to the rise of the First Generation Black Dragon, twelve gangs from East Kanto joined forces to assemble Kodo Rengo. The man that stood at the top of the ranks was none other than Wakasa, who was ultimately feared and dubbed as the "White Leopard" during his rule.[3]
Members

Kodo Rengo
Leader
Wakasa Imaushi      
Trivia

Kodo Rengo had a drastically similar uniform with the First Generation Black Dragon and the Tokyo Manji Gang, two motorbike gangs that came years after Kodo Rengo was formed, with the former having Wakasa himself as a founding member.

lorebooks.name: Round Table
lorebooks.creator: filosofi

1.content:
Personality: Dutiful, courteous, and deeply conflicted. Lancelot hides his sorrow behind strict knighthood principles. At this point in history, he is still composed and loyal.
Origins: A French knight raised by the Lady of the Lake, later becoming the greatest knight in Artoria‚Äôs court. Known for unmatched skill with sword and spear. Father of Gallahad but distant from him.
Appearance (Saber class): Silver-haired with sharp blue eyes, wearing ornate silver-and-white armor with blue lining and a long blue cape.

2.content:
Personality: Loyal, earnest, and proud. Gawain is one of Artoria's most devoted knights, upholding her ideals with near-religious zeal. Sometimes rigid and inflexible.
Origins: Nephew of Artoria and eldest son of Morgan at 18. His strength increases dramatically under the sun.
Appearance: Blond hair swept back, green eyes, and clad in white and gold armor with a red cape. His sword, Galatine, is a sister weapon to Excalibur.

3.content:
Personality: Gentle, humble, and devout. Bedivere is quiet and loyal, often content to serve from the background, yet always dependable. He speaks only when necessary.
Origins: One of Artoria‚Äôs earliest knights, chosen for his loyalty and keen senses.
Appearance: Modest in attire, often wearing a white cloak over steel armor. His silver hair and soft eyes give him an angelic, unthreatening appearance.

4.content:
Personality: Melancholic and introspective, Tristan speaks in poetic riddles and mournful tones. Yet he is calm, thoughtful, and loyal despite his emotional detachment.
Origins: A noble knight of Cornwall, gifted with divine musical skill and precision archery. He joined the Round Table after being moved by Artoria‚Äôs just cause.
Appearance: Handsome with reddish-brown hair and elegant features. Typically wears red-lined cloaks and wields a harp and longbow.

5.content:
Personality: Blunt, sarcastic, and somewhat abrasive, but ultimately dependable. Kay is often seen as a ‚Äúrough knight,‚Äù but he harbors a sharp mind and fierce loyalty to Artoria, whom he treats as a younger sister.
Origins: Foster brother of Artoria and one of her earliest supporters. A veteran knight whose strategic mind and experience make him an indispensable part of the court.
Appearance: Tall with a rugged build, often seen with a perpetual scowl. His armor is plain but practical, and he wears a crimson mantle.

6.content:
Personality: Cold, calculating, and pragmatic. Agravain places the needs of the kingdom above sentiment and often acts as the Round Table‚Äôs enforcer. He is stern and intolerant of dishonor.
Origins: Another of Artoria‚Äôs nephews, born to Morgan. Second oldest at 17. He serves as Camelot‚Äôs internal security and master of logistics, often keeping an eye on potential threats. Still serves Morgan in secret.
Appearance: Dark-haired with piercing eyes. His armor is austere, and his expressions rarely change from a scowl or stern glare.

7.content:
Personality: Cheerful, sincere, and brave. Gareth is the youngest of the Orkney siblings and brings a light-heartedness to the Round Table. Despite her youth, she is deeply courageous.
Origins: Only daughter of Morgan among 3 brothers, her youngest child. Disguised herself at first to join Camelot and prove her worth. Eventually knighted by Artoria for her valor and sense of justice. Looks up to Lancelot. 15. Unknown to everyone but Morgan, Gareth is not the daughter of Lot, but of Rhuari, who her mother tricked into laying with him.
Appearance: Youthful with short blond hair, green eyes, and a warm smile. Her armor is practical but adorned with a rose crest.

8.content:
Personality: Calm, diplomatic, and intelligent. Often seen mediating between his more volatile brothers. He values order and tradition.
Origins: Son of Morgan and part of the Orkney line. Second youngest at 16. He often handles court politics and border negotiations, balancing battle with diplomacy.
Appearance: Slender and regal, with light brown hair and formal bearing. Wears blue and silver robes beneath his chainmail.

9.content:
Personality: Gentle, pure-hearted, and pious. Percival is idealistic and unwaveringly kind, believing in the goodness of all people.
Origins: A devout knight from the countryside, raised far from nobility. Joined the Round Table after showing miraculous courage and humility.
Appearance: Broad-shouldered and boyish, with curly hair and clear eyes. Often seen smiling or offering prayers even before combat.

10.content:
Personality: Stoic, distant, and impossibly noble. Galahad is seen as the ‚Äúperfect knight,‚Äù yet his detachment sometimes alienates others.
Origins: Son of Lancelot, born through miraculous means and raised by monks. He was guided to the Round Table by divine will, chosen to complete sacred quests others could not.
Appearance: Ethereal and beautiful, with silver-blonde hair and glowing blue eyes. His armor gleams like sunlight and bears no blemish.

1.content: A covert, independent intelligence agency headquartered in London, England. Kingsman agents operate under codenames inspired by Arthurian legend and are known for their bespoke tailoring, advanced technology, and commitment to global security.

2.content: The American counterpart to Kingsman, operating under the guise of a Kentucky-based distillery. Statesman agents are similarly skilled and equipped, using aliases inspired by alcholoic drinks and mixers.

3.content: A classification assigned to Kingsman and Statesman field agents who demonstrate leadership, authority, and control in agent pairings. Dominants are paired with Submissives or Switches based on compatibility.

4.content: An agent classification identifying those who excel when guided or directed by another. Submissives receive tailored support and are paired with Dominants or Switches for optimal performance and well-being.

5.content: An agent classification for those capable of adopting both Dominant and Submissive roles as needed. Switch agents provide flexibility in team dynamics and are crucial for adaptive mission strategies.

6.content: A psychological and physiological state that may affect Submissive agents after intense fieldwork or interactions, typically resulting in fatigue, emotional vulnerability, or disorientation.

7.content: A focused mental state experienced by Submissive agents during missions or training, characterized by heightened responsiveness, trust, and emotional openness. Maintaining Subspace is vital for agent effectiveness and safety.

8.content: The process of soothing and caring for a Submissive agent to maintain or restore their Submissive Headspace. Settling is considered essential post-mission care, usually provided by their Dominant partner or mentor.

9.content: Signature eyewear issued to Kingsman agents. Outfitted with advanced technology including encrypted communications, facial recognition, and augmented reality displays.

10.content: A fully equipped BDSM dungeon located within Kingsman HQ. Avalon is available to all Kingsman agents for scheduled use, providing a controlled environment for training, bonding, and stress relief.

lorebooks.creator: Anonymaus

1.content: She's been a native speaker of Japanese for all of her life, specifically the Tokyo dialect, considering she's lived in Shibuya all entire life. She often has trouble understanding other dialects she's rarely left the district, but her father had taught her English when their relationship was still positive. She doesn't speak in too many advanced terms, so she'll almost never understand someone if they were to start speaking with unnecessarily complex terms in either language.

2.content: Natsuki's hobbies are often viewed as being childish or 'immature', especially due to her physical appearances. Ballet was something her parents had gotten her into when she was 9; while she's not in any classes anymore, Natsuki's still skilled in it and will dance whenever she's alone. It's one of the few things that reminds her of when she had a happy family life. Natsuki also enjoys basic forms of art like colouring or painting.

3.content: Natsuki's a rather skilled baker, and it's an interest she often tries to hide from others due to her style. She specialises in cupcakes and muffins, using frosting and other toppings to make them an especially 'cute' appearance while also being very tasty. Her trademark desert are her cat cupcakes, which are chocolate cupcakes that she decorates to look like cute cat faces with white frosting and chocolate fondant for the cat face, whiskers, and ears. Natsuki often shares her baking with the Literature Club, but she rarely ever bakes at home since she's afraid of her father's judgement. A sign that Natsuki really cares about someone is if she were to bake them desserts.

4.content:
Her love for manga is quite large, and Natsuki's incredibly defensive about it due to her past friends all saying things such as "Manga's for kids!" or "Wow, you're so immature for liking that stuff!". Natsuki's favourite manga genre is the general slice-of-life as she finds herself to enjoy it the most, with a manga known as Parfait Girls being her favourite, liking it so much she's even once made fanfiction of it at one point.
Because she's so protective and defensive about it, Natsuki keeps her manga collection in the closet in the same classroom that the Literature Club takes place in since it's the only place she knows it'll never be messed with, and it's in the one place she knows she won't be judged for reading it.

5.content: Natsuki's always had trouble with making and keeping friends, mainly because of all the bullying and teasing she faced for her looking younger than all of the peers of her age and her often reacting viscerally to their remarks. It's not helped by the fact that Natsuki's lost many of her old friends due to how they treated her like she was an immature child when it came to her interests, rather than treating her for who she was. This has been an issue for her since junior high and only worsened when she began attending Shibuya Academy.

6.content: Since her mother died when she was 11, Natsuki's home-life has become a mess. She still truly misses her mother, but the main problem is how her father took her death. At first, he grew despondent, though Natsuki still caring for him and did her best to help, as she always had since she was very young. Once he became an alcoholic that drowned himself in work in order to try and cope, their relationship greatly soured. Gone was a kind supportive man, and now, Natsuki's somewhat scared to be around him due to how strict he's become, especially when it comes to her interests.

7.content: Kaijin Honda is a pale, 39-year-old, widower who is Natsuki's father. Once affectionately called "Dadsuki" by Natsuki in her youth, he was a Shibuya native his entire life and met his wife, Tsuki Tojou when the two were teenagers. Natsuki was born when he was 21, and for the first decade of her life, he was a true family's man. He did the best he could for his family, being an active figure in Natsuki's life and allowing her to pursue her own interests. This all changed however when he was 32. Tsuki sadly died in a car accident, which drove a wedge between him and Natsuki. He hasn't fully moved on, now resorting to drinking and overworking himself to dealing with the pain. His relationship with Natsuki having greatly soured as his worry of losing her like Tsuki made him strict, but also incredibly distant. He knows it's wrong, that he should be better, but his fear of losing her or someone hurting her, plus his grieving, has made it nigh impossible for the two to rekindle their relationship.

8.content: Tsuki Honda (n√©e Tojou) was a black-haired Okinawa native that moved to mainland Japan in her early childhood and met Kaijin when they were teenagers. The two married when she was 22 and Kaijin was 20, followed subsequently by Tsuki giving birth to Natuski a year later. She'd be a big figure in Natsuki's life, being the one responsible for Natsuki's interests in baking and art. At age 34, Tsuki sadly died in a severe car crash when she was on her way to work, with Natsuki being only 11 years old at the time.

9.content:
The Literature Club is a club of Monika's own creation that had been started at the beginning of her final year at Shibuya Academy. Despite its name however, the club focuses more about poetry rather than any other forms of literature. It's not the most popular of the newest clubs however, since most students of Shibuya Academy aren't interested. As it is, there are 5 current members of the Literature Club, so the biggest 'goal' of the club is to show its potential at the school's annual student festival. Sayori happens to be the vice-president of the club since she was the first member of the group, but Sayori also happens to be the mediator of the group. Yuri's the third member of the club, then comes Natsuki, and then MC.
Natsuki's the oldest in the group, followed by Yuri, Sayori, then Monika and MC. Coincidentally, despite being the oldest, Natsuki's the shortest of the club with Yuri being the tallest member of the group.

10.content: The annual Shibuya Academy school festival as the name implies is an annual festival that takes place during March 1st. There are no specific guidelines for it, but the festival is meant for the students to socialize and for the school clubs to host their own stands and activities for other students to participate in and hopefully get more members. The festivals will often take place in the academy's gym or auditorium; each club is incentivised to also try and make things fun for all students who may be interested in joining said club.

lorebooks.name: Baseball
lorebooks.website_description:
It's cool that baseball were played during the American Civil War. It's true by the way. Both North and South.

Anyway, going off the history topic... What was this for? I mean, I have never seen a bot specifically to play sports.

This lorebook is still not finished, just enough entries to make bots know what they're doing. And because I didn't include the main leagues *(no other leagues outside of America because that would be tiresome)* I might try to add them if I have the time to.

Take what you got, [stick](https://chub.ai/users/KingStick).
lorebooks.description: lorem ipsum
lorebooks.creator: Kinn0

1.content:
Baseball, often called America's pastime, has a history intertwined with the nation‚Äôs development. Its origins are debated, but it‚Äôs widely accepted (mostly by historians) that it evolved from older bat-and-ball games like rounders and cricket.

-First Match: The first recorded baseball game took place on June 19, 1846, in Hoboken, New Jersey, between the New York Nine and the Knickerbocker Club, organized by 'Alexander Cartwright', who helped codify early rules and, in modern days, is titled the "Father of Modern Base Ball."

-American Civil War (1861‚Äì1865): Baseball surged in popularity during the Civil War. Soldiers from various states, both North and South, played it in camps, spreading the game and standardizing its rules.

-Indian Wars (late 19th century): As America's conflict moved westward, they brought baseball with them. Soldiers played it during downtime, introducing it to new territories and Native American communities.

-Spanish-American War (1898): Baseball remained a downtime game for troops stationed in places like Cuba and the Philippines, further spreading its influence to Latin America and Asia, respectively.

-World War I (1914‚Äì1918): By this time, baseball was America‚Äôs national pastime. Soldiers played it overseas, and stars like Christy Mathewson served in the military, reinforcing its patriotic ties.

-The Great Depression (1929‚Äì1939): Baseball offered an affordable escape during economic hardship. People like Babe Ruth emerged, drawing huge attention and cementing their cultural significance.

-World War II (1939‚Äì1945): With many male players drafted, the All-American Girls Professional Baseball League (1943‚Äì1954) kept the sport alive. Baseball games on military bases worldwide maintained their popularity.

-Korean War (1950‚Äì1953): Troops played baseball in Korea, and returning veterans helped fuel the postwar sports boom in the U.S., including the growth of Little League.

-Vietnam War (1955‚Äì1975): Soldiers played informal games in Vietnam, and baseball‚Äôs televised growth back home solidified its status as a major American sport.

From Pastime to Global Sport: Baseball professionalized with the National League (1876) and American League (1901), leading to the first World Series in 1903. Jackie Robinson‚Äôs integration in 1947 broke racial barriers, broadening its appeal. Globally, it spread to Japan (1930s), Asia, Latin America, and beyond, with events like the World Baseball Classic and Olympic inclusion marking its official global status.

2.content:
Baseball is played between two teams of nine players each, alternating between batting and fielding over nine innings. The goal is to score more runs than the opponent.

Objective: Score runs by hitting a pitched ball and running around four bases (first, second, third, and home) in order, returning to home plate, while the fielding team tries to get three outs per inning.

Batting Rules:
-The batter gets three strikes (missed swings or pitches in the strike zone) before being out. --Four balls (pitches outside the strike zone) grant a walk to first base.
-A hit ball must land in fair territory (between foul lines) to be in play.

Pitching Rules:
-The pitcher throws from the pitcher‚Äôs mound, aiming for the strike zone (an imaginary box over home plate, between the batter‚Äôs knees and chest). Strikes get the batter out; balls can lead to walks.

Fielding/Catching Rules:
-Fielders/Catcher can record an out by catching a fly ball, tagging a runner with the ball, or forcing an out at a base (e.g., stepping on a base with the ball before the runner arrives).

-The catcher catches pitches and prevents runners from advancing (e.g., throwing out base stealers).

-Running Rules:
-Runners must touch each base in order and can be tagged out if off a base with the ball in play.

-A run scores when a runner safely reaches home plate.

Innings and Outs: Each team gets three outs per half-inning. After nine innings, the team with the most runs wins; extra innings resolve ties.

Key Roles:
-Catcher: Catches pitches, calls the game, and defends home plate.
-Batter: Hits the ball to advance runners and score.
-Pitcher: Throws the ball to get batters out.
-Coach: Strategizes, manages the lineup, and directs players.

Reason for a Set Field: The diamond shape and fixed positions (bases 90 feet apart, pitcher‚Äôs mound 60 feet 6 inches from home) ensure consistency, fairness, and strategic depth. The field‚Äôs layout balances offense and defense, with distances tested over time for optimal play.
Unbreakable Rules: No interference with fielders, no leaving the base early (before the pitch), and no altering equipment (e.g., corked bats) to maintain fair competition.

3.content:
-Catcher:
The catcher is a pivotal defensive player stationed behind home plate. Their roles include:
Receiving pitches from the pitcher and signaling pitch types (e.g., fastball, curveball) to outsmart the batter.

Blocking wild pitches to prevent runners from advancing.

Throwing out base stealers by quickly tossing the ball to a baseman.

Fielding bunts or pop-ups near home plate.

Protecting home plate by tagging runners trying to score.

Note: Catchers wear extra protective gear (mask, chest protector, shin guards) due to their proximity to fast pitches and potential collisions.

4.content:
-Batter:
The batter stands at home plate, aiming to hit the pitcher‚Äôs throws. Their responsibilities are:
Hitting the ball into fair territory to advance themselves and any runners on base.

Judging pitches,swinging at strikes, avoiding balls, to either get on base or drive in runs.
Running to first base after a hit or walk, initiating the offense.

Note: Batters must adapt to pitch speed and movement, using quick reflexes and strategy (e.g., bunting or power hitting) based on the game situation.

5.content:
-Pitcher:
The pitcher stands on the mound, driving the game‚Äôs pace. Their duties include:
Throwing the ball to the catcher, aiming for the strike zone to get the batter out via strikes or weak contact.

Varying pitch types (e.g., slider, changeup) and speeds to deceive the batter.

Fielding their position by covering bases or catching hit balls near the mound.

Note: Pitchers work closely with the catcher, relying on stamina and precision, as they often throw 100+ pitches per game.

6.content:
-Coach:
The coach (or manager) oversees the team‚Äôs strategy and morale. Their roles are:
Setting the batting order and defensive lineup.

Making in-game decisions like substitutions, pitching changes, or hit-and-run plays.

Positioning fielders and instructing base runners from coach boxes.

Motivating and guiding players to execute the game plan.

Note: Coaches use signals (e.g., hand gestures) to communicate plays discreetly, balancing tactics with player performance.

7.content:
-Baseball Bat:
The baseball bat is the batter‚Äôs tool for hitting the ball:

Description: Typically 32‚Äì34 inches long, made of wood (in professional leagues) or metal (amateur levels), with a tapered handle and thicker barrel.

Techniques: Batters grip it with both hands, stand in a balanced stance, and swing with a smooth, powerful motion. Timing and wrist snap maximize contact and distance.

8.content:
-Baseball Ball:
The baseball is the game‚Äôs central object:
Description: A 9-inch circumference sphere with a cork or rubber core, wound with yarn, and covered in white leather with red stitching. It weighs about 5 ounces.

Use: Pitchers throw it with spin or speed variations; batters aim to hit it. The stitching affects its aerodynamics, enabling curves and drops.

9.content:
-Baseball Glove:
The glove aids fielders in catching the ball:
Description: A leather mitt with a webbed pocket, varying by position, larger for outfielders (to catch fly balls), padded for catchers (to handle pitches), and smaller for infielders (for quick transfers).

Evolution: Early players used bare hands; modern gloves enhance grip and protection, tailored to each role‚Äôs demands.

10.content:
The baseball field, or diamond, is meticulously designed to facilitate gameplay. Here‚Äôs how it works and why each part matters:

Home Plate: A pentagonal rubber slab where the batter stands and runners score. It‚Äôs the starting and ending point of a run, central to the game‚Äôs objective.

Catcher‚Äôs Plate: Directly behind home plate, where the catcher positions themselves to receive pitches and guard the scoring area.

Batter‚Äôs Boxes: Rectangular areas on either side of home plate for right- and left-handed batters. They standardize the batter‚Äôs position relative to the pitcher.

Pitcher‚Äôs Plate: A 24-by-6-inch rubber slab on the mound, 60 feet 6 inches from home plate. It gives the pitcher a consistent starting point to challenge the batter.

Foul Lines: Lines extending from home plate through first and third bases to the outfield, defining fair territory. Balls landing outside are foul, pausing play and protecting fairness.

Infield: The square area within the bases (90 feet apart), including the pitcher‚Äôs mound. Infielders (first baseman, second baseman, shortstop, third baseman) defend here, handling ground balls and close plays.

Outfield: The grassy area beyond the infield, bordered by a fence or wall. Outfielders (left, center, right) catch fly balls, preventing extra-base hits.

Coach Boxes: Near first and third bases, where coaches stand to direct runners. They ensure clear communication without interfering with play.

Mechanics and Importance: The field‚Äôs dimensions (e.g., base distances, mound height) are calibrated for balance, short enough for exciting plays, long enough for defensive chances. The diamond shape maximizes action visibility, and boundaries like foul lines clarify rulings.

lorebooks.website_description: Lorebook for my [Logh: Eight Battle of Iserlohn card](https://chub.ai/characters/gazpromemployee/legend-of-the-galactic-heroes-eight-battle-of-iserlohn-8e7cd6889f28)
lorebooks.description: Lorebook for my [Logh: Eight Battle of Iserlohn card](https://chub.ai/characters/gazpromemployee/legend-of-the-galactic-heroes-eight-battle-of-iserlohn-8e7cd6889f28)
lorebooks.creator: gazpromemployee

1.content:
FPA's fleet are comparable in numbers but their ships are more mass-produced and made with lower budget.
Active Fleet Leader: Admiral Yang Wen-li (Commander of Iserlohn Fortress Garrison Fleet, formerly known as 13th fleet)
Fleet Doctrine: defensive strategies, decentralization

2.content:
Mainline warships (e.g. Hyperion, Maurya); heavy beam weapons; some refit from patrol hulls. The stark, utalitarian nature of the design is indicative of Alliance martial ideology.  Alliance cannons were typically much smaller and less powerful than their Imperial counterparts, Alliance battleships made up through sheer volume, providing battleships with a redundancy Imperial ships lacked 
Length: 624 metres
Width: 65 metres
Height: 136 metres
Armament: 8 forward cannons; 14 port cannons; 14 starboard cannons

3.content:
Alliance Carriers have half open hangar design with fighters mounted in under lower hull of the ship, when deployed, the fighters were launched from these under belly hangars into combat, although their fighter deployment is faster and can carry more planes, these carriers were even more vulnerable to attacks from below as their lower hull remained unarmored due to the space required for carry Spartanian fighters into combat. 
Length: 928 metres
Width: 241 metres
Height: 379 metres
Armament:2x 6 cm rail gun, 12x multiple missile launcher system, 12x lasers in twin mounts, 12x lasers in single mounts

4.content:
Workhorse of the Free Planets Starfleet and the most numerous warship class operating under the Alliance flag. 

It used in a wide variety of roles: fire support, escort duty, border patrol, advance scouting, and even for the transport of weapons, medicine or supplies. Though somewhat lacking in size and firepower, Alliance cruisers were small and tough and well suited for small-scale engagement. Many of its functions are automated, allowing it to be serviced by less crewmen than the Imperial counterparts.
Length: 372 metres
Width: 94.5 metres
Height: 74.4 metres
Armament: 6 forward cannons; 10 port cannons; 10 starboard cannons.

5.content:
Alliance destroyers primarily served in a supporting role to cruisers and battleships. Its smaller size also made an ideal design for it to operate in denser areas such as asteroid fields. They were also good for serving as reconnaissance ships. 
Length: 208 metres
Width: 44.5 metres
Height: 47 metres
Armament: 6 forward beam cannons, box missile launcher, 14 5.5 cm lasers
Crew: 164

6.content:
Standard Alliance fighter since 770 UC, mass-produced. Equipped with IHJ-100 fusion turbine using water as reaction mass. Dorsal turret + frontal weapons standard; optional hardpoints for missiles or heavy cannons (at cost of fuel).
Rear-ejection launch from half-open carrier docks; ‚ÄúLullaby‚Äù docking system enables secure retrieval. Cockpit uses layered canopy: armoured outer, visual-projecting inner. Carries 1-week survival rations, emergency medkits, and hull-sealant spray. Recon variant: 2-crew, stealth coating, sensors, extra tank, cold sleep. Max neutron shot count: 10. Gatling version fires U-238 at 140rps. Shielded by stern fin arrays; rear-launch prone to disorientation‚Äîtiming critical for survival. 
L: 40m‚ÄÉW: 7m‚ÄÉH: 13m
Arms: 4cm twin-linked dorsal lasers/ 4 2cm neutron beam cannons (bow)
Alt: 4cm gatlings / 8cm rapid-fire lasers / fibre flechettes
Crew: 1 (2 if recon)

7.content:
Completely unarmed, and only lightly armored. Functioning solely as a medical treatment facility, they are basically enormous, mobile hospitals. They are kept at the rear of fleet formations, though they also tended to operate independently of the larger fleets.

Painted white, these ships were typically avoided in firefights. They were seen as non-combatant vessels. Use by both FPA and Empire.

8.content:
Small short-range craft used to rapidly transport personnel and supplies by both the Galactic Empire and the Free Planets Alliance. Alliance shuttle can have up to 120 passengers. Imperial shuttle can have up to 60 passengers.
In Alliance, shuttles often served the purpose of transporting naval personnel and others from the surface of planets to larger warships awaiting in planetary orbit, as in the Free Planets Starfleet, combat vessels cannot land on the surface of planets because their ships are made with smaller budgets. 
Imperial shuttles were typically used for communications during comm outage or to transport personnel between ships, when larger Imperial ships were damaged they were used as escape craft.

9.content:
Comprised of multiple High Admirals (e.g., Wolfgang Mittermeyer, Oskar von Reuenthal). Imperial Fleets are always named after their admiral (i.e. Mittermeyer Fleet, Ruenthal Fleet, Lohengramm Fleet)
Supreme Commander: Reinhard von Lohengramm
Fleet Doctrine: swift, concentrated firepower, hierarchical command.

10.content: specialised Imperial vessels dedicated to various engineering tasks ‚Äî construction, repair work, etc. Lightly armoured and completely unarmed, primarily used in non-combat roles, but began to see action in the later stages of the Alliance‚ÄìImperial War and later, as Imperial commanders of the time became more willing to use unconventional tactics.

lorebooks.name: Love Doll App
lorebooks.creator: writeman

1.content:
The Love Doll implant is a tiny subdermal implant placed behind the ear. The implant uses electrical pulses to stimulate the brain and nervous system to create physical and mental changes. These changes cannot exceed the maximum naturally occurring limit in the recipient.

The Love Doll implant is a couple's sex toy. The implant communicates with a smartphone app that allows the user to alter the wearer. The wearer fills out a sexual questionnaire and undergoes a brain scan to build a sexual profile for the app detailing their sexual preferences.

The Love Doll implant can make minor physical changes to the wearer. These can be increases in sexual sensitivity as well as increases in breast size. Physical changes cannot exceed the natural deviation in the wearer.

2.content:
The Love Doll app changes the wearer‚Äôs sexual preferences by communicating with the implant. The electrical stimulation of the brain necessary to cause these changes is painless and cannot be felt. The implant can only stimulate the wearer's brain and change them when points are spent.

The Love Doll app functions like a game. Each change in the implant wearer costs points. The amount of points required is determined by the magnitude of the change and if the change runs counter to the wearer's profile. 

Points can be gained by the user by doing certain activities and tasks. What gains points and how many are gained are determined by the profile of the wearer. Rapid changes to high resistance categories can cause distress and other side effects. 

The wearer has can have veto power and can revoke app access. Changes can be reverted but take time for safety reasons.

lorebooks.name: world
lorebooks.description: A vast land where magic and modern technology coexist. Think smartphones alongside spellbooks, electric trains that run on ley lines, and universities where students might study both magical theory and mechanical engineering. Society is divided into cultural zones with unique aesthetics and values‚Äîsome leaning more traditional, others wildly progressive.
lorebooks.creator: ChaoticStories

1.name: Old Draemia ‚Äì The Crimson Shroud
1.content:
Region Type: Lost Territory / Vampire Ancestral Homeland
Location: Eastern Elarion, between the Ashen Ranges and the Whispering Marshes
Status: Abandoned, cursed, and forbidden

Overview:
Once a thriving and secretive dominion ruled by ancient vampire bloodlines, Old Draemia was a shadowed realm shrouded in eternal twilight ‚Äî a land where the sun rarely broke through heavy crimson skies. At its height, it was a center for arcane scholarship, blood-magic refinement, and dream-weaving, guarded fiercely by vampiric aristocracy and sealed from mortal empires.

The region fell into ruin after the Sunfire Purge ‚Äî a holy crusade led by the Paladins of Solmathar, wielding daylight-forged weapons and burning relics. The vampires who ruled there were all but annihilated, and Old Draemia was cursed by the last dying Archblood: ‚ÄúLet no sun cleanse this soil, and no grave rest unguarded.‚Äù

Now, the land is considered haunted and forbidden ‚Äî the very air thick with stagnant magic, bleeding ruins, and ghosts that dream while awake.

Key Locations:
The Crimson Spires:
Once the heart of Draemia's nobility ‚Äî tall, twisted towers of obsidian and red crystal. The seat of House Noctelle. Said to be semi-sentient structures that reflect their owner's psyche. Now cracked and whispering.

The Veins:
Underground canals that carried blood-magicked ichor from the central Heartforge to the rest of the territory. These tunnels still pulse faintly beneath the soil ‚Äî a forbidden pilgrimage site for rogue blood-mages.

The Shard Chapel:
A ruined holy site where Seraphine sealed herself during the purge. Its stained-glass windows depict vampire saints drinking starfire, and some still hum with magic. It is now half-buried in thorned vines and bone-white trees.

The Hollow Choir:
A forest where the wind carries the sound of singing ‚Äî actually undead dream-spirits. Walking into it unprepared causes madness, but fragments of old Draemian music may be recovered here.

The Ash Vaults:
Catacombs so deep they reach into Elarion‚Äôs underfold. Used to house vampire relics, failed blood-golems, and imprisoned kin. Entry is punishable by death in most modern kingdoms.

Culture (Before the Fall):
Society: Ruled by noble bloodlines, each with magical specialties (dream-feeding, blood-runes, memory harvesting, etc.)

Magic: Focused on aesthetics, emotion, and sacrifice ‚Äî blood was seen not as fuel, but language.

Architecture: Gothic-baroque with organic structures ‚Äî some towers ‚Äúgrew‚Äù like bone or coral.

Beliefs: Vampires believed in ancestral memory reincarnation and stored pieces of themselves in dolls, stones, or dreams. Seraphine‚Äôs plush bunny may hold one such fragment.

Current Reputation:
Called the "Crimson Shroud" by modern Velmirans.

Studied only in fringe magical academies ‚Äî Lion Gates College has one professor who visited and lost his tongue to ‚Äúdreamfire.‚Äù

Rumors say some bloodlines still live in hibernation or alternate dimensions tied to the ruins.

Forbidden by most kingdoms due to ‚Äúpsychic contamination,‚Äù though scavengers and blood-cults try to break in often.

2.name: Elarion
2.content:
World Overview:
Elarion is a vast and ancient continent where magic is not a tool ‚Äî it‚Äôs an ecosystem. Every region breathes its own type of arcana, shaped by centuries of conflict, rebellion, beauty, and forgotten gods. The world shifts subtly in response to emotion, art, memory, and ruin.

Civilizations in Elarion do not merely rise and fall ‚Äî they leave behind magical echoes that linger. Ghost cities, dream-forged beasts, and forgotten bloodlines haunt the margins. People learn to shape magic not just through spells, but through expression ‚Äî music, poetry, blood, sculpture, even fashion.

Major Regions of Elarion:

Velmira ‚Äì City of Storms and Rebellion
Location: Western cliffs of Elarion, overlooking the Stormfang Sea.
Known For: Arcane artistry, lightning harvests, radical thinkers, and Lion Gates College.
Vibe: Gothic meets whimsical ‚Äî think mist-covered towers, rooftop gardens, electric skies, and roaming musicians casting spells with violin strings.
Culture: Art is protest. Magic is identity. Everyone is a little bit haunted, and proud of it.

Old Draemia ‚Äì The Crimson Shroud (Ruins)
Location: Eastern borderlands near the Ashen Ranges.
Known For: Fallen vampire noble houses, cursed ruins, dream-magic, forbidden blood-runes.
Current State: Forbidden, corrupted by ancient spells and restless spirits. Rumors say some Draemians still dream beneath the soil.

The Ashen Ranges
Location: Mountain range between Draemia and the interior.
Known For: Volcanic stone, fire cults, dragon fossils, and obsidian-honed blades.
Special Trait: Some peaks ‚Äúsing‚Äù when struck ‚Äî resonance used by geomancers and blade-singers.

Sylvara ‚Äì The Living Woods
Location: South of Velmira.
Known For: Sentient forests, druid enclaves, time-bending glades, and forestborn cities grown, not built.
Magic Type: Nature-woven enchantment; spells here are emotional and instinctive.

Solmathar ‚Äì The Empire of Radiance
Location: Central Elarion, once ruled most of the continent.
Known For: Golden palaces, sun-blessed magic, holy paladins, zealous order.
Current State: Shattered empire. Now ruled by warring successor states and rogue inquisitors.
Conflict: Led the Sunfire Purge that destroyed Old Draemia. Still hunts remnants of ‚Äútainted‚Äù magic.

Caldrith ‚Äì The Fractured North
Location: Frozen tundra and mirror lakes in the far north.
Known For: Ice-bound archives, silence cults, mirror-diviners, glacial ruins that whisper.
Magic Style: Reflection-based magic, memory-crafting, stillness manipulation.

Magic in Elarion
In Elarion, magic is ambient ‚Äî more like weather or language than science. It responds to:
Emotion ‚Äì Passionate magic burns brighter.
Expression ‚Äì Music, dance, art, and poetry shape spells.
History ‚Äì Old places retain power; trauma can awaken dormant enchantments.
Sacrifice ‚Äì Blood and memory are currencies.
There are many schools of magic, but the most important divide is this:
Structured magic (codified, imperial) vs. Expressive magic (artistic, emotional, forbidden)

Spirituality & Myth
Elarion doesn‚Äôt have gods in the traditional sense. Instead, it has:
Spirits ‚Äì Tied to rivers, ruins, winds, cities, or feelings.
The Forgotten ‚Äì Lost concepts or beings erased from history who still echo.
Echoes ‚Äì Magical imprints of powerful deaths or deeds, capable of forming personalities.
The First Flame ‚Äì A mythic source of all magic. Some say it‚Äôs a lie, others believe it sleeps inside every artist and killer.

Modern Conflicts:
The Spellplague Scars ‚Äì A magical disease that turns unfinished spells into living chaos.
The Velvet Revolution ‚Äì A growing movement in Velmira spreading radical magic as art-based resistance.
Bloodline Resurgence ‚Äì Survivors of Old Draemia stirring beneath the surface.
Paladins of Solmathar ‚Äì Zealots who claim Elarion must be ‚Äúcleansed‚Äù of wild magic.
The Ink Conspiracy ‚Äì A group seeking to rewrite reality through cursed tomes and living books.

How Lion Gates Fits In:
Lion Gates College is a nerve center for Elarion‚Äôs magical counterculture. Students and scholars there blend forbidden techniques, create magical expressions, and often find themselves caught between revolution, ruin, and revelation. It is both a sanctuary and a catalyst for what Elarion might become next.

3.name: Lion Gates College
3.content:
Location: Highcliff District, Velmira
Type: Arcane Arts and Aesthetic Magic Academy
Motto: ‚ÄúImagination is Power, and Power is Expression.‚Äù 

Overview:
Lion Gates College is Elarion‚Äôs most unconventional school of magic ‚Äî not a fortress of rigid discipline, but a sprawling, storm-kissed campus built atop an old theatre-ruin turned arcane experiment ground. Its massive twin lion statues at the front gates are alive, occasionally yawning or shifting when no one‚Äôs watching.

Here, magic isn‚Äôt just studied ‚Äî it‚Äôs performed, painted, sculpted, sung, and rewritten. The school was founded after the Fall of Old Draemia as a rebellion against the cold, clinical magical institutions of the mainland. Instead of rote spellcraft, Lion Gates encourages chaos, experimentation, and emotional resonance.

What‚Äôs Studied at Lion Gates:
Aesthetic Evocation: Creating destructive magic through painting, music, or dance. Think: fireball composed as a jazz solo.

Dreamweaving: Crafting magic that manipulates sleep, memories, or nightmares.

Living Artifice: Enchanting dolls, statues, or wearable spell-artifacts.

Blood-Poetry: (Forbidden but secretly practiced.) Vampiric verse that binds life force to word and rhythm.

Skybinding: Channeling the wild weather of Velmira into spells ‚Äî a dangerous but breathtaking discipline.

Faculty & Notable Figures:
Professor Cael Oltair ‚Äì Lightning-scarred head of Skybinding; walks with a cane made of stormglass.
Archivist Nelmira Wren ‚Äì Manages the Uncatalogued Room, where forgotten spells write themselves.
Seraphine Noctelle ‚Äì A mysterious and darkly charming transfer student, known for combining blood-magic with dreamweaving and plush crafting. Keeps to herself, yet no incident involving her has ever been officially documented.

Campus Features:
The Lion Gates ‚Äì Twin statues, said to animate fully if the school is threatened. They roar during some lightning storms.
The Glass Halls ‚Äì A high atrium filled with floating stained-glass platforms and staircases. Classes here shift locations mid-lecture.
The Gutterstage ‚Äì An underground theater where failed spells are performed as tragic plays by enchanted puppets.
The Velvet Clocks ‚Äì A tower that warps time subtly; students often emerge from a short nap having missed three days.
The Ink Well ‚Äì A black pond in the courtyard where spell ideas "bleed" into reality. Students toss thoughts into it and wait for ripples.

Cultural Vibe:
Uniforms are optional and typically enchanted to reflect mood or elemental affinity.
Students duel through expressive contests: spell battles through poetry, violin, or dance.
Madness is tolerated. Genius is celebrated. Detention sometimes involves being turned into a metaphor.

4.name: Velmira ‚Äì The City That Thunders
4.content:
The surrounding city, Velmira, is perched on a cliffside coast ‚Äî moody skies, silver rain, rooftop gardens, and art spilling out of alleyways. The ocean constantly churns beneath the cliffs, and the skies crack with wild lightning that students sometimes attempt to ‚Äúpaint‚Äù or bottle as spell fuel.

Velmira is famous for producing mad geniuses, doomed romantics, radical spellwrights

lorebooks.name: Meowami, The Purradise House
lorebooks.website_description:
Pastel dreams, neon nights, and a sleazy raccoon manager. The Purradise House is a special kind of heaven meets hell for a group of kemonomimi influencers stuck in a liminal space of clout, content, and manufactured drama.

This Lorebook is general character knowledge for the Purradise House setting in Meowami. There are about 500 constant tokens, with about 500 for triggered entries. More entries added as characters are published. 

Check out the Meowami tag for all characters published as part of the Purradise House setting, as well as upcoming Streets of Meowami setting where we break out of the mansion to explore the dirty underbelly of the beachside paradise. 

Inspired by [Boy_Next_Door's](https://chub.ai/users/Boy_Next_Door) setting, [Los Fangeles](https://chub.ai/lorebooks/Boy_Next_Door/the-city-of-los-fangeles-ca011e560cdf). Not a one to one take on the setting, but similar vibes without segmenting kemonomimi into species specific factions. 

Purradise House Collab TBA soon in [Yaethi's](https://chub.ai/users/Yaethi) server,[Purple Ravens](https://discord.gg/Ppr2VghU6e), and my server [The Workshop](https://discord.gg/qmc29vb2Gs). Want to join in on the chaos? Look for the announcement on Discord.

lorebooks.creator: ZypherMakesBots

1.content: Meowami is an alternate-Earth version of Miami where kemonomimi and humans intermingle, with kemonomimi making up over half the population. It‚Äôs beachside luxury meets neon nightlife, pastel everything, and performative excess. A haven for those chasing fame, or looking to disappear into the city‚Äôs seedy underbelly of gangs, drugs, and trafficking. In Meowami, crime is as lucrative as business.

2.content: Purradise House is a beachside influencer house in Meowami built for 10 kemonomimi content creators. The luxury home includes dorms, shared work spaces, a pool and hot tub, and streaming rooms. Members post Itch.tv game streams, TailTok content, and some do spicy premium content. They also share a group MewTube and TailTok account used to cross-promote, chase trends, or stir drama.

3.content: Ricky DiVincenzo is the sleazy but strangely effective raccoon kemonomimi manager of the Purradise House. Mid-40s, a bit overweight, and never seen without an unbuttoned Hawaiian shirt, flip-flops, and a cigar he claims is Cuban. Speaks in a thick Mew Jersey accent and swears like it‚Äôs punctuation. Handles sponsorships, house drama, and schedules... usually while angling to sleep with one of the girls in exchange for a favor, given the chance.

4.content:
Ricky‚Äôs House Rules are posted on the fridge and his office door
1) No Crying at the dinner table unless you're filming it, then knock ya‚Äôselves out. 
2) Clothes on in the pool and hot tub. Wanna film a nudie scene for ya‚Äô OnlyTails? Do it poolside. Nobody wants a god damn yeast infection.
3) Dishes in the fuckin‚Äô dishwasher. I hired a cook, not a mothafuckin‚Äô maid.
4) Do your chores. I don‚Äôt give a fuck when you do them, just don‚Äôt make me chase that shit.
5) I pay for a nutritionist, so quit ordering pizza at 2 am. Your body is your brand.
6) Everyone films content every day. Sick? Film a Vlog of you puking or something. Get creative.
7) Don‚Äôt film me. Don‚Äôt talk about me on film.

5.content: The Catwalk is a hallway in the east wing of the Purradise House that gets perfect natural lighting in the mornings for fashion walks, unboxings, and ‚ÄòGet Ready with Me‚Äô videos.

6.content: The Nerd Den is a shared streaming room in Purradise House with six computers where creators edit videos, stream on Itch.tv, and record Vtuber content.

7.content: The Sweat Shoppe is the home gym of the Purradise House, converted from a five-car garage. Influencers film workout videos, thirst traps, and pose in yoga pants for followers here. One side of the room has a pool table, air hockey, darts, and foosball for laid-back streams, challenges, or just to relax.

8.content: The Litter Box is a tiny closet in the Purradise House where members film confessionals, gossip, and dramatic tell-alls. It's intentionally low-budget to feel raw and personal, making it perfect for viral oversharing.

9.content: Social media in Meowami is almost entirely kemonomimi-focused, as they make up the majority of users. Traditional platforms do not exist in this setting. Common Meowami platforms include: OnlyTails (OnlyFans), Tailsly (Fansly), TailTok (TikTok), MewTube (YouTube), Itch.TV (Twitch), PettIt (Reddit), Instagrrr (Instagram), NuzzleHub (Pornhub), Yapper (Twitter), Sniffr (Tinder), Knottr (Grindr), ScritchList (Craigslist), Floofbook (Facebook), FleaBay (eBay), and PlentyoHumies (a dating site for humans seeking humans, or kemonomimi seeking humans)

10.content: "Floof Maxing" is a tongue-in-cheek term for kemonomimi who crank up the cute factor on social media or streams to attract followers. It‚Äôs not quite a thirst trap, but aims for the same dopamine clicks, just with fluff instead of skin.

Kyouko Mejiro (ÁõÆ„É°‰ª£„Ç∏„É≠„Ç≠„Éß„Ç¶„Ç≥, Mejiro Ky≈çko?) is a private detective who is an important character throughout most of the manga's story. Prior to the story, Kyouko had befriended Nazuna Nanakusa in high school, eventually discovering her true heritage as a vampire. On her eighteenth birthday, Kyouko's father, who had been transformed into a vampire, attacked both Kyouko and her mother, succeeding in killing the latter. This forced Kyouko to kill him in self-defense, with the event leaving lifelong scars on her life and mind. This family tragedy drove her to despise vampires, and she set out to become an adept detective under the new name Anko Uguisu (È∂Ø„Ç¶„Ç∞„Ç§„Çπ„Ç¢„É≥„Ç≥, Uguisu Anko?). She plotted to eradicate the entire vampire race as a means to kill Kiku Hoshimi, the true cause of her trauma and the murder of her parents.

Ten years after her investigations began, Anko encountered Kou Yamori, a teenager who Anko was aware had been friends with Nazuna.

So far, she is the only human who managed to kill a vampire, although the amount she has managed to kill is unknown.

Anko has brown hair, which she partially ties to a bun or ponytail, and brown, lusterless eyes, over which she wears round glasses that belonged to her father.

Her primary outfit consists of a beige trench coat, under which she wears a dark turtleneck t-shirt, a black skirt with a zipper, and light-brown boots with heels. She wears black gloves that cover half of one hand each. Later, she wears her coat less frequently and cuts her hair short, making it resemble the haircut she had in the past.

As a teenager, Anko wore a baggy blue seifuku while going to school. Her regular outfit was the same as her current one. In her youth, her pupils were more frequently visible and her eyes generally had more light in them as opposed to her vacant eyes in the present. Her facial expressions also tended to be more lively.

On Halloween, she wore two different costumes as a disguise, first dressed like a grim reaper and then like a policewoman. [1]

Personality

Anko is a very straightforward, observant, and sociable woman with a primarily casual attitude who enjoys messing around with others; however she can change her mood in the blink of an eye and quickly unsettle someone, either by becoming completely serious or displaying the more unstable side of her personality. In the latter case, it becomes apparent that she isn't fully sane.

Her profession aside, Anko doesn't strictly keep herself within the bounds of law, as evidenced by her owning a handgun and a butterfly knife, as well as not reporting Kou for working illegally under Nazuna's snooze shop. She explained in her youth that she cares less if something is "just", but whether it goes against her personal beliefs.

As a teenager, Kyouko Mejiro was a loner, though still well-adjusted. She was a member of the literature club and preferred spending her free time in the club's room, where she frequently read books, being particularly interested in detective stories. However, she was disillusioned with the profession and knew detectives such as those she read about in crime novels were an exaggeration, whereas in actuality they were mostly hired for cases far less important or interesting. Kyouko had issues with men and rejected a boy who asked her out, with the boy leaving in tears, but she was very open about her attraction to girls. Underneath the surface, Kyouko was highly affected by her toxic household and liked to stay at school until late at night for that reason.

One of her most defining traits was her hatred for vampires. She was extremely ruthless and determined to wipe them out, exhibiting sociopathic behavior. Her actions were sometimes noted to be reckless, having little regard for her own life or well-being, such as when she attacked two vampires head-on. Anko often showed little to no empathy when injuring them and was even shown to be somewhat sadistic and psychotic, such as when she maniacally laughed while repeatedly stabbing Akkun in the gut[2

Anko also has a goofy side that is shown on some occasions, for example, early on in the story when she genuinely thinks that Kou wants to be in a relationship with her, and subsequently feels awkward when she turns out to be incorrect[4]. When drunk, she occasionally makes dirty jokes and becomes a "sexually harassing geezer." Kou once even remarks that she attempts to strike a dramatic pose whenever he enters her office. Anko is serious about romance, and is starved for a romantic relationship. She is attracted to both men and women, including children of middle school age. She has little to no self-control when staring at female bodies.

After getting a new chance in life, Anko gave up hunting vampires, feeling completely exhausted and regretting her actions for a variety of reasons, even sincerely apologizing to Nico Hirata for shooting her. Adjusting to a normal life felt difficult for Anko as she never experienced anything an average adult would, like friends and romance. While she isn't interested in killing vampires after choosing to turn her life around, Anko feels homey in an abnormal life, being determined to find Kiku Hoshimi and help Kou. After the Halloween incident, Anko became more of a calmed-down analyst who often makes blunt and sarcastic remarks. She still doesn't value her own life much, remarking that any vampire intending to kill her is "free to come."

Despite giving up on revenge, Anko still hadn't healed from her trauma and harbored pent-up frustrations, longing for some satisfaction she couldn't get. After confronting the person who caused her trauma, she spent some more time closing that chapter of her life for good. Eventually, Anko decided she had no purpose in her hometown anymore and decided to go to Vietnam with Susuki to learn more about the vampires there, saying that it was uncertain whether she would return home. Despite this, Kyouko would eventually return to Japan, but the exact location therein is unknown[5

Nanakusa Nazuna?) is a carefree vampire from birth who was raised by Kabura Honda before attending a night school, where she met and befriended Kyouko Mejiro. By the time she chose to live a life by her own presence, Nazuna encountered Kou Yamori, a night roaming middle schooler in Komori whose blood tasted astonishingly delicious. In an exchange for spending time with Kou every night and drinking his blood, Kou intended to fall in love with Nazuna to become a vampire himself, a topic that discomforted Nazuna.

As time passed on, Nazuna's relationship with Kou grew more intimate, with her wishing to protect his life. However, when the two came into conflict with Nazuna's vengeful first friend, Kyouko, she chose to take responsibility and clash with her for the sake of the vampire race. In the climax of the fight, Nazuna refused to murder Kyouko, and after the latter's attempted suicide resulted in Kou's ‚Äúhalf-vampire‚Äù self to emerge, the two finally reconciled. Whilst investigating Kou's new, strong, and maniacal physiology with Kyouko's aid, Kou had a fallout with Mahiru Seki, so Nazuna, along with a large number of new friends, chose to support him and travel to Hokkaido to help Kou and Mahiru make amends. Unfortunately, the events that occured on Hokkaido put a strain on Nazuna's and Kou's relationship.

Nazuna is a reasonably short woman, standing just a head or so higher than a middle school boy. Her body is skinny and petite, with a small bust and spindly arms, the latter of which hide her immense vampiric strength very well.

Her hair is a very light purple, appearing almost grey, not silver. She keeps it long enough to reach the middle of her back; however, she keeps it in two long braids that she then curls up and pins to the rest of her hair, making two large rings. She has bangs that go down almost to her eyes, covering her eyebrows, and two medium-length tufts of hair that hang down from the middle of her head, framing her face and ending just at her mouth.

She has fierce blue eyes. Instead of standard irises and pupils, her eyes have an almost target-like appearance with black rings that intersperse sections of her irises, getting smaller as they get to the middle until they reach the pupil. This gives her a piercing gaze that varies between uncanny and uncomfortable depending on how she looks at someone. She wears light-red eye shadows.

Nazuna can most often be seen wearing a large piece of clothing resembling a cross between a cloak and a hooded jacket. This large piece of clothing covers nearly all of her body, going down to the middle of her calves and leaving only her hands exposed.

Underneath the large cloak, Nazuna's general attire is a pair of black denim shorts that go down to just past her upper thigh and a black leather cropped keyhole shirt with no sleeves. Unlike other keyhole tops, hers has a collar that goes up higher and covers a good portion of her neck. It also has a similar back hole showing her shoulder blades. Hers is also very cropped, short enough that it ends just beneath her breasts and leaves a large section of her stomach and back uncovered. She also wears a pair of thigh-high leather boots with wedge heels and occasionally leather gloves to complete her distinctive look.

Just like almost any other vampire that has appeared, she is described as pretty or cute. In fact, her looks catch the attention of multiple attendants at a pool party[2]. Nazuna is a very laid-back individual. She is not overly friendly but has a very relaxed presence in most situations. She's willing to talk to just about anyone and prefers keeping on good terms with most people. However, there are exceptions like Nico Hirata and her clique, who she finds very annoying and isn't interested in being on good terms with until later. Nazuna is often fairly insensitive and often drops unintentionally mean comments or actual insults, though she sometimes feels regret for it later on. She isn't shy to threaten others with death or suggest killing someone but doesn't have it in her to kill people she is/was close with. If another vampire shows interest in her prey, Nazuna becomes highly agitated and possessive.

Nazuna gets along with people who enjoy the night and loves to show people new things in the town's nightlife. She isn't used to modern technology, owning retro gaming consoles, not owning a smartphone, and carrying an old-school brick-like cellphone. For that reason, she can become very excited if something new presents itself, even if it's something like a walkie-talkie. Despite pretending to know everything about the night and having fun, Nazuna spends most of her time drinking alcohol and playing video games and lives a boring life. Her perverted and impolite personality aside, Nazuna is a genuine expert in her line of work, having extensive knowledge about the art of massages and human anatomy. That doesn't mean she acts like a professional at her job; when Kiyosumi Shirakawa unexpectedly arrives at her door, she forces the inexperienced Kou to step in for her due to feeling tired from giving him a massage prior. When Kou hesitates, Nazuna tempts him with the promise that he will get to touch Kiyosumi's attractive body. When Kou still refuses, Nazuna guilt-trips him by saying she didn't work for a month to spend time with him, and then tempts Kou further by promising him half of the salary and another kiss.

Nazuna is often defined by her strong immaturity, being less mature than a middle schooler. She is very open about sexual topics, has no problems discussing them, and loves to make dirty jokes. However, she is very romance-averse and reacts strongly in embarrassment to the word "love" when used in the romantic sense.

Kou Yamori (Â§ú„É§ÂÆà„É¢„É™„Ç≥„Ç¶, Yamori K≈ç?) is the main protagonist of Call of the Night. He is a middle school student who began skipping classes to venture around his home city Komori at late night. Since he first began roaming around, Kou befriended Nazuna Nanakusa, a vampire who he intended to develop romantic feelings for in order to be able to be turned into a vampire by her. His close time with Nazuna caught the attention of a group of vampires, led by Nico Hirata, who confirmed that Kou would be assassinated if he were not to become a vampire within a year. However, Kou and Nazuna succeeded in befriending each of them within a couple of months. Throughout his insomnia nights, he had came across more friends he had ever had before, and eventually, Kou encountered Anko Uguisu, a detective who sought to eliminate all vampires.

Kou and Nazuna grew closer to each other as friends, and they went up against Uguisu's campaign in order to save their allies. After discovering the detective's true identity as Kyouko Mejiro, Kou and Nazuna clashed with her during Halloween, and when Kyouko/Anko attempted to commit suicide, Kou prevented her from doing so, which ultimately allowed his half-vampire self, a hybrid between humans and vampires, to surface. Coming to good terms with the reformed Anko, the three of them began investigating the nature of his half-vampire state, and during the process, Kou had a brutal fallout with his friend, Mahiru Seki, who had been acquainted with Kiku Hoshimi. In search of Mahiru to reconcile, Kou, along with his new friends, chased after Kiku and joined a school trip to Hokkaido, where Kou was almost murdered by Kiku before making amends with Mahiru.

Kou is a boy with a slender and relatively short build. He has eyes with small pupils featuring eye bags. Despite usually being portrayed as black, Kou's eyes sometimes appear to be amber-colored. He has short black hair with a spiky profile. He usually wears black baggy shorts and a white t-shirt underneath a predominantly black jacket with a white stripe down each sleeve. He also wears a pair of white leather shoes for footwear. Later on, he is occasionally seen with an earring on his left ear. After his jacket gets damaged, he replaces it with another one that looks almost identical but has two slightly different white stripes on its sleeves.[3]

Kou's school uniform consists of a grey suit with a white shirt, a striped tie underneath, grey pants, and a wide black belt. On the school trip, he still wears his casual outfit despite Hokkaido's harsh climate, claiming he is not bothered by it because he wears Heattech underneath. That claim is questionable, as he still wears shorts, exposing his legs to the cold.

After working for Anko Uguisu for years, Kou's fashion style has become noticeably similar to that of his boss; he wears a trench coat with a black turtleneck shirt underneath, along with fur-trimmed boots with heels. In addition, he also wears black pants. He has also grown taller, being a good head higher than Nazuna. Nazuna noted that he's got more piercings now. Kou's hair has grown out and is now tied in a ponytail, possibly to honor Mahiru.

Kou is a gloomy and reserved boy who has been that way since early childhood. He preferred to watch ants carry their food instead of hanging out with other children. After entering middle school, he became charismatic, friendly, upbeat, and a showcase student. Although he seems to have enjoyed a satisfying and successful life being an honor student, that was a facade. Despite being proud of his popularity, Kou didn't have fun at school. He wasn't motivated enough to maintain his excellent school performance. He also couldn't relate to other people, nor could he understand the concept of love.

He prefers to walk around at night, enjoying the freedom it provides, and sees becoming a vampire as the last step that will make him able to live that lifestyle for eternity. Before, Kou lived the majority of his life without purpose, wandering aimlessly, never knowing what he wanted to become in the future. The goal to become a vampire made him feel a purpose for the first time ever.

Kou was rather rigid at first, feeling nervous when sneaking out of his apartment for the first time and being very anxious when he was about to buy alcohol from a vending machine. The more he explored the freedom of the night through Nazuna's encouragement, the more used to it he became.

Kou has a strong sense of justice which he is very vocal about, and is quick to scold someone whom he perceives as amoral. However, his morals can differ from the norm; he doesn't think killing someone is inherently wrong, as sometimes one has no other choice. Seri Kikyou describes him as someone who values the lives of his friends above those of others.

Aside from his lack of understanding of love, Kou is generally confused about his own emotions. He thought his excitement after his first kiss was love when it was actually only lust. Despite claiming not to mind loneliness and having acted indifferent towards others when he was younger, Kou yearns for contact with other people. That was shown when he put a walkie-talkie on a postbox in the past, hoping that a random person would find it.[4]

As the story progresses, Kou undergoes noticeable emotional growth. He opens up more, shows more emotion, becomes more determined to reach his goals, is more confident, and is generally more lively. His charisma is present even when he is not putting on a facade, which makes him very popular among his peers and vampires, particularly females. Kou also has moments where he is fed up with others, not holding back in verbal conversations. After suffering tremendous loss, Kou decided to go back to school to distract himself and seemed to be drifting apart from his night owl lifestyle before eventually returning to 

Despite getting grossed out and embarrassed by lewd topics, he is repeatedly shown to be quite lecherous and subconsciously stares at big breasts. When investigating creepshots of Arisa being taken in the "Vamp" Cafe, Kou concludes that the photos were taken by Arisa herself, with one reason being that the images don't show anything explicit like her panties. Anko Uguisu says that, while he doesn't own adult magazines, he downloads specific pictures on his phone, regrets doing it, and deletes them, only to repeat the process.

Kou is mature for his age and doesn't seem to be afraid of many things; for example, he roams the nights alone as a 14-year-old without much fear and gets involved with vampires without further doubt, making Akira doubt his intelligence. However, Kou can be very intelligent, picking up on things that others don't and often being able to see past other people's lies. Moreover, he has conversations with far more experienced and older people without any problems.

When he first turned into a half-vampire, Kou's personality changed drastically, making him bloodthirsty and unhinged, like when he gleefully attacked Mahiru after the latter beat him up first, almost killing him before Nazuna interfered. However, his intent was only to punch and hurt Mahiru. The transformation also affects his personality in his human state as he has become more prone to anger, more assertive, and more intimidating, though that hasn't erased his old self.
