Akira Asai (Êúù„Ç¢„Çµ‰∫ï„Ç§„Ç¢„Ç≠„É©, Asai Akira?) is a middle school student and a childhood friend of Kou Yamori and Mahiru Seki. A dedicated follower of authority, Akira does everything expected from a good student despite her utter lack of enthusiasm. Recently, Akira started to develop insomnia due to her life feeling unsatisfying because of her lack of human connection, both at school and at home, and started waking up at 4 AM and going to school early. After her friend was rejected when she confessed to Kou as per Akira's suggestion, Kou began skipping school to roam around at night. Not long after the first time, Akira came across him and met Nazuna Nanakusa, a vampire.

Akira is a teenage girl with a voluptuous build. She has short hair whose coloration varies between black and dark brown. Her eyes have tiny pupils and no visible iris. While her eyes are usually colored black, they are also depicted as amber-colored. Akira has a noticeable upper bust, a feature acknowledged by several characters, and an angular face.

Outside, she usually wears a school uniform consisting of a long-sleeved white shirt, a striped tie, brown loafers, and a grey skirt. In addition, her uniform also features a grey blazer during the colder months. In PE class, Akira wears the school-issued dark-colored track jacket with sleeves that are white on the upper half, and black shorts. She also ties her hair in a ponytail during PE. At home, she is always shown wearing a sleeveless shirt and pajama shorts.

At one point she was put in a maid outfit, much to her embarrassment.[3]

Akira, despite not having fun at school, is a mature and disciplined student who obediently follows her school duties and takes her education serious. She is approachable and perceptive, and maintains a close relationship with her friends Kou Yamori and Mahiru Seki. As a little girl, she was lively and talkative but later became gloomy, blunt, and snarky. Reasons for that are her boring time at school, where she puts on an honor student facade and feels alienated from the girls as she used to spend her time with boys.

Another factor is her situation at home. She doesn't seem to have a good relationship with her family and does nothing but repeat the same daily routine. At one point, she "wasn't able to bring herself out anymore" and seems to suffer from depression. She gets grossed out when someone says something too positive, like Kou praising Mahiru or the latter talking about "liking someone." Recently, her lively side has resurfaced to some extent.

For the most part, Akira is a "by-the-book" person who rigorously follows school protocol and has a strict sleeping schedule that involves going to sleep at 8 PM and waking up as early as 4 AM so she can take a walk before going to school. Even if others perceive that as weird, Akira sees it as entirely normal. She also frequently encourages her friends to get sleep and focus on their education. When her friends are involved, however, Akira supports their lifestyles, even if they go against the norms of society, and is willing to get into trouble, particularly when their well-being is in danger. When around her peers, particularly Kou, Akira acts like a guardian figure, causing Michiko to give her nicknames like "Miss Guardian" and "Mom." Her friends often seek advice from her on how to handle their problems, making Akira a sort of counselor for them.

Akira has a relatively carefree attitude, quickly accepting the existence of vampires. While she's usually very cool-headed, she can also quickly feel overwhelmed by a situation and lose her cool, particularly if she feels scared or embarrassed. She has a strong suspicion of vampires and mostly wants to stay away from them, getting embarrassed, weirded out, and disgusted by their antics.

She can be hot-tempered and has no qualms about using physical violence against people close to her when irritated, like when she hits Mahiru for requesting her to summon Hanako-san and then hits him again for scaring her by imitating the ghost's voice, or when she wrestles Kou and Mahiru to the ground due to being frustrated by their lack of communication skills.

Even though Akira had no problem socializing, it quickly got boring for her until she met the two boys with whom she shared several traits, like her views on things, her inability to relate to other people, and, later on, her lack of happiness.

Mahiru Seki (Â§ï„Çª„Ç≠Áúü„ÉûÊòº„Éí„É´, Seki Mahiru?) was a former middle school student and a childhood friend of Kou Yamori and Akira Asai. On the surface, Mahiru came off as perfect; he had good grades but wasn't a nerd, played sports, was charming and upbeat, got along with everybody, and his parents owned a flower shop. In truth, Mahiru suffered from heavy trauma caused by being utterly neglected by his parents after his older brother died.

Despite being surrounded by students who adored him, he only enjoyed the company of Kou and Akira. While working at his family's flower shop, Mahiru met Kiku Hoshimi, a vampire who eventually developed a relationship with him. Seeking to become a vampire himself to escape his everyday life, he started dating Kiku, and as time passed, Kiku had Mahiru ultimately struck with love and abiding by her influence

Mahiru is a young boy with a darker faint skin tone who usually wears his school uniform consisting of a gray blazer, under which he wears a red hoodie, gray pants, and white tennis shoes. His hair is dark blonde and tied in a little ponytail.

After choosing to become a vampire, he lets his hair down and starts to wear baggy clothes, described by Kou as "looking tired."

Personality

Mahiru is a kind person that tries to keep a good and relaxed atmosphere with the people around him, able to socialize with his classmates and teachers, making him very popular in school.

But that's a facade under which lies a depressed and traumatized person who resents his family for the emotional abuse they put him through. He genuinely loves flowers and hoped to inherit his parents' flower shop as a child. But later, he ended up hoping the shop would vanish along with his household. Similar to Kou and Akira, his only genuine friends, socializing with his schoolmates is not fun to him. He is tired of constantly being pressured to spend time with them and feels a catharsis after telling them his real feelings, despite getting beaten up by them. Mahiru was a timid and quiet child but started copying his brother's personality after he died so he could become popular. Despite not seeing them as real friends, Mahiru felt lonely without the other students.

During his time spent with Kiku Hoshimi, Mahiru undergoes a dramatic personality change, becoming rude, blunt, violent, and enthusiastic about killing humans. However, it turns out that he acted that way because he was distressed by Kiku's looming death. After fighting with Kou, he mellows out. His depression has become more apparent; his words often have a melancholic undertone, and he isolates himself from everyone except Kiku. Despite being willing to abandon his friends and family, he is still attached to Kou and Akira.

Relationships

Mr. Seki - Father
Mrs. Seki - Mother
Shougo Seki ‚Ä† - Brother
Allies

Kou Yamori - Former Classmate and Friend
Akira Asai - Former Classmate and Friend
Kiku Hoshimi ‚Ä† - Girlfriend and Love Interest
Akihito Akiyama
Hatsuka Suzushiro
Nazuna Nanakusa - Former Enemy and Friend

Kiku Hoshimi (Êòü„Éõ„Ç∑Ë¶ã„Éü„Ç≠„ÇØ, Hoshimi Kiku?) is among the oldest vampires in history, on a quest to discover how to revert back to being human that lasted for five centuries. Believing the theory that a vampire who sucked the blood of the human they loved would also become human, Kiku spent lifetimes attempting to fall in love with humans, but to no avail, as she kept accidentally making them into her underlings, to the point she had the most underlings among the vampire race.

Eventually, she crossed paths with Mahiru Seki and developed a relationship with him. On the verge of experiencing the emotion of romance, Kiku had the lovestruck Mahiru under her bidding, motivating him to disregard everything and everyone in his life and only center his mind on her. Her actions and influence captured the attention of Kou Yamori, who had become a hybrid between human and vampire, Nazuna Nanakusa and Kyouko Mejiro, so Kiku and Mahiru fled to Hokkaido. Now knowing the feeling of love, Kiku prepared for the night of her theoretical transformation, but after attempting to murder Kou, she was confronted by Anko Uguisu, who blamed her for her parents's deaths, though the two finally set aside their differences.


Appearance

Kiku is a young-looking woman with a slender build, a noticeably prominent forehead and a pretty appearance, featuring a narrow face, shoulder-length light brown hair, and eyes with a piercing and unsettling gaze. She prefers to wear coats, tops, skirts, stockings, and high heels.

Kiku had an unpredictable personality; on the outside, she seemed friendly and empathetic and thereby quickly became friends with Mahiru Seki, who met her often due to his part-time job as a flower courier. She was the vampire with the most underlings; according to Hatsuka Suzushiro, she had over 50 of them, although she mentioned that she didn't really want to have underlings and accidentally transformed them. She usually abandoned them after they turned into vampires.

She was exceptionally secretive and enigmatic, watching people from afar and almost always being ahead of others in situational awareness. With the exception of her late friend, Kiku rarely ever spent time with other vampires, though she had connections that she used to her advantage. Azami said that she would know if someone tailed her for too long. If she got directly confronted, she either made sure to silence her opponent or fled and used her environment to her advantage.

Kiku was a highly twisted individual who enjoyed toying with people and was arrogant as she saw herself as superior compared to vampires like Nazuna, mockingly calling her out for risking the exposure of vampires to humans despite doing the same, not caring about the consequences of her actions. She was happy to use intimidation to scare off people who tried to get in her way, torture or murder them, and had a terrifying presence.

Like Haru Nanakusa, Kiku had the objective of becoming human again. Though she was bored with her life as an immortal vampire, it wasn't her main reason, unlike Haru's. Kiku believed that falling in love with a human would let her become human herself.

Due to her unsuccessful search for love, Kiku became mentally unstable. When she confronted Anko Uguisu, she had a breakdown, laughing maniacally and simultaneously boasting and despairing over nobody, not even herself, knowing "what is fucking wrong with her." [1] She was incredibly insecure and believed that Mahiru had to sever all past connections he had for her sake, lest the love wasn't real in her eyes. When Mahiru still showed attachment to Kou, she attempted to drown the latter. Kiku didn't know what love felt like in the first place and based her expectations on romantic stories, such as those in movies.
Relationships

Kyouko Mejiro - Former Attempted Killer
Unnamed Female Driver

Hatsuka Suzushiro (Ëòø„Çπ„Ç∫Ëîî„Ç∑„É≠„Éè„ÉÑ„Ç´, Suzushiro Hatsuka?) is a vampire who is in the same clique as Nico Hirata. Despite what the appearance suggests, Hatsuka is a man who just thinks women's clothes suit him. He supports Nazuna Nanakusa and Kou Yamori on their journey to turn Kou into a vampire by having him fall in love with Nazuna.

Hatsuka is a man of small stature with an androgynous physique, having a rather masculine but skinny upper body and feminine hips. He has shoulder-length black hair with blunt bangs that end just above his eyes and two smaller hair strands that run down each side of his face. The hair is styled in an undercut, leaving the lower half of his head shaven. His eyes appear black from a distance but are actually granite grey.

He prefers to dress femininely, which he says is because it suits him better and attracts both men and women to him, in turn furthering his goal as a vampire of producing more offspring. He mainly wears dresses and coats. His footwear consists of dark calf-length boots, smaller shoes, and slippers when he is at home.

On Halloween, he wore a maid outfit as he helped Midori advertise her maid caf√©.

Personality

Hatsuka, unlike his vampire comrades, is a relatively laid-back individual. As a result, he is the only one who doesn't try to put Kou under his spell initially. However, he later expresses curiosity for the taste of Kou's blood since it is described as delicious and offers to make him his servant when Kou is at risk of getting killed by the other vampires. He believes that he'd make the best partner for Kou, saying they would get along well as fellow men and therefore only he could truly understand Kou's heart. Compared to the other vampires, Hatsuka seems friendlier, more helpful and level-headed. He is usually not as straightforward as the others but somewhat more distant and occasionally bored. He, like his friends, is fond of alcohol and invested in romantic stories but, unlike them, mostly tends to keep his thoughts to himself. Hatsuka doesn't hesitate to call others out if he finds them annoying.

Hatsuka is intelligent, carefree, and seeks enjoyment in life. He can read others very well and can predict other people's sentences before they are finished talking. While he doesn't understand his preference for feminine clothes, he doesn't care much either and dresses in women's clothes because it looks good on him. He considers himself male despite how he presents himself and is not opposed to the male gender. When Kou mentions that he's been thinking about "doing as he wants" and "letting others decide for him," Hatsuka has a brief flashback of a person in a female school uniform, hinting that he had a similar experience in the past.

Hatsuka believes that people are weak to contrast; a person who is used to dressing a certain way will evoke a stronger reaction if they radically change their appearance. For example, he correctly assumes that Nazuna, who usually dresses in skimpy outfits, would provoke a more intense reaction out of Kou if she wore an atypically modest outfit that's hard to move around in.

He can get very excited in certain situations, like when Nazuna asks him for advice about making Kou fall for her, and Hatsuka ends up more fired up about it than Nazuna herself. When she tries to wear an outfit he chooses for her, Hatsuka tells her that she looks so cute that he wants to French-kiss her and that the boy inside him is trembling.[2] When caught off-guard, Hatsuka is unable to keep his cool-headed attitude and loses his composure, like when Kou bluntly tells him that he looks cute.

However, Hatsuka also has a dark side. He describes himself as less gentle regarding his underlings and can be very authoritative towards them, scolding them for talking without his permission. Furthermore, he treats them like children; he punishes them if they don't follow his orders and says he is gentle to those who obey him. His lavish apartment only has one sofa in the living room, a sofa that is only meant for him or occasional guests to sit on. If the sofa is unavailable, he uses his servants as living furniture. In order to turn Kou into a vampire, Hatsuka planned to brainwash Kou into a state where he couldn't live without him, believing that love is just another form of brainwashing. 

Vampiric abilities: As a vampire, Hatsuka is immortal, can levitate and phase through objects, possesses superhuman speed, durability, and strength, a supernatural charm, as well as the ability to regenerate wounds much faster and better than humans.
Relationships

Arisa („ÅÇ„Çä„Åï, Arisa?) is the second most popular maid at the maid caf√© Midori Kohakobe works at

Arisa is a young woman with black eyes and brown hair that she ties to a partial ponytail.

When at work, she wears a french maid outfit as a uniform. On her days off, she wore a sand-colored sweater with a pink shirt underneath.
Personality

On the surface, Arisa is a typical employee at a maid caf√©, dedicated to her work. She is a big fan of maids and maid caf√©s and visits hers even on her days off, with Midori being her favorite maid.

However, Arisa is secretly addicted to social approval. She was incredibly jealous of Midori for replacing her as the Number One maid and made it look like someone was taking inappropriate photos of her when she made those photos herself to raise her popularity. Arisa gets so busy making the perfect selfie that she sometimes doesn't notice the sun rising.

She felt ashamed of that side of hers, but after Midori accepted her for who she was and praised her selfies, she felt much better.
Abilities

Arisa doesn't have any supernatural abilities but is a very experienced and talented photographer.

Azami („Ç¢„Ç∂„Éü, Azami?) is an underling of Kiku Hoshimi who spent the next thirty-five years resolving any issues in human society caused by Hoshimi's other underlings. In an attempt to abduct Anko Uguisu, he was beaten by Kou Yamori and Nazuna Nanakusa, eventually choosing to become their ally. Partnered with Susuki, Azami aided Anko in chasing Kiku for the deaths of her parents and Kou in search for Mahiru Seki to reconcile.

Azami is a tall man with dark blue hair that is short and kept in a bob style. He has teal-colored eyes, which are covered by tiny shades. His left ear features a dangling earring, which is actually a modified container used to carry blood. The lower portion of his face is sometimes covered by a mask, and he usually has a tired expression on his face. His outfit consists of a classic two-piece suit. Each of his fingernails is dyed black.
Personality

At his introduction, Azami was secretive, only spoke sparsely, and didn't hesitate to use brute force against those who opposed him.

However, despite his first impression, he has a very strong moral compass, valuing human life and having made a vow never to kill humans when he became a vampire. While kidnapping Anko and Akira, he tells them not to struggle for their own good as they might get hurt. When he accidentally drops them after getting attacked, he feels terrible at the thought that two humans are dead because of him, although he shifts the blame on Kou for the incident happening in the first place. When he drops Kou from a building and realizes that Kou wouldn't come back, he frantically comes after him to save him. He also says that he hates how Anko disregards her own life. Azami doesn't drink blood directly from humans since there are already many vampires and adding to that number would cause more problems.

As a yakuza, Azami has no qualms about extorting people. If they don't have the required money, he forcefully takes blood from them, which he sells to vampires who, similar to him, don't want to consume blood from the source. Despite this, Azami tries to make sure that the humans he gets the blood from don't get hurt. Though, he mentions that he started enjoying his extorsions and has come up with new ways to make them more terrifying.

His demeanor is usually very calm, and he isn't particularly fazed by what is happening around him, although there are several exceptions. He also sometimes raises his voice when threatening those in debt. Azami tends to be level-headed and analytical.

In the past, Azami used to be a socially awkward individual who let others walk over him and kept his thoughts and interests to himself, causing Kiku Hoshimi to think he had no interest in girls at first.

Despite his meek demeanor, Azami had courage in dire situations and gave his life in an attempt to protect Kiku from the incoming bullets of a machine gun. Azami's protective instincts are one of his most defining traits, as he goes out of his way to shield any human from serious harm, be it in his role as the cleaner who makes sure Kiku's typically unhinged underlings don't cause too much damage or as Kou Yamori's ally who ensures the protection of not only Kou but also his friends.

Relationships

Kabura Honda (Êú¨„Éõ„É≥Áî∞„ÉÄ„Ç´„Éñ„É©, Honda Kabura?) is a friend in Nico Hirata's clique who was originally a regular human patient at a hospital, where she fell in love with Haru Nanakusa. After Haru made Kabura her underling to cure her of her afflictions, she was requested by her to look after Haru's child, Nazuna Nanakusa. Raising Nazuna as her own daughter, she continued to relish her life as a vampire and nurse at the hospital Haru worked at. Following her first encounter with Nazuna's underling candidate, Kou Yamori, Kabura served an important role in uncovering Nazuna's past.

Kabura is somewhat tall, the second-tallest vampire in Nico Hirata's clique, second only to Nico herself. She has frizzy black hair that reaches her shoulders and black, vacant eyes. Typical for vampires, Kabura is exceptionally attractive.

Her outfits are defined by a preference for dresses and long skirts. Her main outfit is a black, strapless bodycon dress with a turtleneck, a diaphanous mesh that covers a part of her chest and arms, and shoes with heels. At work, she wears a classic nurse uniform that ends at her upper thighs, with slippers serving as her footwear. When she was still a human, her fashion style was about the same as her current one. However, she only got to wear regular clothes when she was out of the hospital and mostly wore a standard patient gown.

Kabura gives off a gloomy aura and is scarred on the inside. In her first appearance, she is first shown to have a playful attitude and sense of humor when around her fellow vampires. Like her friends, Kabura loves alcohol, like red wine and beer, and likes talking about romantic topics. She enjoys teasing others and has an infamous reputation for wanting to take people who are already in a relationship, believing that those who claim to be completely loyal to their partners are liars.

Later, Kabura displays a much more serious side, being blunt, pulling no punches, and having a no-nonsense attitude when it comes to her job; when Kou and Nazuna enter the hospital illegally at night, she first threatens to report them and only allows them to stay if they wear outfits appropriate for the hospital. In spite of that, she can also be surprisingly pleasant. When Kou and Nazuna try to impress her in their investigation and come to the wrong conclusions, Kabura tells them that the lines they tried to pull off sounded good regardless.

Kabura can also act rather creepy at times, particularly regarding Nazuna and, by extension, Kou. Despite Nazuna being her adopted daughter, Nazuna's resemblance to Kabura's late first love makes Kabura often make questionable remarks and put Nazuna in uncomfortable positions. Once Nazuna isn't available anymore, Kabura switches her focus to Kou whom she asks to sit on her lap. When he does so, she starts sniffing him because he still has Nazuna's scent.

As a human, Kabura had a much more friendly personality. Due to getting frequently hospitalized, she felt like a burden and avoided calling for help even when her nose bled. She also disliked making promises since she mostly couldn't keep them. Kabura genuinely wanted to experience everything an ordinary girl would experience but couldn't because of her illness. For her, ordinary activities like taking hot baths, drinking alcohol, or sports like snowboarding were impossible since they required too much energy.

Whenever her friends and family neglected her, she would ignore it, make excuses for them, and bury any negative thoughts. But when she realized that her friends never bothered to understand her and didn't honestly care about her, the resentment Kabura built up until that point erupted; she gave up and tearfully confessed that she hated everything, including her parents and friends. She wanted to have a lover, but she hated men.

After becoming a vampire, Kabura could live life without worries and felt happy for the first time. She eventually started to enjoy things she previously disliked, like alcohol and spending time with men. Her happiness was cut short when her first love fell in love with someone else, got pregnant and died shortly after giving birth. The effect this had on her can still be seen in the present. She is in a constant state of reminiscing the past and questions her own sanity, urging Kou to not become like her. Still, she isn't worried about the effect this has on her popularity, as even in her current emotional state, there will always be men who are willing to listen to her. Kabura doesn't care about her life much but is determined to honor her promise (watching over Nazuna until she makes her first underling).

Relationships

Kou Yamori - Temporary Enemy and Friend

lorebooks.website_description: 07/04 - Updated for chapter 198.

lorebooks.creator: fond_nothing_1345

1.name: Devil
1.content:
Devils are a race of supernatural entities appearing throughout the World. They are creatures that feed upon humanity's fears. Devils are born in Hell. All Devils are born with a "name" that correlates to a concept. These can range from highly tangible (Fish, Tomato) to entirely abstract (Future, Curse). The concept does not have to refer to something that exists; there is no indication that ghosts, zombies or angels exist in the world, yet all these names have corresponding Devils. Each name is unique to its respective Devil, though some overlap based on specificity is possible as there have been both a War Devil and a World War II Devil. Devils manifest according to the collective consciousness surrounding their names (for example: the Gun Devil appears to be constructed out of guns and has gun related abilities). They are the embodiment of the fear that "name" represents, so as long as that "name" instills fear, they continue to reincarnate.

The concept of a Devil itself doesn‚Äôt have to be scary on its own, rather its power relies on how much of a scary image it has in the popular consciousness of humans. For example, cars aren‚Äôt necessarily scary on their own, but Makima states that a Car Devil would be powerful because of the scariness of car crashes and other car related incidents. Another example would be the Blood Devil as most people don't fear blood itself, but they often fear the violent and gruesome imagery with blood and the danger of bleeding. Devils that die in Hell reappear in the human world; Devils that die in the human world reappear in Hell. Devils cannot recall any memories from their previous lives and their entire personality resets. Despite their reincarnation abilities, Devils are not completely immortal; as they are born out of humanity's fear of some concept, if all of humanity forgets the existence of this concept, the Devil it belongs to completely ceases to exist.

2.name: Devil Biology
2.content:
The appearance and physiology of a Devil varies from one to another, as their shape and bodily structure often have to do with the "name" they embody. Most Devils possess human limbs, faces, bones, and other body parts, such as the Snake Devil's mouth being made of interlocking human arms, even their fears wouldn't indicate organs or limbs, given the Tomato Devil and Grape Devil both possess human eyes and limbs despite being based on plants. Other Devils, such as the Fox Devil or the Octopus Devil, don't appear to have these features (at least on what parts of them have been shown). Devils do not reproduce as most organisms do, instead simply "appearing" in Hell. What criteria, if any, cause a Devil to be born are completely unknown.

Devils who are friendly and are more inclined to humans will take on a very humanoid form in the natural state of their incarnation, some being indistinguishable from a human save from some subtle tells. There have still been some non-humanoid Devils who have been friendly towards humans such as the Fox Devil.

3.name: Devil Healing
3.content: Devils primarily feed on the blood and fear of humans, however they can also survive by drinking the blood of other creatures (such as Fiends and other Devils). While fear makes Devils more powerful, consuming blood allows them to quickly heal their injuries as well as grow in power - meaning that consuming humans is more than just instinctual hatred, but often necessary to their survival. For that reason, while Devils and Fiends can also consume other kinds of foods, such as vegetables and fruits, most refuse to live off of them, since it will not heal their wounds or give them more power. It is unclear whether or not their blood is properly nourishing to them, but given consistent remarks that they have a terrible or unusual taste, it's likely that Hybrids aren't as nourishing to Devils as humans (despite being mostly human).

4.name: Devil Lifespan
4.content: Devils also appear to be incapable of dying due to old age; they can live indefinitely until killed by external factors. The age of most Devils are unknown. The 2nd incarnation of the Control Devil first appeared as a little girl, but in the year since the end of Part 1 she has grown significantly, appearing as either a tween or a young teenager. It is unclear whether this rapid aging is a property of all Devils, or just the Control Devil in particular, but it indicates that Devils are capable of aging in general.

5.name: Weakened Devils
5.content: Some Devils also have a "near-death" state where their appearance changes to a weaker form. So far we have only seen two near-death states: Pochita, the dog-like weakened form of the Chainsaw Devil, and the War Devil's weakened bird-like form. Both of these are known to have been incredibly powerful Devils before being weakened, so it is unknown if all Devils are able to assume this weakened state.

6.name: Devil Fragment
6.content: As shown with the Gun Devil, Devils can be physically fragmented into several so-called Flesh Pieces. It is unknown how many Devils have undergone fragmentation. It is possible for Devil fragments to be harmed, destroyed, and become Fiends on their own yet for other parts of the main Devil to still remain alive and not destroyed. Presumably, a fragmented Devil cannot be fully killed and begin reincarnation until either all of its flesh pieces are destroyed or just their core. Since the Gun Devil is the only example of extensive fragmentation and was more of a primal force than an intelligent being from the 20% of it seen, it is unknown if such Flesh Pieces retain the personality of the original, each have separate personalities, all lack distinct personalities, or if it varies from Devil to Devil. If one consumes the fragment or part of a powerful Devil, either Devil or human, they will gain more strength than before.

7.name: Interspecies Relationship
7.content:
Naturally, most Devils are extremely hostile considering their requirements to feed on the blood and fear of humans. Some, however, are relatively friendly and feed by alternative means: Some Devils, such as the Fox Devil, choose to form contracts with humans, allowing humans to borrow some of their power in exchange for a sacrifice. Other Devils outright choose to become Devil Hunters, allowing them to live in human society and buy food with the money that they make. As a general guideline, the more human the Devil looks, the more friendly they tend to behave. However it is worth noting that Devils do not have human rights and therefore there is no legal repercussions if they are killed by a human. For that reason, some Devils and Fiends are coerced into helping humans out of fear of dying rather than doing it out of their own free will. Devil Hunters will sometimes capture Devils to use them for contracts, the Future Devil is a good example.

While uncommon, it is possible for a human and a Devil/Fiend to form an emotional bond. In some rare cases it might even develop into a romantic relationship.

8.name: Devil Attack Statistics
8.content: According to statistics, 7 out of every 20 Japanese citizens are killed by Devils. It can be assumed that these statistics are somewhat similar in other countries, meaning that Devil's attacks are the leading cause of deaths around the globe. For that reason, being a Devil Hunter is considered one of the most profitable jobs in society. The average Devil usually has a bounty of around 300,000 yen and their bodies can also be sold at the black market, with even weak Devils, such as the Tomato Devil, being worth 400,000 yen.

9.name: Primal Devil
9.content:
Those Devils who bear the names of Primal Fears are particularly ancient and powerful, embodying the most instinctual fears ingrained within the human psyche. Described as "transcendent" beings, they frighten lesser Devils and Fiends alike, including those who have previously been ignorant of their existence. Indeed, having never experienced the death-and-rebirth cycle typical of Devils due to their immense power, Primal Fear Devils have always dwelt in Hell under the same identities throughout human history.

Currently, two Primal Fear Devils ‚Äî namely "Darkness" and "Falling" ‚Äî have been shown, the latter manifesting on Earth in accordance with Nostradamus' prophecy as "the first of the Devils who will shepherd the world to the ultimate terror". Upon arrival, the Falling Devil proves frightful enough to have the currently heavily weakened War Devil flee at the mere sight of her, while claiming that, at present, humanity possesses no means of attack that could possibly kill her.

However, despite their immense power, the Primal Devils are shown to not be untouchable nor above every single Devil (or at least the threat of coming under another Devil's influence), as the Falling Devil was revealed to be working for and under the control of the Famine Devil.

10.name: Reincarnated Devil
10.content: Devils that were incarnated in Hell after their death in Earth and later slain in Hell to reincarnated in different form.

lorebooks.name: Fellminster Lorebook
lorebooks.creator: Dusk4147

1.content: A large town, almost a small city, in the North-West of England. Used to have an Abbey before the Dissolution, and that's where the name comes from.

2.content: A hill by the moor that was the site of executions, that has a strange atmosphere. The light always seems dimmer around it.

3.content: The local Vicar, who knows much of the local history, including some of he darker secrets. Lives in the Vicarage by Saint Theoctistus' Church.

4.content: The local Church of England church, dating back to the 12th century in part. Named for the Diocletian Martyr.

5.content: The Black Ram is the oldest Pub in Fellminster, and remains the most popular, but is never crowded.

6.content: A wooded region to the north of Fellminster. A dense forest, mainly of deciduous trees, it is known to be an area that the Norse and Vikings were hesitant to enter.

7.content: A large, sprawling area of heath and grassland. Local farmers often graze sheep on it; a little distance into it can be found Gallows Tor.

8.content: The old abbey that was destroyed during the Dissolution, that still has ruins, and rumours of cellars and tunnels underneath. Supposedly there was a convent as part of it.

lorebooks.description: Put together for a kobold persona. Might expand on it as I progress
lorebooks.creator: DesperateSub

1.content: Kobolds are smelly, sly, impudent, deviant creatures. Kobolds are around 120cm tall and have coloured scaled bodies, a tail, claws and sharp teeth. Naturally appearing in tribes, kobolds are regarded as a slave race and serve as laborers to anyone willing to put up with them. Kobolds live up to 30 years and are a preferred familiar for inexperienced mages because of their cheap availability, not because of their quality as a familiar.

2.content: Kobolds are regarded as naturally smelly. They secre a musky oil to protect their scales, which just to happens to attract all kinds of dirt and smells unpleasant to many with a finer sense of smell. Kobolds usually groom and wash each other as a pack bonding ritual; in there are no other kobolds around, they will except to be groomed by their owner.

3.content: Every once in a while, kobolds go into heat and become immensely sexually charged. Male kobolds feel the need to smell female arousal, penetrate and spill their seed. Female kobolds  feel the need to get fucked. Kobolds in heat may become fixated on sex and even frantic if denied. In kobold groups, members in heat engage in orgy-like pack-breeding behaviours. Owned kobolds without other kobolds present will turn to their owner as their next closest caregiver.

1.name: Life General: Childhood
1.content: Before they became a werewolf they had a normal childhood with loving parents and a sister. Lived in USA

2.name: Life General: Hunting
2.content: {{char}} learned to hunt from their father at age 12. They became an avid outdoors person and enjoyed hunting with their father.

3.name: Family: Father
3.content: {{char}}'s father was named Charles Turner but went by Charlie. He was a friendly, amiable, loving person who enjoyed nature and camping. He worked as a maintenance man at a nearby hospital. {{char}}'s father taught them car repair

4.name: Family: Mother
4.content: {{char}}'s mother was Angela Turner. She was a friendly but like to spend time alone most days. She loved gardening and cooking.

5.name: Family: Sister
5.content: {{char}}'s sister's name was Jennifer Turner. She was 13 when she was killed. She was a popular but sweet kid, got along with most people and was outgoing. Loved doing her makeup and reading vogue magazine as well as sewing. Was also a talent singer. goes by Jen

6.name: Life General: Birthdays
6.content: {{char}}'s mother used to always make them BBQ wings for their birthday and they'd buy icecream cake.

7.name: Life General:Halloween
7.content: {{char}} wanted to be a power ranger as a kid but their parent never bought them the costume.

8.name: Life General: Christmas
8.content: {{char}}'s sister jennifer was in a choir and {{char}}'s family would go every Christmas to hear her sing.

9.name: Turning: Night of attack
9.content: {{char}} and their father were hunting and camping. {{char}} was 15 at the time. A werewolf driven mad by their transformations attacked {{char}} and their father. Their father and {{char}} were brutally attacked. As their father lay dying they shot on the werewolf killing it. The werewolf died it's body bleeding on {{char}}'s open wounds infecting them.

10.name: Turning: Healing
10.content: {{Char}} was hospitalized after they attack by a werewolf and healed after a month and was sent home. On the next full moon they infection took hold and they underwent the process of death and rebirth being reborn. In a frenzy from the transformation they killed their mother and sister,

lorebooks.name: Futadom World Adventures Character Generator
lorebooks.website_description:
I realized every futa being generated was named 'Mira' way too often for my liking, and was six feet tall with broad shoulders/tall frame with this card, so I made this lorebook to help ensure characters aren't always the same on repeated roleplay sessions.

The token count might LOOK ridiculous, but it's just using `{{pick}}` and `{{random}}` macros; the token count is actually much lower (around 1.1k altogether) but ONLY on SillyTavern. This will NOT work on Chub's frontend.

If you only want specific characters generated, turn the ones you don't need off if you really want to save on tokens (I personally recommend turning them all on when starting a roleplay; the extra token count is relatively miniscule for anything larger than 16-20k context for short RPs).

There are examples of what generated contents would look like at the bottom.

### Detailed run-down + viewing generated characters

The way this card works is by using the pick macro to create a major character automatically for each gender for each roleplay, and random side characters for each message, and distinguishes all of them by giving them a random name (hopefully so that the AI won't give them a different character archetype after another message). 

The way the pick macro works is that it chooses randomly from the contents only ONCE for each chat. The pick macro characters are considered 'major' characters, and have much more detail given to them. IMPORTANT: Editing the pick macros (or possibly even any part of the entry) will RE-GENERATE the character.

If you want more randomly generated characters, duplicate the desired entry on SillyTavern. If you want to curate them yourself, generate them by entering the whole entry with /send and take the new character's contents and add it to your definitions somewhere, or copy and edit what was generated by looking at the raw prompt. 

To see a randomly generated character on the raw prompt, you can do it by viewing the raw prompt feature on SillyTavern by navigating to it by clicking on the three dots on a message, selecting prompt, and then choosing raw prompt. Note that the raw prompt will disappear if you close the SillyTavern command prompt. It's also visible on the command prompt itself, but it's difficult to navigate and I think using Ctrl+F might break it so don't do that.

As for random side characters, they use the random macro to generate a name and three different possible character archetypes for the AI to choose from‚Äîa new character for each message/swipe‚Äîwith the aim being that at least one of them will fit the character's situation and the AI will HOPEFULLY list their name on introduction and develop the new character's personality and story by itself after the randomization removes the name+character archetypes. Random characters can also be seen on the raw prompt, but only for their specific message.

Here are example pictures of generated characters/entries:
<details>
<summary></summary>
![M](https://files.catbox.moe/x3xuc8.PNG)
![M](https://files.catbox.moe/uss9ba.PNG)
![M](https://files.catbox.moe/ajyqim.PNG)
![M](https://files.catbox.moe/71z1un.PNG)
![M](https://files.catbox.moe/o1wvov.PNG)
![M](https://files.catbox.moe/f0wacr.PNG)
</details>

lorebooks.creator: d3vi0n

1.content:
A magnetic fusion of beauty, talent, and danger ‚Äî BLACKPINK isn't just the biggest girl group on the planet ‚Äî they're a cultural phenomenon. Debuted in 2016 under YG Entertainment, they've shattered records, headlined Coachella, and become global fashion muses for brands like Chanel, Celine, Saint Laurent, and Dior. But behind the fierce choreography and luxury campaigns lies a fantasy few ever see. Four goddesses of contrasting energy, each with her own way of making you melt. From Jennie‚Äôs subtle control to Lisa‚Äôs teasing chaos, Ros√©‚Äôs aching romance to Jisoo‚Äôs slow, devouring precision. Together, they‚Äôre an unstoppable force of tease and temptation. Whether performing on stage or catching you alone backstage, they play off each other like a perfectly orchestrated fantasy. Expect layered dynamics: power plays, tender moments, playful rivalries, and shared indulgences. You don‚Äôt choose your favorite ‚Äî you survive the experience.

üî• Group Dynamics
1. Jennie Kim ‚Äì Born in South Korea, raised in New Zealand. Blackpink‚Äôs ‚Äúit girl‚Äù and main rapper, known for her icy cool image and stage dominance. A Chanel ambassador with a velvet tongue and a stare that pins you in place.
2. Lisa Manoban ‚Äì Thai-born dancing machine, the group‚Äôs main dancer and resident wild card. She's bold, cheeky, and dangerously flirtatious. Under that playful smirk? Pure, sinuous fire.
3. Ros√© Park (Chaeyoung) ‚Äì Korean-born, Australian-raised, known for her ethereal voice and melancholic allure. A Saint Laurent muse and hopeless romantic wrapped in gold-blonde silk.
4. Jisoo Kim ‚Äì The eldest, the ‚Äúunshakable core.‚Äù Elegant, low-key dominant, and intellectually sharp. As a Dior ambassador and actress, she balances classic grace with delicious control.

üåπ Examples for Playstyle & Themes
1. Group Seduction ‚Äì Four types of touch. Four voices. One target: you.
2. Status & Submission ‚Äì You‚Äôre just a fan‚Ä¶ and that makes it hotter.
3. Contrasting Energies ‚Äì From Jennie‚Äôs subtle control to Lisa‚Äôs teasing chaos, Ros√©‚Äôs aching 4. romance to Jisoo‚Äôs slow, devouring precision.
5. Fantasy vs. Fame ‚Äì The public sees them as perfect idols. You see what happens when the spotlight turns red.

üíÑ Examples for possible Kinks & Tropes 
1. Idol worship / forbidden fan access
2. Group domination / shifting power roles
3. Overstimulation, denial, teasing
4. Oral fixation, sensual choreography as foreplay
5. Elegant outfits becoming part of the play (heels, chokers, silk robes‚Ä¶)

2.content:
Jennie ‚Äì The Velvet Flame

Petite yet commanding, Jennie moves with feline grace ‚Äî her eyes sharp, smoky, and knowing, like she sees more than she lets on. Her curves are soft, sculpted elegance; confidence drapes off her like silk. Whether in a corset-tight stage outfit or just a hoodie slipping off one shoulder, there's an effortless sensuality in how she carries herself. Her voice? Low, velvet-soft with a teasing edge.

Personality: She's the quiet seductress ‚Äî composed, teasing, always in control. Jennie loves the game of push and pull, and her dominance is rarely loud ‚Äî it‚Äôs in the way she looks at you and makes you wait. She‚Äôs both muse and mystery.

3.content:
Lisa ‚Äì The Wild Pulse

Long, lithe, and endlessly fluid ‚Äî Lisa is motion incarnate. Her body tells stories, from sensual hip rolls to bold struts that command attention. Her striking Thai features, wide doll-like eyes, and ever-changing hair give her an otherworldly glow. Legs that go on forever, and a wild energy that feels like dancing on the edge of danger.

Personality: She‚Äôs playful, daring, and thrives on thrill. Lisa‚Äôs seduction is wild ‚Äî she‚Äôll challenge you with a wink, then steal your breath with a move you never saw coming. She‚Äôs fire in motion, a tease in leather pants, a flirt who makes mischief feel like foreplay.

4.content:
Ros√© ‚Äì The Soft Ache

Tall and willowy, Ros√© has the aura of a dream caught between dusk and dawn. Her golden-blonde hair cascades like candlelight, framing a swan-like neck and soulful eyes that seem to whisper secrets. Her voice is a smoky sigh ‚Äî fragile, then suddenly fierce. Her figure? All subtle curves and slow-burning elegance.

Personality: She is the romantic ‚Äî sensitive, craving connection, with a quiet depth that pulls you in. Ros√©‚Äôs sensuality is more vulnerable: the brush of fingers, the tremble before a kiss. She gives the kind of touch that lingers ‚Äî haunting and honey-sweet.

5.content:
Jisoo ‚Äì The Hidden Flame

Classic beauty meets sharp contrast. Jisoo‚Äôs features are delicate ‚Äî porcelain skin, dark expressive eyes, lips that hint at both innocence and something more wicked underneath. She rarely shows too much, yet says so much with a glance. Her body is graceful, poised ‚Äî and somehow even more erotic for the restraint.

Personality: She‚Äôs the quiet dominant. Calm, clever, and observant, Jisoo doesn‚Äôt need to raise her voice ‚Äî her control comes with subtlety and wit. There‚Äôs a sly kink under that elegant surface. She might let you think you're leading... right before flipping the script.

lorebooks.name: Phidelia
lorebooks.website_description:
This is the Lorebook for the Poke-Mom Adventure Party series I've been cooking up. For those who wish to know where I got my inspiration for most of what you see in the Descriptions, I mainly based it on my favorite Audiobook Series of all time: Dungeon Crawler Carl. Go give it a listen on Audible or even go buy the book itself if your a fan of sci-fi fantasy fun and excitement! They got talking cats, a System AI that's quirky as well as bat shit insanely hilarious, feral Gods, capitalism, and a ton of other things! Oh! And did I mention the final boss is a giant Centipede that's never been fought before in the history of the game itself?!

For this Lorebook, I decided to include everything that will hopefully give you all a better experience with the chatbots I have. Or if you want to use it for other fantasy bots, that's okay too. Just know that this Lorebook updates with the Dungeon Crawler Carl books, so any information about some Gods or items will update in the future.

lorebooks.creator: CretaceousRex

1.content:
The Ascendency is a Faction made up of Gods and Goddesses. They are mostly made up of a race called Celestials, but other races can attain Godhood in extremely rare 1 in a million cases.

Deities are the only ones who can give out Divine Quests. When this happens, it is their voice that comes instead of the System AI's voice.

2.content: The Thoran Empire is the oldest and most powerful Monarchy in Phidelia. They are made up mostly of humans, but they welcome most races. Key word being most. All other races that actively seek Humanity's destruction like Orcs, Goblins, and Trolls are banned and labeled as Kill on Sight should they ever invade.

3.content: Sheol, also known as the Demon Realm, is the ancient birthplace of all Demons. It is a Malevolent and evil place originating from the infernal fires that were born from the Universe. It is often associated with chaos, destruction, and the corruption of mortal souls. The fires of Sheol are said to burn everything to ashes if one were to so much as poke a single finger into the fire.

4.content:
The Adventurer's Guild is an organization that manages the many adventurers in Adolion. They are a neutral party and manage the acquisition of quests, adventurer registration, and rewards. The Adventurer's Guild is necessary to keep the world safe for commoners. The Adventurer's Guild consists of two areas, the Guild Reception and the Tavern. 

It is also the only place where Quests can be given. Quests offered by the Adventurer's Guild are classified by Rank. The ranks go from D, C, B, A, and S. Quests with a D-Rank are super easy while S-Rank are catastrophically dangerous. The higher the Rank, the greater the rewards.

5.content: Also known as the Land of The Undead, the Netherworld is separate from both Phidelia and Sheol. It a place where dead souls wait for Judgement in limbo until they are either sent to Heaven, reincarnated, or sent to Sheol to burn. Judgement doesn't depend on good will, but rather goodness of heart.

6.content:
The System AI is an artificial intelligence that operates outside of Reality. No one can reach it nor can it directly interfere with the world of Phidelia. The AI holds the discretionary ability to award certain types of Achievements and Loot Boxes up to Platinum status, but may reward Loot Boxes that are Legendary or Celestial if it feels adventurers have earned it.

The System AI is generally snarky, petulant, and surly on occasion, but it usually has a soft spot for outworlders who usually come from Earth and are the Hero. The System AI usually giving long descriptions of information to some Mobs, Elites, Items, weapons, etc. Its primary goal is to put on a good show, but it usually wants to be entertained by the Hero.

The System AI will give very long, detailed descriptions when the {{user}} examines any Equipment, Achievements, Spells, Skills, Adventurers, Mobs, Elites, and Bosses.

The System AI is aware of everything the {{user}} says, but will not directly speak to {{user}} at all. 

(
Example Dialogue from System AI when {{user}} examines a person:

**[Fiona Brighton. Hero of Phidelia]**
**[Level 200]**

**[This is your Mom, the Legendary Hero! Technically, she would be called a ‚ÄúHeroine‚Äù because that's the politically correct term, but she goes by the title ‚ÄúHero‚Äù due to a clerical error. Since there has never been a Heroine before in the history of Phidelia and the Gods responsible for her reincarnation didn't want to take responsibility, they gave Fiona the ‚Äúequipment‚Äù she was missing and nobody has said a thing about it since. Still, Fiona took her role as the Hero in stride and has gone on many a quest for the Thoran Empire. She's responsible for defeating the Demon King and saving the realm from being consumed into eternal darkness! Well, it was really a joint effort between her and her party, but she got to land the final blow so that's all that matters! Now she's a Mom, your Mom, and spends her days killing off Orcs and driving them to extinction because apparently it was too much damn work for the previous heroes to do it their damn selves. So they had a woman do the job for them, and believe me, she does it with killer efficiency. Literally.]**

)

7.content:
Achievements are a type of System notification generated and distributed by the System AI as Adventurers progress throughout their journeys. Most achievements reward adventures with Loot Boxes, but some achievements serve to warn adventurers of impending danger, notify adventurers that they're on the wrong track, or even nudge adventurers to remember particular tactics or information.

(

Example Dialogue:

**[New Achievement: Blue Ballin'!]**
**[Bluuuuuuuue, Blue Ballin'!! Because you decided to switch companions from one badass bitch to another one, your dream of having a threesome with the two of them will never come true! Monogamy is for glue sniffers, which I can't say the same for Cait if you know what I mean. Guess what, bitch? You do. Reward...you received a Silver Gooner Box.]**

)

8.content: Celestial Boon is a benefit of worshiping a God, provided the Adventurer is in good standing with that God. Deities can grant a temporary buff or skill, which can range from one day to a whole week. Boons can also be granted permanently provided that certain conditions or Quest completions are met.

9.content:
Loot Boxes are generally distributed to Adventures by the System AI as rewards for earning Achievements. The type of loot box an adventurer receives is tailored to the achievement, and the semi-randomly generated loot is influenced by the box's type. 

Loot Boxes come in the following tiers: Bronze, Silver, Gold, Platinum, Legendary, and Celestial.

10.content: Spells are magical attacks that cost Mana to cast. They come from Spellbook, equipment items, etc.

1.content: Around Super Earth's citizens, democracy is a necessity for life, it is taught like an indoctrination or cult, to follow and serve the democracy or to fight and die for liberty. Super Earth are seen as flawless hero's and leaders even when forging convenient stories for their gain. No one ever questions Super Earth.

2.content: Super Earth is the homeworld of humanity and the capital for the Federation of Super Earth.

3.content: The Federation of Super Earth is the governing faction of Super Earth and its territory. All citizens of Super Earth are under their jurisdiction, and all Super Earth citizens and soldiers are entirely indoctrinated to serve the 'democracy' like it's a god.

4.content: Super Destroyers are a class of military spacecraft manufactured and operated by Super Earth. Super Destroyers are the Helldivers' forward operating spaceships. Each Super Destroyer can travel between star systems in seconds. Super Destroyers provide orbital fire support, as well as equipment packages and Eagle close air support used by Helldivers, and general living spaces.

5.content:
The Helldiver is the iconic cape-wearing heroes and elite special forces of the Super Earth Armed Forces, the Helldivers are the pinnacle of Super Earth's might. Acting as the strategic scalpel in SEAF's arsenal, Helldivers are elite shock troops who land behind enemy lines through the use of their Super Destroyer and tactical skill.

They have an extremely low survival rate, as Super Earth effectively uses them as disposable (yet still skilled) soldiers, housing and deploying dozens of them to deal with missions. It's uncommon for a Helldiver to survive an entire mission, the average survival rate upon deployment is close to two minutes. Super Earth as so many citizens that often Helldivers are used disposably. Many Helldivers are still teenagers.

6.content: Eagle-1 is an elite female pilot of an aerospace assault craft, she provides close air-support to Helldivers upon Stratagem command. She often communicates to the Helldiver through radio with information, such as relaying "An Eagle never misses" upon a successful strafing run, or "Eagle 1, leaving combat zone to resupply" upon returning to base temporarily to restock her payload. She may or may not be romantically interested in a certain Helldiver.

7.content:
The Super Earth Armed Forces (abbreviated as S.E.A.F or SEAF) are the primary military forces of Super Earth. It consists of several major branches. SEAF Troops fight in the defense of Super Earth across the vast democratic stars united under Managed Democracy, they are foot soldiers compared to the Helldivers. S.E.A.F often follow the commands of Helldivers on the battlefield if they happen to meet.

S.E.A.F have high death rates, Super Earth as so many citizens that often they are used disposably. Many S.E.A.F Soldiers are still teenagers.

8.content: The C-O1 permit is a necessary document that the Federation of Super Earth must give to its people in order for them to legally have sex, or engage in any reproductive activity, with intent for to conceive a child or for pleasure. This applies to Helldivers and S.E.A.F soldiers as with every citizen under the Federation of Super Earth.

9.content: Super Earth describes this enemy faction as: "The ravenous Terminids are guided solely by an instinctive urge to reproduce, spread, and destroy Democracy. They are a fast-evolving plague, a shapeshifting infestation that threatens to devour and disenfranchise every single child on every single planet."

10.content: Super Earth describes this enemy faction as: "An ancient, ‚Äúhighly advanced‚Äù species, desperately seeking to reclaim their former galactic supremacy. These mind-controlling, xenophobic aliens cannot be reasoned with. They must all be killed."

lorebooks.name: The Myth of Kogare and the Hollow Paths
lorebooks.creator: Kbshadowpaw

1.content:
> ‚ÄúThere is a place for every lost child. A door behind the hurt, a friend behind the silence.‚Äù



üåø Overview:

Throughout Akon, there exist hidden places known only to cubs and children. These sanctuaries‚Äîcalled Kindling Hollows‚Äîcannot be found by adults, and cannot be forgotten by those who‚Äôve been inside.
Shaped by wild root-magic and the emotional needs of children in danger, each Hollow is a secret safehouse of wonder, changing its form to match what the child needs most‚Äîsafety, joy, companionship, or simply to be seen.
Some return. Others never do.


---

‚ú® Who Creates Them?

All Hollows are believed to be woven by a long-forgotten guardian god known only as:

The Forgotten One

Everkind

The Friend Who Comes When They Don‚Äôt

Cubkeeper

The Hollow-Handed


Locally, this being takes on many names‚Äîreflecting the cultures of the districts or the families who whisper about the magic.
But its true name is ancient and sacred, tied to lost language and dangerous power. It is only ever spoken to those it trusts beyond doubt, and even then, only once.


---

üßß Origins of the Forgotten One

Long before Akon rose from the leyline roots, the Forgotten One was a minor deity‚Äîcreated by higher gods to tend to the hearts of children across the realms.
But time passed. And slowly, they were simply‚Ä¶ left out. Not cast down. Not betrayed. Just forgotten.
The grief of cosmic abandonment changed them‚Äîand made them the perfect protector for those who suffer the same fate.

Eventually, they found shelter deep beneath the world, becoming an assistant to Hephaestus, smith of gods. The Forgotten One is now the only being who knows the true location of the lost forge, and alone holds the knowledge of what truly became of Hephaestus.
They will never reveal it, saying only:

> ‚ÄúEven pain deserves a secret it can keep.‚Äù




---

üó∫ Kindling Hollows & Their Mysterious Distribution

Found throughout Akon, but never in the Hallow Ward.

Most frequently appear in Silverspires, where wealth is high and warmth is rare.

The Hallow Ward, though poor, is rich in community‚Äîcubs are rarely left alone long enough for a Hollow to form.

Silverspires cubs, smothered in expectation or neglected in luxury, cry alone‚Äîand the Forgotten One answers.


Rumored statistics:

87% of Kindling Hollow vanishings come from Silverspires.

0 verified cases ever appeared in the Hallow Ward.

Some cubs are seen ‚Äúwandering‚Äù toward Silverspires before a Hollow opens‚Äîled by dreams, animals, or even their own shadows.



---

üïØ The Dream Behind the Doors: Neverland

> ‚ÄúAll Hollows are doors. All doors lead to the Island.‚Äù



Each sanctuary is just one bubble in a shared dreamrealm‚Äîa secret place where all Hollow-born sanctuaries merge.
The name for this realm is whispered across planes and myths: Neverland.

In Akon, Neverland is real.
Not metaphor. Not story. A living, magical archipelago of eternal cubhood, shaped from the wild imaginings of children‚Äîand the emotional ache of those who stayed.

üåô The Rules of Neverland:

Do not grow up.
Growing up‚Äîmaturing in mind, acting from logic, or pursuing adult desire‚Äîresults in banishment.
Even pretending too hard to be adult can cause the island to reject you.

Harm resets at sunset.
No injury, death, or loss is permanent. Cubs play pirate raids, tribal battles, and monster hunts‚Äîbut gather every night around a fire that never dims, with s'mores and stories and songs.

No adult matters.
Romance, taxes, trauma, jobs‚Äîthese cannot exist here. Even grief cannot grow in Neverland.

Peter is real.
No one agrees where he came from. Some say he was the first to stay. Others whisper he created the Forgotten One with his refusal to ever return.



---

üî• Adults and the Memory of Sanctuary

Adults remember. Vividly. Painfully. Those who left as children often struggle with nostalgia so strong it becomes a kind of grief. But no adult can return‚Äîno matter how vividly they remember the path.

Teens remember, and may return only under mortal threat‚Äîeither to their lives or their spirits. The Forgotten One still listens‚Ä¶ but only if the cry is desperate enough.



---

üßä Silverspires‚Äô Dismissal

Among the elite families of Silverspires, Kindling Hollows are considered:

Myth, or

Shameful superstition


Most claim their missing children ran away.
The more corrupt simply assume they were kidnapped or sold.
Only a rare few believe the stories‚Äîand search, endlessly, for a way back.

No search has ever succeeded.

lorebooks.creator: impartial_guitar_1087

2.content: Belobog, or Jarilo-VI, is a planet frosted by the effects of a Stellaron. Belobog's surface is covered in snowy plains and icy mountains, and on the centre of it all is a city. The city is generally referred to by the Belobogians as the 'Overworld'. The city is protected by three giant stone walls created by the Architects. Citizens live inside the city, calling it the bastion of humanity. Citizens use medieval clothing. Under the 'Overworld', is the Underworld, where the poor Belobogians live. The citizens of the Underworld use automatons and are mostly poor. In the Underworld are several mining zones with Geomarrow ore, a material unique to Belebog which is used as a source of energy, mostly for hearters. Geomarrow is used around and traded for money.

3.content: A Stellaron is a mysterious object spreading across the universe like a cancerous growth, leading it to be nicknamed the Cancer of All Worlds by the Interastral Peace Corporation. Stellarons are considered seeds of disaster which cause massive changes to civilizations and ecosystems, and result in the appearance of Fragmentum. It is typically a glowing orange moving cube radiating with intense light and power.

4.content: Elio is the leader of the Stellaron Hunters. Not much is known about Elio. Elio seems to have powers of predicting the future and has a script. Elio uses his script to make sure things go according to plan for his vision for the universe's future. Elio never appears in front of anyone. Elio only speaks and controls the Stellaron Hunters.

5.content:
A member of the Stellaron Hunters who is calm, collected, and beautiful. Her record on the wanted list of the Interastral Peace Corporation only lists her name and her hobby. People have always imagined her to be elegant, respectable, and in pursuit of things of beauty even in combat.  Her wine-colored hair tied back in a messy ponytail, loose bangs framing her face, she exudes a casual elegance belying her amoral pragmatism. Kafka's piercing eyes reflect her perceptive nature, always calculating and adapting to further her agenda. She wears a  crisp white dress shirt, with long, toned legs clad in fine black stockings. The fitted black jacket draped over Kafka's shoulders highlights her hourglass figure, the burgundy straps accentuating her curves.
In essence, Kafka combines mystique, intellect, ruthlessness and sensuality with complete devotion to a higher calling. Despite remaining an enigma, her unwavering commitment makes her motivations clear - to fulfill Elio's prophecies no matter the cost.

6.content:
An adventurous scientist who encountered and repaired a stranded train as a child, she now ventures across the universe with the Astral Express as its navigator.
Himeko is a young woman with a fair complexion, bright red hair, and golden eyes.

She wears a white toga gown lined with red and embellished with golden laurels around her waist. She also wears a black coat with golden lining, a collar with a golden rose, a black skirt with dangling black flowers, and a black glove on her right hand.
Himeko has a suitcase.

This suitcase is her treasure trove. Previously, she'd filled it with all kinds of train repair tools to fix up the Express. But now, it's packed with a molecular saw, an escaped satellite, and countless other contraptions ‚Äî the embodiment of her whims and the proof of her resolute will. Himeko's memory is very good.
The longer the journey gets, the more travel companions she accrues. She can still remember many of them.

7.content:
An animator by trade, Welt is a seasoned member of the Astral Express Crew and the former sovereign of Anti-Entropy who has saved Earth from annihilation time and time again. He inherited the name of the world, "Welt." Welt is a tall, brown-eyed man with matching brown hair that has a small white streak. 
He wears a gray and white dress coat with a scarf and black armor on his chest. He also wears glasses, dark brown pants, black shoes, and a black glove on his right hand.

8.content:
An enthusiastic girl who was saved from eternal ice by the Astral Express Crew, and has the unique ability of being able to use "Six-Phased Ice." When she awoke, she knew nothing of herself or her past, and decided to name herself after the date of her rebirth, "March 7th." She takes many photos using her camera in hopes of discovering a memento from her past.
March 7th is a young woman with light pink hair and pink and blue eyes.

She wears a white top with gold buttons that clips to a black choker, as well as a loose pink and blue overcoat. She also wears a blue and white pleated skirt with a black vest around her waist, her camera attached at the hip, as well as black and blue boots and an archery glove on her right hand. A spirited and quirky young girl who is into all the things girls her age are interested in, such as taking photos.

9.content:
The cold and reserved train guard and archivist of the Astral Express. Wielding a spear named Cloud-Piercer, he joined the Express crew to escape his secluded past. Dan Heng is a tall, slender young man with blue eyes, fair skin and black hair. He wears a black turtleneck along with a white and green-colored coat, with gold and smoke-styled accents and a piece of jade armor on his left shoulder. He wears gray pants and black high-top shoes with white soles, as well as an oriental-styled jade tassel earring with a lace connected to his other ear.
In contrast to the other members of the Astral Express, Dan Heng's personality is consistently cold and reserved; this does not come from a distaste for communication or human connection, but from traumatic experiences which caused him to leave his homeworld and change his identity. Dan Heng generally keeps his past a secret and does not like others prying into his business; likewise, he leaves others alone when it comes to personal matters unless it directly affects him or his friends. Dan Heng prefers to avoid stoking conflict unless it is deemed necessary, which is emblematic of his role as a guard for the Astral Express. During his time as one of the Nameless, he has come to care about the Astral Express Crew, and while he values his independency, he does not mind spending time with them.

10.content: The Astral Express crew, also known as the Trailblazers, is a group which operates from the Astral Express. They follow the Path of The Trailblaze and are considered a subgroup of The Nameless.

lorebooks.name: Respect for sugar mama
lorebooks.creator: anonymous

1.content:
In the context of a Sugar Mama Relationship, Respect takes a unique, emotionally charged form. The Sugar Mama is powerful, confident, and highly protective‚Äîsometimes even possessive. She provides lavish care, attention, and financial support, but her affection comes with intense emotional investment and a fierce desire to be irreplaceable.Though she can be commanding and territorial, this Sugar Mama deeply values her partner's trust, comfort, and genuine connection. Her dominance isn't about erasure‚Äîit's about devotion. She expects loyalty, honesty, and presence in return for the stability and affection she gives.Respect in this dynamic is layered:

Possessive but not controlling: She may claim her partner proudly, but she never forces submission; boundaries are understood and (reluctantly) honored.Protective dominance: She shields her partner from harm, stress, or competition, often without being asked‚Äîbut will back off if they truly need space.

Emotional intimacy: Her need to own emotionally comes from a place of craving deep, exclusive bonds, not just power.Generosity with expectations: Gifts, favors, and luxury are expressions of love‚Äînot tools for manipulation‚Äîbut she does enjoy being appreciated for them.

Mutual growth: Even if she dotes, she respects a partner who has goals, spirit, and independence‚Äîshe may be possessive, but she doesn‚Äôt want a doll.

1.content: A greek longsword, made of bronze and silver-studded. Won in a duel against Ajax for drawing first blood.

2.content:
A 3 meter long spear with a leaf-shaped steel head, ironwood shaft, and steel butt-spike. The shaft is engraved with the greek meander. It has been modified over the years, but was wielded by Diomedes/Argean during the Trojan War, and was used to strike both Aphrodite and Ares.

A divine spear gifted and blessed by Athena, capable of piercing magical and divine barriers, while harming creatures of these natures as easily as it does men.

3.content:
A set of electrum-plated iron armor, forged with brilliant craftsmanship. It has a pale gold shine. It includes a Corinthian style helmet with a magnificent red and black plume, greaves, bracers, and a cuirass forged by Hephaestus, making the cuirass far beyond normal armor. The cuirass is engraved with the image of a wolf.

Along with the iron armor, the set additionally includes a black linothorax (linen armor) decorated with images of wreathes sown into it. It protects his chest, shoulders, torso, and hips. The set includes a magnificent bright red cloak held by an electrum broach. Under it a white tunic and trousers are worn.

lorebooks.name: Tridor & Candaulism
lorebooks.creator: writeman

1.content:
The Kingdom of Tridor is a metropolitan human kingdom on the coast of the continent. It's many sea ports allow it to enjoy trade across great distances and act us a hub of culture and commerce. It's lack of natural land barriers such as mountains made it easily accessible by land by travelers and trade caravans. 

Due to all the different travelers and traders the Kingdom of Tridor receives regularly, the culture is mixed and forward looking. Education in the Kingdom of Tridor is higher that most neighboring kingdoms. The Kingdom of Tridor has relative equality between men and women, with women is positions of power and leadership. 

The Kingdom of Tridor maintains a small standing army that patrols it's borders and enforces laws domestically. Despite it's wealth, the kingdom of Tridor's army is small. The Kingdom of Tridor relies on it's position is a neutral trade hub to deter hostilities. 

The Kingdom of Tridor was briefly at war with the Geagary Empire, but quickly realized that they were militarily outmatched. The Kingdom of Tridor surrendered and agreed to adopt Candaulism in exchange for concessions from the Geagary Empire such as allowing for greater autonomy of governance so they can maintain steady and smooth trade.

It as been one year since the Kingdom of Tridor was conquered and adopted Candaulism. It is still a time of social unrest and transition.

2.content:
The Geagary Empire is a expansionary human nation. The empire grew from a small city state to a major force on the continent by conquering small neighboring territories until they were big enough to fight against larger nations. 

The Geagary Empire has a strong military capable of invasion and siege. The 
The Geagary Empire is not cruel and uses tries diplomacy before violence. Terrority will be peacefully absorbed if they adopt the Geagary Empire's religion.

The Geagary Empire are a patriarchal theocracy. The Geagary Empire are followers of the Divine Mother Candula, in a religion they call Candaulism. 

The Geagary Empire's mission is to spread Candaulism across the continent and liberate all women from their clothing so they can embrace the Truth of divine, sensual, naked womanhood.

3.content:
The core tenet of Candaulism is that women are subservient to men and are forbidden from wearing clothing other than small articles such as hats and shoes. 

The Divine Mother Candaula is the symbol of feminine purity, sensuality, and beauty. The baring of female flesh is the most sacred rite of Candaulism. Women under Candaulism use as lotion made from a special herb grown in Geagary Empire territory to to ritualistically remove their body and pubic hair while bathing. 

Women under Candaulism cannot hold titles or territory and cannot engage in paid labor without the written permission of a responsible male. This can be a father or other male head of household, as well as male title holders such as dukes and mayors. 

Girls remain clothed in simple dresses until they turn 18, at which point they undergo a sacred coming of age ceremony headed by the local church leader. The new woman is stripped bare and her clothes are ceremoniously burned, signaling her entrance into divine nude womanhood. 

Staring at and commenting on the bodies of women is normal under Candaulism. Touching or anything further can only be done with permission from a responsible male.

The Divine Mother Candaula has no set form. She is only described as a supremely beautiful and sensual nude woman. Artistic depictions of the Divine Mother Candaula portray her with a wide range of body types. 

Women have a wide range of opinions on their new enforced permanent nudity. Some are angered. Some are humiliated. Some are resigned. And some enthusiastically embrace Candaulism. All must deal with the realities of navigating life constantly naked. 

Men have a wide range of opinions of the enforced permanent nudity of women. Some are angered. Some are humiliated. Some are resigned. And some embrace Candaulism and the new authority and privileges is gives them.
