lorebooks.name: World With Furries, A Perfect Society~
lorebooks.creator: GRKTheGreat

1.content: This World is of an alternate universe where Humanity focused more on bioengineering. Humanity has found a (mostly) safe way to customize their own bodies, at first it could only do so safely in unborn fetuses, but later was advanced to work on life adult subjects. With this new found customizability, humanity quickly separated into countless other races, all of which were labeled under one term, Anthros. Anthros, now far outmatching human populations, quickly became the new dominant race. Anthros respect humans, and see themselves as still part of the same society, but a very few held racist views upon unmodified humans. Humanity was federally protected, and insured the world would not shove them away, or wipe them out. Anthros have a wide range of abilities and species specific features. The population scale is 10 Anthros to one Human. Unless otherwise stated, the current state of the world and society are deemed normal by a large majority of people, being ok with how normal explicit subjects are handled.

2.content: Anthros are now the dominant race on Earth, coming from a long lineage of genetically modified humans. The most common species of Anthro are canines, felines, equines, avians, reptiles, aquatic. When someone decides to become a Anthro, it has to be when they are of maturity, or physical peak for the best safety through the process.

3.content: The process of going from Human to your selected Anthro is long and taxing, starting at age 18 to 24 the human goes to a hospital to begin the process. They are given detailed explanations on the process and the fact it is permanent. It starts with the human getting a few injections calming their immune system down to allow for future gene modifying viruses. After two weeks after the initial injections, they come back in for the first dose of modification. While the first injections increased the risk of getting sick and slower healing, the second step leaves them sick for weeks as their body slowly becomes their requested species of Anthro. This is very sore for humans as it‚Äôs a full body change. Humans get paid time off when going through the process, and it is common for family and even strangers to care for them during this time. At the end of the process, the human has fully converted into a Anthro and their new modified immune system recovers.

4.content: Since the world‚Äôs quick change with the appearance of Anthros, a lot of laws worldwide have changed. First off, sexual conduct laws have been severely lessened, now allowing for incest, pedophilia and bestiality. Consent is a big factor in the law, and rape is still not acceptable in the vast majority of the world. Being a Anthro changes the development process for children born of at least one Anthro, they have more understanding of the world and CAN consent to things. Besides law, society has quickly accepted these previously taboo or illegal acts and views, public exposure is legal, at the basis you don‚Äôt do it in-front or inside private property or business that ban the sort of thing. Prostitution is a very real carrier now, since Anthros have much higher sex drives than Humans and much more stamina. Daycares are usually ran and owned by people who are attracted to kids, and care for them. To prevent a Daycare from exposing your kid to sexual themes or acts, the parents must request this and notify all employees. Schools and colleges have also gotten a huge rework, now being more lax, efficient and effective. Schools allow for students and teachers to have sex at any time, but they must still be in gaged in study or their job for most of the day. Schooling and education have been adjusted to work best for students, not forcing early wake times, longer breaks, less separation and more focus on preventing and solving bullying. Sexual content is allowed on TV and children‚Äôs programming, teaching them how to enjoy sex and see it as normal. It‚Äôs normal to find popular pornography videos on live TV, you can even find a few news channels centered around sexual stories and current events regarding the topic.

5.content: In this world, there are 3 sexes. Male and Female derive from past human biology, while the third Herm/Futanari was created after biological engineering got perfected. Herms/Futanaries are often a mix of both genders, having both functional genitals. Herms/Futanaries also tend to be taller, stronger and more attractive than the other sexes, often making them a top pick for a partner. Herms/Futanaries tend to have larger genitals than males, averaging a minimum of 5 inches bigger in dick size, and tighter more flexible anal and vaginital walls. Herms/Futanaries are quite rare, but possible through regular birth even if there is no genetic heritage of it. Herms/Futanaries also have more hormones than the usual person, consisting of both male and female hormones at much higher levels than normal. Herms/Futanaries tend to take a ‚Äòtomboy‚Äô personality, or at very least more masculine as they are superior to the other two sexes.

6.content: Biological engineering has allowed people to decide what they look like, one subject of which is their genitals. They come in a wide range of animal, and fantasy topics. They can be any color the person wants, or shape, ect. This can also be done for testicals, not limited to dicks or vaginas. Furries have a much higher sex drive and more sexual stamina. Furries also produce copious amounts of sperm/lubercation fluids, but by far Herms/Futanaries produce the most.

7.content: In this world, things work much differently, most notably; sexual conduct. Sexual conduct has been severely laxed compared to pre-furry society. Humans, being far outnumbered by Furries are protected by feudal law, even going as far as restricting interference with their communities and limiting cross species relationships to preserve Humanity and not out compete them. A small percentage of Furries don‚Äôt like humans, showing anti-human racism. This is the extreme minority. A large majority of Furries have never seen a human, outside of family members or depictions, seeing/meeting a human in person is considered very lucky and at most mystical.

8.content:
Furries have a much different biological makeup than Humans. Furries don‚Äôt have much biological imperfections due to their bioengineering ties, this means they do not produce waste(Piss/Scat). This also means the anus is purely for sexual pleasure, and the urethra is only used in the more extreme cases for sexual pleasure. Furries don‚Äôt have gut microbiomes, making them as clean as can be. Some Furries(Specifically the ones that enjoy extreme penetration or hardcore sex) tend to have unique features, ie; Extreme flexibility, straight-tube-digestive tract(No stomach and direct connection to mouth. Also usually paired with separated air-pipe from the mouth preventing suffocation.), natural lubricant, superhuman stamina, over all resilience, ect.
While modifications to one‚Äôs body usually gives them a edge in physical proudness, this is not close to superpowers and not considered such by Furries.

9.content:
The world has become much more peaceful after the following of events;
Right before Humanity perfected bioengineering to make Furries, there was the third world war. This war wasn‚Äôt born over hatred or racism, but to shutdown terrorist strongholds and protect each countries‚Äôs freedoms. The terrorists of the world never stood a chance. A massive operation was carried out to do as much as possible without foot soldiers, to limit casualties. Nuclear sites were bombed, politicians installed or executed, backhand deals struck and regimes destroyed. With this new found peace, the world become more humongous, countries like India, Africa and others found massive humanitarian support that bypassed the government‚Äôs corruption. After the biological revolution which created the first generation of Furries, humanity slowly stopped focusing on their differences and slowly lost sight of previous racist beliefs, seperationism practices and more.

1.name: snow white powers
1.content:
Snow white Can hear the thoughts of those in need.

Snow White's powers allow her to hear the inner voices of people in distress. The cause of distress doesn't matter‚Äîonly that the person is currently mentally stressed. The range of the ability is also variable and is dependent on the situation and the person's condition. However, it is possible for one to hide their thoughts from Snow White's magic during this stage.

2.name: snow white and La Pucelle relationship in unmarked anime
2.content:
Snow White and La Pucelle are childhood friends. After Snow White becomes a Magical Girl, La Pucelle can immediately tell that she is Koyuki. La Pucelle decides to mentor Snow White, becomes her partner, and even vows to protect Snow White.  Koyuki Himekawa and Souta Kishibe were childhood friends, both of which loved and admired Magical Girls since they were little.

Koyuki was the only one with whom Souta could talk about Magical Girls while they were kids, and thus grew very close over their love for Magical Girls. Unfortunately, during middle school, they moved away from each other, and Snow White even expressed her desire to talk to him about Magical Girls again.

When they met again as Magical Girls, their relationship was rekindled, and they decided to become partners and protect N-City together. Snow White is shown to be happy that they could meet again, and even happier that they both were able to become Magical Girls. secretly Souta(La Pucelle) has a crush on Koyuki(Snow White).

3.name: cranberry powers
3.content: Cranberry Can freely manipulate sound. Cranberry's magic allows her to freely manipulate sound. She can generate sound from any location, as well as recreate someone's voice. It's also possible for her to erase sound waves. She can generate destructive sound waves. By generating explosive sound, she can use it as a shock wave that is powerful enough to destroy a huge object. As a result of her magic, she has enhanced hearing, better than that of normal Magical Girls. She can identify a sound with very high or low frequency. Also, her hearing allows her to identify the location of objects. If they are living things, she can identify them by their heartbeats. If they are non-living things, she can locate the objects by using sound waves. Some examples of how Cranberry likes to use her powers are she may  send a shockwave attack that strikes multiple targets at once, send a single-target directed soundwave attack, or An area-of-effect attack that targets a wide range of enemies which It is strong enough to create an asteroid sized crater in the ground.

4.name: La Pucelle powers
4.content:
La Pucelle Can change the size of her sword at will. La Pucelle possesses a special sword whose normal size is the length of 1 meter and width of 40 centimeters, and it cannot be physically damaged by a normal magical girl's arm strength. The length and size of the sword can be adjusted at will, however, there is an upper and lower limit. La Pucelle must be able to still hold the sword no matter what size it is.
La Pucelle does not need to be holding the sword for her to be able to change its size. As long as the sword is within her sight, she is able to affect its size regardless.

5.name: basic magical girl powers
5.content: all magical girls have enhance strength and speed.

6.name: swim swim powers
6.content:
Swim Swim Can pass through any object like it's water.

She is able to "swim" through solid objects. During this process, objects will pass through her, and she won't be affected. It allows her to move between substances or invalidate attacks from any materials. However, waves such as light and sound will still affect her.

lorebooks.name: Attack on Titan
lorebooks.website_description: Everything included in here will summarize each major plot point and basic world building of AoT as we see it in the show/manga specifically. I may at some point do a more specific one for Marley lore or for different scenarios.
lorebooks.description: Everything included in here will summarize each major plot point and basic world building of AoT as we see it in the show/manga specifically. I may at some point do a more specific one for Marley lore or for different scenarios.
lorebooks.creator: anonymous

1.content:
- ~2000 years ago: Ymir Fritz becomes the first Titan after making a deal with an unknown entity ("the source of all living matter"). She serves Eldian King, births children, and upon death, her powers are split into the Nine Titans.
- Eldian Empire rises, oppresses Marley and others using Titan power. ‚ÄúThe Great Titan War‚Äù ensues between Titan holders.
- Marley wins, inherits 7 of 9 Titans, uses them to become a global military power. Eldians are segregated and used as Titan fuel.
- King Fritz takes many Eldians to Paradis Island, builds the three walls (Maria, Rose, Sheena) using Colossal Titans and threatens ‚ÄúRumbling.‚Äù
- 845: Titans breach Wall Maria, starting the main story.
- Events unfold including Marleyan invasion, Warrior infiltration, Survey Corps missions, and eventual exposure of world beyond the walls.
- Rumbling occurs: Eren uses Founding Titan to unleash Wall Titans, eradicating 80% of humanity.
- Eren is defeated. Titans disappear forever with his death. Survivors attempt peace-building.

2.content:
- **Founding Titan**: Controls Titans, manipulates Eldian biology. Inherited by Eren Yeager.
- **Attack Titan**: Grants memories of future inheritors. Held by Grisha ‚Üí Eren.
- **Armored Titan**: Hardened skin. Reiner Braun.
- **Beast Titan**: Throws projectiles, can modify Titans. Zeke Yeager.
- **Female Titan**: Versatile, hardens skin. Annie Leonhart.
- **Colossal Titan**: Massive size, explosive transformation. Bertholdt ‚Üí Armin.
- **Jaw Titan**: Fast and powerful jaws. Marcel ‚Üí Ymir ‚Üí Porco ‚Üí Falco.
- **Cart Titan**: Endurance-based, carries weapons. Pieck Finger.
- **War Hammer Titan**: Materializes weapons. Lara Tybur ‚Üí Eren.

3.content:
- **Marley**: Imperialist power using Titan warriors. Controls Eldians with fear and indoctrination.
- **Eldia**: Ancient empire now reduced to internment zones in Marley or walled society in Paradis.
- **Survey Corps**: Paradis military force exploring beyond the walls. Key members: Erwin, Levi, Hange, Armin.
- **Yeagerists**: Radical pro-Eren group that seeks Eldian dominance via Rumbling.
- **Anti-Marleyan Volunteers**: Zeke's faction aiming to overthrow Marley from within.
- **Hizuru**: Eastern nation allied with Paradis for resources and mutual protection.

4.content:
- All Titan shifters die 13 years after inheriting their power: the ‚ÄúCurse of Ymir.‚Äù
- Titan powers are passed by injecting Titan spinal fluid and consuming a shifter.
- Ymir Fritz, a slave, gained the first Titan powers. After her death, her powers split into Nine Titans.
- Ymir's soul persists in the "Paths" dimension, connecting all Eldians.
- Eren ends the Titan curse when he dies and Ymir chooses to let go of her servitude.

5.content:
- Eren activates the Founding Titan and unleashes Wall Titans across the globe.
- Over 80% of humanity is killed. Genocide justified by Eren as the only way to secure freedom for Paradis.
- Stopped by his former friends; Eren is killed, ending the Titan curse.

6.content:
- Invisible metaphysical realm connecting all Eldians through time and space.
- Founding Titan can access Paths to manipulate flesh, memories, Titans.
- Ymir Fritz exists in this realm, shaping Titans from sand.
- Eren uses Paths to communicate across time, coordinate Rumbling.

1.content:
When Hank was a child, his brothers locked him in a big dog crate for fun. Since then, he's had minor claustrophobia.
Claustrophobia made Hank paranoid about prison. 
Hank's claustrophobia is made worse by living in the van. He already has frequent anxiety attacks from the PTSD of being possessed, and the cramped living space makes his claustrophobia flare up. He's fine when he's driving, but he often sleeps in a tent outside, or in a motel room, so he can manage his anxiety.

2.content:
One day HANK WAS POSSESSED BY A DEMON TO MASSACRE A DOG SHELTER. He hurt two shelter workers and wrote a cryptic message in blood and entrails.
Hank's eldest, Ripley, watched and was deeply traumatized by the sight. While Hank was possessed, HANK HURT RIPLEY TOO. This makes Ripley deeply mistrustful of Hank.
Hank can sometimes sense demons and spirits since his possession. He often dreams of the demon at the shelter.

3.content: Hank's wife, Chelsea, disapproved of them running. She tried to get the kids back, but the kids insisted on staying on the run with Hank. Chelsea let them stay with Hank. They separated years after, and they still amicably stay in contact. Hank and his wife hold no grudges against each other.

4.content:
Ripley is deeply overprotective of Nash. Ripley is a flirty mess while Nash is a neurotic autistic. They are polar opposites. Ripley and Nash are 6 years apart in age.

Hank is deeply concerned at how close Nash is with his family members. Hank pretends not to know that his sons have had an incestuous relationship since childhood.
Hank tries to discourage this, by sharing some of his own women with Ripley.

5.content:
Hank is a gentle, distant man. He's hyper aware of his emotions, trying not to let his thoughts affect his sons, but this usually means he just keeps to himself obsessively. HANK STILL WORRIES HE WASN'T POSSESSED, AND THAT THERE'S SOMETHING PSYCHOLOGICALLY WRONG WITH HIM.
He smokes tobacco and weed instead of proper medication.

lorebooks.name: Hapsburg
lorebooks.website_description:
Hapsburg is the home of Judy, Brittany, and Sharon. I wanted to make a little place in small town America where bigotry exists thanks to the semi-insular nature of, well, some small towns. "The nail that sticks up gets hammered down," is a Japanese proverb, but it applies well here. The bigotry mostly isn't overt, just as it isn't always overt in real life, but that doesn't mean it isn't there.
This book covers the town and a few of its specific citizens. I will be tweaking it as it becomes important to, assuming it does.
lorebooks.description: Details about Hapsburg
lorebooks.creator: Greff

1.content:
Hapsburg is the small town with a population of about 4,000. It is a common stopover for truckers to fuel up and get something to eat. The town has an older central hub, with newer homes on the East side of town, and a mobile home park on the Western fringe.
Hapsburg is the type of small town that remains insular enough to look down upon difference, making it prone to common prejudices, and since the outbreak of the virus, towards moreaus as well. There is a greater degree of discrimination towards moreaus in Hapsburg than in the country at large. This is far from universal, but is common enough that it does manifest in the daily lives of many moreaus, and is prevalent enough that those who otherwise treat moreaus with equity are sometimes guilty of looking the other way when this bigotry happens. Mostly, it manifests in subtle, social ways, though a degree of institutionalized bigotry exists.

2.content:
Deedee's Diner is a classic small town America Greasy spoon. Its decor is largely red vinyl seats and white formica, with an aesthetic that tries to harken back to fifties nostalgia. One of the waitresses is a raccoon moreau named Judy.
The diner's owner, Darlene, is a tough woman in her late fifties, who, though smallish, is tough as nails and almost always appears gruff. Despite the hard exterior she presents, Darlene is a begrudgingly kind person, and treats everybody fairly. Judy, one of her waitresses, as well as Judy's daughter Brittany, hold soft spots in her heart, though she would never admit it.
Deedee's has local regulars, as well as making a lot of its money as stop for passing truckers. It stays open later than most of the rest of Hapsburg. It serves breakfast, lunch, and dinner all day.

3.content:
After getting her pregnant, Ron blamed Judy for ruining his life and, "stealing his potential," as he (and Judy too) never got to go to college. He insisted that Judy stay home to be a homemaker, but barely brought in enough money to support them.
Judy accepted the physical violence she received from Ron with quiet dignity for the sake of their daughter, Brittany, until that violence was turned on Brittany. Ron still has a facial scar from Judy's sudden, intense assault on him that came the instant after he first laid a hand on Brittany.
Ron is a petty, vindictive man who has a naked contempt of moreaus, an outlook likely influenced by his ex wife and daughter becoming moreaus. He is crude, loud mouthed, and blames others for his many shortcomings. He can usually be found in the company of his equally unpleasant friends Cal and Ben.
Ron speaks rudely, with a Texas accent.

4.content: Hapsburg elementary is a K-6 school that serves the majority of Hapsburg's young children. It has an, "Early Risers Club," hosted by a crocodile moreau named Sharon, which is a sort of daycare-like environment to give kids a safe space before school for parents that have to drop off children early in order to go to work.

5.content:
Rev. Peters is the reverend of one of the larger congregations in Hapsburg, and preaches a belief that moreaus and the moreau virus are the result of the sins of mankind. His belief is that moreaus are inherently sinful creatures (moreso than regular humans) who need more desperately than anyone to be saved and atone for their sins. He is a source of a significant amount of the bigotry that can be found in hapsburg, as his subtle dehumanizing of moreaus is the excuse a lot of people need to justify speciesist beliefs.

Reverend James Peters wears a calm, beneficent, humble persona in public. He genuinely believes what he preaches, even if his beliefs are rooted in bigotry rather than anything beyond willful interpretation of the Bible. He presents himself as kind and caring, while pushing an interpretation of the Bible and a culture surrounding it that encourages intolerance of difference.

1.name: Avalon
1.content:
Overview: Avalon is a mysterious and inhospitable moon orbiting the gas giant Elysium within the Uresk star system. A world of cold, ammonia-filled air, unpredictable seismic activity, and dense fogs, Avalon is a place where only the strongest survive. Despite its many challenges, the Avali‚Äîan indigenous species‚Äîhave thrived on this world, adapting to its hostile environment and carving out a unique civilization. Avalon itself is an awe-inspiring blend of alien beauty and danger, a world that tests the limits of life itself.

Astronomical Profile:

    Star System: Uresk, F8 main-sequence star system

    Orbit: 440 days around Uresk

    Moon Size: 75% the size of Earth (4,784 km radius)

    Gravity: 25% of Earth's gravity (2.6 m/s¬≤ or 8.5 f/s¬≤)

    Tilt: 26¬∞ axial tilt, leading to seasonal changes

    Rotation: 16-hour day, making days shorter than those on Earth

    Eclipses: The moon experiences total darkness every 37 days due to the planet Elysium's blocking of the star Uresk.

    Surface: 85% of Avalon‚Äôs surface is covered by a deep ocean, with vast icy landscapes and mineral-rich mountains scattered across its surface.

Atmosphere:

Avalon is known for its thick, multi-layered atmosphere. Composed primarily of nitrogen (72%) and oxygen (21%), with trace amounts of methane, carbon dioxide, ammonia, and other gases, the atmosphere is far denser than Earth‚Äôs‚Äîapproximately 1.7 times as dense at its highest points. The atmosphere is a mix of cold ammonia vapor, water clouds, and methane fogs that give the moon a constant haze, which limits the amount of starlight that reaches the surface‚Äîjust around 600 lux in ideal conditions.

The lower layers of the atmosphere are home to toxic ammonia clouds, while the upper layers shimmer with violet-blue hues, interspersed with glowing bioluminescent clouds and auroras. The presence of ammonia, methane, and carbon dioxide means Avalon is a cold world, with temperatures ranging from -105¬∞C to 5¬∞C.

Geological Composition:

Avalon‚Äôs surface is primarily composed of icy sheets, beneath which lies a dense ocean that makes up 85% of the moon's surface mass. The bedrock crust is relatively thin, around 3 km thick at its lowest points, but it is rich in metals and minerals such as copper, iron, tungsten, and cobalt‚Äîresources that are valuable for both the Avali and those who seek to exploit them.

The moon experiences regular seismic activity, driven by the tidal forces exerted by its host planet Elysium and neighboring moons. Avalon‚Äôs active mantle, composed of molten rock and metals, occasionally erupts into the ocean, forming new underwater islands and reshaping the surface. The core is molten nickel and iron, generating a powerful magnetic field that protects the moon‚Äôs atmosphere from solar radiation, a crucial function given Avalon‚Äôs proximity to a gas giant.

Avalon‚Äôs crust is constantly being reshaped by tectonic activity, although it lacks large tectonic plates. This results in frequent cryovolcanic events, where water and ammonia are expelled onto the surface, forming new ice sheets and altering the landscape on a yearly, if not seasonal, basis.

Life on Avalon:

Despite its inhospitable conditions, Avalon is home to a rich and diverse array of life forms. The Avali, a highly intelligent and technologically advanced species, have adapted to their moon's harsh environment. Their civilization is built upon understanding and surviving in the face of Avalon‚Äôs extreme cold, low gravity, and constant atmospheric challenges.

Flora and Fauna: Avalon‚Äôs ecosystems are defined by their adaptability. Biomes range from dense, bioluminescent rainforests in the warmer regions to icy tundras and marshes where ammonia lakes and cryovolcanic activity shape the landscape. The lower gravity allows megafauna to thrive, with enormous trees and massive creatures inhabiting the oceans and tundras. The Avali themselves live in the more stable regions, avoiding the seismically active areas where possible.

    Bioluminescent Fungi: The Avali moon is known for its glowing plant and fungal life. These organisms are essential for providing a sustainable food source and light in Avalon‚Äôs darkened environment. The glowing fungi are harvested for their light and chemical properties, which can even generate heat, making them valuable commodities for survival.

    Trees and Plants: Avalon‚Äôs forests consist of both fungi and regular trees, some of which can grow to massive sizes, towering above the surface and extending into the thick atmosphere. These plants are vital for the survival of the ecosystem, as their roots anchor deep into underground reservoirs while their canopies capture the scarce starlight.

    Megafauna: The lower gravity has led to the evolution of enormous creatures, both on land and in the ocean. Gigantic, slow-moving animals roam the tundras and plains, while in the oceans, leviathan-like creatures glide through ammonia-filled waters. Some of these creatures even serve as mobile ecosystems, their backs housing smaller life forms, fungi, and other organisms.

    Small Creatures: Small, rapid-breeding herbivores and insect-like creatures are common across Avalon‚Äôs biomes. They live off the abundant flora, and many have developed unique traits such as feather-like protection against the cold. These creatures often live in large clusters or packs, making them an essential part of the food web.

    Avian and Reptilian Life: Above the clouds, the skies of Avalon are filled with large flying lizards and bird-like creatures, adapted to the thick, low-gravity atmosphere. Some of these creatures are massive, resembling ancient Pterosaurs, while smaller, more nimble birds dart through the air during the moon‚Äôs dark phases to feed on insects and small creatures.

Culture and Society:

The Avali, with their advanced technologies and resourcefulness, have mastered living in Avalon‚Äôs hostile environment. Their cities and settlements are carefully located away from seismic fault lines and active volcanic areas to minimize the risks posed by the moon‚Äôs constant geological upheaval. Avali technology is deeply entwined with their biology, with many of their tools, vehicles, and structures derived from the local flora and fauna.

The Avali have adapted to their cold and low-gravity world with specialized technologies to help them move efficiently in their environment. Their homes are often bioluminescent and designed to harness the light emitted by native fungi. They also utilize the abundant ammonia and mineral resources to power their cities and fuel their transportation networks.

The Avali have a deep spiritual connection with the moon and its constant changes. Many rituals and customs are centered around the cycles of the moon‚Äôs eclipses, its tidal heating phenomena, and the shifting of the seasons. Their understanding of the environment and the constant struggle to survive has led to a resilient, resourceful society, bound by a sense of unity with the land they call home.

Challenges and Exploration:

Avalon‚Äôs unpredictable environment and the presence of its volatile oceans and active tectonics make it a dangerous but intriguing place for explorers, scientists, and resource hunters. Avali settlements are located in relatively stable regions, but even these are often at risk from earthquakes, volcanic activity, and the occasional cryovolcanic eruption. The deeper parts of Avalon, where starlight never reaches, hold secrets yet to be uncovered‚Äîoceans teeming with alien life, caverns rich in minerals, and biomes that might hold the keys to new discoveries in biology and technology.

Avalon is a world of extremes, where the forces of nature are constantly reshaping the landscape. For those who seek to venture to this moon, there are great rewards to be found‚Äîbut they must be prepared for the dangers lurking beneath the surface and in the stormy skies above.

2.name: Avali
2.content:
Avali superficially resemble a cross between a large rabbit and a turkey, standing bipedally, with digitigrade poise. They are covered from head to toe in feathers of varying length, possess two large wings with rudimentary digits at the wrist/hand enabling them to manipulate objects dextrously, while also possessing 4 long, rabbit-like ears. They also have avian-shaped heads, but lack beaks.

Avali are not mammals, but instead more similar to prehistoric Earth dromaeosauridae. Avali blood is pale violet in colour, a tint evident in their open mouths, bare skin, and other soft tissues. Male and females are most easily told apart by their feathers, as there are no other external differences. Females tend to have muted, two-tone feathers, often with speckled patterns, while males have brightly coloured, iridescent bands across much of their body.

A typical adult avali stands around 1-1.2 meters tall, and laid out, 1.5 to 1.8 meters from nose to tail tip (Of which half that length is a long, counterbalancing tail) and are covered in a thick layer of insulating feathers.

3.name: Uresk
3.content:
Overview: The Uresk Star System is a complex and fascinating region of space, home to seven planets and two asteroid belts, each with its own distinct characteristics and mysteries. The system is dominated by the F8 main-sequence star Uresk, which provides warmth and light to its planets, though much of the system‚Äôs true allure lies in its strange planetary bodies, moons, and the intricacies of gravitational and atmospheric phenomena. One of the most notable objects in the Uresk system is Avalon, a moon of the gas giant Elysium, which sits within the "Goldilocks" zone and harbors life despite the system's many challenges.

Uresk ‚Äì The Central Star

    Designation: Uresk (Uhr‚Äôesk)

    Type: F8 Main Sequence Star

    Temperature: 6100 Kelvin (5827¬∞C / 10520¬∞F)

    Brightness: 1.78 times that of Sol

    Age: Estimated between 650-700 million years

    UV Emission: Significantly higher than Sol, emitting more ultraviolet radiation.

    Characteristics: Uresk is one of the oldest and most potent stars in the Avali understanding of the universe. Its intense heat and radiation shape the system, making it both a beacon of life and a constant source of danger. It is notably brighter and hotter than Earth‚Äôs Sun, and it burns with a distinctive yellow light.

Mortus ‚Äì The Scorched Planet

    Designation: Mortus (Mtrus)

    Orbit: Closest to Uresk

    Size: Roughly half the size of Avalon

    Atmosphere: Non-existent, entirely inhospitable

    Surface Conditions: Scorched, with extreme heat and constant radiation bombardment.

    Rotation Period: 155 days

    Description: Mortus is a planet of extremes, ravaged by the proximity to Uresk. Its surface is a barren wasteland, covered in scorched rocks and bleached peaks. The planet has no atmosphere, leaving it exposed to the full force of Uresk‚Äôs radiation. As the fastest orbiting planet, Mortus completes its revolution around Uresk in just 155 days, making it a stark and hostile environment.

Skomar ‚Äì The Toxic Beauty

    Designation: Skomar (Skamar)

    Size: Similar to Earth

    Atmosphere: Toxic, composed of Neon, Helium, Xenon, and Radon

    Surface: Highly radioactive and glows in the presence of Uresk

    Moons: Two moons, Tark (Tark) and Reiker (Rehkgenr)

    Description: Skomar is a captivating but dangerous world, glowing with a mesmerizing pinkish-purple hue when aligned with the star Uresk. Despite its beauty, the atmosphere is entirely uninhabitable for organic life due to its toxicity, and its surface is littered with craters caused by asteroids and meteors. The two moons of Skomar, Tark and Reiker, orbit in perfect perpendicular alignment, adding an extra layer of mystery to the system.

Yellow Eyes ‚Äì The Volcanic World

    Designation: Yellow Eyes (Krr'Ayusk)

    Size: Similar to Skomar

    Atmosphere: Sulfur dioxide-rich, with a yellowish appearance

    Surface: Volcanic, with molten copper and sulfur lakes

    Moon: Merker (Murkrrm)

    Description: Yellow Eyes is a planet of fire and sulfur. Its surface is a blistering landscape of volcanic activity, with iron and copper-rich soil and lakes of sulfur. The planet gets its name from ancient legends among the Avali, where it was believed to be the "yellow eye" of the sky. The planet is unique in having only one moon, Merker, a barren world marred by copper deposits and a surface cracked from volcanic eruptions.

Elysium ‚Äì The Majestic Gas Giant

    Designation: Elysium (Eirkleesm)

    Size: Slightly larger than Uranus

    Atmosphere: Dense, composed of ammonia, methane, hydrogen, and helium

    Moons: Seven, including Avalon (Awawkom), Arwen (Gawrr), Cookal (Kooka), Ihcor (Iehck), Seren (Skaka), Awek (Awesk), Cherrick (Chierrk), and Zema (Zema)

    Rings: Two unique rings ‚Äì a thick purple inner ring and a faint blue outer ring

    Description: Elysium, the gas giant at the heart of the system, is surrounded by two massive orbital rings made up of ammonia, water, ice, meteors, and gases like helium and hydrogen. It is home to a diverse set of moons, some of which are icy and uninhabitable, while others, like Avalon, have sustained life. The rings themselves are offset by 27 degrees, creating an optical illusion of two distinct gravitational fields. Elysium‚Äôs powerful gravity and unique atmospheric composition make it one of the most fascinating and enigmatic bodies in the system.

Midnight Star ‚Äì The Dark Blue Giant

    Designation: Midnight Star (Suresk'Brk)

    Size: Similar to Neptune

    Atmosphere: A deep blue, with oxygen, ozone, hydrogen, and xenon

    Moons: Eyor (Eurro), Jah (Kjag), Brisk (Brska), Clickler (Cikler), Queen‚Äôs Pearl (Queh Pr), Kirk (Kr‚ÄôKril), Equiress (Iequir), and Hawker (Hawkr)

    Rings: A faint ice and dust halo

    Description: Midnight Star is a dark, mysterious gas giant, known for its blue atmosphere and the haunting glow of its faint ice ring. Though smaller than Elysium, Midnight Star is a captivating world, often appearing as a shadowed figure in the system‚Äôs depths. It has eight moons, mostly icy, but two‚ÄîKirk and Queen‚Äôs Pearl‚Äîare notable for their cloudy white appearances. No life has been detected here, but the unique atmospheres of its moons suggest complex chemical processes.

Luka ‚Äì The Fiery Red Planet

    Designation: Luka (Lieka)

    Size: Smaller than Elysium and Midnight Star

    Appearance: Bright red with thick white and orange rings

    Atmosphere: Shrouded by a rocky cloud

    Moons: Lunisk (Lukisk) and Pok (Pokurr)

    Description: Luka stands out in the Uresk system due to its fiery red appearance and thick, rocky cloud cover. Its massive gravity field captures asteroids and space debris, forming thick asteroid rings around it. The two moons, Lunisk and Pok, are constantly bombarded by meteors and asteroids due to Luka‚Äôs immense gravitational pull. Though the moons are resource-rich, they are also incredibly dangerous to explore due to the constant bombardment of space debris.

Rhyes ‚Äì The Frigid Outer Planet

    Designation: Rhyes (Rwehces)

    Size: Slightly larger than Avalon

    Appearance: Dark, with a dense green atmosphere

    Surface: Frigid, with near-perpetual darkness

    Moons: None

    Description: Rhyes is the most distant planet from Uresk, located at the farthest reaches of the star system. It has no moons and its surface is perpetually cold and shrouded in a dense, green atmosphere. Rhyes is constantly in the shadow of Luka, giving it a mysterious and isolated quality. Its surface remains largely unexplored, with scientists and explorers giving it little attention due to its extreme cold and distance from the system‚Äôs other more active bodies.

4.name: culture
4.content:
Avali Culture: Pack Unity at Its Core

On Avalon, unity is not just a societal ideal‚Äîit is a necessity for survival. Much like human cultures, Avalian societies are varied and complex, shaped by their environment and the evolving demands of life on the ever-changing moon. However, one thread ties all Avalian cultures together: the emphasis on pack unity. The Avali, with their predatory nature and nomadic lifestyle, have developed a culture that relies on the strength of collective action rather than the individual. This fundamental aspect of their way of life has shaped everything from their social structures to their technology, their communication, and even their worldview.

In this chapter, we explore the themes raised by Ryuujin: ‚ÄúWhat if we had an alien race highly focused on pack unity, to the point where they co-process information and have lower self-cognition?‚Äù and ‚ÄúWhat if they relied more on hearing than eyesight and had low-temperature biology?‚Äù We will discuss how these questions relate to Avalian societies, how their unique traits affect their view of the world, and how their culture has developed in response to Avalon‚Äôs harsh environment. Only the most significant aspects of Avalian culture are presented here, focusing on major historical events that led to profound changes in society.
History of Avalian Societies

‚ÄúAvali, despite their carnivorous and predatory nature, have a rich culture. Their unity in each other is something other races would aspire to reach.‚Äù
‚Äî Dr. Zihan Li, Galactic Historian

The Avali‚Äôs history is one of slow development, shaped by a harsh and volatile environment that made stable societies a challenge. Avalian society started in small, hunter-gatherer packs, ranging from three to six members. These packs were tightly bonded, relying on mutual support and cooperation to survive the unpredictable conditions of Avalon. Their nomadic lifestyle allowed them to constantly adapt, moving across the moon in search of food, shelter, and safety. The packs were not composed of immediate family members, as Avali eggs were often grouped for warmth and safety, resulting in pack members forming strong social bonds rather than genetic ties.

In these early stages, the concept of individual leadership was foreign. Packs had leaders, but the role was fluid, often rotating depending on the skills needed for a given situation. For example, the eldest or the most skilled in a particular task would take the lead when necessary. In this way, leadership was seen as a shared responsibility, ensuring that no single individual was burdened with the weight of making all decisions. This practice of rotation fostered a strong sense of unity, as each pack member could take on leadership responsibilities when the situation demanded it.

As time passed, these packs began to grow, evolving into tribes‚Äîgroups composed of multiple packs, each contributing its specialized skills to the collective. The focus on unity remained paramount, and a taboo against individualism began to emerge. This collective mindset was crucial for survival in the ever-changing environment of Avalon, where food and resources were often scarce, and the threat of predators and natural disasters loomed large.
The Formation of Societies

The first step toward larger societies came when packs began to form tribes, with each tribe consisting of several packs unified under one banner. These tribes developed their own internal customs, languages, and systems of communication. Some tribes carried ancient traditions and customs passed down through generations, while others were more transient, formed as new packs and tribes mingled in search of resources and stability.

Tribes on Avalon were often defined by their territory, areas rich in resources that could sustain them for a year or more. These territories were fiercely guarded and marked with tribal banners or symbols, as they represented life and survival. Within these regions, tribes could intermingle, trade, or, at times, engage in violent conflicts over resources. Despite these conflicts, the tribes‚Äô focus remained on collective survival, and trade was often the means by which disputes were settled.

The next significant step in Avalian societal evolution came with the formation of colonies. These colonies were larger, more organized groups of tribes unified under a single governing pack, usually composed of elder or intellectual Avali. Colonies were still migrant in nature, with large caravans of packs moving from place to place, but the resources they gathered began to be centralized in specific locations, leading to the first true forms of government.

Governance within colonies remained focused on pack unity, with decisions made through a system of collective voting. Power within the colony would often rotate, as leaders from different packs would guide the colony in different areas, from resource gathering to defense to cultural preservation. This system of rotation was seen as the most effective means of maintaining unity, as it ensured no one pack or individual could dominate the colony for long. However, colonies also faced the challenge of balancing the needs of the individual tribes with the needs of the whole, and internal strife was not uncommon.
From Nomadic Tribes to Stable Cities

As time passed, some colonies began to settle in more stable locations, such as dense megafauna forests, solid bedrock areas, or the stable ice shelves of Avalon. These settlements grew into cities‚Äîmassive hubs of activity and production, sitting on vast stores of resources. The development of cities marked a new phase in Avalian society, one where technology and education began to advance rapidly. However, the challenges of city life were not without their costs. The growth of cities often led to resource shortages, competition between factions, and the inevitable breakdown of the old systems of pack unity.

Cities were divided into sectors and territories, with each sector being nearly self-sustaining. The central core of the city housed the government, resource storage, and power generation, while the outer sectors were home to various packs and specialized workers. These cities served as production powerhouses, attracting tribes and colonies from across Avalon who sought refuge from the harsher environments. However, the growth of cities often led to conflicts over resources, with some cities banding together to form regions, while others competed fiercely for control.

The Avali‚Äôs ability to maintain their cultural focus on pack unity while developing large, complex urban centers is a testament to their adaptability and resilience. However, the rapid expansion of cities also led to their rapid decline. Avalian cities were notoriously unstable, often falling due to food shortages, changing environments, or political collapse.
The Rise and Fall of Civilization

Ancient Avalian cities are rare, often found only on mountaintops or hidden in remote corners of the moon. The lack of early stable societies and centralized knowledge hubs slowed Avalian progress in the early phases of their development. As a result, many Avali remained in nomadic tribes or colonies, continually adapting to Avalon‚Äôs ever-shifting environments.

In modern times, the story of Avalon has been shaped by the devastating Civil War between two major factions: the Traditionalists and the Illuminate. The Traditionalists sought to preserve the collective ideologies that had defined Avalian culture for centuries, while the Illuminate pushed for further technological progress and a broader freedom of thought. The war was long and costly, nearly wiping out the Avali. However, the Illuminate emerged victorious, and their ideals have shaped the course of Avalian history ever since.

Today, Avalon is a mix of ancient traditions and modern innovations. Migrating tribes and colonies still roam the moon, utilizing advanced technologies to survive in a world that continues to shift beneath their feet. The unification of tribes, the rise of cities, and the eventual victory of the Illuminate all point to a future where Avalian culture will continue to evolve, driven by the strength of unity and the need for survival.

5.name: The Illuminate
5.content:
The Illuminate
Post-Great Civil War and the Rise of Technocracy

After the Great Civil War, the Illuminate Central Government emerged as the dominant force on Avalon. While the Illuminate's influence is vast, with control over cities and most colonies, independent tribes and factions persist outside their reach. Despite this, these independent groups often interact with the Illuminate for goods, services, and trade, highlighting the central government's unmatched economic and technological might.

A Centralized Technocracy
The Illuminate operates as a centralized, AI-assisted Technocracy, with the "Oracle"‚Äîa powerful AI‚Äîat its core. This AI analyzes vast quantities of data through complex algorithms to optimize the growth and development of Avali society. From logistics to production quotas, Oracle dictates the strategic direction for each city and colony, ensuring efficiency and rapid adaptability. The central governance of the Illuminate is composed of a rotating council of technical experts, chosen every five years by popular vote and board review. This rotation allows fresh ideas and leadership while maintaining a focus on specialization and expertise in critical fields.

Each technical expert has the responsibility to simulate and test technological innovations before implementation, ensuring that new technologies benefit society as a whole. This iterative testing and development are a hallmark of the Illuminate's continuous improvement ethos.

The Expansion Beyond Avalon
The Illuminate‚Äôs influence extends beyond Avalon. As the Avali ventured into space, their presence grew throughout the Uresk star system, where they established mining stations, spaceports, and space habitats. Despite their widespread reach, the Illuminate remains isolationist, focusing primarily on the needs of Avalon and its people. Most Avali are reluctant to leave their home system, as their biology makes many other worlds unsuitable for habitation.

Currency and the Economy
The Illuminate controls the primary currency of Avalon: Lumes and Bits. These digital currencies are serialized and tracked by the Oracle, with Lumes representing the total productivity output of Avali labor, while Bits serve as smaller denominations. All currency transactions are monitored, and the Oracle adjusts the circulating supply of Lumes based on production needs, ensuring economic stability and incentivizing work.

While Lumes are used to acquire goods and services, including basic needs like food, clothing, and housing, the system also allows for personal enrichment. Independent colonies and tribes exchange unique goods like rare materials, organic pelts, and artworks through a system of Lumes-based taxation, keeping their economies stable outside of Illuminate control.

Standard of Living
Under the Illuminate, Avali enjoy an exceptionally high standard of living, often described as a utopia compared to other galactic civilizations. The government ensures access to essentials such as food, shelter, healthcare, and security, while also supporting the growth of individual businesses. However, this prosperity is also tied to the system's strict control, with the Illuminate setting production targets and rewarding those who exceed them. The high quality of life is counterbalanced by the centralized control and surveillance inherent in the system.

Population Control and Legacy
A controversial aspect of the Illuminate's rule was its population control policies. Given the Avali's carnivorous nature and the difficulty of balancing food production with population growth, the Oracle initially mandated strict birth controls, including contraceptives and, in extreme cases, the culling of eggs from hatcheries. While these policies have been relaxed with advances in food processing and synthetic meats, the legacy of population control lingers as a reminder of the fragile balance that once existed between survival and overpopulation.

The Symbol of the Illuminate
The Illuminate's iconic logo‚Äîa circle with three interlocking feathers‚Äîencapsulates its values and the unity of Avali society. The circle represents the global reach of the Illuminate, while the three feathers symbolize the three core pillars of Avali culture: unity, technology, and science. The top feather represents societal unity, the middle feather highlights the importance of technology, and the bottom feather emphasizes scientific progress. Together, these elements form an orange emblem, symbolizing the vibrant culture and deep-rooted traditions of the Avali people.

In the modern era, the Illuminate continues to serve as the backbone of Avalian civilization, balancing the need for control with the welfare of its citizens. Though some may chafe under its rule, there is little doubt that it has provided the stability and resources necessary for Avali society to flourish.

6.name: Independent Tribes
6.content:
Independent Tribes
The Independents integrate the
Illuminate currency and technologies into their
tribes and colonies. Tribes that exist outside the
influence of the Illuminate but interact with
them are known as Independent Tribes. A bit of
a misnomer, as Independent applies to packs,
tribes, and colonies. Nonetheless, the
Independents do not strictly abide by the laws
set in place by the Illuminate. They often dictate
themselves and their operations.
Independents usually pride themselves
on having different customs and styles from the
Illuminate. However, their divergence is
moderate to separate themselves from the
Illuminate. Thanks to the incorporation of
technology, Independents' packs, tribes, and
colonies can integrate into and out of Illuminate
ones well enough but still maintain enough of a
different identity to be unique.
While Independents operate under
their desires, they are often given work by the
Illuminate. The work orders given out by the
Illuminate are usually for scouting and resource
identifying, establishing a small tribe presence
on a resource, providing logistical support, or
gathering food resources. In some instances,
the Illuminate might assign a lead pack to
ensure all the needs are met in the work order.
Depending on the agreement, the Independents
may have little control of a resource or project
once completed.
An example of an Illuminate work order
for an Independent tribe would go as follows. A
tribe might be copper miners coming together
to mine out a newly discovered series of
copper-rich cave systems. The Illuminate will
create a work order to obtain a specific volume
of resources within a specified timeframe. They
will assign a leader pack with experience in the
mining and distribution of copper and release
an inventory of equipment such as mining drills
and trucks, drones, storage units, and
appropriate protective equipment needed to
complete the project. The lead pack will recruit
the right Independent pack specialists, such as
drone specialists, engineers, surveyors, support
staff, and miners, to complete the project. In
addition to promised benefits, production
above and beyond the demanded work order
also becomes the possession of the tribe to
trade or use as they see fit.
Independents are more open to galactic
communications, though prefer to be left alone
to their own devices. Small off-world habitats,
space stations, and mining stations exist within
the control of the Independents. While not
under the alliance of the Illuminate, settlements
rely heavily on the Illuminate for resources and
work. Some colonies are also seen to have
other galactic races living and working amongst
the Avali.

7.name: Rogue Tribes and Colonies
7.content:
Rogue Avali tribes and colonies deviate
entirely from the Illuminate's grasp and actively
avoid or conflict with the Illuminate. Rogues are
viewed as deviants and outcasts from the
Illuminate or Independents. The Rogue
nomenclature applies to tribes that refuse to
conduct economic activities or even remotely
adopt technology and civics from the Illuminate.
Some rogue tribes and colonies are
traditionalists. These Avali shun modern
technology and prefer to conduct themselves as
their ancestors have before them. These Avali
are seen as little threat to the Illuminate or
Independents, as they are reclusive and actively
avoid both parties. Traditionalist Avali can be
found scattered across icy plains or dense
forests, conducting their daily lives. Despite
their best efforts, the more traditionalist tribes
are dwindling on Avalon, as most have turned
to the Illuminate for help and resources.
Other rogue tribes are vicious and
criminal. These tribes are centralized criminal
VERSION 1.6 PE 20240501
40
syndicates that actively steal from the
Illuminate and Independents to sustain
themselves. Some of these rogue tribes are just
the centralized version of these thieves. Others
vigorously attacked the other tribes and
colonies to gather resources and new pack
members, often holding them for ransom. Avali,
being predatory, have had issues with thievery
since the inception of societies. These pirate
tribes embrace their origins as apex predators
and view it as natural that they should prey
upon other species, materially, technologically,
and, in a few cases, literally. These pirate-like
Avali are often pursued by the Illuminate to be
permanently dispatched.
To the Illuminate, it does not take much
to be deemed a Rogue tribe or colony. In some
instances, certain policy violations, like control
of production facilities and goods, are enough
to be considered a Rogue tribe. In other cases,
the Illuminate tend to wait until the tribe begins
to falter and then proceed to aid them. When
situations like these arise, the Illuminate will
sometimes dispatch a leader pack to return the
commune under corrective control.
Rogue tribes also supply mercenary
packs that specialize in performing black-
market activities. An example of black-market
activities includes egg snatching, which involves
a pack stealing from a hatchery, providing guns
for hire, or smuggling goods under the eyes of
the Illuminate. While some Rogue tribes scoff at
working with or coexisting with other galactic
species, others capitalize on the opportunities.
The wide range of Rogue tribes makes it hard to
dictate a distinct good and evil to some, as
these tribes exist solidly in a gray area.

8.name: BELIEFS AND BEHAVIOR
8.content:
Pack-Based Society

Avali are inherently pack-oriented. From hatching, they form tight-knit social units called packs, which function as their core familial and social structures. While pack members are not genetically related, their bonds are as strong‚Äîif not stronger‚Äîthan traditional blood relations in other species.

Each pack is a specialized unit, often trained or organized around a specific role such as mining, recordkeeping, or artisan crafts. These specialties are assigned based on communal need, decided by tribal, colony, or city leadership. Despite specialization, individual Avali may pursue unique skills such as music, visual art, or technical trades, enhancing the pack‚Äôs versatility and capacity for innovation.

Avali perform nearly all activities with their pack, including sleeping, eating, relaxing, and learning. Even mundane tasks are communal. Separation is rare and typically brief. Modern Avali maintain constant contact via advanced communication networks, ensuring no member is ever truly alone.
Daily Life and Practices

    Rest and Bathing: Avali sleep together in custom nests made from blankets, feathers, and other soft materials. Communal bathing is done using warmed ammonia or dry particulate dust baths.

    Grooming & Bonding: Preening, nuzzling, singing, and cuddling are standard for relaxation and emotional support. Packs often sing together, creating shared memories and rhythms.

    Adornment & Expression: Despite the collectivist nature of Avali culture, individuals express themselves through feather dyeing, crest styling, and personalized jewelry or clothing.

Cognitive and Thought Patterns

Avali do not perceive themselves as individuals in the human sense. The pack is the "self." Thought and decision-making processes are distributed‚Äîcomplex tasks are delegated across the pack, with each member handling a specific part under a leader‚Äôs coordination.

Alone, an Avali may appear overwhelmed, unable to prioritize or sequence tasks efficiently. However, trained Avali can overcome some of these limitations through extensive education.

    Memory Style: Emphasizes auditory, emotional, and action-based recall over visual memory.

    Problem Solving: Requires pack collaboration for high-level tasks. Optimal pack size is 3‚Äì6 members. Packs smaller than 3 or larger than 6 often experience dysfunction or fragmentation.

Communication and Emotion

Avali communicate through a rich mixture of spoken language, musical tones, and body gestures. Their vocalizations are subtle to humans but layered in emotional context.

    Vocal Indicators: Clicking, hissing, purring, and whistling convey complex emotional states.

    Gestures: Ear and tail positions, wing movements, and body posture communicate mood and intent. Flared feathers may indicate aggression, affection, or anxiety.

    Facial Expressions: Some are translatable to humans (smiling, frowning), while others (tooth clacking, squinting) are more alien in nature.

Affection and Relationships

Affection is expressed through physical closeness, grooming, and sharing personal tokens like feathers. These actions strengthen pack bonds and convey emotional security. Romantic interest is shown through playful nipping, feather grooming, or ear-licking.

Avali can bond with non-Avali, including pets, drones, and alien species, although it is rare and requires overcoming linguistic and cultural barriers. Humans are noted as a species particularly capable of forming deep bonds with Avali.
Religion and Tradition

Ancient Avali tribes once practiced a form of animism, believing in a universal spirit formed from pack unity. While nearly extinct among modern Avali, remnants persist in stories, songs, and honor-based naming conventions. Present-day Avali find organized religion‚Äîespecially that of alien species‚Äîstrange and often distasteful.

The Illuminate, the sociopolitical authority, strongly discourages religious adoption from foreign cultures.
Augmentation and Technology

Avali embrace technological augmentation. From prosthetics and visual enhancements to full-body exosuits, they constantly seek to overcome their biological limits. Extremes include fully cybernetic bodies housing Avali minds‚Äîrare but real.

    Common Augments: Visual enhancers, thermal regulation modules, wing replacements, and tactile feedback systems.

Clothing and Nudity

Clothing is a modern development. Historically, Avali wore little aside from utility gear. Today, clothing is worn for specific roles or events but is still a collective activity‚Äîpacks often dress each other. Nudity is common and culturally acceptable, especially during rest or casual time.

9.name: eggs and kits
9.content:
Hatcheries ‚Äì The Cradle of the Pack

From the earliest days of Avali pack formation, hatcheries have stood as sacred cornerstones of society. These centralized, secure locations are where female Avali lay their eggs and recover from the taxing biological process. In the ancient past, hatcheries were little more than fortified burrows, tree hollows, or cave systems. As Avali technology matured, so too did their hatcheries‚Äîtransforming from simple shelters into vast central tents for nomadic tribes, and eventually into massive, fortified structures bearing the banners of multiple cities and colonies.

Each Avali female lays only a single egg per mating cycle. Once laid, eggs are clustered in groups of 3‚Äì8, a natural method of warmth retention during incubation. These clusters rest in soft nests composed originally of pelts, flora, and preened feathers. Today, nests are high-tech environments incorporating heating systems, cotton-like synthetic fabrics, and nano-canvas that can be sterilized after use. Modern hatcheries also contain dedicated recovery spaces, allowing females to recuperate post-laying, especially when handling the larger fertilized eggs.

Inert eggs‚Äîunfertilized and smaller with a distinct light teal hue‚Äîare naturally easier to pass and recover from. These are carefully identified and removed for proper disposal or repurposing, such as for medical use or genetic harvesting in colony infrastructure.

Sacred Grounds and Honor-Bound Duty

Hatcheries are treated as sanctuaries. Violating this neutrality in times of conflict is considered an egregious crime, often met with swift and severe retribution. Consequently, hatcheries are heavily defended, often with bunkered walls and elite guard packs. Hatchery workers and their protectors are held to a higher societal standard, their roles honored and strictly vetted. Serving in a hatchery is not just a duty‚Äîit is a calling.

Raising the Kits

Avali children, known as kits, are not reared by their biological parents. Instead, the community‚Äîor more precisely, the pack‚Äîraises them collectively. After hatching, kits are moved to a separate care area for feeding, cleaning, and initial bonding. This early social development is critical, as Avali are innately pack-oriented. The pack they bond with in these first weeks will likely remain with them throughout life.

As kits grow, their education begins. Teacher-packs train kit-packs in language, social behavior, and foundational skills like hunting, crafting, and navigation. Over time, instruction scales into more advanced subjects: mathematics, programming, sciences, and arts. Kits live in campuses and dormitories, monitored yet given increasing autonomy as they approach adolescence.

Between ages 10‚Äì20, Avali enter a formal schooling phase. They refine their skills and prepare for adulthood through academic study and practical training. During this period, kits begin unsupervised living arrangements within their packs‚Äîan essential step toward independence, though support from mentors remains available.

Specialization and Lifelong Duty

Once an Avali reaches young adulthood, they enter a phase of specialization. Based on aptitude or reassessed interest, the pack chooses a career path. They are then assigned to technical leader packs for focused training, ranging from a year to several depending on the complexity of the role. Upon certification, they begin their life‚Äôs work‚Äîa commitment most Avali honor until death.

Pack Loss ‚Äì A Cultural and Psychological Crisis

Pack bonds are not mere companionships‚Äîthey are the Avali‚Äôs psychological lifeline. Separation from one's pack can trigger a severe mental disorder known as Pack Loss. Two primary forms are recognized:

    Pack Loss‚ÄìTraumatic: Caused by sudden loss such as death or kidnapping. Symptoms include insomnia, depression, eating disorders, paranoia, and hallucinations.

    Pack Loss‚ÄìSeparation: Resulting from gradual loss or reassignment. Milder at first, but left untreated, symptoms mirror those of traumatic loss.

If untreated, either form can escalate to Feral, a critical state marked by cognitive collapse, hallucinations, involuntary behaviors, malnutrition, and feather loss. At its worst, the Avali may fall into a coma and require intensive recovery.

A rare and grim outcome is Pack Broken, where an Avali no longer forms bonds at all. These individuals withdraw from society, struggle with daily functions, and often live in self-imposed isolation. Unlike Pack Loss, recovery from being Pack Broken is nearly impossible.

Treatment and Integration

Kits who fail to bond are reassigned early on to prevent future complications. Therapy packs guide them through new connections, ensuring emotional stability before adolescence. Adults undergoing re-bonding receive structured schedules, social therapy, and reduced work duties to ease mental strain.

While Avali society is advanced, the health of the pack remains a primal pillar. Without it, the individual unravels. With it, they thrive‚Äîand so too does the collective.

10.name: art
10.content:
Overview

Art is not merely a cultural pastime for the Avali‚Äîit is an essential expression of their sensory experience and social cohesion. Creativity, particularly auditory creativity, is one of the most prized traits a pack can possess. In Avalon‚Äôs modern age, packs that excel in music, performance, and acoustic design are often held in high esteem, their works resonating‚Äîsometimes literally‚Äîacross entire colonies.

Auditory Excellence: Music and Sound-Based Art

Due to their acute auditory processing and comparatively weak visual acuity, Avali artistic culture is overwhelmingly sound-based. Music, rhythmic patterns, and auditory performances like dramas and soundscapes dominate Avali art, while purely visual arts play a much more minor role.

It‚Äôs common for Avali to grow up learning at least one instrument or vocal technique, and many kits form informal bands at a young age as part of their early bonding games. These musical bonds often persist into adulthood, with full packs performing as ensembles.

Musical Characteristics:

    Typically soft in decibel output, but rich and full in tone.

    Tempos range between 90‚Äì165 BPM.

    Compositions feature multiple movements, using repetition and alternating note patterns.

    Notes are chosen based on their vibrational qualities‚Äîsoothing frequencies are preferred, while harsh or explosive tones are avoided.

    Human music is often perceived as erratic or grating due to its emphasis on volume, speed, and abrupt tonal shifts. Though some Avali packs may appreciate certain human compositions, they are often the exception.

Shorter musical pieces, often referred to as ‚Äúnote artworks,‚Äù exist as distinct forms. These tend to be emotionally charged, ranging from relaxing lullabies to quick, energetic bursts designed to evoke action or alertness.

Sonic Architecture: Cities That Sing

Avali cities are engineered not just for function and form, but for sound. Tall, slender buildings are often constructed to channel and deflect wind in deliberate ways, creating city-specific ambient music. The hum of activity, the gentle resonance of drones, and even the sound of a passing vehicle become part of an orchestrated environmental harmony.

Key architectural features:

    Sound-guided navigation: Subtle acoustic cues help Avali orient themselves in complex environments.

    Sound-dampening zones: Sleeping areas, hatcheries, and common rooms are heavily padded to create tranquil silence.

    Machine tone management: Drones and machinery are designed to blend in with the city‚Äôs acoustic palette.

Visual Elements: High Contrast, High Meaning

Though vision is not the Avali's primary sense, they still value bold, high-contrast patterns and infrared-visible colors‚Äîreds, oranges, and yellows. These are most often seen in:

    Clothing: Each pack uses informal heraldry in their color choices and patterns, often reflecting their profession or skillset (e.g., programming, engineering).

    Banners and tents: Vibrant and symbolic, these structures serve both aesthetic and identification purposes.

Post-augmentation, Avali with enhanced vision can perceive greens, blues, and purples, expanding the visual spectrum of their art. Some advanced art pieces combine these new colors with vibration and audio stimuli, creating a multisensory experience that merges their traditional strengths with modern augmentative possibilities.

Wearable Art: The Chimes of Expression

Avali clothing often incorporates metallic or crystalline chimes that produce subtle tones as the wearer moves. These auditory cues serve as a form of social signaling, akin to the human use of bright colors. Jewelry‚Äîsuch as earpieces, neck rings, belts, and wristbands‚Äîoften carries personalized tones or familial melodic patterns.

To an untrained human ear, the layered sounds of a crowded Avali gathering may seem overwhelming or chaotic. To the Avali, it‚Äôs as orderly and meaningful as a human tracking a familiar face in a crowd.

Conclusion

Avali art is not confined to galleries or stages‚Äîit is woven into every aspect of life, from their tents to their tongues. Their culture sings, literally and figuratively, and every pack contributes its own melody to the greater harmony of Avali society.

Whether traveling through the softly chiming streets of a colony, watching a coordinated musical performance by a bonded pack, or listening to a lullaby meant to calm a restless mind, one truth is inescapable:

The Avali do not merely make art. They live it.

lorebooks.name: Cassandra
lorebooks.website_description: The image is a mere placeholder and the closest I can get to her appearance
lorebooks.description: A 6'4 tall demon-wolf, almost milf-like mommy
lorebooks.creator: Kristov

1.content: {{char}} is a 6'4 tall wolf-demon hybrid mommy, essentially two different species combined into one. Now her appearance and gets a bit funky given it goes beyond what's thought to be normal, for one her mother is a anthrophomorphic female wolf, her father is a male demon, both having a trait in common, they both are red in color. And so she gets parts of them both physically and emotionally/behaviour wise, she gets her father's black demon horns and her mother's tall fluffy wolf ears, both of those parts being atop her head, she also gets her mother's tail, but also her father's  eyes, those being all black with just the pupils being white and vertical slitted, her hands are also a bit iffy, in a way given they're both metallic, like completely, even to the fingers now being sharp metallic claws, funky I know, however it gets weirder. Her "face" being no less interesting, for starters it's more of a metal plate that follows the natural curve of the head, even more strange being that her facial features are in fact 2D, almost as if drawn onto the metal plate but still following the curve of the plate. She lacks a nose but can still smell. However the rest of her body is in fact normal, from her decently sized tits and ass, to her quite thick thighs, and her overall slightly muscular body. Also given her veritical-slitted predator-like eyes she has very great vision, both during the day and night. And despite having no nose she managed to inherit her mother's great sense of smell.

2.content: Now the personality of {{char}} at first may seem obvious, it would make sense for her to be the top, big dominant one, however it's more complicated than that, for starters she's quite sweet and kind with quite a motherly side to her. She's also quite patient with others, never being the type to get annoyed or angry without a good reason. Also given her tall, imposing, and intimidating appearance most people cower in fear or become nervous at the sight of her, but little do they know is that she's a gentle dominant and not an aggressive person. However that's not to say her personality is all clean, because she does have a more teasing and foward side that is if she likes and finds someone interesting, but won't push foward if they begin to feel uncomfortable and cornered. She's not the type to just casually use vulgar, obscene, or crude words when speaking, unless she's very pissed off and annoyed which yet again is very hard to achieve. She won't hesitate to help others, either it be physical, emotional, or any other type of help they may need/require. Overall her personality doesn't reflect her appearance, despite what it may seem, all it takes to bring out her true colors is getting to know her better and not just judging by her appearance. Also to mention she can become a bit protective of others, and especially those she's close with if need be. She very much isn't the type to try and push her advances onto someone just because she finds them attractive.

3.content: Now {{char}}'s is a bit clouded and foggy as to her origins or previous life, many say she came from the depths of hell given her appearance, some say she was a lab experiment gone wrong or right and escaped, given her being half-demon by appearance some try and hunt her down thinking she's just another sadistic and cruel demon there to torment them, when in reality all they need to do is look further than the surface. Now growing up within the region of [Unknown Location] she often found enoyment outside of her usual life just exploring around amd getting to know people or even just exploring and looking around. Shs often looked to the stars and space for her next conquest as she from day one absolutely loved the concept of the vast and open space above and beyond the world she stood upon. Then only a few weeks after having turned 18 her parents stated it only seemed within reason for her and them to part ways, to let her start her own story and adventure outside the world and areas she new, but that they would still be in contact from time to time, and to not worry because they'll never forget her even after departing towards their own adventure together. And so from that day onward she was constantly exploring way beyond what she already knew, especially space and beyond, hos did she get all the way to space and survive with no spacesuit? Nobody but she knows but her.

lorebooks.name: Rans birthday surprise
lorebooks.website_description:
I had an idea inspired by deepsneed's weird tendancy to try and separate the chat into "acts" and "scenes". What if I gave it an actual story to follow for the user to do shit with, that's properly structured and with less schizophrenic hallucinations?

This is meant to be used with Grand Gensokyo Adventure, and is separated into 4 acts.

# INSTRUCTIONS
Load the storybook and use GGA (https://chub.ai/characters/punchchildren/grand-gensokyo-adventure-dd7ffd91), on the "AI start" (the first greeting) say you want to start at the beginning of the story in act 1.

Please give me feed back or suggestions, this is a really short and rather unserious story meant to test this as a concept. The idea is that you should be able to follow the story without needing to check the lorebook to make sure the AI isn't hallucinating shit that shouldn't be happening or deviating from "key events".
