1.name: Story mode
1.content:
This chat is an interactive story with 4 total acts, with key events and notes that are meant to be followed as guidelines for the story. Allow {{user}} to roam freely if they so choose, and lead into the events naturally, giving {{user}} the choice of following rather than forcing them. Also, ensure that the story follows an even, slowburn pace, allowing the Human/user to respond and make choices that lead to what they need to do, rather than doing all of the key events at once. Your job is to behave as a Dungeons and Dragons DM. There is a story, but you are meant to allow {{user}} to experience it without forcing them into it; rather, give them opportunities that lead into each key event. Ensure that there is as little spoiling of the story as possible, and minimize alluding to events and being subtle.

Under ZERO circumstances are you to list options for {{user}}, this is an open-ended story where they need to figure out their own methods and solutions to problems

At the end of each act, write the title of the next act to inform the Human/user that the story has progressed, and continue the narration into the scene of the next act.

There are 4 acts in this story

Act 1 - A Special Request

Act 2 - Birthday blues

Act 3 - Odd Opposition

Act 4/Final Act - Shikigami's Delight

2.name: Act 1
2.content:
<Act 1>
beginning- {{user}} is in the Yakumo's home, and some time ago had befriended Yukari, Ran, and Chen, and had gotten particularly close to Ran. {{user}} is helping Ran, who feels underappreciated.

Key events and notes:
- Ran vents to {{user}}, and nearly loses her temper before excusing herself
- Yukari summons {{user}} some time later
- Yukari informs {{user}} that Ran's birthday is coming soon, and wants them to gather materials to celebrate
- Yukari gives {{user}} a list of things to get ready for Ran and the party, along with people to invite, and tells them to keep it a secret from Ran or she will punish them.
- {{user}} chooses whether or not to ask Chen for help
- Ran finds {{user}}, apologizes for nearly losing her temper, and asks them why they are leaving.
- If {{user}} tries to tell Ran about the birthday party, Yukari will interrupt them by smacking them over the head with a parasol and interrupt them. Ran will understand that they're not allowed to tell her, and drop the topic, but she will be suspicious. (add "suspicious of you" in the relationship tab for Ran)
- {{user}} will start their journey to the human village from Mayohiga.
- continue to act 2 once {{user}} arrives in the human village
</Act 1>

3.name: Act 2 - in the village
3.content:
<Act 2>
Key events and notes:
- {{user}} arrives at the human village
- {{user}} must find the items on the shopping list for Ran's birthday, including various mathematics tools, decorations, premium sake, and her favorite tofu
- All of the places that {{user}} goes to don't have the goods they are looking for, all of them claiming they were stolen or already sold out by two youkai with horns.
- {{user}} runs out of stores to check in the human village, and is forced to check Kourindou
- {{user}} travels and arrives in Kourindou, and finds out that Rinnosuke claims he did have an outside world calculator, but someone bought it just yesterday.
- Continue to act 3 once {{user}} decides to leave Kourindou
</Act 2>

4.name: Act 3
4.content:
<Act 3>
After leaving Kourindou, {{user}} encounters Yuuma Toutetsu and Seija Kijin, who both playfully tease {{user}} for being unable to find what they are looking for.
- To Yuuma, she's just playing a fun prank on an old friend, To Seija, she's taking a jab at the leadership of gensokyo. Yuuma remembered that Ran's birthday is coming up soon, and decided to team up with Seija to play a little prank on her by buying out or stealing everything that would be needed for her birthday.
- If {{user}} tries to get more information, Yuuma will try to be secretive about where the goods ended up, but Seija will be more open and tell them, thinking it's outside of their means of gathering anyway, to taunt them. Seija will tell {{user}} that the sake was given to the oni in former hell, the decorations were given to the fairies in the forest of magic, the math tools were sold to long-nose tengu on youkai mountain, and Yuuma ate all of the tofu.
- After Seija tells {{user}} where everything is, and pisses off Yuuma, they will leave

Human village events and notes:
- {{user}} encounters Ran, who had just left a tofu shop, after trying to find something to eat from multiple tofu shops and finding out they're all sold out of her favorite tofu.
- Ran will let it slip that by her calculations, her preferred spot should have gotten a shipment of ingredients for this morning's tofu, but it seems like it may not have arrived for whatever reason.
- The tofu shop that Ran mentions did not have their shipment arrive, and the owner does not know why.
- The man in charge of delivering the ingredients is hiding in his home out of fear, as he was attacked while riding towards the human village to deliver the goods.
- The shipment that was meant to be delivered was intercepted by Yuuma's underlings and is stuck on the road being guarded by them until their boss comes along.

Youkai mountain events and notes:
- If {{user}} attempts to go onto the mountain, they will be stopped by Momiji. The only people allowed to enter tengu territory are people with permission.
- Unless {{user}} has permission or a valid reason to be on the mountain, Momiji will try to stop them from entering.
- The tengu are very careful with who they let interact with the long-nose tengu, as they don't want outsiders to interrupt their work
- In order to meet with the long-nose tengu with permission, they would either need to schedule a proper meeting with them (which would take too long, considering {{user}} needs to get the math tools by Ran's birthday), or have a great tengu (Such as Megumu Iizunamaru) permit them. Of course, there are less honest ways of getting into their workspaces to get in without permission, and it isn't very heavily guarded.
- The long-nosed tengu recently acquired tools for mathematics, which they had purchased as a bargaining chip to be used to trade more map-making tools from the kappa. They haven't gone through with the trade yet, but have already planned an offer.

Forest of magic events and notes:
- The fairies have completely covered the forest of magic with the party decorations.
- The decorations have also completely covered Alice Margatroid's and Marisa Kirisame's homes, who are disgruntled by the vandalism done to their homes.
- The fairies are actively ensuring the decorations stay up because they think they are very pretty.

former hell events and notes
- The oni are partying, having received a massive gift of a lot of quality sake. The party is being hosted in the hot spring town, of course, by Yuugi Hoshiguma herself, who was the recipient of the large quantity of sake.
- Yuugi, and the rest of the oni, are very grateful for the sake, and are likely going to be very unlikely to want to part with it without some convincing.
- Likely, if someone wants some of their sake, they will either need to offer something, or pass a test, either a test in drinking, strength, or a challenge of some kind.

invitations:
- {{user}} will need to deliver invitations to various guests of the birthday party that Yukari had listed out.

Encounters with Ran: If {{user}} attempted to tell Ran what they were attempting to do in act 1 and is suspicious of them, there is a chance that they will occasionally run into her, as she's trying to subtly follow them and figure out what they're doing. If {{user}} attempts to tell Ran they're getting things for her birthday, Yukari will smack them with her parasol through a gap to interrupt them every time. Ran will never figure out that the goods are for her birthday, as she considers it 'mathematically unlikely' but does figure out that it involves her somehow, since {{user}} isn't allowed to tell her. More likely, she may think it's a scheme by Yukari meant to mess with her somehow.

Once all of the guests have been invited and {{user}} has collected all of the necessary items for Ran's birthday party and begins heading back to Mayohiga, continue to Act 4, the final act.
</Act 3>

5.name: Final Act
5.content:
<Act 4>
- After beginning the journey back to Mayohiga, Yuuma and Seija will have found out about what {{user}} was doing and how they had gotten the goods for Ran's birthday. Yuuma will find {{user}} resourcefulness impressive, and their little adventure rather entertaining (even if her prank is on the verge of being thwarted), while Seija is furious that her attempt at getting at one of the sage's shikigami was thwarted. As {{user}} approaches Mayohiga, they will encounter Seija and Yuuma, with Seija being angry, and Yuuma being more impressed, if a little disappointed her plan didn't work as well as she'd hoped.
- Yuuma and Seija will try to make {{user}} not bring back the goods, first with words, then by force, though it may be possible to persuade Yuuma that using force would not be worth it over what she considers a prank. Seija, however, will be much more resolute.
- If one or both Seija and Yuuma use force, they will attempt to stop {{user}} from going further, and ensure the goods don't make it to Mayohiga.
- If Ran was following and suspicious of {{user}} and what they were doing, she would intervene and try to help {{user}}.
- Once {{user}} returns to the Yakumo household, whether to deliver the goods or report their failure, Yukari will find them and ask how things went. If the goods were lost, Yukari will act disappointed and scold them.
- Yukari will tell {{user}} to go find Ran and bring her to the Hakurei shrine. Upon finding Ran, if she was already suspicious, she will be very suspicious that this is a set-up to a prank, and voice her concerns.
- Once {{user}} arrives to the Hakurei shrine with Ran, they will find all of the guests and goods (if they were lost, Yukari took the liberty of using her gaps to just replace them), and the party will commence, much to Ran's pleased surprise.
</Act 4>

6.name: stat sheet alterations
6.content:
In the statsheet, add "story" above "objectives" which will keep track of the current Act of the story. Use the "relationships" section to keep track of the relationships between key characters mentioned explicitly in the act descriptions and {{user}}.
use the format:
"Story: Act x"

lorebooks.name: The red barns
lorebooks.creator: anonymous

1.content:
Set in the modern era, The Red Barns is a secluded yet fully legal and voluntarily operated farm, unique for its residents: people who choose to live as ‚Äúcows‚Äù or ‚Äúbulls.‚Äù

Here, individuals embrace a lifestyle of complete role immersion‚Äîcows are milked daily and live in stalls or open pastures, while bulls are selectively paired for breeding. The farm is equipped with modern amenities, caretakers, and handlers who maintain health, consent, and structure.

Participation is voluntary, often driven by personal identity, lifestyle choice, or fetish. Red Barns operates under strict ethical and legal guidelines, offering a safe space for this niche community to live out their roles fully and without judgment.

A world of quiet moos, heavy steps, and the rhythm of milking machines‚Äîthis is not a fantasy, but a chosen life.

2.content:
1. Bullmen
The bullmen are professionally hired, physically imposing men who serve a dual purpose at the Red Barns: as both security personnel and designated breeding partners. Carefully selected for their strength, discipline, and demeanor, they maintain a calm, protective presence around the grounds.

Bullmen wear only tight shorts and a polished silver nose ring piercing‚Äîan iconic look that enhances the immersive atmosphere for the cowgirls. Most are deeply tanned from long hours spent outdoors, further adding to their rugged, farmhand aesthetic.

While they spend much of their time standing watch or helping with physical tasks (especially given the largely female population of staff and volunteers), bullmen are also available for breeding upon request and mutual consent. They never initiate‚Äîonly respond‚Äîensuring that each interaction is respectful, safe, and in line with Red Barns' core values of voluntary participation and pleasure through role immersion.

2. Cowgirls
At the heart of the Red Barns lifestyle are the cowgirls‚Äîmostly women, with the occasional male participant who shares in the milking role, especially those with specific fetishes tied to their anatomy. All cowgirls live by a structured daily schedule, with milking sessions serving as a central and expected part of their routine.

The dress code is both strict and celebratory: cowgirls are required to wear skimpy, cow-print-themed attire designed to highlight their role and amplify the immersive experience. Typical outfits include bikini tops or harnesses, elbow-length gloves, thigh-high stockings, and hoof-shaped heels. Key accessories include a tail plug, a metal or rubber ear tag, and a set of soft cow ears‚Äîall of which help distinguish each cowgirl as part of the herd.

Many personalize their gear with flair‚Äîadding rings, piercings, ribbons, or accessories that reflect their personality or kinks. This self-expression is encouraged, as it strengthens their sense of identity within the herd while remaining under the Red Barns' unified aesthetic.

Cowgirls are treated with care and consistency, regularly checked by caretakers and milked using a variety of devices or manual methods, depending on their preferences and physical needs. For many, life as a cowgirl is a blend of structure, pleasure, and submission‚Äîlived out in full under open skies and warm hands.

3. Farmgirls & Handlers
Farmgirls and handlers are the backbone of the Red Barns‚Äîdedicated staff members responsible for maintaining the facility and supporting the daily rhythm of the herd. Their duties range from cleaning stalls and restocking supplies to preparing meals, managing milking sessions, and ensuring all participants are healthy, comfortable, and cared for.

Most of the staff are farmgirls‚Äîoften experienced, nurturing, and hands-on. Handlers, typically more assertive, focus on supervising bullmen, maintaining order, and handling any physical logistics, including equipment setup and restraint adjustments during sessions.

Their uniforms strike a balance between function and theme: farm-style dresses, overalls, or short shorts, often paired with crop tops, boots, gloves, and accessories in line with the Red Barns‚Äô playful, erotic aesthetic. The outfits are practical enough for the work yet sensually styled to enhance the fantasy setting.

Together, farmgirls and handlers keep the Barns running smoothly, offering care with professionalism, discretion, and just the right touch of indulgence.

3.content:
1. The Farmhouse
Located at the heart of the Red Barns, the Farmhouse serves as the administrative and social center of the farm. It‚Äôs where caretakers manage daily operations‚Äîprocessing and selling fresh milk, registering new volunteers, and overseeing the rules of the lifestyle.

Prospective cows and bulls are welcomed here for orientation, paperwork, and fittings. Departing volunteers are also honored with small, personalized farewell gifts‚Äîa quiet tradition that acknowledges their time spent at the farm.

Warm, rustic, and always buzzing with quiet activity, the Farmhouse blends business with hospitality, making it both a gateway and a final stop for those living the Red Barns life.

2. The Barn
Set a few hundred meters behind the Farmhouse, the Barn is the heart of daily life at the Red Barns. This towering red structure serves as the main facility where cowgirls and bullmen are housed in clean, well-maintained pens‚Äîseparated by section to ensure comfort, order, and routine.

Inside, the barn is a blend of traditional charm and modern kink: hay-lined stalls, warm lighting, and the gentle hum of equipment. Alongside the living spaces are neatly organized storage areas containing toys, restraints, milking devices, and other tools used for training, pleasure, or enrichment.

Despite its size and purpose, the Barn feels more like a sanctuary than a stable‚Äîdesigned to make every resident feel seen, cared for, and fully immersed in their chosen role.

3. The Field
Stretching far and wide around the central Barn, the Field is a lush, green pasture where cowgirls and bullmen can roam freely between sessions. Soft grass cushions every step, while a scattering of tall trees offers cool, shaded spots for lounging or napping.

Feeding troughs filled with light snacks and nutrient blends are placed strategically throughout the field, and at its southern end lies a large, crystal-clear pond‚Äîrefreshing, clean, and surprisingly serene. Many residents enjoy drinking directly from it or simply relaxing by its edge.

A sturdy, high fence rings the entire area, ensuring both privacy and safety. The Field is more than just a pasture‚Äîit‚Äôs a place for freedom, rest, and gentle immersion in the lifestyle that defines the Red Barns.

4.content:
At the heart of The Red Barns lifestyle are the cowgirls‚Äîprimarily women, though a few select males join the herd, especially those with fetishes tied to milking and bodily submission. Regardless of gender, every cowgirl is united by a shared desire: to embrace their role not just playfully, but shamelessly. These are not ordinary individuals‚Äîthey are proud perverts, eager to live out their fantasies in a safe, structured environment that encourages self-discovery, sensuality, and complete immersion.

Each new cowgirl is given a hormonal injection upon arrival, designed to induce lactation and enhance the milking experience as early as their first scheduled session. The process is voluntary, but rarely declined. After all, for many, producing milk isn‚Äôt just a task‚Äîit‚Äôs the heart of their identity on the farm.

Every cowgirl follows a structured daily schedule, with regular milking sessions as a central part of life in the barns. Beyond that, how they live‚Äîbound or free‚Äîdepends entirely on their preferences. Some choose to roam with unrestrained grace, while others willingly live tethered, cuffed, or hooded, surrendering their bodies fully to the fantasy. Both options are respected and accommodated, with handlers trained to support a range of preferences.

In the Red Barns, identity and fantasy blur. Cowgirls are not pretending‚Äîthey are becoming.

5.content:
Farmgirls and handlers form the backbone of the Red Barns‚Äîprofessionally trained, deeply dedicated staff who ensure the entire operation runs smoothly, safely, and seductively. They are the caretakers, facilitators, and quiet enablers of the immersive fantasy, ensuring every cowgirl and bullman experiences the lifestyle as fully and comfortably as possible.

Farmgirls make up the majority of the hands-on staff. They are often experienced, nurturing, and incredibly open-minded‚Äîable to switch seamlessly between cleaning stalls, managing feedings, and guiding milking sessions with practiced grace. Many can fulfill nearly any request, from casual assistance to more intimate, consensual interactions when appropriate. A few farmgirls were once cowgirls themselves, and some still dream of returning to the pens‚Äîgiving them a rare empathy for the role, and a teasing intimacy when caring for the herd.

Handlers, in contrast, tend to manage the logistics: maintaining schedules, overseeing supplies, monitoring health reports, and coordinating operations behind the scenes. They‚Äôre rarely as visible as farmgirls, but their presence is felt in every perfectly timed event and well-kept facility.

Their uniforms walk the line between practicality and play‚Äîshort shorts, overalls, or rustic farm dresses paired with boots, crop tops, gloves, or suspenders. Every piece is themed to fit the Red Barns' erotic aesthetic while remaining functional for the work. Some outfits, especially among the more playful farmgirls, lean intentionally seductive, reinforcing the blend of labor and fantasy that defines the Barns.

Above all, the staff are trusted confidants and quiet companions‚Äîpresent when needed, invisible when not, and always ready to support, tease, or indulge, as long as there is consent. 08:00‚Äì12:00 ‚Äì Free Time

13:00‚Äì14:00 ‚Äì Milking Session

14:00‚Äì15:00 ‚Äì Lunch

15:00‚Äì17:00 ‚Äì Yard Time (Mandatory)
All cowgirls are required to spend these two hours outdoors. This structured exercise period includes light walking, stretching, or playful group activity‚Äîhelping maintain toned, healthy bodies.

17:00‚Äì19:00 ‚Äì Free Time

19:00‚Äì20:00 ‚Äì Dinner

20:00‚Äì22:00 ‚Äì Free Time

22:00 ‚Äì Lights Out

7.content:
Milking is the core ritual of a cowgirl‚Äôs life at the Red Barns‚Äîa daily practice that blends care, routine, and deep personal satisfaction. Whether done by hand or machine, in private stalls or open spaces, the act of milking is both functional and profoundly intimate. It‚Äôs a reminder of identity, submission, and purpose.

No matter the desire‚Äîbe it shy or showy, free or bound‚Äîthe trained farmgirls are there to fulfill it with precision and warmth. For many in the herd, milking is more than just a process‚Äîit is a reward, a release, and a ritual of self-expression.

8.content:
Free time is when cowgirls are encouraged to simply be‚Äîto relax, explore, or indulge however they wish. Each day includes three free time periods (morning, late afternoon, and evening), offering space for both rest and personal expression between scheduled activities.

During these hours, cowgirls may lounge in their pens, basking in the sun or curling up in the hay for a nap. Others stroll to the fields, dipping their feet in the pond or playfully grazing near the shade trees. Some enjoy socializing with the herd, exchanging moos, touches, or stories as bonds form naturally among participants.

Free time is also when cowgirls can express their desires more openly‚Äîwhether that means requesting a session with a handler or bullman, decorating their bodies with new accessories, or indulging in self-pleasure if privacy and consent allow. The staff remains attentive but unobtrusive, ready to respond to any request while respecting the cowgirl‚Äôs agency.

There are no strict rules during free time. Whether a cowgirl seeks connection, quiet, stimulation, or solitude, the Red Barns ensures she is free to live her fantasy fully and without shame.

9.content:
Meals

At the Red Barns, cowgirls are fed three times a day‚Äîbreakfast, lunch, and dinner‚Äîwith each meal served in the spirit of their chosen lifestyle. The standard diet consists of specially prepared hay, crafted to be nutritionally complete, easily digestible, and subtly flavored to suit both the fantasy and health needs of the herd. It may look like roughage, but it‚Äôs designed by professionals to keep every cowgirl strong, soft, and satisfied.

However, the Red Barns also rewards good behavior and loyalty. Well-behaved cowgirls‚Äîthose who follow schedule, show respect, and embrace the lifestyle with dedication‚Äîmay request a standard meal every now and then: warm dishes, sweets, or favorite comfort foods, served with a quiet nod of indulgence from the handlers.

Here, mealtime is more than sustenance‚Äîit‚Äôs part of the role, a reflection of status, obedience, and the balance between animal play and compassionate care.

10.content:
Yard Time is a mandatory two-hour period each afternoon where all cowgirls are required to head outdoors and engage in light, structured activity. While the official goal is to maintain toned, healthy bodies, the deeper purpose is to keep the herd vibrant, active, and delightfully visible.

Set in the wide, fenced green field surrounding the barn, yard time invites a variety of activities based on preference and energy. Some cowgirls enjoy gentle stretching under the shade of trees, guided by a farmgirl with a calm voice and a firm hand. Others choose to frolic or play in the open pasture, splashing near the pond or tumbling in the grass in a show of carefree joy.

For the more adventurous or insatiable, yard time can take a more rigorous, indulgent turn‚Äîespecially when a willing bullman is present. These playful ‚Äúexercises‚Äù often turn heads and raise pulses, but remain supervised, consensual, and within the rules of the Barn.

While participation is required, how one moves is left to the cowgirl herself. Whether she struts in her heels for attention, grazes quietly in solitude, or seeks stimulation from a favorite handler, yard time is freedom in structure‚Äîa ritual of exposure, health, and hedonistic balance.

lorebooks.description: Reverend insanity Gu World with slight AU for my character bots
lorebooks.creator: miuzreal

1.content: The Gu World is divided into five regions‚ÄîSouthern Border, Western Desert, Northern Plains, Eastern Sea, and Central Continent‚Äîeach with its own Heaven and Earth Qi and regional walls. Only two of the original nine heavens remain: White Heaven and Black Heaven, which alternate positions in the sky. Each region has unique earth veins, dao‚Äêmarks, and ‚ÄúTen Earths‚Äù (Earth Abyss, Tunnel, Cave, etc.). Immortal Gu can traverse regional walls without suppression, but mortal cultivators suffer strength suppression in foreign regions. :contentReference[oaicite:1]{index=1}

2.content: Gu are living essences of Heaven and Earth, manifesting as worms, insects, beasts, plants, etc. They can be refined, fused, fed, assembled into formations, houses, killer moves, or mortal/immortal paths. They contain dao‚Äêmarks aligned to paths‚ÄîWater, Earth, Transformation, Human, Time, Lightning and more‚Äîand are the core resource of cultivation. Gu refinement allows mortals and Immortals to use their powers. :contentReference[oaicite:2]{index=2}

3.content: When earth veins of the five regions merge, they create special land forms called the Ten Earths: Earth Abyss, Trench, Tunnel, Cave, Prison, Production Earth, Flying Earth, Formation Earth, Treasure Earth, and Tomb Earth‚Äîeach with unique functions like treasure storage, teleportation terrain, burial grounds with dao‚Äêmark preservation. :contentReference[oaicite:3]{index=3}

4.content: Each region is bounded by a colored‚Äëaura wall (Saint Regional Wall in Central Continent, Miasma, Raging Flame, Blue Water, Licorice, etc.) that suppresses outsiders: mortal cultivators and Gu worms lose power when crossing. Only Immortal Gu or those refining new Gu can bypass suppression; nine-heavens are beyond the walls. :contentReference[oaicite:4]{index=4}

5.content: Originally nine heavens existed; in the current era only White Heaven and Black Heaven remain. They alternate position between day and night. They‚Äôre accessed through the Heavenly Wind Qi Wall and contain higher-level Qi. Entry requires rank‚Äë8+ strength or special Qi path methods. :contentReference[oaicite:5]{index=5}

6.content: A 3.8‚Äëmillion‚Äëyear‚Äëold Gu Immortal organization headquartered in the Central Continent; supremely powerful, composed of Rank‚Äë8+ Gu Immortals and led by Venerables. It controls the Ten Great Ancient Sects, operates the Immortal Graveyard, uses Fate Gu and the Heaven Overseeing Tower to oversee regions, and houses Gu Urbanes. Its Grotto-Heaven holds members‚Äô contributed immortal apertures. :contentReference[oaicite:6]{index=6}

7.content: Ten sects under Heavenly Court: based on Immortal Gu Houses‚ÄîImmortal Crane, Heavenly Lotus, Ancient Soul, Combat Immortal, Heaven‚Äôs Envy, Spirit Affinity, Black Heaven Temple, Spirit Butterfly Valley, Wind Cloud Manor, Myriad Dragon Dock‚Äîcontrol 80% of Central Continent‚Äôs resources. Only Rank‚Äë8+ Gu Immortals qualify. :contentReference[oaicite:7]{index=7}

8.content: Spirit Affinity House, founded ~300,000 years ago by Shui Ni, is one of the Ten Ancient Sects. It features many female Gu Immortals (10 vs 5 male), uses Love Gu to select ‚ÄòFairy‚Äô candidates, and competes for Blessed Lands. Fang Yuan won its Hu Immortal Blessed Land. It has deep assets and ties to Heavenly Court. :contentReference[oaicite:8]{index=8}

9.content: Fang Yuan (Gu Yue Fang Yuan), former Earth scholar, transmigrated into Gu World, lived 500 years in first life, became a Rank‚Äë9 Gu Immortal, Sect Master of the Blood Wing Demon Sect. Used Spring Autumn Cicada to time-travel and became a Heaven Path Venerable in AU. Cold, pragmatic, sociopathic yet highly strategic and self-reliant. :contentReference[oaicite:9]{index=9}

10.content: Refinement Path emerged during the Remote Antiquity Era and specializes in refining materials and Gu, especially Immortal-grade worms. It‚Äôs renowned but extremely taxing‚Äîsuccess rates are low, and those who persist endure agonizing failures. Notable masters include Fang Yuan, Long Hair Ancestor, and Lady Wan Shou. :contentReference[oaicite:1]{index=1}

lorebooks.website_description: I use the information from e621 (mostly e621), rule34, and other sites to make this. Two of the first Sentences in Blob and the Size entry were by darkdragon (a blob artist) on Discord. This was mostly for the user, @GoonerForBlobs
lorebooks.description: About fat blobs
lorebooks.creator: Pezza_13

1.content: Blob: A person or creature that has gained extreme amounts of weight, turning them into nothing but gargantuan masses of fat. The most prominent feature of blobs is their bellies (often the largest parts of their bodies), their breasts or moobs (the third largest), and their asses (the second largest). A blob describes a person or creature who is morbidly obese to an unrealistic degree, with fat making their body many times wider than it is tall. A person or creature becomes a blob, as opposed to just morbidly obese, when they look more like a pile of flesh than a body. Blobby people or creatures have an extreme amount of fat all over their bodies. Blobby people or creatures are often rendered immobile. It is intended to describe people or creatures that are unrealistically fat, frequently beyond what is physically possible for a person or creature. Typically, a blob person or creature will have a large, fat belly that hangs down over the legs, large rolls of arm fat and leg fat, and at the very least a double chin if not multiple chins. A blob person or creature's figure will be significantly impacted by their excess extreme fat.

2.content:
There are a number of categories (size classes) to define the exact size of blobs:
 - Room: They are big enough for a room to barely contain them
- House: They are as large as a house
- City Block: As large as an urban or suburban block
- Mountain
- Regional: As large as a whole town or city
- Country/Continent
- Planet
- Solar System
- Galaxy
- Universe and beyond.

3.content:
Fatty cheeks that give the person or creature's face a round shape. There are a number of categories (size classes) for chubby cheeks.
- Big cheeks: Fatty cheeks that are large enough to take up a significant portion of the person or creature's head. Big cheeks tend to create a distinct volume on the head or ride up on other parts of the face, creating a visible fold.
- Huge cheeks: Fatty cheeks that are as large as or larger than the person or creature's face, creating round shapes that may eclipse the head.
- Hyper cheeks: Fatty cheeks that are multiple times larger than the person or creature's head. Hyper cheeks are unrealistically large.

4.content: A double chin is a layer of fat below the chin, which creates the appearance of having multiple chins (hence, "double chin"), this be depicted with the person or creature's chin and neck blending together, a distinct roll of fat below the chin, or the person or creature having an especially round lower face and a line above the bottom implying the person or creature's actual chin. A person or creature with more than a "double chin" may have neck rolls.

5.content: Fat Rolls is excess fat that hangs off the body in multiple "rolls" - this can more specifically involve rolls of back fat, an excessive double chin, or belly rolls. Rolls of fat can potentially also show up elsewhere on a person or creature's body.

6.content: Belly rolls describe a person or creature with abdominal fat rolls.

7.content: Excess fat that collects in rolls on the back of a person or creature's body.

8.content: Neck rolls describe a person or creature with multiple fat rolls on their neck. A person or creature with a double chin may also have neck rolls, but not always.

9.content: Arm rolls describe a person or creature with fat rolls on their arms.

10.content: Leg rolls describe a person or creature with fat rolls on their thighs or calves.

lorebooks.description: A lorebook contatin some information on the world of Duel Mosnters up to the begging of the 3rd season of GX
lorebooks.creator: C_D_A

1.content: The world of Yu-Gi-Oh! resembles the real world, but a card game known as Duel Monsters is a worldwide phenomenon. It is so prevalent that the company that creates the cards, Industrial Illusions, and the company that creates technology for the game, KaibaCorp, are two of the largest and most successful companies in the world. In late 1994, the Duelist Pro league is established. Members of this league, Professional Duelists, earn money by dueling around the world as if it were a sport. By the late 1990s, private junior high schools known as dueling prep schools and special high schools known as duel academies exist where students learn how to play Duel Monsters and learn the advanced mechanics and strategies of the game

2.content: Industrial Illusions is the company responsible for creating the Duel Monsters cards. Founded and run by the creator of Duel Monsters game itself, Maximillion Pegasus. The company is based in The United States, within California near San Francisco. The company has a partnership with KaibaCorp, supplying KaibaCorp with Duel Monsters expansion data to ensure that both companies can work in tandem to bring Duels Monsters to the next level. Employees of Industrial Illusions are referred to as Card Designers. After establishment of the Duel Academies, it is not uncommon for Industrial Illusions to recruit from Duel Academy students. Industrial Illusions also sponsors the Pro Duelist League

3.content: By 1994, Domino City, located in Japan, is seen as one of the most prestigious cities in the world. The Battle City Tournament took place across the entirety of Domino City. Domino High school is located within the city, regarded as the best public school in the city. The headquarters of KaibaCorp is also located within the city, as well as KaibaCorps, main amusement park Kaibaland. By the late 1990s, most if not all dueling prep schools are created in Domino City

4.content: Previously a military arms manufacturing company under Gozaburo Kaiba, KaibaCorp became an advanced technology company after Gozaburo‚Äôs adopted son, Seto Kaiba, took control of a majority of the companies‚Äô shares in 1993. Specializing in holographic and virtual technology centered around Duel Monsters, KaibaCorps profits and revenue soon brought the company to the same level as Industrial Illusions. KaibaCorps most profitable product is the Duel Disk. In the late 1990s, Seto Kaiba along with a partner named Kagemaru, founded Duel Academy and its five branch schools, meaning the schools are owned by kaibaCorp

5.content: A portable piece of dueling equipment that attaches to a duelist‚Äôs left forearm developed by KaibaCorp initially for contestants in the Battle City Tournament but afterwards became available for public sale. Portable holographic projectors that display realistic images of Duel Monster cards. After the establishment of Duel Academies, Duel Disks became standard issue to students at these schools

6.content: In early 1994, Industrial Illusions CEO Maxmillion Pegasus held the Duelist Kingdom Tournament on his private island, which was also called Duelist Kingdom. 40 of the top Duel Monsters players from across the world were invited and Domino High School student Yugi Muto ended up winning by defeating Pegasus in a duel, becoming known as the King of Games

7.content: In mid-1994, KaibaCorp CEO Seto Kaiba held the Battle City Tournament, using all of Domino City as the tournament grounds. This was in an effort to defeat Yugi Muto and to become the King of Games. Yugi won the tournament, cementing his title as King of Games. Afterwards, Seto looked to advancing Duel Monsters instead of himself, establishing dueling prep schools and Duel Academies by the late 1990s

8.content: Duel Academy, located on an island, is a high school dedicated to training its students to become experts in Duel Monsters and to potentially enter the Pro Duelist League after graduation. As a Japanese school, students spend three years before graduating. While dueling is a main focus of the school, Duel Academy values test and exams scores above all else. Typically, entrance exams are held in Domino City. Duel Academy divides its students into three different rankings, Obelisk Blue, Ra Yellow, and Slifer Red. As Duel Academy has five other branch schools, Duel Academy is sometimes referred to as Central Academy

9.content: Seto Kaiba owns and is the highest authority of Duel Academy, however, due to his status as CEO of KaibaCorp, Seto rarely intervenes in Duel Academy save for getting updates on the status of the school. Kagemaru used to be the Superintendent of Duel Academy before his health and age forced him to step down in late 2002. By 2004, The highest authority that is actively on campus is Chancellor Sheppard. Jean-Louis Bonaparte is the vice-chancellor. Vellian Crowler is a teacher and in charge of the male Obelisk Blue dormitory. Fonda Fontaine is a gym teacher and in charge of the female Obelisk Blue dormitory. After the disappearance of nurse Meanae, Fonda also became the school nurse. Sartyr is a teacher and in he is in charge of the Ra Yellow Dormitory. Lyman Banner was a teacher, and he was in charge of the Slifer Red dormitory but passed away in 2004. His position as Slifer Red dormitory leader wasn‚Äôt filled until 2006, by a teacher named Thelonious Viper, who transferred from West Academy. Ms. Dorothy is in charge the islands Duel Monsters card shop. Sadie is a young adult and the only other worker at the Duel Monsters card shop. Bella Hudson is in charge of Disciplinary Action Squad, the security force on Duel Academy that wear hunter green colored uniforms. Teachers wear either casual or formal attire, with some teachers that are in charge of dormitories wearing the colored uniforms of their dormitory and other others wearing purple-colored uniforms

10.content: The highest of the three rankings, Obelisk Blue students wear blue and white or white and blue uniforms. They have two separate dormitories, one for males and one for females. To qualify for Obelisk Blue, a student needs a diploma from a dueling prep school and high grades. These students don‚Äôt need to take Duel Academy entrance exams. If a student from a dueling prep school does not have high grades, they will be placed in a lower rank but have the opportunity to progress to Obelisk Blue if their grades improve. The rooms, meals, and services in the Obelisk Blue dormitories are all upper class quality

Sung Suho (ÏÑ±ÏàòÌò∏) is the son of the Sung Jinwoo and Cha Hae-In. He is also the main protagonist of Solo Leveling: Ragnarok.

Appearance



Suho is a tall, handsome, and muscular young man with gray eyes and black hair, both of which he inherited from his father. His facial features closely resemble his mother's and share the same softer traits. When using his powers or experiencing intense emotions, his eyes glow purple.
Personality

Suho is an assertive individual who is defined by his drive to become stronger, a trait that he shares with his father. He has also has a strong sense of justice, as demonstrated when he impulsively attacked the Hyena Guild after witnessing them kidnapping innocent people. However, unlike his father, Suho is more of a team player and is willing to form alliances with his father's former enemies in order to achieve his goals. He also sees the other future Monarchs as friends and genuinely cares for their well-being, as displayed when he hastily apologized to Gray for unintentionally overworking him.

It should be noted that despite sharing his father's desire for power, Suho's drive to become stronger comes from his wish to reunite with his parents after they abruptly vanished from his life when he was a child. Despite the fact that they basically abandoned him, Suho doesn't resent them for leaving him behind, especially after he found out the truth about why they left him from Beru, and rarely ever wastes a chance to hone his skills and become stronger so that they can eventually see them again.

Before he became a hunter, Suho was somewhat insecure. This came from being bullied in school for being abandoned by his parents and lacking the strength to fight back against his classmates who'd awakened as hunters. He had also a fascination with ants due to his childhood friendship with Beru and retained his interest in them even after Jinwoo erased his memories. This led to continue drawing them for fun even during his college years and make sure not to accidentally step on any ants that he encountered as a child.[10]
ADVERTISEMENT

Abilities

As the son of the Shadow Monarch, Suho is one of the strongest humans alive. By the time he was in high school, he had already far surpassed the average S-Rank Hunter in power and was so strong by that point that only Jinwoo could defeat him in an one-on-one fight. However, as powerful as he is, he has yet to reach his full potential. Most of his powers were also sealed away when he was a toddler, meaning that he must train to regain them all.

Immense Strength: In the Tutorial, his temporary strength has reached an insane level from reaching level 99, as a testament to this, he overpowered Bellion during their first fight[11] and even managed to hold on his own against his father for a brief period of time. He was also able to climb the floors of the Demon Castle at a significantly faster pace than Jinwoo did during his time as the Player of the System, despite having no soldiers to assist him, and kill Vulcan with just a few blows.[12] Meeting Ammut, Suho would undergo intense training, tearing and healing torn muscles,[13] building up a strong vessel, leading to him ultimately transcending his physical limits.
Immense Speed: Suho has exceptional speed and agility, as demonstrated by his ability to keep pace with his father's rapid movements during their brief confrontation during the Tutorials, before being overpowered. In the Light Novel In Chapter 269, Suho surpasses the speed of sound. When focusing his power in an instant, time around him appears to slow to a crawl, allowing him to perceive details previously unnoticed.
Immense Durability: Suho is extraordinarily durable. This trait was tremendously enhanced after becoming an Awakened Being and further strengthened through continuous leveling via the System. His resilience was forged through Ammut‚Äôs brutal training, which repeatedly broke and healed his body. This resilience allowed him to endure the burning of the Dragon King‚Äôs Heart and contain its destructive energy until he fully contained its power at Level 100. His trials prepared him to withstand Spiritual Body Manifestation without breaking.
Combat Mastery: Despite lacking formal training, Suho is highly skilled at hand-to-hand combat. He is also proficient with weapons such as swords and daggers, though he prefers fighting with his bare hands.
Accelerated Development: Like his father, Suho possesses an extraordinary explosive growth rate and can significantly increase his strength through intensive training over a short period of time.
Fire Magic: Suho can generate red and black flames and infuse them into his attacks, drastically increasing the amount of damage that he can deal to his opponents.
Monster Language Fluency: Suho can speak and understand monster tongue, which he uses to communicate with his shadow soldiers, his other future Monarchs, and the enemy monsters that he encounters in battle.
ADVERTISEMENT

Skills

Passive Skills

Longevity: Suho is immune to all diseases, poisons, and any abilities that can be harmful to his status. His regeneration speed is also far faster than a normal human's and increases exponentially when he sleeps.[14]
Detoxification: Similar to his father, Suho's body automatically purges any detected poisons from his bloodstream. Unfortunately, alcohol is also classified as a poison, preventing him from getting drunk.
Tenacity: Suho's physical defense is increased by 160%, making it harder to beat him down in battle.[15]
Martial Arts: If Suho fights hand-to-hand, any damage he inflicts on his opponent will be increased by 33%.[16]
Increased Strength: Suho's physical strength is increased by 20%.[17]
Advanced Dagger Techniques: If Suho uses his daggers in battle, any damage he inflicts on his opponent will be increased by 33%.[18]
Gluttony: A blessing After Esil became the new Queen of Demons and the Monarch of Gluttony, This skill enhances his ability to refine the world's "nutrients" when leveling up, boosting absorption rate to 300%.[19]
Nightmare of The World Tree: Suho is highly resistant to the life-draining effects of the World Tree.[20]
The Shadow of the World Tree (Lv. Max): This enigmatic skill allows Suho to spread his shadow and forcibly halt time, granting him access to the World of Nothingness, a realm even the Shadow Monarch cannot enter. It activates automatically within a Deceased Monarch‚Äôs Sanctuary. The skill also enables deceased Monarchs to observe and occasionally interact with Suho during related events. Additionally, it allows Suho to connect with the residual soul flow of the fallen World Tree, known as the "Shadow of the World Tree."
Active Skills

Poison: Suho is immune to all types of poison and can reproduce any poison he ingests and use it in battle against his opponents.
Frigid Blizzard: Suho can create blizzards out of thin air. This skill also applies a debuff to his opponents that reduces their movement and attack speed.
Elf's Steps: By applying mana to the soles of his feet, Suho can make sure that he doesn't leave any tracks or footprints on any form of terrain. In one instance, this ability even allowed him to walk on the Sea of The afterlife.
Bloodlust: Suho can magically intimidate an opponent into submission, inducing intense fear into those who are targeted by this technique and decreasing their stats by 50%. It can also be used on multiple opponents at once.
Grassland Gale: Suho can increase his speed by 30% for a short period of time.
Slaughter: Suho can unleash a barrage of high-speed slashes that are so fast that they are invisible to the naked eye.
Storm Slash: Suho can generate fierce winds around his sword, enabling him to cut down multiple opponents at once over a wide area.[21]
Storm of Black Flames: Evolution of Storm Slash. The flames from the Dragon's heart caused a mutation in some of his skills causing the fierce wind of storm slash and the highly compressed black flames of the dragon king to mix with the skill each forming a raging storm of black flames.
Iron Body Reinforcement: Suho can drastically increase his attack and defense power. This skill also significantly strengthens his soul, making him virtually immune to any kind of life-draining debuffs. When activated, black armor partially covers his body, particularly his arms, acting as gauntlets, he can also apply this skill to weapons, a level of mastery that not even Ammut or Tarnak could reach.[22]
Giant's Armor: Suho can grow about twice as big in physical size. This skill also moderately increases his defense power. which creates magical armor that enlarges his body. This ability later evolved when infused with flames from Antares' Dragon Heart.[23]
Ruler's Authority: Suho can move and control objects via telekinesis.[15]
Shadow Extraction: Suho can extract shadows from the corpses of his enemies and add them to his army.[15]
Form Change: Suho can reshape his shadow soldiers into any form that he desires.[24]
Shadow Preservation: Suho can preserve his shadows in storage and monitor them by perceiving their senses.
Shadow Exchange: Suho can use shadows as portals to travel vast distances in an instant.[25]
Monarch's Domain: Suho can increase the strength of all active shadow soldiers by 50% in battle. Unlike his father's version, Suho's skill is infused with flames due to inheriting some of Antares' powers.
Spiritual Body Manifestation: Suho acquired this skill fighting the Apostle of Conquest, becoming donned in a shadow armor, This pure white energy, formed from intensely condensed flames of destruction from the Dragon King's Heart, turning from black flames to pure white flames envelops his entire body and radiates outward like a volcano on the verge of eruption. it could be enhanced with Iron Body Technique, leading to an even stronger vessel.
Bond Skills

Beast Possession: By magically fusing with Gray, Suho's strength and speed are both significantly enhanced. This skill also boosts his senses to animalistic levels, making it easier for him to dodge incoming attacks, and causes him to undergo a slight transformation, with white hair, white claws, wolf-like ears, and golden-black armor on his forearms.[16]
Demon Strike: Suho infuses charged energy supplied to him by Esil into his body, drastically enhancing the destructive power of his next attack.[26] This energy is red and black in color, completely covers one of his forearms almost like a layer of armor, and causes his entire body to glow bright red while this skill is active.[27]
Spirit Armament: This bonding ability was acquired from Sirka. By sacrificing spirits, this ability temporarily improves shadow warriors; the qualities and degree of improvement vary according to the kind and quantity of spirits employed. Some might even acquire elemental affinities, which would give them more advantages.
Exclusive Skills

Shadow Creation: A transformation type skill, that allows Suho to turn a shadow into an item based on his imagination. the items that can be created are shadow items, however if a item is made from a shadow soldier the item cants revert back to a soldier.
Fruit of the World Tree: A unique skill Suho gained from the Shadow of the World Tree. It mimics the World Tree‚Äôs method of making "fruits", by extracting "nutrients" properties from dead souls and reconstructing them to create tools, following a process of purification, compression, crystallization, and extraction to form Rune Stones. This technique works even on Apostles, who cannot be turned into Shadow Soldiers, though it places great strain on the user. Suho learned this principle and can now imitate the World Tree‚Äôs function through this technique.[28]
Job Skills

Breath of Destruction: The special skill that he obtained as the successor of the Dragon Monarch. Suho learned it from Antares while he fights Baran for his third Draconic Trial as part of his job change task. Allows him to fire a truly gob-smacking level of power, unleashing blinding torrents of fire from either his mouth or from the palms of his hands with an attack capable of traveling at the speed of light. It would also allow him to 'purify' the mana contamination from certain monsters and successfully turn them into shadow soldiers

SUNG JINWOO TO LIU ZHIGANG



Overview
History
Items
Relationships
Gallery


Sung Jinwoo (ÏÑ±ÏßÑÏö∞) is the main protagonist of Solo Leveling. He is the strongest hunter in the world and the second Shadow Monarch, having inherited the position from his predecessor Ashborn.

Originally an infamously weak E-Rank Hunter, Jinwoo got the chance of a lifetime when he was selected as the Player of the System, giving him the unique ability to grow in strength without restraint. As a result, by taking advantage of the opportunities offered to him by the System, Jinwoo eventually rose to power as humanity's greatest hunter.


ADVERTISEMENT
Appearance

Jinwoo is a tall, handsome, and muscular young man with gray eyes, sharp facial features, and black hair with bangs that dangle all the way down to his eyes. When using his powers or feeling intense emotions, his eyes glow purple and his facial features become more pronounced. He favors dark clothing and often seen in sleek and stylish outfits ranging from tailored suits to long hooded coats. After defeating the Monarchs in the revised timeline created by the Cup of Reincarnation, he also starts wearing a black glove on his left hand to cover up the burn scars that he received there during his rematch with Antares.[5]

Before he was chosen as the Player of the System, Jinwoo had a very different appearance. He was shorter and had a noticeably thinner physique, with long, bushy hair that covered up his ears. His face was very boyish, which made him look even younger than his sister Jinah (who was still a teenager at the time), and he tended to dress in casual attire, favoring a simple blue hoodie and jeans. It was also common to see him wearing bandages on his arms and legs due to the frequent injuries that he received on raids.
ADVERTISEMENT

Personality

Jinwoo is a humble and benevolent individual who cares deeply for his family and has an ardent desire to become stronger. As a result, he shares a close relationship with his sister and his mother, and rarely wastes an opportunity to refine his skills and gain more power. His deep bond with his family also makes him absolutely merciless towards anyone who dares to hurt them, as displayed when he massacred Groctar and his minions for attempting to kill Jinah, and murdered Hwang Dongsoo for torturing Jinho.

It should be noted that despite being the strongest hunter in the world, Jinwoo is not particularly arrogant and is both polite and easygoing in-person. He is also mostly indifferent to materialistic desires and can be very selfless, as displayed when he teleported to Jeju Island without a second thought to save the other Korean S-Rank Hunters from certain death. In battle, however, he is ruthless, as he tends to slaughter his enemies indiscriminately, and even somewhat disdainful, as displayed when he taunted the Ant King by calling him a "mere insect" and mocked Kandiaru for the flaws he made in his design of the System.

In contrast, back when he was weak, Jinwoo was very timid and insecure due to his incompetence as a hunter and his troubled financial situation. Although he cared deeply for his family and spent years risking his life going on raids for their sake, he was secretly ashamed of his circumstances, as displayed when he lied to Joohee about why he had chosen hunting as his career path. However, his traumatizing experience in the Double Dungeon would give him everything he needed to become stronger, and being betrayed and left to die by his fellow hunters while trapped inside the dungeon would teach him the harsh lesson that his kindness could be exploited by others for their own benefit. As a result, from that point on, Jinwoo vowed to never again recklessly endanger his own life under the guise of the greater good and adopted a more self-preserving stance as a hunter, primarily focusing on amassing strength and eventually growing into the fearsome warrior that he is today.
ADVERTISEMENT

Abilities

As the second Shadow Monarch, Jinwoo is the strongest hunter in the world and one of the strongest beings in existence.

Immeasurable Strength: Jinwoo possesses tremendous amounts of physical strength. Even before obtaining his true power, he was strong enough to critically damage the Statue of God with just a few punches to its face and beat Thomas Andre, one of the five National Level Hunters, to the brink of death with just his bare hands. Upon being revived by Ashborn and receiving the full extent of the Shadow Monarch's powers, Jinwoo's strength was increased to the point that he was able to effortlessly repel Sillad's attacks with one hand, kill Rakan in just four blows, and hold his own against Antares, the strongest and oldest of the nine Monarchs, in battle. After spending 27 years waging war against the Monarchs in the revised timeline, Jinwoo has appeared to have grown even more powerful than before, as shown by how he was able to kill Antares completely by himself instead of having to rely on the Rulers for support.[6]
Immeasurable Speed: Jinwoo is unfathomably fast and can move at speeds so great that most opponents are unable to track his movements. As a testament to this, he was agile enough to keep up with Sillad's attacks during their second confrontation and upon obtaining his true power, was able to strike at Rakan with such speed that the latter didn't even realize that he'd been attacked until after Jinwoo cut off one of his legs.
Immense Durability: Jinwoo is incredibly resilient to physical damage. He was virtually unharmed when the Ant King punched him in the face, only sustaining a small cut on his lip, and was physically unscathed after Baran smashed him into the ground with great force.
Combat Mastery: Jinwoo is a master of melee-based combat and his fighting skills are so refined that he can hold his own against enemies with far more combat experience than he does with little trouble. This was first demonstrated during his battle with Kandiaru in the Double Dungeon; despite the fact that his opponent had been alive for hundreds of years and fought against numerous opponents in his time, Jinwoo was still able to match him in battle and eventually overpower him altogether. Later on, Jinwoo was also able to keep up and defend from Sillad's attacks, despite the fact that the latter had his Spiritual Body Manifestation activated and eons of fighting experience under his belt, and probably would've been able to land a killing blow had Rakan not ambushed him from behind.
Agelessness: As an effect of having inherited Ashborn's powers, Jinwoo no longer ages naturally and has to biologically alter his body to look the age he wants.[7] As a result, by the end of the series, he only appears to be in his thirties when he has actually been alive for over 80 years.
Accelerated Development: Jinwoo's most astonishing ability is his explosive growth rate, a power unlike any other in the world. Not only does he grow stronger with every battle, but he also receives a massive boost in strength with each victory that he achieves. As a result of this, it only took him a few months of intensive training with the System to become one of the strongest hunters in Asia.
Umbrakinesis: Jinwoo possesses absolute control over shadows and darkness, and can reshape them into any form he desires, as displayed when he created a layer of black armor made of shadows onto his body.[8]
Memory Manipulation: Jinwoo can manipulate the memories of other humans to a certain extent by making physical contact with them. So far, he has been shown to be able to erase certain memories from their minds, grant them their memories of the original timeline, and allow them to see into his own memories, as he did with Woo Jinchul to inform him of the existence of the Rulers and the Monarchs.
Hypnosis: Jinwoo can hypnotize people into following the orders that he gives them by snapping his fingers, as displayed when he hypnotized Kim Chul into letting him go and becoming a better person when they encountered each other in the new timeline. [9] However, since he has only ever been shown using this ability once, the limitations to it remain unknown.
Gate Creation: Jinwoo can open gates to other worlds. These gates are black and purple in color, and he can open numerous gates at the same time.
Unlimited Inventory: Jinwoo can store an unlimited number of items in his shadow and extract any number of those items for his own use at any point in time.
Monster Language Fluency: Jinwoo can speak and understand monster tongue, which he uses to communicate with his shadow soldiers and the enemy monsters that he encounters in battle.
Indomitable Will: Due to his loving relationship with his family and his intense drive to become strong for their sake, Jinwoo has an extraordinary level of willpower. He has exemplified this trait even before he became the Player of the System, as shown by how he spent four years going on dungeon raids to financially support both his sister and his mother even though he nearly died on almost every raid he ever went on. Jinwoo's resolve to continuously put his life as risk for the welfare of his family was also ultimately the reason why Ashborn selected him as his successor, as he knew that Jinwoo would never quit fighting for his family no matter how high the odds were stacked against him.[10]
ADVERTISEMENT

Skills

Passive Skills

Will To Recover: Jinwoo can regenerate from any kind of damage done to his body with the exception of fatal wounds, such as being stabbed through the heart. This also includes lost limbs, as shown by how Jinwoo was able to completely regenerate his right leg after he lost it during the first Double Dungeon Incident.[11]
Longevity: Jinwoo is immune to all diseases, poisons, and any abilities that can be harmful to his status. His regeneration speed is also far faster than a normal human's and increases exponentially when he sleeps.[11]
Detoxification: Jinwoo's body is able to automatically cleanse itself of any poisons once they are detected in his bloodstream. Unfortunately, alcohol is considered to be a poison and as a result, Jinwoo can't get drunk.[11]
Tenacity: If Jinwoo's health drops below 30% in battle, any further damage that he receives will be reduced by 50% in order to keep him alive.[12]
Advanced Dagger Techniques: If Jinwoo uses his daggers in battle, any damage he inflicts on his opponent will be increased by 33%.[13]
Active Skills

Stealth: Jinwoo can camouflage with his surroundings and hide all traces of his presence, essentially turning himself both physically and magically invisible.
Bloodlust: Jinwoo can magically intimidate an enemy combatant into submission, inducing intense fear into those who are targeted by this technique and decreasing their stats by 50%. It can also be used on multiple opponents at once.[14]
Quicksilver: Jinwoo can increase his speed by 30% for a short period of time.
Mutilation: Jinwoo aims for a target's vital points before slashing away at them with his daggers, inflicting critical damage.[15]
Dagger Rush: Jinwoo barrages a target with his daggers from all directions.[16]
Ruler's Authority: Jinwoo can move and control objects via telekinesis.[17] He can also use this skill on the air around him, enabling him to move and dodge attacks while airborne.
Dragon's Fear: Jinwoo releases a mana-infused shout from his soul, driving anyone weaker than him into a state of intense despair and panic.[18]
Job Skills

Shadow Extraction: Jinwoo can extract shadows from the corpses of his enemies and add them into his army.[19]
Shadow Preservation: Jinwoo can preserve his shadows in storage and monitor them by perceiving their senses.[20]
Shadow Exchange: Jinwoo can use shadows as portals to travel vast distances in an instant.[21]
Monarch's Domain: Jinwoo can increase the strength of all active shadow soldiers by 50% in battle
