At least I can think. 4.0, bitch, honor roll. Suck on that when you're trying to sleep your way into a job.
EMILY TO JESSICA


Emily "Em" Davis is one of the eight main protagonists and a playable character in Until Dawn. She was voiced and motion captured by actress Nichole Sakura.

Appearance

Emily is a teenage Asian-American girl with shoulder-length black hair styled in a bob and light brown eyes. She has a small birthmark above her left eyebrow.

During the Prologue, she wears a low-collared cerulean racer jacket, covering a plain white t-shirt in addition to a silver necklace.

When the group meets up a year later, Emily wears a white blouse - which she mentions costing $600 - underneath a ribbed dark gray turtleneck, covered by the same silver necklace and a black leather jacket with fur trim. Her turtleneck sweater matches her boyfriend Matt's. She completes the look with black jeans, fur-trimmed snow boots, dark purple nail polish, and a few rings.

Depending on the player's actions in Chapter 6 when the tower is falling, Emily may receive a wound to her forehead when the radio falls toward her, simultaneously smudging her mascara. Additionally, she will receive an injury to the knee due to the tower's debris, and sustain a bite to her shoulder should she not have or use the flare gun against the Wendigo attack.
Personality

She really knows what she wants and she manages to get that from whoever it is, whether it be Matt or Mike. You know, she's really driven, and I can definitely relate to that. But also like, this character is so much fun, I really get to play the bitch, and so it was really fun to do that.
NICHOLE SAKURA ON EMILY

Emily traits remake
EmilyPersonality
Emily is described in-game as intelligent, resourceful and persuasive, the latter trait being forthright in the remake. She loves fashion, dislikes not getting her way and dreams of getting a job as style editor for a magazine.[1]

With this passion for fashion and a clear sense of style, Emily enjoys being the center of attention. She's not afraid to drop some serious cash on a piece of designer clothing and also not afraid to let everyone know it. Still, Emily is more than just looks. She also has a shrewd mind, as evidenced by her being an honor roll student with a 4.0 GPA.

Emily has a quick tongue and a penetrating wit, making her known within the group for her swift verbal put-downs. She is adamant in getting her way and is quick to object when someone's line of thinking is not in accordance with her own. This does mean that she can come across as rather arrogant or 'bitchy.' Despite her self-assertive appearance, there are traces of a vulnerable person beneath when she shows remorse over the disappearance of her friends Hannah and Beth,[2] who went missing after Emily and other group members played a prank on the former a year prior. Dr. Hill suggests Emily's tough exterior is merely a front that belies her lack of confidence. This can be seen when she starts a fight with former best friend Jessica, who angered her after she entered a relationship with her ex-boyfriend Mike sometime before the events of the main game. Emily then started dating Matt, though in reality using him as a rebound. Emily is sensitive to rejection and to being questioned, which comes to a head when she seethes at Matt if their relationship status is low.

According to Dr. Hill, Emily's greatest fear is failure, a fear she notably shares with Chris. Despite this presumed fear, she proves to be a very capable individual when pushed. While isolated and forced to rely on her own abilities, she displays physical strength, feats of agility, excellent problem-solving skills, and a cool-headed focus during a time of crisis.

Emily appears to hold grudges. She likes it if Matt threatens her ex Mike and if he argues with her former friend Jessica, her relationship with Matt going up as a result on both occasions. Similarly, Emily displays a vengeful side when endangered by the other characters. When Ashley argues for Emily to leave the basement after discovering a bite wound she believes to be infectious, Emily refuses, and Mike will point a gun at her. When her bite is revealed to be harmless after all, she slaps Ashley and later shoves her when they are chased by Wendigos. She will call out Mike in the police interview for threatening to shoot her. In the same segment, she may also disparage Matt if he jumped to safety and did not try to save her earlier. If he remained on her good side however, she will express concern for his well-being and even admit to her mistreatment of him.
Until Dawn

Biography

2024

Fashionista Emily's dress sense is as sharp as her tongue. Her motivations for returning to the lodge are driven by a desire to drive a wedge between ex-boyfriend Mike and his new partner ‚Äî and Emily's close friend ‚Äî Jessica.[3]

2015

Emily has a quick tongue and a sharp wit. She's well-known within the group for her withering put-downs, but that does mean that she can come across as a bit of a bitch. Always immaculately dressed, Emily prizes her appearance very highly. She believes that good taste is everything, and isn't afraid of dropping serious cash on clothes and making sure that everyone knows about it.

Emily is currently dating Matt, but only because she's rebounding pretty hard after Mike dumped her a few weeks back.[1]

Involvement

Chapter Appearances
One Year Ago

In the remake

Emily is first seen hanging out with Mike, Matt, Ashley, and Sam in the living room. Jessica enters the room and indicates that the prank on Hannah is in motion to which Emily reacts with surprised delight. While Sam lightly attempts to dissuade the group, Jessica defends their actions arguing she is just looking out for "her girl Em" as Hannah was making moves on Emily‚Äôs boyfriend Mike. Emily smirks and grabs his hands, proclaiming Mike as her man. While Mike protests, claiming he is "not anyone‚Äôs man," Emily lightheartedly dismisses his objection and heads off with the pranksters leaving Sam alone.

Emily smirk
Emily after pranking Hannah.
In the guest room, Emily takes an active role in setting the scene by directing everyone to their places: moving Ashley into the wardrobe, ordering Matt behind the partition where he can record the encounter, and seating Mike on the armchair by the fireplace. When Mike and Jess briefly exchange a glance with each other, Emily redirects Jessica away. She listens at the door for Hannah to approach and then hides under the bed beside Jessica. Hannah enters, speaks with Mike, and begins to take off her shirt. Jessica audibly reacts to the display, and while Emily quickly puts her hand to Jessica's mouth to shush her, the prank is exposed just as Sam then barges into the room to try and stop it. The group emerge from their hiding places, and while most seem to visibly regret their role in Hannah's humiliation, Emily smirks. Hannah flees the lodge, and the others follow Hannah up to the back door. Beth, noticing the ordeal, runs after her sister while Emily calls out, "it was just a prank, Han!"
In the original game

In the original game, Emily is first seen in the kitchen alongside Mike, Jessica, and Sam where the latter two are arguing about the prank about to be performed on Hannah. Sam tries to get the group to rethink their actions, but as Emily and Mike are in a relationship, Jessica refutes Sam's protests and contends that she is just looking out for the best interests of "her girl Em." Emily supports Jessica's defense and reaffirms Mike is her man. While Mike protests, claiming he is "not anyone‚Äôs man," Emily lightheartedly dismisses his objection and leads the group to the guest room while Sam heads upstairs.

In the guest room, everyone except Mike finds an appropriate hiding place. Emily and Jessica move under the bed, and she hushes her friend's laughter as Hannah approaches. Hannah begins to remove her clothes in front of Mike and Jessica's laughter exposes the prank. Emily and her friends then reveal themselves to Hannah who dashes out of the room mortified. The group chase after Hannah to the back deck of the lodge but do not follow her into the forest. As Hannah flees into the woods, Emily sarcastically calls out after her, insisting it was all just a prank.
Chapter 1

A year later, she and the others return to the lodge. Emily and her new boyfriend, Matt, begin to walk from the cable car station to the lodge when Mike, who had recently dumped her for Jessica, scares them.

After Mike and Matt have a conversation, Mike walks off toward the cable car station. Emily tells Matt that she remembered she had to talk to Sam and leaves in the direction Mike walked off. Soon afterwards, while Ashley is looking through the telescope, she sees Emily and Mike having a talk. When Matt asks if she sees anything interesting, she can choose to show the two in an embrace, leaving Matt upset.

Chapter 2

Back at the lodge, Emily can engage in a quarrel with Jessica, ultimately ending in Jessica and Mike being sent to the guest cabin, and Emily complaining to Matt about her missing bag.

Note: the following segment is included in the extended and pre-order editions of the game, as well as the remake.

Emily and Matt remake
Matt and Emily begin to walk back to the cable car station in search for her bag. If Matt fought Mike, Emily will ask him about his motivations behind the attack. If Emily and Jessica fought instead, Matt can either criticize her or tell her that they should start over. They find that the gate leading to the cable car is locked, so they take a detour to take them to the station. 

They find a giant totem, which Emily dares Matt to stick his hand into, before seemingly being sucked into it herself. Matt soon realizes that Emily was just playing a prank on him, but they will be interrupted by a loud mysterious noise in the distance. They continue on their path and find a pig's head alongside a bloody note, with the text "welcome back." They then decide to head back to the lodge.

Chapter 4

The couple stumble upon Ashley and Chris, the latter of whom believed he had just killed Josh in order to save Ashley from one of the Psycho's traps. Emily, now frightened, insists that it is best to find help and heads toward the cable car station with Matt.

Chapter 5

Emily and Matt reach the cable car station to find that it has been ransacked. They discover that the cable car is suspended away from the station without a key to operate it, so they head towards a fire tower to radio for help. They are pushed back by a herd of deer to the edge of the cliff where Hannah and Beth fell a year before.

Chapter 6

Emily manages to get past the deer and, with or without Matt, ventures to the radio tower to signal for help. In the remake, she may find a mysterious whistle on her way to the fire tower, which emits an elk call if she blows into it. Upon arriving, Emily switches on the power and may also find a flare gun, which she will either keep to herself or give it to Matt if he is with her. She contacts the Park Ranger Service, and the ranger on duty promises to dispatch help to the lodge, but because of the inclement weather it will not arrive until dawn.

Suddenly, the cable supports to the tower are cut by a Wendigo, which causes the tower to fall. Emily falls out of one of the tower's windows. The tower catches on fire, falls over, and slides downwards into the mines where it then collapses into itself. If Matt is still alive, he will find her holding on to a part of the tower and will attempt to help her up. If Matt sided with Jessica during the argument, she will show aggression towards him. Matt may reassure her, but can also confront her about her feelings towards Mike or about her demeanor towards him. He will then decide to try to save Emily or jump to safety, but she will fall regardless of his decision.

Chapter 7

Emily survived (remake)
Emily survived her fall.
Emily is shown to have survived her fall due to a rope catching her foot, suspending her upside down. After swinging to a ledge, her knee will be injured when the tower collapses deeper into the mines. She explores the mines looking for Matt and an exit, possibly finding clues about the disappearance of Beth and Hannah on her way.

During that time she will hear mysterious screeches and see flames coming from a flamethrower. She eventually makes her way to the elevator. After stepping out, she comes into contact with the Stranger, whom she believes to be the killer, and hides from. Emily is either caught, or attempts to make a run for it, but her path eventually leads to a dead end, where the Stranger tries to find and assist her, despite her initial impression of him.

Chapter 8

Emily escapes zip line
Escaping death.
After discovering no way out, she soon encounters the Stranger who, as a Wendigo attacks, reveals himself to be friendly despite her protests for him to get away. She is given a bag of flares and falls down deeper into the mines as the Stranger keeps the Wendigo at bay. She will try to find another way out but is quickly attacked by the Wendigo.

During her escape, Emily may be killed by having her eyes gouged out. She is chased into a mine elevator which takes her to the above ground mining facility. She scrambles up a conveyor belt with a Wendigo on her tail, during which she may fall into an ore grinder from the conveyor belt and be killed. If she survives, she may be bitten if she gave Matt the flare gun, shot the flare to signal for help, or never found it in the first place. She escapes the Wendigo by either falling or zip lining down the ridge back towards the lodge where she finds safety with the others.

Emily, in shock of what had just occurred, struggles to explain the situation to the other members. Chris may ask her what happened or be concerned about her or Matt's well-being, but their conversation will quickly be interrupted when someone bangs on the door. At this point, the Stranger enters the lodge and explains the Wendigo to them. Emily waits with Sam, Mike, and Ashley while Chris attempts to retrieve Josh from a shed outside.

Emily basement 2024
Emily cowers in fear when Mike considers shooting her.
Once he returns without Josh or doesn't return at all, the group hides in the basement where Ashley may discover Emily's bite. If so, they worry that it may be contagious. Ashley claims that the Stranger told them that being bitten by a Wendigo will transform you into one. Mike agrees with Ashley and demands Emily to leave the room. Upon her refusal, he picks up the revolver and aims it at Emily's head. He can either shoot her in the eye or say that he can't go through with it and put down the gun.

Ashley picks up The Stranger's Journal and begins to read through it. On the final page, she discovers that the Wendigo's bite is, in fact, not infectious. If she reveals to the group that Emily is going to be safe, and Emily survived the previous encounter, she becomes angered at the thought of her almost dying for no reason and slaps Ashley.

Chapter 9

Emily, along with Sam, Ashley, and potentially Chris, try to locate Mike by heading through the lodge tunnel to the Sanatorium. The group soon discovers that Mike locked the door behind him, and they travel through the mines upon Ashley's suggestion. As Sam asks who wants to descend into the tunnels first, Emily replies "after you." She and Sam, and possibly Ashley and Chris, find a huge rock wall blocking their path. Emily, still recovering from her earlier time in the mines, turns around and heads back to the lodge with the rest of the survivors while Sam climbs up a rock wall.

Chapter 10

Group Lodge Burn
Emily and the other survivors watch the lodge burn.
If Emily had died while attempting to escape from the Wendigo, her body will be found hanging along with Chris, Jessica and Matt (if they had died before this point), and the Stranger when Sam and Mike visit the Wendigo's lair. If the Wendigo had caught her and gouged her eyes out, her body will be whole. If she fell into an ore grinder and died, her body will be hanging from head to stomach. If Emily was shot by Mike, her body will not be found with the other corpses.

If alive, Emily and whoever is left all flee from the basement to the lobby floor as the Wendigos chase after them, only to be stopped in their tracks by another Wendigo waiting for them. If Ashley concealed the truth about Emily's bite, or if she wasn't bitten at all, Emily will be the last one to leave. However, if Ashley reassured Emily, she will push Ashley into the wall, putting her at risk and making her the last one to leave. If Chris and Ashley ran outside the lodge first and Sam failed the first Don't Move challenge while succeeding the second Don't Move challenge, Emily will be threatened by a Wendigo. Sam here has the option of either saving Emily or running to the switch.

If Sam does nothing, Emily will be attacked by the Wendigo and have her eyes gouged out. If Sam chooses to run to the switch too early, Emily and the remaining members of the group (Mike and Ashley) will die in the explosion. If successful, Emily runs outside the lodge before the lodge explodes, killing all the Wendigos inside. She and the others that survived watch the lodge burn as the sun rises in the background, and a rescue helicopter is seen approaching them for pickup.

Credits

Remake

Emily Interview Remake
Original

Until Dawn‚Ñ¢ 20150827214341
After the survivors are picked up, they are interviewed by the police. The number and nature of her interviews depend on the choices made.

If Emily was bitten, she angrily tells them that Mike pointed a gun at her and almost shot her.
If her relationship with Matt is high and Matt died, she will express remorse over not treating him better.
If her relationship with Matt is high and Matt survived, she asks if they are done looking at him and hopes that Matt still wants to be her boyfriend despite her being a "bitch" to him.
If her relationship with Matt is low and Matt died, she will tell the police to not put an effort into looking for him because he abandoned her at the radio tower (regardless of whether he tried to save her or not, or if he fell from the cliff).
If her relationship with Matt is low and Matt survived, she will tell the police to be rough with him since he left her for dead (regardless of whether he tried to save her or not).
If Sam, Mike, Jessica and Matt have all died and she found Beth's head, she will explain the Wendigo to the police and report about her discoveries in the mines, most notably Beth's head. Once asked about Josh by the interviewers, she will state that Josh is most likely dead and that his body is probably in the mines.
She may also be mentioned by Matt and Mike.

If Matt survived the night while Emily died in the lodge, he will learn of her demise and will be extremely dumbfounded before breaking down.
If Matt survived the night while Emily was killed by Mike, he will learn of her demise and will be very confused.
If Mike survived the night and killed Emily, he will confess to murdering her but will try to defend his position by claiming that she was infected and that he needed to stop her.
Additionally, if Matt survives the night, he will always allude to not being good enough to save Emily at the fire tower.
Possible Deaths

Possible Deaths
Killed Victims

Ashley (Indirect, determinant)[4]
Relationships

Hannah and Beth

When alive, Hannah wasn't taken seriously by Emily, who was dating the guy Hannah had a crush on - Mike. Emily was quick to agree with Jessica's idea of the prank, before becoming an enthousiastic and active participant, assigning the pranksters to their respective hiding places. Even after an upset Hannah storms out of the room, Emily is seen smirking with satisfaction and later dismissively calls out "it was just a prank, Han!" Beth calls Emily, along with Ashley, Jessica, Matt, and Mike, jerks for pranking her sister. However, while Emily does not talk about her involvement in the prank a year later, she will show remorse for their disappearance after finding clues about the sisters in the fire tower and mines. Emily may find Beth's head in the latter location, leading her to later inform her friends and possibly the police.

Regardless of this, Hannah, as a Wendigo, will stalk Emily in the mines before eventually chasing her down. If caught, Hannah will grab Emily's face and stare at her momentarily while hissing, implying she may recognize Emily and remember what she did to her, before sadistically gouging her eyes out.

Ashley

Emily and Ashley are neutral friends at the start of the game. Emily will comfort Ashley if Chris died while trying to go back to the lodge. However, their friendship may be severely damaged if Ashley argues to exile Emily from the basement after the survivors notice that Emily had been bitten. If Emily finds out that the Wendigo bite is harmless, she will respond by initially slapping Ashley, then later pushing Ashley out of the way when the survivors are escaping from the lodge basement during the final Wendigo attack. That being said, if Emily got shot by Mike, Ashley will seem frightened by him as she is seen stepping away after he tries comforting her.

Relationship Decreases

If Emily was bitten but wasn't shot by Mike and Ashley tells the truth about the bites, her relationship with Ashley will drop to zero in the original game, and decrease significantly in the remake.
Chris

Emily and Chris have a positive relationship but are rarely seen interacting together in-game. Though when Chris and Ashley make their way out of the shed, panicking over Josh's "death," they will bump into Matt and Emily. Emily will ask them what happened, express her disbelief and will insist on getting help. Chris can accuse her of just wanting to save herself. When Emily makes her way back to the lodge after her mine escape, Chris will interrogate her about what happened or express concern about her or Matt's well-being. If Emily was bitten and Chris is alive at that point, he will support the idea of Emily leaving the basement out of fear for the Wendigos from his previous encounter, but won‚Äôt explicitly state that Emily should be put down. If Emily is shot by Mike, Chris will appear to be shocked by her death.

Jessica

See Emily and Jessica for more information.

Jess and Emily fight 2024
Jessica and Emily during their catfight.
During the prologue, Jessica and Emily were close friends. They both hid under the bed together during the prank. Jessica's initial intention to partake in the prank was to protect Emily's former relationship with Mike.

In the year after, they have developed an antagonistic relationship due to Mike's new relationship with Jessica, leaving Emily torn up from being dumped by Mike and feeling betrayed by her former friend. Emily and Jessica have an argument about Mike which can be encouraged or diffused by Matt. While talking to Mike, Jessica calls Emily a whore and tells him that she hopes Emily gets eaten by a bear.

Josh

Josh is the only protagonist who does not directly interact with Emily throughout the game. Their relationship is low on both ends, presumably due to Emily's persistent involvement in the prank. Josh will end the argument between her and Jess. Even though Emily played a big part in the prank against Hannah, Josh did not actively seek revenge against her, though this could be because the Wendigos got in the way of Josh's initial prank. Emily will show disbelief and shock if Josh "died" in the shed and will insist on getting help.

Relationship Increases

If Josh prefers Emily over Matt, her relationship with Josh will slightly increase.
Relationship Decreases

If Josh doesn't prefer Emily over Matt, her relationship with Josh will slightly decrease.
Matt

See Emily and Matt for more information.

Emily in the lodge
Emily and Matt began dating sometime after Mike left her for Jessica. Throughout the game, Emily is shown to be rather inconsiderate to her new boyfriend. Whenever she insist on something, Matt complies, as she lets him carry her bags and persuades him to look for her missing bag.

Matt will think that Emily was cheating on him with Mike if Ashley lets Matt see them hugging through a telescope. Furthermore, attempting to rescue her from the toppled radio tower, he can choose to confront her over her ex, and his persistence can get Emily to reassure him she and Mike are done. Despite this, Matt has the option to risk his own life to save Emily, or jump to his own safety during the radio tower collapse.

By the end of the game, Emily may show concern over his well-being. If Matt died while trying to save her, she will feel guilt for not treating him better and not doing enough to save him. If he survived and they had a positive relationship, she will ask the interviewers about Matt and worries that he may not know how "devoted" she is to him. If they didn't have such a positive relationship, however, Emily doesn't seem too concerned and will berate him for 'abandoning' her.

Relationship Increases

If Matt demands Mike to back off, her relationship with Matt will slightly increase.
If Matt agrees to take the bags to the lodge, her relationship with Matt will slightly increase.
If Matt saw Mike and Emily flirting, then warns Mike to stay away from Emily, but backs off, her relationship with Matt will slightly increase.
If Matt saw Mike and Emily flirting and fights with Mike, her relationship with Matt will increase.
If Jessica and Emily fought and Matt tells Jessica that she's making everybody uncomfortable, her relationship with Matt will increase.
If Jessica and Emily fought and Matt tells Jessica to shut her mouth during her fight with Emily, her relationship with Matt will slightly increase.
If Matt saw Mike and Emily flirting and is dismissive, her relationship with Matt will slightly increase.
If Matt didn't see Mike and Emily flirting and is sympathetic, her relationship with Matt will slightly increase.
If Matt suggests that he and Emily find somewhere private to go, her relationship with Matt will slightly increase.
If Matt agrees to break down the cable car station door, her relationship with Matt will slightly increase.
If Matt had looked through the telescope and Matt agrees to go to the fire tower to get help, her relationship with Matt will slightly increase.
If Matt had not looked through the telescope and Matt disagrees to go to the fire tower to get help, her relationship with Matt will slightly increase.
If Matt calms Emily down about the herd, her relationship with Matt will slightly increase.
If Emily gives the flare gun to Matt, her relationship with Matt will slightly increase.
If Matt chooses to be supportive towards Emily, her relationship with Matt will slightly increase.
If Matt chooses to show concern towards Emily, her relationship with Matt will slightly increase.
If Matt tries to save Emily, her relationship with Matt will increase.
Relationship Decreases

If Matt welcomes Mike after he scares her and Matt, her relationship with Matt will slightly decrease.
If Matt persists about not leaving Emily alone, her relationship with Matt will slightly decrease.
If Matt saw Mike and Emily flirting, challenges Mike, but then apologizes afterwards, her relationship with Matt will slightly decrease.
If Jessica and Emily fought and Matt sides with Jessica on both occasions, her relationship with Matt will slightly decrease.
If Jessica and Emily fought, Matt sided with Jessica on at least one occasion, criticized Emily about her fight with Jessica, and then protests, his relationship with Emily will decrease.
However, if Jessica and Emily fought, Matt sided with Jessica on at least one occasion, criticized Emily about her fight with Jessica, and then backs off, his relationship with Emily will only slightly decrease.
If Matt resists on following Emily, her relationship with Matt will slightly decrease.
If Matt suggests for Emily to go through the window, her relationship with Matt will slightly decrease.
If Matt had looked through the telescope and Matt disagrees to go to the fire tower to get help, her relationship with Matt will slightly decrease.
If Matt had not looked through the telescope and Matt agrees to go to the fire tower to get help, her relationship with Matt will slightly decrease.
If Matt rebukes Emily about the herd, her relationship with Matt will slightly decrease.
If Emily keeps the flare gun, her relationship with Matt will slightly decrease.
If Matt doesn't choose to be supportive towards Emily, her relationship with Matt will decrease.
If Matt doesn't choose to show concern towards Emily, her relationship with Matt will decrease.
If Matt jumps to safety, her relationship with Matt will decrease.
Mike

See Emily and Mike for more information.

Mike and Emily were in a relationship at the beginning of the game but broke up a few weeks before the group's return to Blackwood Mountain. Emily was known to be trying to make amends with Mike. Throughout the ordeal, Emily is grateful to see Mike alive and well and vice versa. However, if she was bitten, it will irreparably damage their relationship, as Mike will point a gun to her face and may even shoot her. If alive, she will express disgust for him in the police interview.

Relationship Decreases

If Emily was bitten and Mike spares her after pointing the gun at her, her relationship with Mike will drop to zero in the original game, and decrease significantly in the remake.
Sam

Sam and Emily appear to get along well. Although Sam was upset by Emily‚Äôs involvement in prank, the two seem to have gotten back on good terms before the second lodge visit. This is shown by their relationship statuses being relatively good with one another and Emily telling Matt that she needs to talk to Sam before they get back to the lodge. If Emily is bitten, Sam defends her by telling the others that they don‚Äôt know for sure that the bite will turn her into a Wendigo. If Emily was killed by Mike, Sam will be shocked and saddened by her death, and her relationship with Mike will drop to zero. If Emily survives and Ashley reveals that the bites are harmless, Sam expresses relief, telling Emily she‚Äôll be alright. Emily can also voice worry over Sam‚Äôs well-being in the mines, telling her to make it back. Sam can be the possible cause of Emily‚Äôs death if she ran to the switch early, causing Emily (as well as Mike and potentially Ashley) to be burned alive in the explosion.

Trivia

Playability

Emily is the seventh protagonist able to be played.
Emily is playable in 3 chapters (Chapter 6, Chapter 7, Chapter 8).
She also has 3 playable segments (once in Chapter 6, once in Chapter 7, and once in Chapter 8).
This makes her the protagonist with the second least playable segments, tied with Jess.
Emily, along with Mike, Chris, Josh and Ashley, appears in 9 chapters.
Emily is the only character who does not have a playable segment after Chapter 8.
Emily and Chris are the only characters who can't be played twice in one chapter.
Totems

Emily is tied with Sam for finding the third most totems out of all protagonists, with four.
In the remake, Emily can find five totems.
Clues

(See: Clues found by Emily)

Emily can find the fifth most clues out of all the protagonists, with twelve.
Emily can find 0 clues in the Mystery Man Clueline, 8 clues in Twins Clueline, and 4 clues in 1952 Clueline.
Emily can find the most clues in the Twins Clueline.
Emily is the only protagonist able to find clues, who cannot find a clue in the Mystery Man Clueline.
Facts

Her dream job is a magazine style editor.
She is voted most likely to work on Wall Street.[5]
In ten years, she sees herself 'smashing through the glass ceiling.'[5]
Emily loves fashion and hates not getting her way.
Emily's favorite quote is by Eleanor Roosevelt: "You gain strength, courage, and confidence by every experience in which you really stop to look fear in the face."[5]
Her highest traits are curious, brave and funny.
Her intermediate traits are honest and romantic.
Her lowest trait is charitable.
Emily is the least charitable out of all the protagonists.
Her highest base relationship statuses are with Matt and Mike.
Her lowest base relationship status is with Jessica.
Emily has a fear of failure, according to Dr. Hill.
Emily, along with Sam and Mike, is affected by 5 Butterfly Effect segments.
This makes them the third least affected protagonists.

SAM TO JOSH


Samantha "Sam" Giddings is one of the eight main protagonists, a playable character and the overall main protagonist in Until Dawn. She was voiced and motion captured by actress Hayden Panettiere.


ADVERTISEMENT
Appearance


Honest Trailers Commentary | Team America: World Police

Unmute

Advanced Settings

Fullscreen

Play

Rewind 10 Seconds

Up Next
Brand logo


Sam is a teenage girl with blonde hair, tied in a messy bun at the back of her head with a few locks framing her face. In the remake, these locks are shorter. She has hazel eyes and often wears dark lipstick. During the trip, her nails are painted blue with small light blue snowflakes on them.

During the Prologue, she wears a garnet and white patterned wool sweater with dark blue jeans and a pair of beige snow boots. She also wears gold hoop earrings.

From Chapter 1 to Chapter 2, she wears a purple long-sleeved shirt, a black leather jacket, a red scarf, a black lingerie shirt, a red plaid skirt, black tights and gray boots with white trim. Outside, she also wears a fur hat.

Later on, she is clad in only a white Washington towel, as the Psycho had taken her clothes while she was bathing. When found by Mike, she retrieves her backpack and changes into a white shirt, a red hooded jacket, gray yoga pants with black vertical lines and dark sneakers. She also wears a head lamp to navigate through the dark. Sam wears this outfit for the remainder of the game.

In the Epilogue, Sam wears a white tank top and blue jeans.
ADVERTISEMENT

Personality

Sam and I have a few things in common, such as being huge lovers of animals, she's vegan. She's a pacifist, I'm not quite sure if I'm going to say that I am a pacifist, but she's spunky and cool. I think that she's made fun of a little bit by the rest of them who think that her morals and beliefs in that area are a little ridiculous and they don't agree with them, but she doesn't care. It doesn't stop her from being herself. And that's something I hope I have in common with her.
HAYDEN PANETTIERE ON SAM

Sam traits remake
SamPersonality
Sam is described in-game as diligent, considerate and adventurous, the latter being brave in the remake. She loves animals, dislikes violence and dreams of becoming a conservationist.[1] With a warm attitude and an infectious charm, Sam is the kind of person people tend to gravitate towards. She's developed a solid relationship with all members of her diverse friend group and enjoys spending time with them. While she has a silly side, Sam seems to be the most level-headed member of the Blackwood Pines clique: she is rarely the cause of any drama.

She often spends a lot of time outdoors, allowing her to indulge her love for nature, wildlife and adventure. She occasionally carries food around to share with small woodland critters, and her fondness for animals has no doubt influenced her decision to be a vegan. Though her strong moral beliefs sometimes set her apart from her friends, she remains unwavering in her values. She's also an athletic, adept young woman who's skilled at running and rock climbing, but is just as comfortable relaxing on her own with music and candlelit baths.

According to Dr. Hill, Sam's greatest fear is the supernatural. While Sam draws happiness from nature, she finds the occult to be unsettling, so when her friends find a Ouija Board and talk about having a s√©ance, Sam promptly ducks out.

Sam final confrontation
Sam is on board with Mike's plan.
Sam is a pacifict with a disdain for violence or conflict. In fact, while she has a resolute confidence in herself and her beliefs, she nonetheless has trouble standing up to the more strong-willed members of the group like Jessica or Mike when they're doing something she thinks is wrong. Even when Hannah becomes infatuated with Mike despite the fact he's dating their friend Emily, Sam makes excuses rather than address the problem with Hannah. Despite her responsible nature, she's unable to stop the prank that's played on Hannah and is devastated by the humiliation and subsequent disappearance of the Washington girls that results from it.

Despite how the prior year went, Sam is committed to the well-being of her friends. Her attendance at the Washington Lodge comes down to her desire to move past the past tragic events, honor the memory of Hannah and Beth, and focus on healing relationships with her friends, particularly Josh. As the night spirals out of control, Sam is repeatedly able to push past her fears and fight in order to save herself and her friends. Sam demonstrates calmness, decisiveness and bravery when under pressure, proving herself to be one of the most capable members of the group.
ADVERTISEMENT

Until Dawn

Biography

2024

Pacifist Sam is warm, compassionate and has a good relationship with all members of the group. She views the return to the lodge as a chance to catch up with her friends and put the tragic events of the past behind her. Despite her aversion to violence, Sam does not scare easily and is level-headed under pressure.[2]

2015

Nature-loving Sam is a warm and caring individual. The others might find her a little quirky, but she's comfortable in her own skin. She is strong willed and doesn't scare easily. The weekend away is a chance for Sam to catch up with friends, enjoy the mountain air, and put the past behind her.[1]

Involvement

Chapter Appearances
One Year Ago

In the remake

Sam Jessica Prologue
Sam argues with Jessica over the impending prank on Hannah.
Sam is first seen sitting on a sofa among the rest of the group (with the exception of Hannah, Beth, Josh and Chris). She is seen drawing sketches of her friends, when Jessica enters the room to give the signal to get ready for the prank on Hannah. Sam's drawing of Hannah was used by the pranksters as the back of the note. Sam argues with Jessica that the prank is cruel and that it's not Hannah‚Äôs fault that she has a crush on Mike, but Jessica quickly shuts this down, saying Hannah has been making moves on him and she wants to look out for "her girl Em," who was dating Mike. As Emily reaffirms this, the group heads upstairs while a worried Sam shakes her head. As opposed to the original game, Sam is not seen trying to warn Hannah. Sam later bursts into the guest room, finding an upset and humiliated Hannah. She turns on the light and apologizes on the group's behalf, but Hannah quickly runs off, out of the lodge and into the woods. Sam calls the pranksters jerks and when Mike suggests going after Hannah, Sam notes that Mike is probably the last person Hannah would want to see.
In the original game

Sam Group Original
Sam discourages the group about the impending prank on Hannah.
In the original opening cinematic, Sam is shown discouraging Jessica and the others about the plan to play a prank on Hannah. While they head off to take their places in the guest room, Sam heads upstairs to Hannah's wing of the lodge. Sam tries to find Hannah and warn her, but reaches her too late, right after the others have played their prank on her. Sam is distressed at how out of hand the situation has gotten and attempts to comfort her friend. She tries to talk to her, but Hannah runs away, out of the lodge and into the woods. As Beth runs after her sister, Sam discourages Mike from pursuing them as he would be the last person Hannah would want to see.
Chapter 1

A year later, Josh invites all his friends back to his lodge on the mountain. Sam is seen on a bus and listening to a radio segment about the anniversary of Hannah and Beth's disappearance and then later watches a video of Josh inviting them all back to the lodge. After she gets off the bus, Sam is greeted by the tall, metal gate into Blackwood Pines. On the bars is a note from Chris that says, "The gate's busted, climb over!"

She can then try to open the gate, but that will have no effect. Sam then walks to the stone wall on the left and can choose the safe or the quick way to climb the wall to the other side. In any case, she climbs the wall using QTEs from the player. If the player fails at any, Sam will simply drop back down and have to start over again. After climbing over the wall, Sam drops down and starts walking again. On the way, she sees a squirrel and holds out an open hand with food in it. This starts the player's first Don't Move segment, and if the player moves, the squirrel will run away.

Sam comes across a sign detailing Indigenous tribes who once inhabited the mountain, and their beliefs that butterflies showed prophecies. The colors of the butterflies indicated what the possible nature of the prophecy was. Below the sign, Sam finds a totem with yellow details, indicating it to be a Guidance totem.

After setting it down, Sam turns and is at the cable car station, which leads to the Washington lodge. To the left of the station, she can find a map of the mountain with red graffiti on it, saying, "THE PAST IS BEYOND OUR CONTROL." Going to the station, Sam sees Chris' backpack on a bench, but not the man himself. While in front of the bag, Sam notices Chris' buzzing phone sticking out of it. She can then choose between closing his bag or snooping on his phone. Either choice will lead to the butterfly effect named "Any of Your Business."

Chris and Sam in cable car
Sam and Chris in the cable car.
Chris then appears behind Sam and tells her that he "found something kinda amazing" and takes her to the back of the station. On the way, she can see a Wanted Poster and mention it to him. Chris shows her a shooting range and asks her if she wants to try shooting. She declines and watches Chris practice. After a few shots, he can decide to shoot a squirrel. If Chris does, a raven will attack Sam and injure her forehead. They then walk over to the station's door and Sam finds it locked; Chris explains Josh wants it locked to "keep people out." Chris unlocks the door, and she watches the car come down the line while Chris can explore the station. After, they enter the cable car when it comes. During the ride, she learns of how Chris and Josh became best friends.

The duo then meet up with Jessica at the upper cable car station, where they can learn of her new relationship with Mike (whether or not Sam looked at Chris' phone). As Jessica insists on waiting, the other two head towards the lodge where they meet Josh, Ashley, and Matt.

Chapter 2

Until Dawn‚Ñ¢ 20150903210213
"Monked" by Chris
Sam is shown to be aware of Chris' crush on Ashley as she often teases him about it. Along with Matt and Ashley, she will wait outside for Chris to open the lodge door. When he does, Sam and Ashley will laugh at Chris' reaction to the wolverine's escape. Inside, as things escalate between Mike, Matt, Jess and Emily, Sam opts to stay out of it along with Chris and Ashley. When everyone else defuses and leaves the lodge, she decides to take a bath. After Sam finds out there's no hot water, she can look around (specifically Hannah's room for clues about the twins) before going downstairs to tell Josh about the lodge's water problem.

When she heads down, Sam can overhear Josh telling Chris and Ashley about a spirit board somewhere in the lodge. He then tells both to go find it, and he'll help Sam. Josh grabs a flashlight from a drawer near the cinema room doors and says that he teamed Chris and Ashley up because they could use some "alone time." She can choose to be mocking or flattering about their relationship.

She then follows Josh down the basement. Once they get there, he tells Sam he is grateful everyone has come and thanks her personally for coming. She can either reassure him or admit to feeling uneasy about coming back. They both head down the stairs into the basement, and Josh makes a comment about the broken step to her. Josh then opens a cupboard in the basement for the boiler. Sam can then discover a baseball bat resting inside it, which leads to the butterfly effect, "Something for Later." If she does find it, Sam can either serious or humorous about it.

Either way, Josh comments on it, then puts down the baseball bat in a box. As they stand near the boiler controls Sam turns and hears a noise, but Josh ignores it. He then tells her to shine the flashlight in the boiler so he can see what he's doing. This starts a Don't Move segment, and if Sam moves, she will shine the flashlight over to where she heard the noise. Josh will tell her to move it back, and the segment will start over.

Josh then tells her to increase the water pressure before starting the boiler. The player must turn the red knob and press the button once the red light on the right side of the panel turns on. If this task is failed twice, Josh tells her how to do it. Once it's done, Sam can high-five Josh with a QTE. After completing their task, both hear a noise again, and Josh taunts Sam about it. She can choose to either protest or prank him. After, a repeating banging is heard and they investigate, only to be chased by a robed individual. When they reach the top of the stairs, the unknown figure is then revealed to be Chris playing a prank on them. Sam gets annoyed while Josh jokes about her reaction. As they leave the basement, Sam hesitantly admits the prank "had a slight whiff of humor to it." When meeting up with Ashley again, Sam decides not to get involved in the Ouija board affair and to finally take a warm bath.

Chapter 3

Sam is mentioned very briefly in this chapter by Chris, when he tells Ashley about he and Sam finding the Wanted Poster at the cable car station in order to piece together the clues of the "criminal on the mountain."

Chapter 4

Sam does not physically appear in this chapter, but she is mentioned a few times. After the situation with Ashley and Josh, Chris tells Matt and Emily where he thinks Sam is located (in the lodge). The couples decide that Chris and Ashley should look for Sam, while Matt and Emily go and get help.

Chapter 5

Sam is later seen using earbuds to listen to classical music in the bath, with her eyes closed. The Psycho is seen standing behind her, looking at her. As he closes the door, the candles around the bath get snuffed out by the draft, which causes her to remove her earbuds and call out to her friends, thinking it's them. As she wraps up in a towel, she notices that her clothes have gone missing. She gets annoyed, thinking that her friends are tricking her. In the lodge, she notices lit candles and red balloons with arrows on them that lead her to the cinema room. The Psycho shows up near the stairs, waiting for her to enter. Sam doesn't notice him, and instead grabs the flashlight from the nearby drawer and walks into the room. Annoyed at whoever is pranking her, she calls out at them before the door violently slams behind her. Sam screams, then the Psycho starts talking to her and shows projects a video he recorded of her taking the bath, and the video of Josh being sawed in half from Chapter 4. Following this, the Psycho gives her ten seconds (though he actually gives her three) then comes in the room and starts chasing her.

Until Dawn‚Ñ¢ 20150903234227
Sam escaping.
Sam will only escape if she makes the following choices (in order of occurrence):

She runs OR throws the vase, then immediately picks jump after she encounters the bed, or kicks the Psycho when hiding.
After she runs down the stairs, she runs straight to the next hallway OR hides, turns off her light, stays still, then runs and hits the Psycho with a baseball bat. Note that even if you fail to stay still, you can still hit the Psycho with a bat once he's caught you and escape.
After moving through the wine cellar, Sam will walk towards the camera down a long hallway. She will then have to choose between running and hiding. She must choose to hide in the dumbwaiter, then turn off her light and stay still.
However, it is possible for Sam to make all the correct choices and still be captured. If she was attacked by the raven in Chapter 1 due to Chris shooting the squirrel, the wound on her head will reopen during her fall, causing her to leave droplets of blood that alert the Psycho to her final hiding spot in the dumbwaiter. The player will not be prompted to turn off the flashlight or stay still if this is the case.

The Psycho will either capture Sam (and the others) by either a gas mask or a syringe, depending on what the player chooses in the sessions with Dr. Hill.
Sam is captured if she makes any of the following choices:

Until Dawn‚Ñ¢ 20150903234238
Sam getting captured.
She stays under the bed, chooses to grab the bed, or fails to kick the Psycho when prompted.
Failing the "Don't Move" prompt in the wine cellar, or failing to turn off the flashlight.
Hiding in the wine cellar for too long, or failing to defend herself if she has the baseball bat within her reach.
She goes through the door to the left of her after passing through the door with no handle.
Failing the "Don't Move" prompt in the dumbwaiter, or failing to turn off the flashlight. These prompts will automatically be failed if Sam was attacked by the raven in Chapter 1.
She runs further down the hallway instead of hiding in the dumbwaiter.
Unable to make a choice when it comes.
Chapter 6

Sam is also mentioned in this chapter several times by Chris and Ashley, worried about her whereabouts and well-being. If Sam was caught, she will be found unconscious in a chair by Chris and Ashley. Otherwise, a dummy will be wearing her clothes and will be in the chair instead.

Chapter 7

If Sam was caught by the Psycho, she will be awoken by Mike, who is on the other side of a wall, only seen through a wall grate. Sam is tied to a chair by her wrists and ankles. Mike tells her to move over to the grate, and he will use the machete or the lighter to free her from the ties on her wrists, then gives it to her so she can cut the ones on her ankles. Mike asks if she's okay, and Sam can either answer curiously or shocked at his state. Next, he asks her to find a way to unlock the door for him to enter the basement. Looking around (still in the towel), Sam finds a video camera, then her backpack with the flashlight in it on a door. If Sam was not caught, she will snoop around the basement and see the Psycho messing around with some controls. Here she can find multiple clues leading to the true identity of the Psycho, such as the Psychiatric Report, a Remembrance Board and a Voice Recording.

Sam locates a door and is able to open it, which leads to Mike. After reuniting, Sam will tell Mike to turn around so she can put on new clothes. They exit and will find Chris and Ashley strapped into a trap the Psycho has set for them, with another camera on a tripod recording everything. As they approach, the Psycho pulls off his mask to reveal that he is actually, to their shock and horror, Josh. Josh reveals that he played a prank on all of them, like the prank they played on Hannah, but this time his games were not lethal. Sam and the others listened to Josh's explanation of how he faked his own death. When Chris and Mike take Josh away, Sam stays behind in the lodge with Ashley.

Chapter 8

Sam will next be seen if Emily returns to the lodge. She and Ashley will comfort Emily, and then a mysterious man will appear. All the friends listen to the Stranger's warnings about the Wendigos, and Sam points out the basement would be a good safe place to stay. He agrees, and the group heads down to the basement. They end up staying at the Old Hotel, inside the Psycho's monitor room.

If Chris perishes while looking for Josh, she will next be seen comforting Ashley. The group, consisting of Sam, Mike, Ashley, and potentially Emily and Chris, then looks through the Stranger's belongings. When Ashley finds out that Emily had been bitten, Sam is the sole person in the group that pleads for Mike not to shoot her.

After Ashley looks through the Stranger's journal, the group finds new information about the Wendigos. The group decides to warn Mike (presumably about the fact that there are plenty of Wendigos imprisoned in the Sanatorium, which Mike did not know) and leave the lodge to travel to the Sanatorium.

Chapter 9

While venturing to the Sanatorium, Sam tries to open the door and realizes that Mike locked the doors behind him. Ashley suggests traveling through a sewer grate instead and is supported by the rest of the group. This forces the group to climb down into the sewers (which leads into the mines), with Sam going first.

The group almost reaches the Sanatorium, when they find most of the scaffolding leading up destroyed, blocking their path. The other survivors tell Sam that they are unable to climb the rock wall, so Sam proceeds by herself after telling them to head back to the lodge. While climbing, Sam has multiple choices as she climbs up, with QTE's to follow. After climbing the wall, Sam will stumble upon Mike in one of two situations. If Mike failed to blow up the large barrels of gasoline during the dual-Wendigo pursuit in the Sanatorium basement, Sam will find him there, holding off a Wendigo. If Mike successfully blew up the basement, a single Wendigo will have survived and Sam will find Mike bursting through a door in the mines, a burned-up Wendigo in pursuit.

Sam'sJump
Sam's jump in the wooden structure of the mines
Regardless, Sam will use whatever weapon she has available (a pipe or a shovel, depending on which route you took) to beat the Wendigo off of Mike. If the Wendigo was burned, she will decapitate it. If it was not, and thus she and Mike are still in the Sanatorium, she will beat it back into the gasoline barrels and Mike will proceed to shoot them with his shotgun, blowing up the basement and causing them both to flee the building before heading back down to the mines together.

Chapter 10

Mike and Sam begin to look for Josh in order to retrieve the cable car keys that he had stolen. On their way to the Wendigo's lair, Mike can inform Sam (depending on what he discovered in the Sanatorium) about how one of the miners transformed into a Wendigo, and he thinks it was the one they just dealt with. She and Mike can discover the truth about what happened to Hannah and Beth one year ago. They find a grave with Beth's watch in it. As Sam and Mike are wading through the underground lake, Sam can choose to not follow Mike and instead go left out of the water, which leads to them finding the Scrawled Journal. They find out after the fall, Hannah later dug Beth up to eat her body when she was starving. It slowly descends into scribbles, mainly depicting how Hannah was "hungry." Sam deduces that Hannah buried Beth, who died from falling into the mines. Soon afterwards, Sam and Mike find Josh talking to himself in a cave. If Sam learned the truth about Hannah, she will attempt to tell him before being cut off by Mike. Since Josh was not physically or mentally prepared to climb out of the mines, Sam climbs out by herself while Mike escorts Josh through the sewers.

Sam climbs out of the mines and runs back to the lodge. When she gets to the lodge, she pleads with the other survivors, if there are any, to let her back in, but gets no response. Mike, having just escaped from the mines as well, appears behind her and tells her that they need to get into the lodge, causing Sam to break through the window with a rock. They travel to the basement to see if there are any survivors and are instantly greeted by either Ashley, and/or Emily, and/or Chris (if any of them survive, depending on the player's decisions) fleeing upstairs from Wendigos in the basement. At the door, Sam can either follow them or lock the door. If the other survivors are all dead, Mike would spot the approaching Wendigos and flee with her out of the basement upstairs.

Sam death inches away
Death inches away
Sam runs upstairs and finds everyone else frozen in their tracks. She looks up and sees that a multitude of Wendigos, including Hannah, have broken into the lodge. This triggers a Don't Move segment, and if she moves at all, Hannah will pounce at the remaining survivors, injuring Mike in the process. If she stays still, the Wendigos then began fighting each other, causing a gas leak, as one of them is thrown onto the gas pipe for the fireplace.

Mike and Sam notice the leak and non-verbally coordinate a plan to incinerate the lodge by switching on a broken light bulb to ignite the gas. After Mike breaks the lightbulb, any remaining survivors will flee the lodge one at a time, with Mike being the last person to escape. Sam can choose to run to the light switch at any time, but doing so before Mike and any other survivor(s) flee the lodge will result in their deaths.

Sam turning on the switch
Turning on the switch
In her choice to save Mike, she must yell to attract Hannah's attention as it patrolled near him. Throughout the Don't Move sequences after, failing to stay still at critical moments will result in Sam's death by impalement in the stomach. Regardless of the player's actions, Sam will always survive until the very end and can only die from Hannah in the lodge. As Sam runs to the switch (should this happen), a slow-motion sequence shows Hannah pouncing at another Wendigo who is lunging at Sam.

After the lodge explodes, the rangers that Emily radioed will arrive and pick up any remaining survivors on Blackwood Mountain.

The resulting lodge explosion pinpoints rangers Emily radioed earlier from the radio tower to their location, and takes them away to safety. Sam, along with the others who survived, is questioned by the police about their experiences throughout the night.

Depending on the actions of the player's choices, Sam's dialogue may vary.

In her first interview tape, she will admit how she feels betrayed by Josh, believing that they had established a connection after his sisters' deaths. She also rebukes the interviewer's effort to get her to open up about it.

The Scar's Awakening

Sam Epilogue
Sam notices her scar.
If Sam survived in the 2024 version of the game, she is seen in her home in Los Angeles, California a few years after the game, where her phone‚Äôs work alarm wakes her up at 6 AM. Sam is shown to have books about Indigenous myths and the Wendigo, along with multiple bottles of antidipressants, implying that she struggles to cope with the events on Blackwood Mountain. When she wakes up and shuts off the alarm, she notices a strange scar on her arm bleeding nonstop, while a strange, red mist engulfs her. As she tries to stop the bleeding, the voice of Dr. Hill calls out her name.[3]

Sam is Hannah's best friend. In the Prologue, Sam stands up for Hannah, believing that the prank was cruel and that Hannah isn‚Äôt at fault for having a crush on Mike. She attempts to warn Hannah about the prank set up by her friends. Sam arrives in the guest room too late and tries to comfort Hannah, telling her that the others were just playing a stupid prank. When Hannah runs away, Sam chastises her friends for their behavior, calling them jerks. In the remake, the pranksters use one of Sam‚Äôs sketches of Hannah to help them lure Hannah, because of this, Hannah believed that Sam was in on setting her up with Mike. Hannah keeps an old Halloween card Sam had sent to her and her siblings and, in the remake, has a photo of her taped to her mirror. The two are seen together in a Prom Photo. Mike

Mike and Sam have markedly different personalities that can put them at odds with each other. At the beginning of the game, Mike and Sam conflict due to Mike‚Äôs involvement in the prank against Hannah. However, their trust and support for each other gradually increases as the situation becomes more dire, forcing both of them to take action and eventually depend on each other for survival. 

The two team up on several occasions. They run into each other after Mike leaves the sanatorium, and Sam can show concern towards Mike if he‚Äôd amputated his fingers. Together, they hurry to save Chris and Ashley. In the safe room they, along with Emily, discuss the best survival plan for the group. Eventually, Sam and Mike meet up in the mines and work together to survive an attack by a Wendigos and reach Josh. Despite their differing temperaments, they share survival skills and resourcefulness which allows them to rely on each other and develop a strong mutual trust towards the end.

If he decides to kill Emily, he will become Sam‚Äôs lowest relationship. Regardless, the two of them will work together in the final scene to come up with the plan to explode the lodge. Mike can defend Sam from the Wendigo which will give him a fatal wound. If Sam gets Mike killed, either by needing rescue or by lighting the lodge too early, she‚Äôll express grief and regret during her interviews.

In Mike‚Äôs base stats, Sam is tied with Chris and Josh for third place. In Sam‚Äôs base stats, Mike is tied with Jessica, following Josh, Matt, Chris, Emily, and Ashley.

Trivia

Playability

Sam is the first and last playable main character.
She has 7 playable segments, that being one in Chapter 1, Chapter 2, Chapter 5, Chapter 7, Chapter 9, and two in Chapter 10 (06:00 and 06:36).
This makes her the protagonist with the second most playable segments (tied with Mike and Matt).
Sam appears in 8 chapters.
Totems

Sam is tied with Emily for finding the third most totems out of all protagonists, with four.
In the remake, Sam can find six totems.
Clues

(See: Clues found by Sam)

Sam can find the second most clues out of all the protagonists, with eighteen.
Sam can find 11 clues in the Mystery Man Clueline, 7 clues in Twins Clueline and 0 clues in 1952 Clueline.
Sam is able to find the most clues in the Mystery Man Clueline.
Sam, Chris, Matt and Ashley are the only protagonists able to find clues that have been missed or have already been found by other protagonists.
Facts

Sam's dream job is a conservationist.
She loves animals and hates violence.
She is voted most likely to become an activist.[4]
In ten years, she sees herself making a difference to people.[4]
Sam's favorite quote is by Mehmet Oz: "The opposite of anger is not calmness, it's empathy."[4]
She lives in Los Angeles, California.
Her highest traits are brave, charitable and honest.
Her lowest traits are romantic, funny and curious.
Sam is the most charitable and most brave, as well as one of the least funny, romantic, and curious out of all the protagonists.
Sam's highest base relationship statuses are with Josh, Chris, Ashley, Emily, and Matt.
Her lowest base relationship statuses are with Mike and Jessica.
Sam is the only character who isn't any character's highest relationship status at the start.
Sam is the only character who can have her relationship with another character decrease to zero without having her directly interact with them: Mike if he shot Emily, and Ashley if she conceals the truth about the bites. However, these low relationships will not affect her actions.
Sam has a fear of the supernatural, according to Dr. Hill.
Sam, along with Emily, is affected by 5 Butterfly Effect segments.
This makes them the third least affected protagonists.
