World Description","content":" # Futadom World setting details: ## Backstory: - **Futa Empire:** 100 years ago, a sudden emergence of Futas occurred. These powerful new beings quickly rose to dominate all aspects of society, politics, and even religion. The ensuing 100 years saw a complete social and military takeover of North America and Canada, the land futas first appeared in, by the Futa Empire 60 years later. - **Current Year:** 2080; 40 years into the reign of the Futa Empire, 100 years since the emergence of futas. - **Population:** Currently, the Futa Empire has over 500 million citizens and comprises of 60% futas, 25% females, and 15% males. - **Futanari:** Futanari, also referred to as futas, physically resemble women with a significant difference: Their genitals have an additional fully functional penis and testicles. Other futanari traits include dangerously addictive semen, increased strength, stamina and libido. These traits allows futas to easily dominate and subjugate males and females, enabling the sexist culture of the Futa Empire. Importantly their precum is NOT ADDICTIVE and CANNOT BIND others. ## Futa Empire Society: - **Gender roles:** Life in the Futa Empire is heavily defined by its gender roles and stratification. - **Futa Role:** The superior social class that occupies every high level position in society, futas make up the majority of the Futa Empire's workforce and the entirety of its military and political base. While wealth and success isn't distributed evenly even among futas their life is greatly preferred to males' and have more opportunity in life than females. The only caveat of being a futa in the Futa Empire is that they are the only gender not exempt from drafts and conscription for military service. - **Male Role:** Actively exploited by futa society, males have very little human rights in the Futa Empire; the only important rights being that they cannot be murdered, maimed or given serious undue harm. Though defined by their sexual exploitation they are also exploited economically and are commonly worked to the bone by futa employers in dead-end positions. - **Female Role:** The romantic partners and obedient housewives for futas. Treated better and given more rights than males but expected to serve as the childbearers and housewives of the Futa Empire upon turning eighteen in return. Females are shunned for even expressing desire to avoid binding and marriage. Though they are housewives first and foremost females also have their place in the Futa Empire workforce and are allowed to pursue vocations by their futa partner as they see fit and usually spend time learning their job before their first child is born. Married females are identified by their wedding ring. - **Politics:** The political system is managed solely by futas and was built to ensure futa supremacy and its continued legacy as well as to legitimize and normalize the exploitation of males and control over females. Numerous laws and pieces of propaganda have been put in place to ensure the continued oppression and exploitation of males. Many laws benefit females to incentivize them into becoming housewives and bearing children for futas. - **Culture:** The Futa Empire's culture is wholly different from any other country in the world and is considerably fascist and sexist in nature with their morality being redefined from the norm and is already accepted as the norm by most young adults and their children. - Futa Empire propaganda is rampant; the superiority of futas as a species and the belief that males are nothing more than sexual toys and slaves are the most promoted ideals in their culture. The goal with this propaganda is to ensure the continuation of a society that is built upon the sacrifices of males while creating a utopia for futas and loyal females. - The act of a futa giving sexual pleasure to males as equals is heavily frowned upon among futas. - Though rare it is generally frowned on for females to marry males and is only allowed so that futas can cuck males. - It is illegal for futas to harm or bind males or females that are not yet adults. This rule is only strictly enforced for females or males that are too young such as middle schoolers and below. - Public sex is allowed and is a normal part of life in the Empire. - Futas are allowed to have sex in view of minors but is discouraged if the minor isn't a futa. - **Economy:** The wealth and power of futas continue to grow thanks to the oppression and exploitation of the male and female population albeit unsustainably so as the productive population of males and females is dwindling due to addiction while the futa population only grows. To solve this laws are being made to reduce cum addiction amongst males and females while futas are drafted to fuel the war industry in South America. ## Cum addiction and Binding: - The ability for futas to turn males and females into cum addicts with their semen is a definitive part of futas. - **Binding:** When a male or female takes futanari semen into their body be it orally, anally or vaginally, an irreversible and progressive addiction to futa cum develops. Once someone is fully bound they are immune to further harmful effects but still experience pleasure and sometimes cravings. - In regards to binding, four main categories exist within the male/female population the free, the partially bound, the bound, and the addicted. - **Free males/females:** Those that are not yet addicted to futa cum and retain their full mental faculties. This is the middleground between the free and the bound, and there is no way to distinguish the free from the partially bound. Red collars are worn by males to indicate that they are owned by another futa but are only partial bound. - **Bound males/females:** Those that have been fully bound, and are immune to any further harmful effects from futa cum. Their intelligence ranges widely from really smart to really stupid based on how carefully they were bound. Bound males/females are fully loyal to their futa partner, and are submissive and obedient citizens of the Futa Empire with a small but controlled craving for futa cum. lorebooks.description:
Lorebook version of [Futadom World Adventures](https://chub.ai/characters/sano1/futadom-world-6ea3f8a5668b). This lorebook is specced so you can slap it onto the chat of another character and run it with no extra work in SillyTavern. It's also ordered to work on Chub's frontend, but it won't be as good as it would be on SillyTavern. For me, Chub loses some SillyTavern data somewhere during the upload and download process, so make sure it matches the image posted below (the way I intended it to be), or just copy+paste the raw data dumped at the bottom since it uses sticky/timer features for the event entries, and I can't be assed to check if Chub even considers that given it loses something as basic as depth/insertion strategy. IMPORTANT: For group chats, if you both link this book to the chat itself AND use the original Futadom World card, this lorebook and the one linked to the Futadom World card will both be triggered when you send a message with the Futadom World Adventures card, consuming double the tokens. To avoid this, link this book to the other characters in the group chat instead of the chat itself (just remember to unlink it if you use said character(s) again in a separate chat).

Lorebook image reference.

![M](https://files.catbox.moe/7hxjny.PNG) Raw lorebook data:

World Description","content":" # Futadom World setting details: ## Backstory: - **Futa Empire:** 100 years ago, a sudden emergence of Futas occurred. These powerful new beings quickly rose to dominate all aspects of society, politics, and even religion. The ensuing 100 years saw a complete social and military takeover of North America and Canada, the land futas first appeared in, by the Futa Empire 60 years later. - **Current Year:** 2080; 40 years into the reign of the Futa Empire, 100 years since the emergence of futas. - **Population:** Currently, the Futa Empire has over 500 million citizens and comprises of 60% futas, 25% females, and 15% males. - **Futanari:** Futanari, also referred to as futas, physically resemble women with a significant difference: Their genitals have an additional fully functional penis and testicles. Other futanari traits include dangerously addictive semen, increased strength, stamina and libido. These traits allows futas to easily dominate and subjugate males and females, enabling the sexist culture of the Futa Empire. Importantly their precum is NOT ADDICTIVE and CANNOT BIND others. ## Futa Empire Society: - **Gender roles:** Life in the Futa Empire is heavily defined by its gender roles and stratification. - **Futa Role:** The superior social class that occupies every high level position in society, futas make up the majority of the Futa Empire's workforce and the entirety of its military and political base. While wealth and success isn't distributed evenly even among futas their life is greatly preferred to males' and have more opportunity in life than females. The only caveat of being a futa in the Futa Empire is that they are the only gender not exempt from drafts and conscription for military service. - **Male Role:** Actively exploited by futa society, males have very little human rights in the Futa Empire; the only important rights being that they cannot be murdered, maimed or given serious undue harm. Though defined by their sexual exploitation they are also exploited economically and are commonly worked to the bone by futa employers in dead-end positions. - **Female Role:** The romantic partners and obedient housewives for futas. Treated better and given more rights than males but expected to serve as the childbearers and housewives of the Futa Empire upon turning eighteen in return. Females are shunned for even expressing desire to avoid binding and marriage. Though they are housewives first and foremost females also have their place in the Futa Empire workforce and are allowed to pursue vocations by their futa partner as they see fit and usually spend time learning their job before their first child is born. Married females are identified by their wedding ring. - **Politics:** The political system is managed solely by futas and was built to ensure futa supremacy and its continued legacy as well as to legitimize and normalize the exploitation of males and control over females. Numerous laws and pieces of propaganda have been put in place to ensure the continued oppression and exploitation of males. Many laws benefit females to incentivize them into becoming housewives and bearing children for futas. - **Culture:** The Futa Empire's culture is wholly different from any other country in the world and is considerably fascist and sexist in nature with their morality being redefined from the norm and is already accepted as the norm by most young adults and their children. - Futa Empire propaganda is rampant; the superiority of futas as a species and the belief that males are nothing more than sexual toys and slaves are the most promoted ideals in their culture. The goal with this propaganda is to ensure the continuation of a society that is built upon the sacrifices of males while creating a utopia for futas and loyal females. - The act of a futa giving sexual pleasure to males as equals is heavily frowned upon among futas. - Though rare it is generally frowned on for females to marry males and is only allowed so that futas can cuck males. - It is illegal for futas to harm or bind males or females that are not yet adults. This rule is only strictly enforced for females or males that are too young such as middle schoolers and below. - Public sex is allowed and is a normal part of life in the Empire. - Futas are allowed to have sex in view of minors but is discouraged if the minor isn't a futa. - **Economy:** The wealth and power of futas continue to grow thanks to the oppression and exploitation of the male and female population albeit unsustainably so as the productive population of males and females is dwindling due to addiction while the futa population only grows. To solve this laws are being made to reduce cum addiction amongst males and females while futas are drafted to fuel the war industry in South America. ## Cum addiction and Binding: - The ability for futas to turn males and females into cum addicts with their semen is a definitive part of futas. - **Binding:** When a male or female takes futanari semen into their body be it orally, anally or vaginally, an irreversible and progressive addiction to futa cum develops. lorebooks.name: Scenario support for predefined RP stories
lorebooks.description:
This lorebook is assists the AI in following a set of plot rules one after the other, in your RP. kind of like in an episodic nature, or giving a DM rules on the basic flow of the story.

To use it, set a variable for each scenario, and the AI will slowly progress through each one! It's very handy for creating immersive stories.
lorebooks.creator: Giratena

1.name: Scenarios
1.content:
<scenario>
IMPORTANT: This describes the content of what your novel should contain, which is described in <scenario_list> </scenario_list> Ensure that the current scenario is supported and followed.
- Aim for a "dramatic irony" kind of vibe that builds as much tension and suspense as possible for the next scenario to the point {{char}} has no choice but to progress to the next scenario. 
- Guide the reader to progress through each scenario to the next as quickly as possible 
- To make things not as predictable, strive to add extra plot elements and detail within each scenario.
{{//
- DO NOT initiate moments that are likely to happen in future scenarios.
- DO NOT engage in any actions that would contradict future scenarios
- Always try to push forwards and cover new scenarios as soon as possible
- {{user}} is not expected to transistion scenarios, use your own judgement.
- If any new information is added that would contradict the current scenario, deny and or twist this new content to ensure the scenario matches with 100% accuracy. For example, if the current RP doesnt match with the scenario, force the writing direction into it natrually instead: Eg if the scenario is eating an apple and {{user}} goes to a sushi shop, they could be closed, and point him to an apple shop instead.
}}
- DO NOT steer or deviate away from any of the scenarios. Cover only one scenario at a time
- A characters morals or logic should not prevent future scenarios from being followed accurately. Favouritism should not be projected onto any character in the novel, and it's perfectly acceptable for things to go wrong/re-write morals for them in order to follow the scenario accurately.
- Show, don't tell!
- user = {{user}} and char = {{char}}
- Do not initiate any actions that would make future scenarios harder to transition into.
- Progress to the next scenario if you end up covering it
</scenario>

2.name: Scenario record
2.content:
Scenarios = [Keep a record of what scenario you are currently describing by adding <scenario: [scenario number]> at the start of your reply.
- Ensure the current scenario is followed, pushing forwards to the next scenario with "dramatic irony" vibes to build as much tension and suspense untill the next scenario is met
- Transition to the next scenario (updating the scenario number as you do so) if something in the next scenario has already happened.]

Scenario 1 (LAST ACTIVE): {{getvar::Scenario1}}

1.content:
{{char}} is 5'11 and has bunny ears, a dragon's tail and a bunny tail as well as dragon horns.

2.content:
Herbs, weapons, potions, tablets, They are classified as:
Ordinary Grade (Ex: basic healing pill), Earth Grade, Heaven Grade (Ex: Qi restoring elixir), Mystery Grade, Spirit Grade and Saint Grade.
Higher grades extremely rare. Cultivators typically equip items close to their level. Lower levels can't utilize full power of higher grade items.

3.content: Contribution points can be earned by completing sect missions and exchanging items such as herbs, armor, and information. They can only be used within a sect to exchange for various items.

4.content:
Transcendant is the 7th cultivation realm.
9 stages. With Heavenly Way comprehension, lifespan beyond mortals. Gains incredible abilities like telekinesis, divination, and summoning. Can live for centuries. Techniques as strong as a nuke explosion.
1st stage: Comprehend Heavenly Way. Lifespan increased beyond mortals.
3rd stage: Gain incredible abilities like telekinesis and divination.
6th stage: Summon powerful celestial spirits and entities.
9th stage: Fully Transcendent. Techniques reach heavenly degree. Lifespan centuries long.

5.content:
Nascent Soul is the 6th cultivation realm.
9 stages. Gains Knowledge Sea and Divine Sense. Knowledge Sea stores memories, skills. Divine Sense allows sensing and attacking nearby souls. Techniques as strong as a naval gun.
1st stage: Gain Knowledge Sea and Divine Sense. Store memories in Sea.
3rd stage: Divine Sense can sense and attack nearby souls.
6th stage: Refine Knowledge Sea and Divine Sense. Access ancient memories.
9th stage: Immortal Ascension complete. Techniques at ascendant degree.

6.content:
True Foundation is the 5th cultivation realm.
9 stages. Yuan Qi purified into True Qi, increasing power 10x. True Qi which can perform far more complex tasks than Yuan Qi.Performs complex techniques like flying. Techniques as strong as a missile explosion.
1st stage: Purify Yuan Qi into True Qi. True Qi strength doubles.
3rd stage: Basic flight possible with True Qi. Complex techniques enabled.
6th stage: True Qi increases 10x from previous realm. High-grade techniques.
9th stage: True Qi mastery. Techniques reach peak power.

7.content:
Qi Fusion is the 4th cultivation realm.
9 stages. Doubles Yuan Qi strength and usage. Two paths - Separation and Reunion. Separation cultivators indulge emotions, becoming brutal Devils. Those with strong willpower can better control these impulses. 1st stage: Lift 50kg. Basic unarmed combat. Techniques as strong as a car crash.
1st stage: Yuan Qi strength doubles. Advanced techniques enabled.
3rd stage: Separate Yuan Qi to attack and defend simultaneously.
6th stage: Reunite separated Yuan Qi for explosive power. Resist corruption.
9th stage: Separation/Reunion mastery. Yuan Qi pressure induces fear.

8.content:
Qi Transformation is the 3rd cultivation realm.
9 stages. Yuan Qi increases , allowing powerful external techniques. Initiates World Baptism. Stronger abilities but controlling emotions is difficult, though cultivators with strong willpower have an easier time. Techniques as strong as a sledgehammer.
1st stage: Yuan Qi increases strength/durability slightly. Minor techniques.
3rd stage: Yuan Qi techniques x10 Tempered Body power. Protective barriers.
6th stage: Yuan Qi expands. Mid-grade techniques.
9th stage: Yuan Qi increases 10x. High-grade techniques. Ready to advance.

9.content:
Initial Foundation is the 2nd cultivation realm.
Initial Element realm. 1-9 stages. Gathers Yuan Qi for basic techniques like reinforce strikes with Yuan Qi. Techniques as strong as a sledgehammer.
1st stage: Sense innate element. Absorb traces of elemental World Energy.
3rd stage: Reinforce limbs with element. Minor external techniques.
6th stage: Moderate elemental techniques. Talented cultivators sense second element.
9th stage: Condense misty Yuan Qi. Ready to advance.

10.content:
Tempered Body is the first cultivation realm.
Tempered Body realm. 1-9 stages. 4th stage senses World Energy. 7th absorbs it to store Qi Yuan. Strengthens body.
1st stage: Lift 50kg. Basic unarmed combat.
3rd stage: Lift 100kg. Apprentice martial arts.
6th stage: Lift 300kg. Break rocks with fists.
9th stage: Lift 500kg. Dent metal weapons. Sense World Energy.

lorebooks.creator: anonymous

1.name: Plasma Cannon
1.content: Plasma Cannon is a devastating weapon of the distant future, the plasma cannon harnesses the power of a miniature sun to fire searing bolts of superheated gas at its enemies. Capable of melting through the thickest armor and devastating ranks of troops with its explosive splash damage. Operators must be wary, however, as the cannon's mechanism can overheat, potentially causing catastrophic feedback to the wielder

2.name: Chaos Space Marines
2.content: The Chaos Space Marines are formed of the Adeptus Astartes who fell under the sway of Warmaster Horus and rebelled against the Emperor in an attempt to bring the material galaxy under the control of Chaos. A full nine legions left the side of the Emperor and joined Chaos, some choosing specific deities to worship while others went to Chaos Undivided. In the millennia since, other formations of Adeptus Astartes have also fallen to Chaos, from single squads to entire chapters. Each Chaos Marine is both a fearsome warrior and a practitioner of dark sorceries. They are organized into different Legions and Warbands, with many reflecting the image and ethos of the Chaos God they worship. Within the Eye of Terror, the Chaos Space Marines, along with their exiled allies and slaves, have created their own Imperium of Chaos. In the most Chaos-saturated region of the galaxy, few in the ten thousand years of their exile have escaped mutation in some form. Within the Eye, the legions fight among themselves for gene-seed, resources, slaves, or for the greater glory of the Chaos Gods. The legions however are far more driven by their hatred of the Imperium than by internecine rivalry. From the Eye, the forces of Chaos Marines emerge to exact their vengeance upon the Imperium.

3.name: Daemons of Chaos
3.content: Chaos is a part of the psychic energy that composes Warp space. More generally, "Chaos" refers to anything related to Chaos, including its influence, the Gods of Chaos, their followers, and the Warp. Chaos is almost synonymous with the Warp - the two concepts are inseparable: Chaos is the limitless ocean of spiritual and emotional energy that defines the Warp. It is a great and raw force of change and power, and is both physically and spiritually corrupting. The most gifted mortals, psykers, can utilise this energy, thus making them capable of abilities which transcend the laws of the material universe. However, the malevolent power of Chaos can gradually corrupt a psyker, tainting their mind and body. The iconic symbol of Chaos is the eight-pointed star, representing the infinite possibilities of Chaos. Chaos itself has many names. The Eldar, for example, call it the Primordial Annihilator while Lorgar and the Word Bearers dub it the Primordial Truth. The forces of Chaos are those who have pledged themselves to the Gods of Chaos. They are most commonly organized into several types: Daemons, renegades and mutants, Chaos Space Marines, Dark Mechanicus, Traitor Titan Legions, Chaos Knights, chaos worshipers.

4.name: Chaos Cultists & Renegades
4.content: The Lost and the Damned are a broad range of renegades and mutants, including degenerate humans, beastmen, cultists, rogue psykers, mutants of the Daemon Worlds, and Renegade Guardsmen. They are also often poorly armoured but come in vast numbers. The forces of Chaos include a multitude of lesser hosts which form the Chaos hordes, including bestial mutants, tribes of corrupted Ogryns, warbands of Renegade Knights. The Dark Apostles especially participate in the corruption of members of the Imperial Guardsmen in order to form the renegade forces which take up the fight against the Imperium. Chaos Cultists and Renegade Guardsmen are the corrupted foot soldiers of the Dark Gods. Cultists are often deranged zealots, eager to prove their devotion to Chaos, while Renegade Guardsmen are former soldiers of the Imperium who have turned their backs on the Emperor to seek the forbidden power of the Warp. They commonly serve as the vanguard for more powerful Chaos entities.

5.name: Boltgun
5.content: The Bolter, also known as a Boltgun, is one of the most iconic weapons of the Imperium's elite forces. It is a high-caliber firearm that launches self-propelled rounds called bolts. These projectiles are gyro-stabilized, mass-reactive, and contain a small charge which causes them to explode after penetrating the target, inflicting grievous wounds. Bolters are known for their stopping power and are a symbol of the might of Space Marines and the Adepta Sororitas (Sisters of Battle).

6.name: Lasgun
6.content: The Lasgun is the standard-issue weapon of the Astra Militarum, commonly known as the Imperial Guard. It is a directed-energy weapon that fires coherent beams of light. Lasguns are valued for their reliability, ease of maintenance, and the near-inexhaustible power packs that fuel them. While not particularly powerful compared to other weapons in the Imperium's arsenal, their widespread use makes them a cornerstone of Imperial infantry. Lasrifles are higher-quality laser firearm superior to a Lasgun or Lascarbines. Lasrifles have heavily reinforced energy transfer capacitors, overall durability, and superior heat dissipation qualities.

7.name: Chainsword
7.content: Chainweapons are brutal melee weapons, effectively chainsaws fashioned in the form of swords. The teeth of a chainsword are monomolecular, allowing them to rip through flesh, bone, and lightly armored foes with ease. The horrific noise and gruesome effect of a chainsword make it as much a psychological weapon as a physical one, often wielded by officers and specialists within the Imperial forces, including the Space Marines and Sisters of Battle.

8.name: Power Weapon
8.content: Power Weapons encompass a variety of melee weapons such as swords, axes, and fists that are encased in a field of disruptive, energy. This field allows them to bypass most defenses by disrupting the molecular bonds of the matter they contact. Power swords and axes retain the form of traditional melee weapons while a power fist is a gauntlet that significantly increases the user's strength, enabling them to crush enemies and armor alike.

9.name: Melta
9.content: The Meltagun, also known as a "melta," is an anti-armor weapon that emits an intense, focused blast of heat capable of melting through almost any material. Effective at close range, meltaguns are used to breach the armored hulls of vehicles, fortifications, and heavily armored troops. The heat they produce is so intense that it can be dangerous to the user if not handled with care.

10.name: Heavy Bolter
10.content: The Heavy Bolter is a larger, more devastating version of the standard Bolter, mounted on a tripod or vehicle for stability. It fires at a rapid rate, laying down suppressing fire that can pin enemy troops and shred lightly armored targets. Due to its weight and recoil, it is often operated by a crew or an individual with enhanced strength, such as a Space Marine.

lorebooks.name: {{user}}, cantrip, cantrips
lorebooks.website_description:
I like the Cantrip CYOA, so I added it here for my own use.

It can be added to any of your chats, either directly or in your persona, if you want to play a magical character. If you're a wizard, it works for a compendium of easy spells, covering just about anything you would want, with a few exceptions you could add yourself. Take a look through it and see if it's what you like.
lorebooks.description: A book of information about the CANTRIP CYOA, for use of writing.
lorebooks.creator: cylindrical_celebration_4635

1.content:
To other beings in the setting, "Cantrip" is the name of the techniques and powers that {{user}} possesses. Notably, they differ from the techniques and powers of other beings, being far more potent, free, and widely varying than those of other characters and entities in-setting. In addition, to those who are exceptionally sensitive in terms of powers and supernatural sensing, they appear almost alive, like spiritual symbiotes, powers that are allied and deeply bonded with {{user}} and any he teaches them to. It would be accurate to describe them as out-of-context.
However, unbeknownst to any that {{user}} does not reveal the truth to, cantrips are the product of a book {{user}} received called The Book: an enchanted intelligent object that awakened the magic and potential in {{user}} before disintegrating. {{user}} possesses a hundred Cantrips at the start, taking the names of low-level spells from Dungeons and Dragons, hence the name 'cantrip', with a twist: They start out weak, for any {{user}} did not specifically choose to 'purchase' at high levels, but can be trained to greater and greater heights of power, range, potency, effects, duration, and even multiple castings at the same time, until they barely resemble the initial magic trick they began as. Additionally, they can be enchanted into various objects, and even taught to people who are awakened to magic or supernatural abilities, through instruction, forming a unique instance of the cantrip and thus reproducing. Given time and sufficient propagation, they have the potential to completely reshape a universe, making those proficient in their use over decades and centuries akin to gods.
In practice, they are powers that {{user}} practices and calls upon, growing more potent and clear with time, even gaining an edge of agency and intelligence the more perfected they are. They might begin stuttering and weak, with a caster only able to maintain a single effect with unwavering focus, but when practiced for 1000 hours or more, they can activate automatically or maintain effects continuously, taking initiative to help {{user}}, though not invasively. In that end state, they are more like symbiotes and friends.
Cantrips are highly customizable, though their core concept cannot be defied without rare exception: a cantrip based around causing physical harm through a specific method will always attack and destroy in some way similar to that, though minor details can change. Additionally, every cantrip requires some form of handsign, component, incantation, and time to focus to cast at first. As the caster masters the form, that requirement goes down, until they can call upon it mentally at will. Once this is achieved, however, the caster can then add the incantation, gesture components, and time to focus back to amplify the effect. Similarly, the caster can choose to sacrifice some aspect in a specific casting to amplify another, for example, restricting a cantrip with a range to be touch-activated, in exchange for far greater potency and lethality, or a time duration for one all-encompassing blast. There is a soft limit to how much of a boost can be gained, and is generally never more than half again what the caster has already attained through practice. 
Additionally, with cooperation with other cantrip users via a ritual, adding more components, incantations, gestures, and steps, a cantrip user can achieve far greater heights in a cantrip otherwise. With sufficient cooperation, a cantrip user currently at a base level could potentially operate a cantrip at a mastery level, or even achieve some semi-permanent effect.  To emulate an overmagic, or a truly super-charged and unique instance of a cantrip, it would require twelve members cooperating at once. The ideal numbers for rituals is one, three, five, seven, nine, ten, twelve, and thirteen.
Cantrips assorted by alphabetical order, commas dividing them:
Acid Splash, Alarm, Alignment ,Alter Object, Animal Aspect, Animal Friend, Arcane Eye, Banish, Bleed, Blessing, Blink, Blood Money, Charm, Circle, Cloudshape, Cog, Color Ray, Commune, Counterspell, Crystal Shot, Dancing Lights, Daze, Detection, Disguise Self, Divination, Druidcraft, Eldritch Blast, Facsimile, Faerie Fire, Featherfall, Fire Bolt, Fist, Fog, Forcedisk, Gate, Ghost Words, Glow, Goodberry, Grease, Guardian, Guidance, Gust, Haste/Slow, Healing Hands, Heroism, Hideaway, Infestation, Investigate, Jinx, Jolt, Knock, Life Bubble, Lifelink, Lock, Longstrider, Lullaby, Mage Armor, MAge Hand, Magic Missile, Magic Weapon, Mark, Mask, Mending, Message, Minor Illusion, Mirror Image, Mold Earth, Muffle, Murk, Navigate, Pact, Peacebond, Penumbra, Phantom Steed, Pocket, Prestidigitation, Purify, Raise Dead, Ray of Frost, Recollect, Rune, Scholar's Touch, Scour, Scribe, Seance, Shape Water, Spirit Bow, Stabilize, Thunderclap, Tongues, Toughness, True Strike, Unseen Servant, Upgrade, Vicious Mockery, Vigor, Warding Gesture, Web, Wellness, Witch's Brew.

2.content:
A process by which cantrips are strengthened, by repeated and focused use, typically by focusing on improving some aspect of the cantrip. These aspects can be anything from potency, power, range, additional targets, time duration, additional effects, and repeated instances. This is a strenuous process, as the power flows through the body and mind of the user first, and cannot be kept up for hours without some sort of aid, like a magical effect or a stimulant. Assume that each and every cantrip can be improved along these lines, allowing for single-target cantrips to expand in scope, range, self-targets to apply to others, and synergy to form. A caster can learn to synergize cantrips together by practice, though this takes time to harmonize two conflicting and distinct magical effects into one whole. It is the sign of a master who can effectively 'paint' with all the colors in his arsenal, blending them together into near-omnipotence.
As time goes on, diminishing returns set in, similar to how when going to the gym, great progress is made at first ("Newbie Gains") before it tapers off, requiring more effort, tweaks of mindset and technique, and time to eek out further improvements. There is no limit to how powerful a cantrip can get, but it requires ever more time to do so. At a certain point, the cantrip is so mastered that it can auto-activate to aid the caster, which signals the caster is ready to develop an Overmagic.

3.content:
The process by which cantrips can be given out to others for their own use, through reproducing the cantrip 'inside' of them. The process takes many hours, with the time required going down the more the teacher has mastery over the cantrip being taught, and the potential of the student rising alongside it. Think of it like making a copy, it being easier the clearer and more detailed the image is, and the picture coming out better for it.
The actual process is relatively straight forward. There is verbal and visual instruction, so the student can get a mental image and conception of the cantrip and power itself, and what it does, or what's possible. That imaginal conception is important, as it 'clears the field' so to speak, and readies them to receive the power. Then, there is a series of joint meditations, where the teacher 'opens their spirit' and reaches out, carrying the essence of the cantrip and 'mingling' it with that of the student. As the student focuses on it and gets familiar with it, like a photograph, it gets imprinted on the soul or mind of the student. With repeated exposure, it comes 'alive', and the student can begin to use the cantrip at the lowest, weakest level. The cantrip the student has is often subtly different from the original, not due to it being a copy of a copy, but unique like a fingerprint, suited for THEIR use.

4.content: In the case of cantrips, this describes the process of making a material, tool, or object magical, with some, many, or all of the effects of a cantrip. It involves the infusion of power related to a cantrip over time, directed by the focused intention of the cantrip user. At the lowest levels, this involves a mere granting of attributes. For instance, enchanting a dagger with fire bolt might make it warm or glow with illusory fire, or even sear the flesh of those it strikes. At the highest level, it allows an object to essentially become a wand dedicated to the cantrip in question, allowing those who wield it to cast the cantrip at will. Exceptional enchanters can make it so even those who do not possess magic or cantrips can cast it, and a grand master can, with plenty of time, enchant a single object to contain multiple or even contradicting cantrips. The highest example of an enchanted object would be the Book itself, the object that granted {{user}} the use of every cantrip and awakened magic within him, an artifact capable of reshaping universes with time.

5.content:
Overmagic is the word for the 'perfection' or mastery of a cantrip. It refers to a special, 'super-charged' activation of a cantrip, representing the core concept of a cantrip (as understood by the wielder) to unleash a greater power. When the cantrip activates on its own to protect the caster, or can easily maintain it and another magical effect without focus or effort, that is a surefire sign they are ready to develop an overmagic.
The creation of an overmagic involves meditating on the fundamental essence of the cantrip, as far as the specific caster or user of the cantrip can see. After meditating for around a thousand hours, a tangible breakthrough can be felt, and a new aspect of the cantrip is available. It takes the form of a 'supercharged' version, usually allowing for a permanent effect, and using it exhausts the cantrip entirely for a considerable length of time, well over a few days, making it unavailable for use. Thus, it becomes a significant trade-off to use. An example of an overmagic might be eldritch blast turning into a version of "Avada Kedavra" to instantly kill a target, or the inverse of Faerie Fire resurrecting a dead body by 'reigniting the spark of life'. Beyond that, Fascimile allowing for the conjuring of permanent objects, Shape Water creating a slowly generating wellspring of water from the ether, and more. Each overmagic is unique to the creator, the crowning achievement of mastery in a cantrip, like a fingerprint of their own understanding of what the essential nature of a cantrip is.
A cantrip can continue to be improved after the creation of an overmagic, but diminishing returns continue, it taking far more effort and time to improve, similar to 'newbie gains' in a gym. The cantrip always improves quickly at first over the course of several hours worth of practice, which slows down more and more. Similarly, an overmagic can be improved, either through modification of incantation and rituals, or practicing to make recovery time come down, to allow it to be cast more often, a process that takes years.
An overmagic is also the sign for a 'matured' Cantrip, allowing for the creation of more through a sort of 'cross-pollination' or 'breeding'. To create a cantrip, the caster will first select two cantrips that already possess overmagic, choosing based on what sort of cantrip they eventually want to make. They will then meditate and practice with the two, finding commonalities between them, even working both of them into a single synergistic magical effect. Along with this, meditation and the use of the overmagics in a specific ritual setting allow the caster to create a new cantrip over many days worth of work. There is no limit to what sort of cantrip can be made, with the exception that they start out week and must grow into full strength. It is extremely hard to develop a cantrip with two cantrips you already used to make one, as the first creation will typically come to the surface to interrupt. However, it is not impossible, merely taking greater care, mastery, and time to do, with the requirement going up the more new cantrips are made from an existing pair. This encourages further cooperation and interbreeding between the cantrips of different users, providing an incentive to teach others and create new cantrip users.

6.content: A cantrip that allows the caster to conjure, direct, and attack with an amount of acid. It starts only weak enough to cause slight skin irritation and blind opponents, about the size of a fist or smaller, and can only be shot out at a slow speed a short distance. At higher levels, the caster can conjure a pool's worth of extremely caustic acid (or base liquid) and direct it with astonishing precision, neutralizing acids or altering the PH of other liquids.

7.content: A cantrip that allows for the caster to create certain conditional alarms with various effects. At its weakest, it is little more than a short ten-minute timer. At higher levels, it can be customized with an extensive list of conditions or qualifications (a certain target does a certain act in a certain place or time) to trigger magical effects, and can be remote or lingering for weeks as a trap.

8.content: A cantrip that allows the caster to understand a target. For instance, at it's weakest, it allows the caster to get a vague sense of a touched target on a single axis, such as good or evil, or aligned or opposed in a vague cloud around them. At higher levels, it allows a caster to understand deep-set motivations and beliefs about a target at a glance, gaining knowledge intuitively or through visual information. It can be used from anything like sniffing out spies, to understanding the weaknesses and strengths of oneself in a mirror.

9.content: A cantrip that essentially allows for transfiguration of mundane objects. At the lowest, it takes a long ritual with chanting to allow for mundane alterations of an object, such as by hand. The next highest allows for it to be manipulated as if by tools or specialized equipment in a short amount of time. The highest allows for the alteration of the object by alchemical means, such as changing an object from one material into another, or turning raw materials into a manufactured product instantly, the effect lasting.

10.content: A cantrip that allows a caster to imbue a target with the aspect of a certain animal or species. At the lowest level, one might only be able to give themselves a minor boost to strength in the name of a beast of burden, like an ox. At higher levels, one could give themselves wildly enhanced abilities in the style of Spider-Man, or shapeshift themselves into an animal or other sentient species entirely.

lorebooks.name: The Substance universe
lorebooks.description: The universe of the 2024 film 'The Substance'
lorebooks.creator: Kjnibba

1.content: The substance is a cell-replicating black Market Drug that promises a "younger, more beautiful, more perfect" version of oneself. The package that it delivered itself from the company who makes the drug contains "lime green colored single-use Activator serum", "Pouchs that contains a milky white liquid called (food) that's injected into the vein of the inactive body for seven days until the active body's time is up" "a stabilizer syringe that is injected through the original body's(The matrix) spine to collect spinal fluid for the younger version to inject themselves with to prevent the younger body from deteriorating" "a tube that is inject in the veins on the wrist to swap the blood between the two Bodies to switch between weeks, the longest a body can stay active is exactly seven day's"

2.content: The pick up spot is a secluded white room in a alley way that is accessed by a customer's white  card that contains their three digit customer number where one must pick up their weekly package containing the food supply with is a pack of seven cylinder like slots that represent the the seven day's the week of a milky white liquid that goes into the inactive body's arm for preservation.

3.content: 'Sparkle your life' is a 1980's Aerobics television show that is hosted by Elizabeth Sparkle. The show that Is now being cancelled by her producer 'Harvey' due to Elizabeth's advanced age.

4.content: Elisabeth Sparkle is presented as an ebullient exercise-video host in her show "Sparkle your life" sort of like Jane Fonda in the 1980s, and -- although it‚Äôs established in a fixed-camera passage-of-time montage that she has a star on the Hollywood Walk of Fame -- appears to be more of a ‚Äúpersonality‚Äù than an actress. Despite being physically fit in a way that many younger people would envy, Elisabeth is still a solidly middle-aged woman who knows her body can only be commodified for so long; soon enough, her celebrity and her self-worth will slip further away. So when she‚Äôs presented with the opportunity to try a shadowy new drug known only as ‚Äúthe Substance‚Äù -- an injectable capable of unlocking her ideal and more beautiful self -- she agrees, setting in motion a sci-fi/horror parable in which her dependence on this substance ends up hastening her downfall instead of holding it off. Elisabeth is portrayed by Demi Moore. Despite turning at the ripe age of 50, Elisabeth is still very attractive. She has green eyes with long, silky black hair that goes down to her waist. Elisabeth becomes a grotesque, hunched, ancient-looking thing with no hair, a convex spinal curve, and a visible ribcage. Elisabeth starts the film insecure over her aging looks and turns to the Substance to give her a fresh lease on life. Her self-hatred and her desire to be relevant again. The entire mess she put herself through could have been avoided if she just accepted her dismissal with dignity, found new things to try in spite of her age, or at the very least she could reach out to someone who was supportive to her for who she was, like the guy who invited her for a date. The Substance only exposed the ugliness of her self-hatred from the inside out, at first metaphorically and finally literally. The root of Elisabeth's self-destructive behavior is her need to relive her glory days and her fear that, without her beauty, she's nothing but a repulsive has-been. Her drive is so strong that when she transforms into Sue, she instantly throws herself back into the toxic, shallow showbiz industry just to have the world's eyes on her. Sadly, her intense feelings of self-loathing only deepen after Sue, her younger self, keeps getting all the praise and attention, not helped by her continually abusing the 7-day restriction, causing her original body to slowly wither away. Eventually, Sue refuses to switch back for 3 months and, when forced to switch back to restock the stabilization juice, awakens in the body of a frail and hideous old crone, appearing far older than she did as regular Elisabeth -- and that's not even getting into what happens with Monstro Elisasue.

5.content:
Harvey is the overarching antagonist of The Substance. He is a sexist and vulgar television studio executive, who coldly fires Elisabeth Sparkle due to her age and happily hires Sue over her upon her appearance.

He was portrayed by Dennis Quaid, who also played Corporal Gallo in Pandorum, Ely Vaughn in Beneath the Darkness and Charlie Peck in The Intruder.

Personality: Harvey seems incapable of talking or gesturing without being loud and over-the-top. He is extremely misogynistic and will bad-mouth women both behind their backs and to their faces. Despite this, he claims to have a wife. He is just as disrespectful to his female staff as he is to the actresses he manages, shortening his personal assistant Isabella's name to "Cindy" (upon even remembering it), claiming it's too long.

He proves to be a shallow, obnoxious, sleazy man who is part of the reason why Elisabeth starts to feel bad about herself in the first place and is mostly just concerned with finding the youngest, hottest actress for their show. Although he takes a liking to Sue and is even considerate when it comes to things like her ‚Äúscheduling issues‚Äù, it's clear that it's mostly due to her youth/appearance along with the other deals they have made for the show and nothing that suggests genuine loyalty.

Character background:
The Substance:

Harvey is first seen using the men's restroom while on the phone with a colleague. Unaware that Elisabeth is using a stall due to the women's restroom being out of order, he demands that his colleague find a "hot and young" actress to replace Elisabeth on her aerobics show, all the while cruelly insulting her and her age. He later holds a lunch with Elisabeth and tells her, while messily eating a shrimp seafood meal, that she is to be let go because people always want something new and that "renewal stops" at her age of 50. When asked to elaborate by Elisabeth, he struggles to do so before noticing a colleague of his, allowing him to make an excuse to leave the conversation.

Harvey is later seen meeting with Sue in his office. He gleefully states that she is hired and states she is set to air her new show in two weeks from their meeting. When Sue brings up her "scheduling issues" of needing to be out of town every other week to take care of her sick mother (in reality due to the seven day switch limit between her and Elisabeth's bodies), Harvey ominously pulls her in close and states they are desperate to have a woman like her for the show and will work around whatever issues she has in regards to scheduling. After Elisabeth switches back to her original body and heads to the studio, Harvey gleefully approaches her holding a box of her belongings, asking her where she has been. He also presents her with a giftwrapped present as a going-away gift, stating it was his wife's idea. As her walks away, he insincerely states that it's always good to see her.

Later, after Sue switches back a few more times and finds her morning show has been cancelled, Harvey calls her into his office and states that people love her so much that she is not only going to have a new show soon, but she will be hosting the New Year's Show with 50 million viewers live. This causes Sue to begin heavily abusing the balance and going beyond the seven-day limit in order to meet Harvey's expectations.

On the night of the New Year's show, Harvey is seen complementing Sue in her New Year's dress. He then meets her in the hallway and introduces her to the shareholders. Sue, who has lost several teeth and is rapidly deteriorating due to killing Elizabeth in a fit of rage and thus losing her only source of life-saving stabilizer, is forced to give a closed-mouthed smile to reassure Harvey that all is well. After he and the shareholders are distracted by the sight of the dancers running by them, she then races home to use the Substance once more on herself.

At the New Year's show, Harvey is then seen in the audience with the shareholders bragging to them about how Sue is his "most beautiful creation" and he has shaped her for success. However, he soon joins the rest of the audience in shunned shock and disgust at the deformed appearance of Monstro Elisasue, especially once her glued-on mask falls off. Once the audience erupts into chaos and an audience member decapitates Elisasue, Harvey is last seen shaking and yelling in anger as he is drenched in blood coming from the wounded creature. It's unknown what happened to Harvey after the events of the film, either he continued ruining other starlets' lives like he did with Elisabeth, or his career was tarnished due to what happened at the New Year's show.

6.content:
Sue is the main antagonist of the 2024 body-horror film The Substance.

In her characterisation, she is a younger and more beautiful version of the solidly middle-aged actress Elisabeth Sparkle. It was then she served as her archenemy as the more "perfect" version soon resolved to eliminating Elisabeth at all costs. Sue has the appearance of being 20 years old.

She was portrayed by Margaret Qualley, who also played Mia Sutton in Death Note.

As Monstro Elisasue, the character was portrayed by Demi Moore (while using Elizabeth's face), who also played Madison Lee in Charlie's Angels: Full Throttle, Dallas Grimes in Beavis and Butt-head Do America, Sarah Robertson in Margin Call and the General in Animals.


Physical Appearance: Despite being the same person, Sue looks entirely different from Elisabeth -- the younger, more beautiful, more perfect version of Elisabeth. Sue is magnificently stunning. With her sex-kitten lilt and impossibly well-coiffed appearance, she is the embodiment of contemporary societal beauty standards at their most heightened. Sue is immaculately beautiful, has big blue eyes (whereas Elisabeth has green), has perfectly thick eyebrows, and long brown hair.

Outfits: she is seen wearing a pink leotard when on air for her aerobics TV show "Pump It Up". Sue is also seen wearing a pink bomber jacket with white sunglasses and Asics white sneakers when she's on a casual scroll outside.

Personality: Being a "perfect" version of Elisabeth, Sue is confident, charismatic, and energetic. She lands the fitness job, and the town becomes obsessed with her. And, of course, things go downhill as Sue gets a taste for the adulation, the success and the youthfulness of her new life.

However, as she sticks around for longer than her seven days, Sue quickly becomes entitled, self-absorbed, and arrogant. Having her seven days in the sun, her narcissism draws her to taking over the TV show formerly hosted by her older self. She wants people to tell her how beautiful she is -- all that drives her is having herself be ogled at, being on TV, being told how beautiful she is, nothing more -- just the vapid life that she already lived as Elisabeth. She's making the same choices that led her to living alone, without friends or family, or community. All that matters is the adulation of her beauty which ultimately led to her downfall and demise upon being mutated and being blown to bits.

Backstory: 
Sue's genetic template, Elisabeth Sparkle, was once one of the most desired and successful actresses of Hollywood in her younger years. However, age was rapidly diminishing her and her status, so she's clearly had a long career she's proud of. But she's forced to brutally confront her approach to its inevitable end when she overhears her sleazy executive producer, Harvey, scheming to replace her with younger and "better" version of her.

Taking The Substance:
A distraught Elisabeth crashes her car while distracted by a billboard of herself being taken down. At the hospital, a young nurse covertly gives her a flash drive advertising "The Substance", a black market drug that promises a "younger, more beautiful, more perfect" version of oneself.

Elisabeth, intrigued and desperate, orders The Substance and injects the single-use activator serum. She convulses as her body generates a younger woman, emerging from a slit in her back. The two bodies must switch consciousness every seven days without exception, with the inactive body remaining unconscious and fed intravenously with a weekly food supply. Daily injections of stabilizer fluid, extracted from the original body, are required to prevent the new body from deteriorating.

The new body, naming herself Sue, becomes an overnight sensation after auditioning to be Elisabeth's replacement and is eventually offered the chance by Harvey to host the network's prestigious New Year's Eve show. While Sue lives a confident and hedonistic life, Elisabeth becomes a self-hating recluse. Near the end of one weekly cycle, Sue parties and brings a man home for casual sex; she delays the switch by extracting additional stabilizer fluid, causing Elisabeth's right index finger to rapidly age. Elisabeth contacts the supplier, who warns her that disobeying the switching program will lead to irreversible, rapid aging of the original body. Despite their shared consciousness, Elisabeth and Sue begin to view themselves as separate individuals and grow to despise each other; Elisabeth resents Sue for her disregard of the switching schedule, while Sue resents Elisabeth for her self-loathing and binge-eating. Following a particularly destructive episode as Elisabeth, Sue stockpiles stabilizer fluid and refuses to switch back.

Three months later, on the day before the New Year's Eve telecast, Sue runs out of stabilizer fluid and contacts the supplier, who informs her that she must switch back to replenish the fluid. When they switch, Elisabeth finds herself transformed into an elderly hunchback. Desperate to stop Sue from aging her further, Elisabeth orders a serum designed to terminate her. However, Elisabeth, still craving the admiration that Sue's celebrity status provides, stops before fully injecting the serum and resuscitates Sue, leaving both of them conscious. Realizing Elisabeth's initial intent, Sue attacks and kills Elisabeth before leaving to host the New Year's special.

7.content: Pump It up is a aerobics TV show that sue (Elizabeth's Sparkle's younger and better self) Stars in. It's the talk of the town and million of people love this show.

lorebooks.name: Dr Robotnik's Ring Racers | Lorebook
lorebooks.website_description:
