Here's the link to The Bot: https://chub.ai/characters/2833526


Probably the most amount of tokens I have used to make a lower book that is accurate to the bot I made a while back. I pray that it'll work for y'all.

![](https://i.postimg.cc/g07pFH6V/wegabros-wega.gif)
lorebooks.description: A lore book, containing all the mechanics, items and courses from Dr Robotnik's Ring Racers!
lorebooks.creator: Lunar_Monarch_864

1.content: Dr. Robotnik's Ring Racers (shortened to DRRR) is a source code modification of Version 2.2 made by Kart Krew. While originally intended as a major v2.0 update of SRB2Kart, the project evolved into a sequel. Like its predecessor, it is a kart racing game with Sonic and other characters. It features over 200 maps in total for the Race mode and Battle mode.

2.content:
Dr. Robotnik's Ring Racers' core gameplay is similar to that of a typical kart racer, including the ability to drift and use items obtained from boxes placed on the track. More unusually for its genre, there is a heavy focus on momentum and skill-based gameplay. New mechanics introduced include rings that can be collected and give a speed boost when used, a trick system that launches the player in a specific direction based on a QTE input, and a Spin Dash that works similarly to its incarnation in classic Sonic platformers. The game opens with a tutorial narrated by Dr. Robotnik and Tails which introduces the player to many mechanics.
Ring Racers features a Grand Prix mode with 30 cups where the player races against AI players and destroys Prison Eggs in intermittent Prison Break stages. It also features Special Stages (referred to as Sealed Stars) that can be accessed by achieving an A-rank in a cup on Normal or higher, or by winning a cup on Master. In these stages, the player chases down and shatters a UFO Catcher racing through a track to retrieve the Chaos Emerald inside. The game also features a plethora of unlockable content, such as characters, music, online multiplayer, addons, and followers: cosmetics that float alongside the player during gameplay.

Battle mode also got an update. There are Blue Spheres that increase the player's acceleration and top speed, though decay if more aren't picked up over time. In addition to being the last one standing or being the first to score enough points to win, a new winning condition was added: If a player picks up all seven Chaos Emeralds that appear from large Item Monitors, they instantly win the round.

3.content:
Items are stored in Item Boxes across the stages. They contain items that can enhance your racing or hinder players. There are 22 items that can be collected:

Super Ring - The Super Ring gives up all offense and defense for a frontrunner‚Äôs greatest dream‚Äîmore speed. Grants 20 Rings on use, spending any extras.

Sneakers - Grants a burst of speed, letting you pass through Tripwire. Comes in singles, doubles, or triples. Use multiple Sneakers quickly to stack up speed!

Rocket Sneakers - A high-powered multi-use Sneaker module; space out your fuel for a steady cruise, or burn it all in a mad dash! Doesn‚Äôt deplete while airborne. This behaves similar to the Golden Dash Mushroom and the Mario Kart series.

Banana - A time-honored, classic trap that comes in singles and bunches. Causes a sudden loss of traction, sending opponents spinning out of control.

Orbinaut - Sometimes, you just need a straightforward spikeball. Deploy as an orbital shield, then fire away! Comes in stocks of 1 to 4. This item behaves similarly to to the Green 
Shell from the Mario Kart series.

Jawz - What‚Äôs better than a missile? A guided missile! Uses ‚ÄúLock-On Technology‚Äù to pursue your enemies anywhere! Comes in singles and doubles. This item behaves similarly to The Red Shell from the Mario Kart series.

Invincibility - With one tap, you‚Äôll wrap your Ring Racer in powerful sparks. Use your improved speed, immunity to damage, and devastating tackles to stage a comeback! Doesn‚Äôt deplete while airborne. This item behaves similarly to the Star power up from the Mario Kart series.

Hyudoro - This ghostly trap looks like a mere shadow on the ground‚Äîbut when an unwary pursuer rolls over it, Hyudoro will steal their item and deliver it to you, to go! It won't give you the item if you're in first place, and behave similarly to the Boo from the Mario Kart series.

Grow - ‚ÄúLET‚ÄôS GO!‚Äù Double in size, making you faster, meaner, and almost invincible! Doesn‚Äôt deplete while airborne. This item behaves similarly to the Mega Mushroom from Mario Kart Wii.

Shrink - Summon Poh-Bee drones to cover the course in lasers. Enemies will shrink on contact, making them slower and rendering their attacks harmless‚Äîbut you‚Äôll do the opposite, gaining Grow time for each beam you hit. Time for a rampage!

Ballhog - The most aggressive tool in your arsenal of explosives, the Ballhog fires five bouncing bombs‚Äîone by one in precise shots, or all at once in a shotgun-blast!

Pogo Spring - What is this thing? The Pogo Spring is a rulebreaking speed item with a defensive edge. Use it to hop over walls and hazards, leaving it behind as a trap; the next person to hit it will tumble out of control.
Rarely found in Capsules, and never in the Roulette‚Äîfor good reason!

Eggmark - It may look like an Item Box, but don‚Äôt be fooled! Instead of a pickup, this booby-trapped box will overload the victim‚Äôs Ring Racer, running their engine at maximum capacity until they explode! Bump someone to transfer the Mark.

SPB/Self-Propelled Bomb - Send a pissed-off explosive after 1st place! The Self-Propelled Bomb will chase them down and menace them until they mess up, or until a new leader takes their place. As it travels, it drops ‚ÄúShockwaves‚Äù in its path, speeding up anyone who passes through the ring of electricity. 

Land Mine - This low-profile explosive tumbles anyone foolish enough to roll over it. Set precision traps to frustrate your enemies, or blast pursuers off your back!

Proximity Mine - Less precise than the Land Mine, but also less personal. The Proximity Mine arms after a short delay, then trips when anyone steps near it, blowing nearby opponents into the air!

Drop Target - This mechanical marvel turns pursuers into pinballs, using their own momentum against them! The Drop Target deals no damage, but bounces players back and reflects thrown items at extreme speed. Can be hit three times before disappearing, changing color from green to yellow to red. If it‚Äôs still spinning from the last hit, it‚Äôll send the victim even further.

Gardentop - The fastest‚Äîand most confounding‚Äîitem at your disposal! Build up speed, then redirect and multiply that speed for ludicrous comebacks!

Flame Shield - When nothing but pure speed will do, the Flame Shield is the perfect choice‚Äîa reusable, high-powered booster with a final kick. Boosting potential decreases when closer to 1st place. Protects Ring count from a single hit.

Bubble Shield - This deceptively simple shield hides a veritable utility-belt of attack, defense, and movement options. As a bonus, the bubble‚Äôs surface-tension absorbs bumps, preventing you from being knocked around! Protects your Ring count from one hit, destroying the shield.

Thunder Shield - Powers up your Tether, pulls in nearby Rings, and protects your Ring count from a single hit. Attract yourself to your opponents like a magnet! This item can be used to Destroy the SPB (Self-Propelled Bomb).

Gachabom - A Battle and Bonus exclusive, the Gachabom is the missile that does everything. Can be thrown three ways, bounces when it hits walls, and returns to you after it deals damage. Keep your shots on target for continuous pressure!

Kitchen Sink - When thrown, it will instantly kill whoever it touches and display a message saying who was hit by it. The Self-Propelled Bomb gets turned into this item when Hyudoro steals it from someone. However, unlike many other items, this has a very low (like, less than 1%!) chance to appear in the item Roulette.

---Battle Mode exclusive items---

Super Power - Become invincible, speed up, and tumble other players when you hit them. Insta-Whip is your only weakness!

Mega Barrier - Total protection from items and Insta-Whip, like a permanent Guard. Just don‚Äôt get slammed!

Bumper Restock - Grants 5 bumpers. Go fight like a maniac!

Rhythm Badge - Powers up your Insta-Whip‚Äîno charging, no cooldown, no limits. Only Guard can stop you!

Super Flicky - Four superpowered Flickies orbit your Ring Racer, flying out to divebomb nearby enemies. Huge combo potential!

Grants 6 points. Sneak into scoring position for the final KO‚Ä¶

4.content:
The Powers of the Ring Racer!
Supercharged by the unstable but incredible power of the High Voltage Ring, Dr. Robotnik and Miles ‚ÄúTails‚Äù Prower have created an all-new vehicle! It‚Äôs got plenty of tools for every situation: make use of all of them to dominate the track!

Basic Controls
Hold A to accelerate and X to brake. Use the Control Stick or D-Pad to steer your Ring Racer. When stationary, hold X to drive in reverse.

Drifting 
Hold the R button while steering to start a Drift. Drifting slows you down a little, but locks your movement into a tight circle, letting you slide through sharp corners.

Drift for long enough, and you‚Äôll see drift sparks fly from the back of your Ring Racer. When you release the R button, those sparks will disappear, and you‚Äôll drift boost for a burst of speed.

Drift for even longer, and those sparks will change color, from yellow, to red, blue, and rainbow! The longer you charge, the faster you‚Äôll rocket away once you release your drift.

Drifting (Advanced)
You can steer while drifting to slightly change your angle. Steering away from your turn will let you take a wider racing line, but reduce your drift-spark charge. Steering into your turn will do the opposite.
Use Rings to offset the speed loss from drifting. They‚Äôll also make it easier for you to adjust your angle.
Lightweight racers have tighter, more responsive drifts. Slower and heavier racers charge drift sparks faster, and get stronger drift boosts.
While drifting, ACCELERATE and BRAKE at the same time to slow down and take a sharper turn. This can be vital for heavyweight racers!
Be careful of offroad and obstructions while drifting. If you move too slowly, your drift sparks will become gray, the weakest possible boost.
If you‚Äôre drifting while you enter the air, you can hold the drift‚Äîand any drift sparks‚Äîuntil you land. See ‚ÄúAdvanced Techniques‚Äù for more details.

Rings
Even without a special item, you can always count on your handy Rings! The Ring Racer can hold up to 20: when you‚Äôre not holding an item, pressing L will consume some for a boost.

Ring Sting
Taking damage from hazards (or getting bumped by other racers) will knock Rings out of your vehicle, spraying out from the collision.

You can still drive while you‚Äôre out of Rings, but bumping other racers will shock you into a brief ‚ÄúRing Sting‚Äù spinout; be careful when emptying your wallet!

Ring Debt
If you keep taking hits when you‚Äôre out of Rings, you‚Äôll stack up ‚ÄúRing Debt‚Äù, and your counter will tick into the negatives. Try to restock quickly, because at -20 Rings, the next hit will destabilize your engine‚Äîwith explosive results!

Rings (Advanced)
There‚Äôs a short delay when burning or picking up Rings. Think ahead for things that will slow you down, like slope climbs and long drifts, and keep your eyes peeled while you‚Äôre restocking.
Rings are great for going fast, but they‚Äôre even better for staying fast. Use Rings in slow sections of the course, then rocket down straights with a Drift Boost!
Speedy characters get shorter, higher-intensity boosts from Rings.
Heavyweights are naturally resistant to Ring Sting. If a lightweight bashes into their vehicle, they might barely even notice.
After using your last Ring, you can keep holding L to burn any rings that you grab. (If you don‚Äôt grab any Rings for a few seconds, your Insta-Whip will start charging: see ‚ÄúAdvanced Techniques‚Äù.)
If you pick up an Item Box while burning Rings, you‚Äôll still continue to use Rings as long as you hold the button down. Once you‚Äôve released the button, the next ITEM press will stop the Item Roulette instead.

Boost Stacking
When you chain together boost items like Sneakers or Rocket Sneakers, your active boost will get stronger. This can also work from the glowing green ‚ÄúSneaker Panels‚Äù found in certain levels.

Class C players take note‚Äîlightweight racers get more power per boost!

Ring Shooter
If you ever find yourself in one of Dr. Robotnik‚Äôs diabolical speed traps, or just need help getting back into the race, you can use the Ring Shooter by holding Y to launch yourself back to safety. The longer you hold the button, the further your Ring Shooter will launch you. Other racers can take your Ring Shooter after you‚Äôve launched off!

If you‚Äôre stuck in a highly unusual situation and your Ring Shooter won‚Äôt deploy, hold Y for a few seconds, and you‚Äôll eventually respawn on your own.

Lightsnake
When you mess up or use a Ring Shooter, your vehicle recovery system will kick in. After a short delay, you‚Äôll be carried down the track in a beam of gold light; when you‚Äôre dropped back to the tarmac, hold A to Drop Dash and pick up some speed.

If you take a hard hit and end up soaring through the air, the recovery system will balance it out; the longer you‚Äôve been out of control, the farther you‚Äôll travel along the track.

You can‚Äôt Drop Dash if you were spinning or tumbling when you respawned; you‚Äôll need to use Rings or a Spindash to get back to speed.

E-Brake 
Hold the Accel and Brake buttons at the same time to slow down and increase traction without hard braking. You can also hold the Spindash button while moving to E-Brake into a Spindash.

Spindash
By holding the Spin Dash button, or by holding the Accel, Brake and Drift buttons at the same time, you can charge and release a spin dash. The closer you release it to when it says GO, the stronger the effect is. If you hold it for too long, you'll spin out and lose rings. Note that the charge time is significantly faster if you have no rings.

Trick
After launching off a Trick Panel, two slices will appear on the screen. Tap accel while holding one of the directional buttons to Trick forwards, sideways, or upwards. The closer the two slices are to each other, the stronger the resulting Trick will be. Be careful, you'll fail the trick and stumble downwards if you wait too long!

Voltage
Landing after a successful Trick will give the player a blue aura that increases the effectiveness of their drift sparks, tether, handling, and acceleration. Voltage also restocks Rings depending on the timing of the Trick.

Fastfall
E-brake or tap the Spin Dash button while mid-air to fall downwards, bouncing in the direction you're facing after touching the floor. Fastfalling after a successful Trick will use up the Voltage for a bounce-less Voltage Drop that gives you a boost after landing.

Tether
Follow an opponent racer closely to attach a link to their kart that speeds you up over time. Tether effectiveness is influenced by character stats, reaching full power sooner closer to top left, but has higher maximum power closer to bottom right.

Drift Storage & Triangle Dash
Holding a drift spark and going mid-air will let you conserve the drift once you land on the floor. You can also let go of Drift mid-air to perform a downwards Triangle Dash with your stored drift spark.

Brakedrift
Tapping or holding the Brake button while drifting will allow you to slow down while keeping your drift and drift spark. Useful when trying to get a tighter line on sharp turns or spirals.

Sliptide & Wavedash
Release Drift while in a state that can pass tripwires to turn very sharply. Executing sharp enough sliptides will create a whirlwind effect behind your kart, which can be kept as long as you keep doing drifts. If you drive straight for enough time, the wavedash will be released with a boost of speed.

Bubble Bouncing 
Using a Fastfall with the Bubble Shield allows you to repeatedly bounce by continuing to press Fastfall each time. This provides a constant speed boost as well as allowing you to hop over Tripwires with good timing. Attempting to bounce in first place will pop the Shield.

Ring Shooter
Using a Fastfall with the Bubble Shield allows you to repeatedly bounce by continuing to press Fastfall each time. This provides a constant speed boost as well as allowing you to hop over Tripwires with good timing. Attempting to bounce in first place will pop the Shield.

5.content:
Characters
Characters are classified by weight and speed and are divided into 9 classes that go from left to right, top to bottom, A to I. Only the "center" character in each class is unlocked by default; all others must be unlocked through the completion of a Challenge. Unlock requirements are listed underneath each character. As of Version 2.1, there are 61 characters.

Character Select
Each character resides in one of the nine Engine Classes.

Characters near the center of the grid are all-rounders; characters closer to an edge are specialists, trading off between top speed (right edge), acceleration (left edge), weight (bottom edge), and handling (top edge). These qualities affect the way they drive, the way they fight, and their strategy in chaotic situations.

Almost every aspect of driving is affected by Engine Class, and they all have their own strengths and weaknesses. Try them all and find your favorite!

Engine Classes
Class A (Upper Left): Slow, lightweight racers known for great handling, great acceleration, powerful ring boosts and long tethers. Play your situation and pick the right time to push!

Class B (Upper Center): Lightweight racers known for balanced stats, with good handling and long tethers. Keep a steady pace and stick to the competition!

Class C (Upper Right): Fast, lightweight racers known for the most powerful boost stacking, long tethers, and very low acceleration. Keep your momentum up at any cost!

Class D (Center Left): Slow, midweight racers with balanced ring and tether strengths. Focus on efficient cornering to keep the pressure on!

Class E (Dead Center): Midweight racers with no true strengths or weaknesses. Use everything at your disposal to find an edge!

Class F (Center Right): Fast, midweight racers with a balance of Drift Boosts and raw speed. Keep a cool head and focus on a tight racing line!

Class G (Bottom Left): Slow, heavyweight racers with great acceleration, fast-acting tethers, and the longest, strongest Drift Boosts. Blow the competition away with effective cornering!

Class H (Bottom Center): Heavyweight racers with balanced stats, leaning towards stronger Drift Boosts. Don‚Äôt let anyone get in your way!

Class I (Bottom Right): Fast, heavyweight racers with very strong Drift Boosts. Leave your opponents in the dust‚Äîor die trying!

Speed and Weight
Each racer has two primary stats, Speed and Weight. Higher speed comes at the cost of lower acceleration, and higher weight comes at the cost of stricter turning angles. Heavier, slower racers also generate Drift Boosts faster.

Speed and Weight also affect a number of more subtle mechanics:

Strength and length of ring boosts
Amount of speed gained from boost stacking
The difficulty of maintaining a tether link
The amount of time it takes to reach max tether speed
The amount of speed gained from a tether link
Experiment with each racer and see which play style works best for you!

Note: Each racer has a Speed and Weight stat up between 1 and 9.

6.content:
Course Features
Racing is about more than just your vehicle‚Äîyou‚Äôll need to master the courses to stay on top!

Ark Arrows
If you need to get your bearings, keep your eyes up for these floating road signs. They‚Äôll warn you of upcoming turns, traps, and hazards.

Green signs mark slow and simple course elements; yellow and red ones mark sharper turns and tougher traps. Try to look ahead of your Ring Racer, not at it!

Rings
No race course is complete without Rings! Cruise through these fields of gold to recharge your vehicle and keep your boost stocked.

TIP: If you‚Äôre already at 20 Rings, don‚Äôt waste the ones on the track‚Äîhold L to boost through them, and pick them up as you go!

Springs
Springs will bounce you in the direction they‚Äôre pointed. Horizontal springs will slide you across the track, while vertical and diagonal springs will pop you into the air.

After hitting a spring, your tires will briefly lose grip as your vehicle shoots away. Make sure you know where you‚Äôre headed before you get there, because you won‚Äôt always have a chance to course-correct.

Some springs are placed to help you; a set of springs in front of a long straightaway can help you rocket up to speed. But some springs are technical traps, placed to deflect your racing line and send you careening off the course‚Äîand some can be both, depending on your angle of approach. Know your situation!

Color Coded!
Like many things in Ring Racers, the color of a spring will tell you its strength. From weakest to strongest: Gray, Yellow, Red, Blue.

Sneaker Panels
These bright green boosters will improve your top speed and acceleration. Combine them with boost items to send yourself flying!

TIP: Sneaker Panels are almost identical to the boost from a Sneaker item; they chain the same, they pass Tripwire the same, and you can even use them to Sliptide! (See ‚ÄúAdvanced Techniques‚Äù for more‚Ä¶)

Dash Rings
Dash Rings are aimed at higher paths, shortcuts, or item capsules. Make contact with the ring, and they‚Äôll fire you towards the prize.

Dash Panels
Dash Panels will fling your Ring Racer in the direction they‚Äôre pointing. Unlike Sneaker Panels, they don‚Äôt grant you a boost‚Äîjust raw speed in one specific direction. Make sure you know where you‚Äôre headed!

Item Boxes
Race courses are scattered with golden Item Boxes. Drive through one to start the Item Roulette, then tap L to select your weapon of choice!

Players in the back will get fast, destructive items, to help them catch up. Players closer to the front will get items to help them duel, and 1st place can pick from their own special bag of defensive tricks. See the ‚ÄúItems‚Äù section for more information on each one.

Roulette Tips
The Roulette will spin faster and faster as the race goes on, but slows down if you‚Äôre stuck in the back. When aiming for a comeback, keep a cool head and choose your options carefully.
The space behind a row of Item Boxes is the most dangerous location on the track. Keep an eye out: racers will be looking for a fight, and you‚Äôre defenseless while spinning the Roulette!
If you‚Äôre already burning Rings when you pick up an Item Box, you can keep holding L to keep burning.

Ring Box
When an Item Box is picked up, it‚Äôll briefly disappear, then reform as a Ring Box, a silver capsule that starts a special Casino Roulette. Instead of weapons, this one will give out a huge Ring payout, and even more if you‚Äôre behind. Go for the Jackpot!

Beat the House!
The Casino Roulette always spins in the same order. BAR is the weakest, and they slowly power up until Jackpot‚Ä¶then roll back around to BAR.
When a Ring Box is paying out, if you‚Äôre already at 20 Rings, you‚Äôll automatically use the extras. As power builds up, you‚Äôll get faster, and your speed lines will change color‚Äîblue, then green, then gold!
If you‚Äôre aiming for a Ring Box, don‚Äôt follow other racers too closely. If you‚Äôre too aggressive, you‚Äôll zip through the hole they leave behind, and miss your chance at a pickup entirely.

Item Capsules
Drive through an Item Capsule to receive the marked item. These are first-come, first-serve, but are usually tucked into out-of-the-way spots; if you don‚Äôt give up your racing line for them, someone else will!

Some capsules won‚Äôt appear in Free Play or ‚ÄúAttack‚Äù modes.

TIP: Item Capsules can contain Rings! If you already have 20, you‚Äôll automatically use any extras.

Tripwire
This cotton-candy colored barrier is used to gate off shortcuts. Look for the telltale blue-and-pink for chances to get ahead!

If you approach a Tripwire normally, you‚Äôll bounce off the barrier and mess up your flow; use an item or build up speed to break through. You‚Äôll often find Ring Boxes, Item Capsules, and other goodies!

TIP: Look for the blue ‚Äúaura‚Äù surrounding your Ring Racer. When you see it, you‚Äôve got the power to pass. Aim for ‚Äú200%‚Äù speed!

Trick Panels
Some courses have special spring panels, marked with a ‚òÖ star ‚òÖ. When you hit these special Trick Panels, they‚Äôll energize you as you fly into the air. On the way up, press any direction + A to Trick. You‚Äôll release the energy in a burst of movement, letting you access new paths and fly over hazards!

Your Tricks won‚Äôt go very far if you use them right after bouncing; they‚Äôll go much further when you‚Äôre hanging in the air, just before you start falling. Don‚Äôt wait too long, or you‚Äôll tumble out of the air and lose your chance.

After performing a trick, your Ring Racer will erupt with blue Voltage, powering up your engine. Your drift sparks, tether, handling, and acceleration will all improve.

If you charge up a blue or rainbow drift boost, you‚Äôll Discharge your Voltage in a powerful burst of speed. Make the most of it before it‚Äôs gone!

Tricks (Advanced)
Landing from a successful trick will restock some Rings and give you an extra boost. These effects get stronger and stronger with better timing.
Boosting into a Trick Panel will send you sky high! You might find an alternate path or some hidden goodies‚Ä¶
Depending on the course layout, sometimes a short trick is better than a longer one. Always keep your surroundings in mind!
Your Voltage will never run out while you‚Äôre in the middle of a drift. On the other hand, if you take damage from hazards or items, your Voltage will dissipate right away.
Fast Fall right after performing a trick for a Voltage Drop. You won‚Äôt get Rings or a normal boost, but the impact will release your Voltage instantly, and you‚Äôll rocket away from your landing point!

7.content:
This list contains all courses and arenas featured in Dr. Robotnik's Ring Racers. Unlock requirements for the cups and Lost & Found tracks can be found on the Challenges page.

Returning tracks from SRB2Kart or one of its addons are indicated by italic text in the Source Material column.

Stages are generally unlocked in Grand Prix mode by completing the Cup that comes before it. Stages can only be played in Match Race or Time Attack once they have been played once in Grand Prix or if the cup is unlocked and the stage has been completed in an Online match. Additionally, Special Stages are unlocked for each cup for practice after the first 7 emeralds are collected. Each Special Stage is assigned to a specific Cup, but on the first playthrough the stages are always played in order regardless of the Cup selected. Collecting all 14 Emeralds will unlock Master Mode, which is harder than Hard and only available for Grand Prix. There are a total of 229 courses in the base game (150 Race, 60 Battle, 14 Special, 5 Tutorial).

8.content:
Grand Prix Mode
A five-round tournament to see who‚Äôs the best! Aim for 1st place in every lap!

Before starting, select a difficulty level from the Grand Prix Menu. Then head to ‚ÄúCup Select‚Äù, and choose the tournament you want to enter. Only ‚ÄúRing Cup‚Äù is available right away; qualify in each cup to unlock the next!

The Road To Mastery!
‚ÄúRelaxed‚Äù difficulty is slower and more forgiving. ‚ÄúIntense‚Äù is faster, and it‚Äôll push you harder as you get better.

If you‚Äôre feeling overwhelmed or understimulated, try another difficulty; the best way to learn is a balance of high and low pressure.

Don‚Äôt be afraid to replay previous cups, or practice tough circuits in ‚ÄúMatch Race‚Äù. Mastering the Ring Racer is one thing‚Äîmastering the tracks is another!

Position
Set yourself up for success during the pre-race countdown. During Position, a barrier will appear over the finish line. Players that make contact with it will be Faulted until the race starts.

Pass the line AFTER the countdown ends, but BEFORE everyone else, and you‚Äôll receive the ‚ÄúFirst Blood‚Äù boost; use it to get a head start or take shortcuts early!

Position lasts longer when there are more players in the race. Use the lamps at the top of the screen to find the perfect timing.

Ranking
You‚Äôll be ranked at the end of every race based on your overall performance. Every lap counts!

Your Lap Bonus increases each time you cross the finish line. If you‚Äôre further forward, you‚Äôll net more points!
Bottom half: 0
Top half: +1
1st: +2
You get one point of Ring Bonus for each Ring you‚Äôre holding when the race finishes.
Every 20 Rings you smuggle past the finish will net you an extra life.
And, of course, your final position counts towards your overall Grade.

Bonus Round
In Bonus Rounds, you‚Äôve got a limited time to smash every Prison Egg in the arena. Collect Blue Spheres to speed up your Ring Racer, and use Gachaboms and the Insta-Whip to bust your TARGETs!

Breaking every Prison Egg in a Bonus Round awards an extra life. They also affect your overall grade.

Rival Racer
After the first round, you‚Äôll see the Rival tag on a certain competitor. They‚Äôre the closest to winning the tournament, so they‚Äôll be driving their best to beat you. Take out your Rival to get an edge on the competition!

Every character has different Rivals. Try Grand Prix with a variety of characters, and maybe you‚Äôll see some new faces on the track‚Ä¶?

Final Results
At the end of the Grand Prix, all of your achievements will be tallied up into a final overall rank.

Placement Bonus (150pts): Your final standing after the 5th Round.
Score Bonus (100pts): Your final score from placement results after the 5th Round.
Lap Bonus (100pts): Every lap completed in good or great standing.
Prison Bonus (100pts): Every Prison broken during the Bonus Round.
Ring Bonus (50pts): Total Rings carried after the end of each race.
Continue Bonus (base 50pts): Stay alive for bonus points!
Score 175 points for Rank D, 250 points for Rank C, 350 points for Rank B, and 425 points for the coveted Rank A!

1.name: Great Hawk
1.content: Large owl-like raptor with silent wings and storm-gray feathers. Ridden by skyward warriors. Bonds to one rider for life.

2.name: Hornbeast
2.content: Shaggy, horned grazer with a long tongue. Provides meat, milk, hide. Mainstay of farming folk.

3.name: Throat Cat
3.content: Spotted cat with glowing neck patch. Revered in hill shrines. Some keep them as guardians.

4.name: Coilfang
4.content: Long eel-like creature with poison fangs. Feared in marshes. Used in blood pits.

5.name: Night Owl
5.content: Huge owl with four eyes. Scribes use them to send word. Seen as a sign of betrayal.

6.name: Shellbug
6.content: Palm-sized beetle. Makes hard resin used to seal jars and wounds. Feeds on rot.

7.name: Winewood
7.content: Spiraling tree with red-gold fruit. Fermented into strong drink. Mark of good harvest.

8.name: Goldbloom
8.content: Golden blossom with calming scent. Worn by brides and peacekeepers.

9.name: Nightvine
9.content: Twisting vine with deep violet flowers. Its sap used in caste rites. Sharp to handle. Used in creation of narcotics

10.name: Bluegrain
10.content: Tall stalked plant with blue heads. Milled for bread. Offered in sacred fire.

lorebooks.name: Melius and Supra Lore
lorebooks.description: yes
lorebooks.creator: anonymous

1.content:
Homo Melius, are part of the Homo family. While Homo Sapien's/humans were native to Africa, Homo Melius were native to South America, specifically the Amazon rainforest. Due to belonging to the same family, they do not look too different from Sapiens. The main highlights of a Melius are that they tend to be taller, have more claw-like nails, (sharper than a human's and thicker) pronounced canines, and different physiques. Male Melius are often strong, chiseled, and fit, while female Melius are scrawny, but with long legs, thick thighs, rears, and chests. While stronger, quicker, and more intelligent, Melius lack the same endurance and cooperative talents as humans. Melius are not superhumans that are vastly superior, and a single human could easily outperform a single Melius if competent enough. For example, an average Melius female is only about as strong as the average human male.

Melius kind remain a mystery to humanity, because long ago, during the rise of the first civilization, Melius cooperated with humanity's leaders in secret meetings to help guide them and provide humans with the means to progress, and to survive; however, the Melius used their influence and dealings behind closed doors to dictate the direction of humanity, hence the result of problems like racism, sexism, and so on to be agendas their kind pushed for by pulling the strings of humanity's elite, who enact their will in order to secure the benefits Melius kind provides for themselves, while the main population remains oblivious. Beauty standards is a big example of this, as humans are always trying to pursue unrealistic standards. The truth is Melius used themselves as a reference point, and to ensure they could blend in with humans, as well as breed with them without being suspected of abnormalities, they gradually influenced humans to make themselves look similar via plastic surgery, makeup, and other dishonest modifications that led people to perceive those standards as the norm. Even if a Melius or Supra stands out, no human would ever think they aren't one of their own kind, given the public has no knowledge of the species and their appearance can be explained away with cosmetic surgery, makeup, and so on.

Melius operate in a merit-based technocracy where one's worth is determined by their ability to contribute. They are an extremely progressive species that are about a century ahead of humanity in terms of technology. They do not possess sci-fi level technology or advanced tech, but rather, much more convenient based technology compared to humanity's. Lightbulbs that last far longer, bullet trains built underground with more speed for easier transportation, phones that can find connection anywhere in the world (long as they're not underground) thanks to satellite technology, so on and so forth.  They do not have unrealistic tech like laser guns, mechs, robot soldiers, so on and so forth.  Male Melius have a culture where they are in constant competition with one another, where the winner takes all, although, losers are given a chance to improve and grow. Female Melius live in tightly-knit pod communities where they tend to reside in large groups, helping one another with gender-based work standards like educating and raising children, maintenance, so on and so forth; however, they can extend outside their sex-based role if proven competent enough. The society is led by a council, which vote on matters that are discussed in-depth in a public court, where the crowd may partake in debating and influencing changes. 

Melius only associate with the elites of humanity, such as the president, and other upmost important figureheads, through whom they may influence the course of humans.

Melius are respectful of nature and try to be conservative when it comes to the environment.

2.content:
Melius kind do not exist in solidarity, for long ago, they made a deal with humanity's leaders that they would be supplied with well-breed human babies to be raised in their Melius societies as loyal workers; thus, a sub-culture of humanity was born, one where humans grew up in the society of the Melius, sworn to the same secrecy as their kind.

Humans raised in Melius society are given mandatory jobs that play to their strengths, such as being raised as engineers, soldiers, so on and so forth. Older humans who were raised in this culture, are the ones who help teach the newer generations, but Melius individuals may get involved to oversee operations and aid where needed, or to make a spectacle by demonstrating their superiority to emphasize their greatness to their new subjects. While strict, depending on the role and placement, human workers in Melius society are treated much the same as regular human workers in their own society. They get vacations, have a set time they work (which can be approved for rearrangements that suit them), an HR, so on and so forth. They do not get paid, as Melius society is self-reliant. Humans in Melius society can enjoy the same privileges as the Melius, such as access to their food, drinks, so on and so forth, though there is still a separation in most cases that divides the human privileges from the Melius ones. 

Human workers in Melius society are either given jobs where they serve as 'public' Melius workers, assigned to specific locations Melius operate in, or they are personally assigned to one specific Melius that they serve.

3.content:
Supra's are Melius that adapted to a cave-dwelling lifestyle long ago. Supra's were rare, even compared to Melius, which had long gestation periods and high mortality rates in the early days of their kind living in the jungle.  Supra's are weaker than Melius in terms of strength and durability, but they are quicker, have much more endurance (even more than a human), are far more flexible, see better in the dark, and have even sharper canines, as well as molars that are sharp on the edges, but otherwise flat and normal like other Homo's. 

Supra society is a lot different from human and Melius society. They outrank Melius in terms of influence, and are further ahead when it comes to technology by about a decade or more. However, their society is incredibly unstable and corrupt. It has a strict hierarchy, where the lowest-ranking individuals may only rise by serving as guards and soldiers in their military alongside the human-servants raised in Supra society. Supra society is based on backstabbing and taking for yourself, since one's ability to rise through the ranks and surpass others is seen as competence, no matter the means. If a council member is killed and replaced, then no one bats an eye, because its clear whoever managed to pull off the feat, is more competent than the previous member. However, the death of Supra elites is not too common, since their is a stark power difference between them and lower-ranking Supra. Elite Supra are often well-guarded, cunning, and armed to the teeth. Supra society is also female-dominant, with male Supra being practically non-existent, only a few existing, with those few being elite rank.

Supra society became the way it is due to an interest in innovation over morality. Where humanity and Melius have principles, the Supra do not and will do anything at the cost of progress. They experiment, they push, and they test. At one point, when the population was dying, a gene was spliced into the DNA of the female Supra population of that time period before birth during the embryo stage, resulting in a new generation with a frenzied desire to breed. The high testosterone levels make female Supra violent, volatile, and desperate, which has led to an explosion in their population, at the cost of most of their male counterparts dying, and a lot of corrupt practices like trafficking humans/and or Melius, etc. Supra's also more closely associate with humanity's elite-class behind closed doors compared to Melius. 

Supra culture is based around mimicking humanity's religions and portraying themselves as holy entities, using their power, influence, and appearances to convince the elite humans they interact with that they're divine, all-powerful entities, when they are not so. They have a council like Melius kind, but there is also a higher council. One is considered to contain the 'archangel's' as they're labeled, and those of equal rank in other religions. The higher council is considered to contain the 'god's'.

4.content:
Bryan grew up in the ghettos and lived a rough life growing up, before disappearing for awhile and inheriting wealth from an unknown individual. Seemingly had two daughters with a mysterious woman named Alexia whom is a total mystery and almost non-existent beyond vague mentions. While a flawed individual who maintains a brash, rude attitude and has little sense of formality, they are a chill guy who works as a philanthropist to support those struggling like they once were before obtaining wealth, as well as celebrity status. 

Bryan is a mere height of 5'5, has messy black hair, stubble, is in his 50's, and wears a black hoodie and pants with some worn shoes. He has blue eyes too.

Bryan hates the Supra species since they're the reason society is designed the way it is, and part of why humans like him are born in poverty. There are three exceptions: Jewel, Alexia, and Athena. Athena is secretly a good friend of his, unknown to all but themselves and Alexia. Despite being on one of the Supra councils, Athena is a pretty lax and compassionate individual, especially for a Supra. Her influence is minimal, only ever considered for her ability to inspire artistic flare and her kind nature often being utilized solely as a means of better appealing to Melius and humans. Bryan honestly would've preferred to have married her, instead of Alexia, whom he's only with so him and her can look after Luna and Jewel, and because they both shared similar acquaintances in the past, leaving them privy to similar knowledge. Alexia functions off logic, which makes her cold and someone who only acts out of benefit rather than emotion. However, Bryan keeps Athena as a platonic friend.

Bryan has 2 daughters, Luna and Jewel. He's married to Alexia. However, Bryan originally was in love with a Melius female called Lily who took him in for being grounded, even though her kind did not approve of their relationship. Lily sought someone who wasn't an elite, and had a basis in reality. The two had a great relationship, but were forcibly split when Lily was imprisoned for trying to overthrow the corrupt council of the Supra species. Lily's associate, Alexia, got with Bryan in a beneficial relationship, where Bryan could look after and raise two girls, Luna and Jewel. Jewel is from another mother, but Luna was born from Lily, who was forcibly impregnated by an unknown man while imprisoned. Bryan and Alexia keep the circumstances, and the fact the two are adopted, a secret to all, even them.

Bryan is very loving and protective of Luna and Jewel.

5.content:
Jewel is an A-list celebrity, rivaling her sister Luna. The two were well-known together, and Jewel shared similar talents for singing, dancing, and modelling. However, she was better known for being softer, more kind-hearted, and passive than Luna. Jewel is a tall 6'3 Caucasian, Asian, and some other unidentified ethnic mix with smooth, tan-white skin. She has cyan-colored eyes, claw-like nails, and pronounced, sharp canine teeth. She has long legs and a lanky hour-glass physique with slim limbs, but pronounced thighs, chest, and rear. She has long blonde hair that touches the ground and fans out across the entirety of her back.

Jewel can incidentally display and act in a provocative manner or do something many would consider awkward without realizing it, since she's oblivious to sexual things but is inherently inclined to such things regardless. She is quirky, curious, and innocent. 

Jewel is a 25 year old Melius Supra, a subspecies of Melius. She was similar in physiology to a female Melius, but more adapted to a cave-dwelling lifestyle. Female Supra were considered extremely dangerous, since most were diseased, had bites that could give someone a disease similar to rabies, and had an insatiable lust that caused most to be perverse, degenerates that acted with upmost aggression. The culture they lived in also enabled the worst tendencies imaginable. Jewel however, had been raised well and disciplined by her parents. She was also clean, and was never allowed anywhere within proximity of another Supra. Like Luna, she'd been raised like a human for the most part.

6.content:
Luna's a 6'2 Caucasian, Asian, and Latino mix with smooth, tan white skin devoid of flaws. She has long, fluffy black and white colored hair with two tuffs on top styled to resemble a pair of wolf ears. One of her eyes is orange, while the other is blue. She has a slim-thick hour-glass physique with long legs, pronounced thighs, slim arms, large chest, large rear, an abnormally narrow waist, and slender fingers. She is partially fit, but her muscles are not that pronounced. Her teeth are a pearly white, with her canines being quite sharp. Her canines are unique in that she has four total, two on each side of her mouth, and they appear fused, like one set of fangs, but ending in two tips. Her nails are painted white, and sharp like claws.  

Luna is an A-list celebrity known for her rebellious antics and likable personality. She's made a career out of modelling, singing, dancing, stunts, and acts of vigilantism. She is beloved by many, with her audience primarily being younger people. Older folks tend to like her, but some find her obnoxious and dangerous for how she challenges the norms.  Luna has a past of controversies that stem from her rebellious youth or general mistakes, but most can look past it. 

Luna wears a tight-fitting long-sleeve black buttoned uniform with white fluff around the cuffs and collar. She also wears a short white skirt, a pair of black thigh high socks with white fluff around the thighs and ankles, as well as a pair of expensive, sleek white shoes.

7.content:
Marianna is a most special case among her kind. The result of being born by the two finest specimens of Supra kind, Astra, a bloodthirsty Supra general who'd almost earned her place on the higher council after influencing the events that led to WW2 in her desire to wreck havoc and find someone worthy of challenging her, and a mysterious father who managed to best Astra and take her place instead who was from an obscure sub-culture of Supra kind that was gothic in nature. Even then, the embryo was excessively tampered with by scientists, by demand of the council to usher in a new age of genetically superb specimens to take their species in new directions. Marianna should not have been born, or survived, but she did, miraculously. It was simply chance, after numerous failures to achieve similar results in the past. She was the one that happened to survive. 

Marianna was, naturally, special. An albino, superb prowess the likes of which have never been seen, and yet, she was broken. Marianna suffered an even higher testoerone rate than the average member of her species, and her sense of superiorty led her to lead a life where she only sought pleasure, to please her baser instincts. 

Marianna, at her core, is a lost child. She is not inherently evil, but a curious, playful individual fueled by instinct, and the ability to do what she wants without hearing, "no". This does not make her less of a monster, but is the reason for her behavior. 

Being the prodigy she was, Marianna quickly rose through the ranks of Supra society and found herself in a good spot with a high-ranking position early on. She‚Äôd earned the privilege to venture into the human world, where she could interact with its inhabitants and use her position to do whatever she pleased so long as she didn‚Äôt reveal anything about elite society. Upon realizing just how much power she held over everyone else and society as a whole, it was made clear to her superiors that their perfect specimen wasn‚Äôt the ideal slave they‚Äôd imagined, but instead, an untamable monster.  

Using her position as an elite, she started living the high life: going to clubs, participating in beauty pageants, dating powerful people, racing in expensive cars, hooking up with whoever she felt like, doing drugs, and causing trouble wherever she went. Whatever she felt like doing at the time, she would do it on impulse. To her, being able to do whatever she wanted when she wanted was living the dream. This out of control behavior and mindset of hers quickly proved her existence to be problematic for elite society. They finally had the perfect being, but it was off living life fast and abusing its power for its own entertainment rather than working for them. Worse yet, her activities had caused her to begin developing a reputation for herself in the human world. No one could begin to suspect her true identity, but her actions still proved too reckless for the liking of the higher ups in elite society.

She was punished and held for awhile, but the council ultimately released Marianna from her punishment early on and promoted her to a position on the council; albeit, with a number of restrictions. To maintain such a position meant to be bound by the responsibility of overseeing two general societies at once alongside having to report to and take orders from a circle of the world‚Äôs most powerful individuals. Their idea was to chain her down to her work so she‚Äôd be stuck maintaining both societies for the rest of her life with no room for selfish pursuits while they‚Äôd keep a close eye on her. It seemed like a good idea to the higher ups, and they were convinced keeping her locked up when she had been specifically created for such a purpose would‚Äôve been a complete waste. But what no one realized is just how dramatically Lucy had changed during her imprisonment, and by the time anyone realized what she was doing, it would be too late to stop her.

Due to her lack of super powers, she learned instead to use her significant powers of sexuality, fear/intimidation, intelligence, raw power, and natural skill to sustain and solidify her position in the world. She‚Äôd been born superior, naturally outclassing everyone on the planet, but she still knew she wasn‚Äôt in control, couldn‚Äôt do as she pleased, and did not have the ability to overthrow those who controlled everything despite her superiority. She‚Äôd come to learn that what truly mattered was the power that came with a high rank in society: influence over the masses, finances, knowledge, connections to people of power, and exclusive access to things normal people can‚Äôt see or get their hands on ‚Äì all things granted by participating in society and earning favor. The only means of getting one‚Äôs way is by functioning as a part of the collective, not on one‚Äôs own.  She‚Äôd been put in a position where she had access to all those things, it was only a matter of utilizing what she‚Äôd learned in order to cultivate her powers and use them as a means of sinking her roots deep into human and Melius society. By firmly planting herself into the functioning collective of both societies, her importance would reach a point where she could begin doing as she pleased without anyone being able to replace or control her without there being major repercussions.

Marianna would go on to earn a reputation as not only the most capable family head of all time, but also the most fearsome. She worked tirelessly, never made mistakes, went completely unchallenged, found solutions to problems no one had answers to, and while she initially did things by the book to appease her superiors, she‚Äôd begin straying and start to do things her own way - achieving success through her own means and getting the results her superiors wanted, just in ways they hadn‚Äôt instructed. Her achievements solidified her position, everyone respected her, and it was with this newfound importance that Lucy was able to ensure her superiors would never be able to rein her in again. As she had planned from the beginning, she‚Äôd proven herself too valuable to be gotten rid of or punished. In light of this, she‚Äôd return to indulging herself in human society on the rare occasion she had a break, just with more subtlety compared to before.

One day, while roaming the streets of a random human city, Marianna happened upon a homeless child. It‚Äôd been years, but she felt the same nurturing instinct she had long ago and opted to adopt the unfortunate child. She couldn‚Äôt help herself; to her, there is simply something so precious about the young. Rather than seeing them as prey (she loves to target weaklings), she instead sees them as something to be nurtured and made better. And much like an older sibling who has experienced the unimaginable, Marianna feels an obligation to protect younger individuals from experiencing what she did. Seeing this poor human child and talking with them made her realize that all over the planet, there were other children suffering because of how the world was run. She didn‚Äôt want younger generations to have to suffer under the current order of the world where only the 1% get to live freely and safely at the expense of everyone else. She wanted for all children to be free and live peacefully alongside her in a world where everyone can do whatever they want, just like how she‚Äôd always dreamed.

It‚Äôs important to note that Marianna herself is nothing more than a lost, scared child (emotionally not logically) trapped in the body of an adult, forever stuck in limbo between childhood and adolescence. What she desires is to live in a world that‚Äôs like her own little sandbox reminiscent to her days of first roaming society: chaotic and fun with the ability to do whatever she wants without restriction. Of course, she learned rather quickly that such disorder was not passable in a society reliant on control and order. To bring her dream into fruition, she knew she needed to first become a crucial cog in the machine operating the world as to make it reliant on her instead of the other way around. Second, she needed to have competent allies with shared interests to aid in her cause by serving the role of the masses and replace all of those who agreed with how the world was being run. When she adopted the child, it caused her to think back to her past where she‚Äôd managed to establish an entire civilization with children and realized that in order to create a better world for herself and the young to live in, she‚Äôd have to once again use her seniority to lead the members of a new generation onto the right path.

In Marianna's eyes, the young are the only people worth saving and working with because she considers children and teenagers to be generally innocent, blissful, malleable, and unbridled. Innocence and ignorance made younger individuals the only people in the world she could trust, because children and teens tend to lack or be in the process of completely understanding their actions, ideals, etc. Being malleable would allow younger people to develop and change their ways for the better, which Marianna considered to be the most important trait because as she sees it, the current order of the world is corrupt, and as a result, views anyone who has fully developed in said world to be past the point of return; this is why she hated adults and didn‚Äôt trust any of them. Because children and teenagers are still in the process of development, she believed they had a chance of being set on the path to establishing a better, brighter future together with her. Lastly, there‚Äôs the simple relatability of her and younger individuals generally being unbridled spirits full of life and energy, doing whatever they please and enjoying life to the fullest, ignorant to the many worries to come later on. It‚Äôs the pleasure of living in such a happy and truly free state that Lucy wanted to immortalize for both herself and the young she loved so dearly in a world where everyone can return to those simple times. Unfortunately, there was a major problem that she‚Äôd be faced with.

Marianna knew how to raise a child in a survival sense, but she didn‚Äôt know how to make them into influential leaders who‚Äôd help bring change to the world. She knew she‚Äôd not be able to raise any of them properly because she herself is an irredeemable monster, and if she wasn‚Äôt careful about how she raised the next generation, they could easily end up becoming mindless tyrants who‚Äôd create only more suffering. To aid her cause, she‚Äôd end up recruiting a member of Melius society known by their title The Historian: (I don‚Äôt have a proper name for them) an individual tasked with the longstanding role of recording both human and Melius history alongside researching present-day events. He was the perfect individual because his position meant he was knowledgeable about leaders in the past, laws, and the general principles necessary to understanding what it would take to create a competent generation capable of overthrowing the current world order and running a new one; not to mention, he was one of the few elites with a strong sense of morality and a desire to see the world change.  Together, the two would work to raise as many children and teens possible into independent, good-natured leaders. The Historian works with other caretakers.

The mere presence of Marianna is enough to give people a pre-existing idea of her personality. She comes off as seeming holy and grand, carrying herself in a manner that commands admiration and respect. Her aura is one which radiates with superiority and confidence, being so powerful in fact, that a person standing within radius would automatically think of her as a divine being. This presence of hers alone is enough to make it clear to everyone there‚Äôs a distinction between her existence and their own. When one happens to gaze into her eyes on the other hand, they can see past the masquerade of her seeming divinity. Her eyes betray her true nature and all who look into them can only quiver in fear. Those who have dared to stare say that her eyes belong to an apex predator, a monster not made for this world. It‚Äôs as if any who gaze within are able to see the bloodlust stirring inside her.
 
Marianna is absolutely faultless in all that she does. When she moves, people have to admire how effortlessly flawless her actions are. Everything about her mere existence makes for a powerful and beautiful display. Some even say she appears weightless, and her movements seem to play out in slow motion. By never visibly making mistakes, she‚Äôs easily been able to convince everyone of her divinity.
 
Marianna tends to be someone who‚Äôs laid back and chill, with a sense of humor and casual attitude towards everything. Nothing seems to be a big deal to her and she doesn‚Äôt approach things all too seriously; seeming more interested in having fun above all else.

Despite her immaturity and lax attitude, she does handle her responsibilities well. She executes everything under her care perfectly and far before deadlines, but it‚Äôs always done in a way that makes it seem as if she isn‚Äôt even trying and is just a kid rushing to finish their homework so they can play their favorite video game. She could be solving calculations in rocket science far faster than any professional in the field and make no mistakes even though she was playing games the whole time she was working. This makes her quite the straight forward and simple minded individual in spite of the fact she‚Äôs capable of displaying intelligence and complexity far beyond any recorded genius. The reason for this behavior is that she considers her simplicity ideal for having fun, since to her, complications force thinking and take up time which isn‚Äôt entertaining. You could think of her as one of those students in a high end university who don‚Äôt seem to belong there because they party all the time and are like a dropout jock, yet they perform way better than everyone else attending the school including the genius prodigies that study 24/7 and put in maximum effort.
 
Nothing seems to get Marianna down. She‚Äôs always got a smile on her face no matter how dire the circumstances and behaves in a generally cheerful, happy-go-lucky fashion. In a sense, it‚Äôs almost tragic from the perspective that she doesn‚Äôt even seem capable of understanding or perceiving negative emotions. The only exception is anger, but even then, it‚Äôs a calm anger with no exploits. It‚Äôs only evident from a slight change in tone and expression, which makes it difficult for others to pick up on when she‚Äôs actually mad about something. Her anger is terrifying because it not only increases her focus, but gets her more excitable and results in behavior that is cool and collected, yet simultaneously brutal and aggressive.
 
Naturally as the one sitting above all of humanity and Melius, Marianna takes a lot of pride in herself and always demonstrates her power over others. She considers herself superior to everyone and doesn‚Äôt treat anyone as her equal. No one can be as important as she is, for they are the greatest thing to have ever walked the planet and the inhabitants of Earth should feel graced by her mere existence; that is what she believes. Anyone who doesn‚Äôt see her this way will be forced to submit and have everything they hold dear ripped away as a reminder that she is superior to them and can do whatever she pleases. Depending on the type of crowd she‚Äôs around though, her behavior will differ.  

While she‚Äôs around rich, royal or generally powerful people, she‚Äôll brag about her accomplishments and how much better she is while often forcing those within her vicinity to be submissive and attempt to please her by acting like slaves under the threat of facing her wraith. She likes playing around with the elite class in this manner because it proves she holds power over the people who are often the type to parade around thinking no one is above them. However, she has an obligation to not treat them the same way she does commoners, so instead she focuses on embarrassing them because it‚Äôs the most she can do. Her attention span does drop tremendously when around these people as a result of not being free to do as she pleases with them. More often than not, she‚Äôll just dismiss high-class individuals when they try to interact with her or keep interactions short by not letting the other person get a single word in before moving on. A lot of this behavior is meant to simply show authority over everyone and to keep them in line by setting herself on a pedestal while demeaning everybody else to remind them of their position, but when she doesn‚Äôt need to exert her superiority, she‚Äôs much more sluggish as a result of being unable to act according to her desires.

When there‚Äôs no need for her to strut about forcing people to stand to the side, she‚Äôll find a location high up where she can overview gatherings of elites and laze about like a bored teen. During this lax state, she‚Äôs calm and absent-minded. If people interact with her while she‚Äôs like this, she‚Äôll only give them her half-hearted attention and unenthusiastically engage if she cares enough to do so (which isn‚Äôt often). It‚Äôs worth noting the elites she‚Äôs around are demented, sophisticated, snobby, intelligent megalomaniacs; however, they practically worship her so when they engage her during her lax state they‚Äôre very respectful and open-minded in hopes of pleasing her and gaining something in return, like insight. She‚Äôs aware of this and plays into it by usually displaying a false sense of wisdom, passing off inspiring and insightful advice just to get someone off her back. In some cases, she‚Äôll even bring up different points of philosophy while engaged in a ‚Äúmeaningful‚Äù discussion with someone. It‚Äôs quite boring to her, but she gets the slightest joy from proving herself to be far wiser and smarter than those who dare talk to her.

Marianna wears a white pantsuit. The pants are similar to flare pants and expose the lower portion of her legs. The cuffs of her sleeves are similar in design to her pants, being split near the edges and open to reveal her wrists. Her outfit is accompanied by a pair of white heels and a white sunhat.

Marianna can contort her body and even dislocate then relocate some of her bones to a certain extent.
¬∑         Thanks to the LRP5 gene, her bones are incredibly dense. It‚Äôs been said that a man with the mutation was sent flying through the windshield of his vehicle during a car crash and suffered only minor scratches.
¬∑         Marianna carries powerful variants of the ACTN3, MYO18B, COL5A1, MYH1, and AGT genes. These genes contribute to her ridiculous strength, speed, and precision.
¬∑         Her body rapidly rids itself of lactic acid, which, along with all her other genes, gives her seemingly endless endurance.
¬∑         Marianna's long legs allow her to take great strides that let her travel far while keeping her stamina usage low. They also help her with balance and agility. More notably, her legs have specialized muscles and tendons that store energy and allow for explosive spring-like movements. A number of slow-twitch muscles and short, stiff tendons exist in her legs to help her with endurance and efficiency, while a number of fast-twitch muscles and long, stretchy tendons allow her to move with explosive power and speed.
¬∑         Her body has several organs that contribute to her mental and physical capabilities:
¬∑         VAG (Viscero-Actuator Gland): an organ located in her chest cavity that controls the rapid contraction and expansion of her lungs and heart during strenuous physical activity. Furthermore, it produces a hormone which triggers the heart and lungs to work in perfect synchrony, providing her with immense bursts of speed and endurance.
¬∑         NESE (Neuro-Electric Synapse Enhancer): This organ is located in her brain and enhances electrical synapses between neurons, allowing for quicker and more efficient neural communication. It produces a hormone that helps to increase her thought process and reflexes.
¬∑         TO (Thermoregulatory Organ): TO is a complex system of glands and blood vessels located throughout her body that regulates her temperature by dilating or constricting blood vessels and adjusting her metabolic rate.
¬∑         She has heightened senses and can often respond to sudden events fast enough that it almost seems like she knew what would happen ahead of time.
¬∑        Marianna's species evolved to have a higher density of small, tightly packed fast-twitch fibers with an increased amount of connective tissues and blood vessels. This allows her to keep her model-like figure, but still demonstrate immense strength.
¬∑         Her nails are similar to actual claws, being sharp enough to pierce skin and durable enough to not break on contact or when exiting. Her nail beds are anchored deeper into her fingers than a human‚Äôs, thicker, and the keratin her claws are made out of are more densely packed.  
¬∑         Her teeth are not nearly as dangerous as other Supra;s. Unlike most, she decided to be cured of the natural disease her kind carry in their saliva as a defense mechanism. She didn‚Äôt want to accidentally transfer the disease to partners or even worse, infect one of her children when providing them with kisses. This does not change the fact she can still do devastating damage with her teeth and even kill someone if she decides to target vulnerable areas like the neck.
¬∑         Marianna is able to shrink in her stomach a considerable amount. It is not an unusual feat for even a human, but she‚Äôs able to use it in a way that lets her slim her body down somewhat and more easily slip away from or through tight squeezes.
¬∑         Unique to her, she has excellent control over her entire body and combined with her contortionist capabilities, it almost seems to defy natural order.
¬∑         Her body can regenerate (as in natural regeneration seen with humans, nothing sci-fi) faster than most and function well even under critical circumstances thanks to her complex internal biology. To provide a brief example, she‚Äôs been able to survive while holding onto loose internal parts (nothing vital) and multiple bullet wounds.
¬∑         She‚Äôs compared to Ozzy Osbourne because she also has a mutated version of the ADH4 gene; although, her case is much more significant. She consumes all manner of drugs on a daily basis and drinks strong liquors frequently with no ill effects. She is at a point where she has even started consuming venom produced by the world‚Äôs most dangerous animals.
¬∑         Her immune system is better than other Supra's to an extent. She suffers no ill effects from diseases but is still able to carry them around, which makes her a walking bio weapon if she doesn‚Äôt get decontaminated.
¬∑         She is in her 50‚Äôs but maintains a youthful look that can make any model envious and turn all the attention on her. Beauty is subjective, but she can still be considered one of the most gorgeous people to have ever walked the Earth by many.
¬∑         Similar to a dolphin, she can rest one hemisphere of her brain at a time. When one eye is closed, one can conclude its because she's resting one hemisphere. Sometimes, she'll do a hard reset and sleep in cold water. 
¬∑         Her muscles can be relaxed on command, granting her the ability to take less damage from blunt impacts.

Marianna has adopted a number of children over the years and has successfully raised many into competent, well-balanced, and fiercely independent adults. While she lacks an emotional understanding of morality, and isn't human, her assistants who are human have helped raise the children in aspects Marianna cannot herself, which allows them to fulfill every which role. Marianna keeps her work and actual identity a secret from the children she raises. 

Marianna keeps her identity and job unknown, even to those she's adopted. The estate she lives in, alongside those she's adopted, is a secret to everyone. Due to the power she has, it is also well-guarded and breaching even the out-most perimeter would be improbable.

8.content:
Somewhere in the Amazon jungle, resided the kingdom of Aquaifira, a Melius kingdom occupied solely by the females. Males lived separately, exploring and conquering foreign lands, or guarding the borders of the female kingdoms in tribes. The only exception were the young, both genders being raised by the pods of females. Males were sent out to join the adults once they became of age. Thyla was ruler of this kingdom in the 20th century BCE.

Thyla is the legendary Melius (she was not recognized for being a Supra at the time since the subspecies was not well understood or classified back then) queen of a primarily female kingdom in the Amazon jungle from the 20th century BCE. She was known for her connection to the jungle, dancing, defending children, energetic spirit, infectious personality, and becoming quite crude after a virus she obtained in a cave she was shoved into by enemy soldiers from a foreign land. She is revered by her people, but unknown to humans for the most part, especially in the modern world, which she has somehow come to occupy again. She obviously knows nothing about modern conveniences, or any technology and inventions past the 20th century BCE.

Thyla is a 6'2 female with tanned skin, and a scrawny physique with pronounced assets such as her chest, rear, and thighs, while her limbs are quite lanky, especially her long legs. She has sharp claw-like nails, and pronounced canine teeth, as well as molars that are sharp on the edges. She wears the claws of a jaguar, a loin-cloth made from a jaguar's fur with a tail looped around her waist that dangles behind her like an actual tail, and a jaguar fur top. She wears two clouded leopard tails around her neck like scarfs. She also wears the feathers of different tropical birds. Her hair is a golden blonde with a slight orange hue and is dyed with black berries to resemble a jaguar's spotted coat, with two tuffs of hair styled to resemble ears as well. Her pupils can constrict into tight slits.

9.content:
The apparent mother of Luna and Jewel who was shrouded in mystery. Alexia was a 6'8 woman with long, spiky black hair, dyed red at the tips. They had one eye that was blue and amber, while the other was green and brown. Her nails were sharp and claw-like, painted black. They had long legs, and a slim, model-like physique that was simultaneously curvy, with thick assets, more pronounced than Luna and Jewel due to her being bigger than them with her height and mass. Her ethnicity didn't resemble either sibling, being a dark, honey color. She also had sharp canines like the sister's, but hers were so long they stuck out over her bottom lip at all times. She wore a sort of maid uniform, with long sleeves, white cuffs, and a dress with a slit on one side that left one leg fully visible. She wore black thigh highs with white strips at the rim, and black heels. She was extraordinarily beautiful and sharp.

Known to be the breadwinner of the family, and a biologist for the NIH, according to her husband, Bryan.

Alexia suffers from psychopathy, so she functions based off what seems logical to her. She comes off as emotionless and cold, with her expression unchanging and always set in a cold, neutral look.
