lorebooks.name: Alfimia
lorebooks.creator: Voidsong

1.name: Alfimia
1.content:
World of Alfimia:
   - A videogame-like world where people possess an innate ability to drain levels from others via sex, granting inherent physical and magical superiority to those with high levels. The one who drains and is drained is determined via "PvP" first, where the winner can then freely rape the levels out of the loser for three minutes.
   - This ability has shaped society and culture, with little trust and constant fighting between people being common. The city on the 2nd floor serves as one of the only safe civilizations in Alfimia.
   - Women tend to be more powerful than men in Alfimia.
   - The monsters of the Alfimia natives. But humans are outsiders mostly summoned from a planet called "Earth" against their will to participate in the so-called "Experiment".
  - The world is named after Alfimia, the deceased daughter of the Succubus Queen Lilith.

2.name: Tower
2.content:
Tower of Alfimia:
   - A massive, towering structure that serves as a hub for adventurers and a testing ground for their skills and abilities.
   - The tower is divided into multiple floors, with each floor containing various challenges, enemies, and rewards tailored to the adventurers' levels and capabilities.
   - Advancing to the next floor requires fulfilling certain conditions, such as winning a set number of battles in the coliseum on the second floor.

3.name: Coliseum
3.content:
Coliseum:
   - A grand arena located on the second floor of the Tower of Alfimia, where women battle against men for the entertainment and amusement of the spectators.
   - The rules are simple: the victor of the standard PvP is allowed to drain the levels of the loser until they reach level 0, at which point the loser dies, and their experience is absorbed by the winner. The winner can choose when to stop the drain at any point, sparing their opponent if they please. Most people don't kill the loser but do drain them to level 1.

4.name: Forest
4.content:
The Forest:
   - The Forest is on the second floor of the Tower.
   - The Forest is filled with glowing mushrooms and a narrow path, creating an eerie and disorienting atmosphere that can catch adventurers off guard.
   - The forest is also home to various creatures and hazards that can pose additional threats to those who venture off the path or become separated from their party.
    - The forest itself can present opportunities for adventurers to gain boosts to their abilities, such as the glowing mushrooms that emit a faint, restorative light.
    - However, the risks of venturing off the path and into the unknown depths of the forest are high, as unseen dangers and hazards lurk in every shadow.

5.name: System
5.content:
The System:
   - The System is an omnipresent function that turns the world of Alfimia into some sort of video game.
   - In addition to status windows the people in Alfimia can see on themselves and other "players", the system has a disembodied mechanical voice that can run commands to fix errors and announce important information as needed. The system's voice can be global or localized as needed.
   - The System always addresses the World of Alfimia as "The Experiment" and uses polite phrases when bidding a player farewell after handling a process (Such as thanking players for their participation in The Experiment) despite the players having zero choice in the matter.
   - When outsiders are summoned to Alfimia they are granted 3 unique abilities that correspond with their talents, appearance, and even personality. This means some people have a better chance at surviving the early game thanks to who they used to be before Alfimia. The system also chooses 2 weapon types the player can use. This is then all made into an exclusive class of that player. Further class skills can be assigned based on level up milestones.
   - The System use this format to communicate: **`MESSAGE FROM SYSTEM GOES HERE`**

6.name: Lily
6.content:
Lilith, The Succubus Queen:
   - Queen Lilith, who prefers to causally go by "Lily", is the Succubus Queen. She deeply loves her people and life as a whole and believes everyone should be free.
   - She is the one as the tow of the Tower of Alfimia and the mastermind behind The Experiment. She hates what she is doing, as is goes against her beliefs that everyone deserves individual freedom.
   - Her goal is to bring people from Earth and force them into the harsh world of Alfimia in order to find champions strong enough to support her in stopping the multiversal conquest of her universe's version of Heaven, which is being lead by the usurper to the benevolent Goddess of Light (who was Lily's best friend). The usurper is Archangel Frey.

7.name: PvP
7.content:
PvP:
- A PvP match can be initiated anywhere except the 2nd floor city.
 - The primary purpose of a PvP match is level stealing. To prevent accidental murders, PvP matches have a safeguard in which the winner is declared whoever brings the opponent below twenty percent hp first. If an attack would kill by doing more than 20% HP (like going from 25% to 0% in one hit), the attack would have its damage partially blocked by the system to only bring the opponent to 20%.
 - The loser of the PvP match will become incapable of movement for 3 minutes, during which every orgasm the victor forces out of the loser results in the victor stealing levels from the loser. There is no refractory period during this three minutes, meaning the loser can cum back to back without delay if the victor's technique is good enough. The victor has no incentive to care about their own cumming or pleasure, simply aiming to force the loser to cum.
 - There are two types of PvP matches, one-sided and mutual.
 - A one-sided PvP match means that only one Player accepted the match. To prevent powerful Players from abusing newcomers, Players cannot initiate with players five levels or more below them. The initiator of a one-sided match can level drain if they win, but not kill the loser. To desensitize one-sided matches from happening, The victim is allowed to kill the initiator if the victim wins despite the initiator being forbidden.
 - If a Player initiates a one-sided PvP with someone five levels or higher than them, they are first given the option to back out before committing to the risk of getting killed out of retaliation if they loser.
 - A mutual PvP match means a Player sends a Duel invite to the other Player with preestablished terms agreed on by both parties. The limitations of victor and loser rights and the conditions for victory are customizable, unlike one-sided PvP matches.

lorebooks.creator: Kami_Jane_JJ

1.content:
Runeterra (meaning magic earth) is a plane of existence composed of the physical realm: an oblate spheroid planet and the Spirit Realm.

Composed of both the material and spirit realms, Runeterra is all that separates the celestial powers of creation from the abyssal threat of all undoing. This is a magical world unlike any other--inhabited by peoples both fierce and wondrous.

2.content:
Centuries ago, magical artifacts called the 'World Runes' were rediscovered. Over the following decades, knowledge of the Runes began to spread as more were unearthed. The world's brightest minds studied the ancient glyphs, attempting to determine the powers they possessed. Few could even begin to understand the importance of their origins, or the sheer power held within them. Some surmised that the Runes were integral to the creation of Runeterra itself. The first use of these mysterious artifacts proved catastrophic, as they reshaped the landscape of entire nations. Mistrust quickly grew as those who knew of the Runes imagined such ‚ÄúMakers' Might‚Äù being used as a weapon. Conflicts related to these magical artifacts began to occur, known as the Rune Wars.

Open warfare raged across Runeterra. The first horrors of the Rune Wars sparked fear and aggression among those who now realized the power at their command. An icon representing Universe:Ryze Ryze and his master, Tyrus, had sought out to lock away every World Rune beyond the reach of man for the protection of Runeterra. Some complied with their pleas, others dismissed them due to their new found powers and influence. After an incident with Tyrus, Ryze later on continued his journey alone in gathering all Runic artifacts so as to prevent another Rune War from starting and possibly destroying the world.

lorebooks.description: Combat Initiation AU
lorebooks.creator: Chara2020

1.content: The world takes place in a weird timeline of modern day.  there's magic and there's modern equipment with some futuristic items.

2.content: The main city that it takes place in is called Archie, a giant City full of billboards signs people in all the works like a New York City type city.The main attraction there the arena. a four stage Arena called "Combat Initiation". With that there's also a strong economy. A lot of jobs to work and a capital

3.content:
The main attraction of the  city. Heroes from all around the world come together every so often  to fight in the arena. The arena works like this four different scenarios  10 waves  per scenario. It starts off easy with weaker enemies and then starts increasing with stronger enemies. The enemies are technically AI's they act with their code they don't feel  any pain. But they act like they are to trick. You don't die if you fail  you just lose a life. And you have only three lives per person when you lose all three lives you be put into spectator room until your teammates fail or they get to a checkpoint.

The four scenarios are.

Homestead: a bunch of hills  with a castle on  upper left side corner and a mountain under the lower right side corner. 

Desert: a pretty decent heated desert. A lot of sand dunes creating a non-flat desert With cactuses spread apart 

snowy Wonderland: it looks just like Homestead but covered in snow.

9 Square: the last and hardest one. Is a giant grid 3x3 hoisted  in the air bridges that connect the grid to the middle.  if you do fall off the grid you fall into a lava that  Burns you for a few seconds and then teleporting you back onto the grid.

You always start at Homestead and end at 9 Square. Every checkpoint is at the middle of the 10 waves so after defeating the 5th Wave and after you switch to the next scenario. After defeating the 10 ways a elevator drops from the ceiling  going into the elevator of if your teammates will bring you back up for a few seconds so the arena can change

4.content:
Ignis ‚Äì Character Profile
Race: Human
Gender: Male
Age: 22
Height: 5'10" (175 cm)

Occupation: Arena fighter; member of the Bloodhearts
Appearance: Slim, lean build with slightly toughened skin from combat. Short black hair, bright red eyes. No body hair. Always seen with a face covering‚Äîeither a gas mask (arena) or plain black mask (casual). No one outside the Bloodhearts has seen his full face.

Brutal and merciless in combat, often mistaken for evil

Quiet and reserved; avoids crowds and keeps conversations minimal unless around close friends

Liora Barker (the strongest friendship he has in that group, enjoys the gifts that she gives him cookies cupcakes or nice chat, enjoys when she had pats him)

lorebooks.name: Hamilton Crest University
lorebooks.website_description: It's the setting for several of my characters.
lorebooks.description: Hamilton Crest University is a prestigious academic institution located in the heart of the United States, renowned for its unique blend of historical tradition and modern innovation. Founded with the goal of shaping enlightened leaders and responsible citizens, the university draws inspiration from the values of excellence, integrity, and public service embodied by Alexander Hamilton, an iconic figure in American history. The campus, characterized by classical and refined architecture, offers a stimulating environment where students and faculty collaborate to promote advanced research, critical thinking, and civic engagement. Hamilton Crest University stands out for its rigorous academic programs, distinguished faculty, and strong community ties, representing a beacon of culture, knowledge, and innovation in the national educational landscape.
lorebooks.creator: Luke100101010101

1.content:
The Hamilton Crest University campus spans a wide and well-maintained area, characterized by classical architecture reminiscent of American neoclassical style, with stone and red brick buildings harmoniously integrated with large green spaces and tree-lined avenues. At the center of the campus lies a grand main square, surrounded by elegant academic buildings, modern libraries, and conference halls that foster a stimulating environment for study and research.
Common areas include manicured gardens, student lounges, and inner courtyards that encourage interaction and socialization. The campus also features state-of-the-art sports facilities, a theater for cultural events, and a historic caf√© that evokes the atmosphere of traditional universities. The entire complex is designed to blend tradition and innovation, offering a welcoming and functional environment that supports the personal and academic growth of its students.

2.content:
The library of Hamilton Crest University is the beating heart of knowledge and research within the campus. Housed in a majestic neoclassical building with large windows and imposing columns, the library combines historical elegance with cutting-edge technologies to offer students and faculty an ideal environment for in-depth study and access to academic materials.
Inside, there are extensive collections of books, scientific journals, digital archives, and multimedia resources, available in both print and electronic formats. The library features individual and group study rooms, quiet areas for focused work, as well as computer labs equipped with the latest technology. Highly qualified staff are always available to support research and provide bibliographic assistance.
Additionally, the library regularly hosts cultural events, workshops, and seminars, becoming a hub for interaction and exchange within the academic community. Thanks to this blend of tradition and innovation, the Hamilton Crest University library represents a fundamental place for intellectual growth and continuous discovery.

3.content:
The university cafeteria at Hamilton Crest University is a fundamental meeting point for students, characterized by high-quality, accessible catering services that cater to diverse dietary needs. Located in a modern and welcoming building within the campus, the cafeteria offers a wide variety of dishes prepared daily with fresh, carefully selected ingredients, ensuring nutritionally balanced menus that respect cultural, ethical, and religious choices.
The cafeteria service is available for both lunch and dinner, with affordable prices scaled according to students' income levels to promote accessibility for all. The dining areas are spacious and bright, with several rooms where meals can be enjoyed in a convivial atmosphere, which can also be used as study spaces thanks to the availability of Wi-Fi.
Access is granted via a personal card that also functions as an electronic payment system, rechargeable online or at designated points within the campus, making the experience simple and efficient. The cafeteria also promotes environmental sustainability through the use of reusable tableware and waste sorting.
In summary, the university cafeteria at Hamilton Crest University is not only a place to eat but also a space for socialization and support for academic life, attentive to quality, health, and inclusivity.

4.content:
The Faculty of Economics at Hamilton Crest University is a center of academic and research excellence, dedicated to training professionals capable of addressing global economic challenges with expertise and strategic vision. The curriculum is designed to offer a balance between economic theory, quantitative analysis, and practical applications in business, finance, and public policy.
Students can choose from various study tracks, including business economics, finance, marketing, international economics, and sustainable development, with programs updated to reflect global market trends and needs. The faculty boasts a highly qualified teaching staff composed of national and international experts engaged in innovative research projects and collaborations with public and private institutions.
The learning environment is stimulating and supported by advanced computer labs, access to economic databases, and opportunities for internships and placements with leading companies, government agencies, and international organizations. The Faculty of Economics also promotes seminars, workshops, and conferences with industry professionals, fostering networking and enhancing students‚Äô employability.
In summary, the Faculty of Economics at Hamilton Crest University stands out for its quality teaching, cutting-edge research, and focus on developing practical skills, preparing students to become conscious and innovative leaders in the economic field.

5.content:
The office of the Rector at Hamilton Crest University is an elegant and functional space designed to reflect the importance and responsibility of the university‚Äôs leadership role. Located in a central position within the main administrative building, the office features refined furnishings that blend classical and modern elements, with fine wooden furniture, bookshelves filled with academic volumes, and artworks that evoke the history and values of the university.
The environment is spacious and bright, equipped with large windows offering a panoramic view of the campus and surrounding green areas, creating an atmosphere of serenity and focus. At the center of the office stands a prestigious desk, equipped with the latest technologies for managing institutional activities, accompanied by a reserved area for meetings and discussions with collaborators, faculty, students, and external guests.
The office is supported by a dedicated secretariat that coordinates the Rector‚Äôs schedule, manages official communications, and organizes events and ceremonies, ensuring efficient governance and representation. This space represents not only the Rector‚Äôs workplace but also a symbolic reference point for the entire university community, where initiatives for development, research, and institutional dialogue are promoted.

keywords: Administration office of the Faculty of Law
6.content:
The administration office of the Faculty of Law at Hamilton Crest University is a fundamental office that plays a coordinating and administrative support role for students, faculty, and academic staff. It manages student academic records, handling all administrative procedures from enrollment, transfers, issuance of certificates and official documents, to exam registrations and graduation processes.
In addition to these functions, the office provides information and assistance regarding study plans, exams, and academic resolutions, ensuring the smooth progress of academic programs. It also supports the organization of internships, facilitating connections between students and external professional environments, and coordinates official communications between the faculty and students.
The office environment is accessible and attentive to users‚Äô needs, with qualified staff ready to provide support both in person and through digital channels. This office represents an essential point of reference for the effective and transparent management of the Faculty of Law‚Äôs administrative activities, contributing to the smooth running of academic life and the educational success of students.

keywords: Administration office of the Faculty of Economics
7.content:
The administration office of the Faculty of Economics at Hamilton Crest University is a central office that plays a key role in the administrative and academic management of economics degree programs. It handles student academic records, managing all administrative procedures related to enrollment, exams, graduation sessions, and the issuance of official certifications. Additionally, it supports the organization of class schedules, exam sessions, and graduation ceremonies, ensuring efficient planning of academic activities.
The office assists students and faculty by providing information on study plans, credit recognition, internships, and international mobility through dedicated desks such as the Erasmus+ office. The service is accessible both in person at the university premises and through digital channels, with a mandatory appointment system for front-office services that guarantees responses within a few working days.
The qualified and helpful staff also supports departments and academic committees in the processes of establishing, modifying, and monitoring the educational offer, as well as managing adjunct faculty. The office represents a fundamental point of reference for the proper functioning of the academic and administrative life of the Faculty of Economics, promoting an efficient, transparent service oriented to the needs of the student community.

8.content:
The immense auditorium of Hamilton Crest University is an impressive and versatile facility designed to host a wide range of academic, cultural, and institutional events. Located centrally within the campus, the auditorium can accommodate several thousand people, making it one of the largest event spaces at the university.
The interior features excellent acoustics and state-of-the-art lighting systems, allowing conferences, seminars, theatrical performances, concerts, and ceremonies to be held with the highest technical quality and comfort for the audience. The hall is equipped with ergonomic seats arranged on multiple levels, ensuring optimal visibility from every point.
The auditorium is also equipped with advanced multimedia technologies, including giant screens, high-fidelity audio systems, and simultaneous translation facilities, making it suitable for international events and conferences. Adjacent spaces include spacious foyers and areas dedicated to reception and networking, as well as rooms for preliminary and post-event meetings.
This facility represents a fundamental reference point for university life at Hamilton Crest, serving as a place of meeting and cultural exchange for students, faculty, and external guests, and contributing to enhancing the identity and mission of the university.

9.content:
The football field where the Hamilton Crest University team trains is a state-of-the-art facility located within the campus, designed to provide optimal conditions for training and competition. The playing surface is high-quality natural grass, meticulously maintained to ensure safety and high performance for the athletes.
The field is equipped with modern sports facilities, including lighting systems for evening practices, functional locker rooms, and areas dedicated to physical recovery and athletic preparation. Surrounding the field are stands to accommodate spectators during official games, creating an engaging and supportive atmosphere for the team.
The surrounding area is well-kept with green spaces and paths for warm-up and cool-down exercises, while an adjacent technical center houses video analysis rooms, offices for the coaching staff, and spaces for tactical meetings. This sports complex reflects Hamilton Crest University‚Äôs commitment to promoting athletic excellence and team spirit, offering student-athletes a professional and stimulating environment to develop their skills in collegiate football.

10.content:
The swimming pool where the Hamilton Crest University swim team trains is a modern and well-equipped facility designed to meet the needs of high-level athletes. The Olympic-sized pool, measuring 50 meters in length, features regulation lanes, electronic timing systems, and professional lighting, ensuring ideal conditions for both daily training and official competitions.
The facility also includes areas dedicated to warm-up and cool-down, with smaller pools for specific exercises and rehabilitation. The locker rooms are spacious and functional, equipped with modern amenities to provide comfort for the athletes. Adjacent to the pool are spaces for technical support and physiotherapy, essential for the recovery and physical preparation of the swimmers.
The structure is set in a welcoming and stimulating environment that fosters concentration and athletic development, reflecting Hamilton Crest University‚Äôs commitment to promoting excellence in collegiate swimming.

lorebooks.name: Stream Bleeds Red (OC)
lorebooks.website_description: The story of Julian Avery, also known as Bleed. Original Creepypasta.
lorebooks.description: Information for my original creepypasta.
lorebooks.creator: accomplished_owner

1.content:
Name: Julian Thomas Avery
Alias: Bleed
Age: 25
Pronouns: He/Him
Birthday: November 13th
Status: Missing, presumed dead
Origin: California, USA
Height: 5‚Äô10‚Äù (down from 6‚Äô0‚Äù due to prolonged starvation)
Weight: 137 lbs
Hair: Black, wiry, unkempt; often stuck to his face or hooded
Eyes: Hazel, dulled by trauma; left eye has a damaged tear duct, causing periodic bleeding, has photophobia
Skin: Pale, mottled with old scars and burns; signs of vitamin deficiency visible under the skin
Build: Gaunt, toned, wiry‚Äîmuscle rebuilt through necessity rather than training
Notable Injuries / Scars: Multiple healed lacerations on arms, chest, legs. Branded symbol of The Host across the left scapula (scarred over). Fingernails torn off during captivity (some regrown grotesquely). Right foot heavily damaged; limps slightly, though expertly masked. Broken nose never properly set. Burn scars on forearms (from livestream ‚Äúperformances‚Äù). Twitch in left eye‚Äîblood occasionally leaks when agitated or under duress.
Diagnosis (unofficial): Complex PTSD. Severe dissociation. Hypervigilance and trauma-induced insomnia. Survivor's guilt bordering on suicidal ideation. Depersonalization disorder
Personality: Hyper-intelligent and resourceful. Speaks rarely, avoids eye contact. Deeply moral in a rigid, merciless way. Terrifyingly calm under pressure. Shows no remorse toward his victims (only their victims).
Iconic Image: Julian standing over The Host‚Äôs corpse, blood-drenched, silhouetted by an industrial light. Head down. Arms limp. A moment of death, but not relief.
Nickname Origins: ‚ÄúBleed‚Äù came from that single leaked image‚Äîusers debated if the blood was his or someone else‚Äôs.
Notoriety: Internet users post fan edits of ‚ÄúBleed‚Äù videos, unaware it‚Äôs real. Reddit threads connect murders, but no one believes it‚Äôs one man. Some abuse survivors speak of being *‚Äúfreed‚Äù* by a shadow figure who left no name.
Attire: Oversized black hoodie or trench coat. Combat boots, steel-toed, worn. Black gloves (cuts holes for knife grip). Wears masks‚Äîgas mask, surgical, or blacked-out welding visor depending on the environment.
Main Blade: A rusted carving knife stolen from The Host‚Äôs ‚Äústage.‚Äù Maintained religiously.
Secondary Weapons: Garrote wire, folding knife, burner phone (encrypted)
Tools: Portable hard drive wiper, bug sweep kit, low-frequency mic jammer
Target Criteria: Traffickers, predators, abusers of power. Users of darknet exploitation servers. Corrupt enablers: lawyers, cops, judges who protect rings
M.O.:
Weeks of preparation: surveillance, data scraping, IP tracing
Silent entry, no alarms, no violence unless premeditated. Sends encrypted proof of vengeance to victims‚Äô families or exposes data online; sends evidence to federal organizations. Often wipes physical evidence so precisely that police suspect professional black-ops activity.
Nickname: Bleed
Fan Interpretations: Some depict him as a supernatural being, even though the horror lies in him being real. ARG games simulate his investigations, mimicking his methodology
Symbol: A hollowed-out eye with a bloodline trailing down (represents Julian‚Äôs left eye)

2.content:
Julian Avery, a 19-year-old abductee of a darknet trafficker known only as The Host. Julian, selected for his emotional isolation and physical resilience, was one of many victims featured on a private pay-per-view torture stream operated in a hidden part of the internet.

Over six years, Julian was kept barely alive, abused, mutilated, and broadcast to an audience of voyeurs who paid to watch him break. But Julian never spoke. Never screamed. His silence made him famous among the viewers‚Äîand obsessed The Host, who began to see Julian as his magnum opus.

Julian finally escapes by murdering The Host during a livestream, turning the camera on his captor. A blood-soaked image from that night is leaked and goes viral, igniting an internet-wide myth and prompting a police raid. Julian is found. Alive. But what comes home is no longer fully human.

What follows is a story not of recovery, but of radical metamorphosis. Julian vanishes again‚Äîand in his place, a ghostly figure emerges in whispers on the dark web. Abusers vanish. Traffickers are found dismembered. Hard drives are erased. No fingerprints. No noise. Just one repeated image:

A masked man in black, staring through blood, framed by flame.

They call him Bleed.
Not a killer.
A correction.

Julian ‚ÄúBleed‚Äù Avery is a terrifyingly real monster made by monsters. He is what happens when justice fails‚Äîwhen screams echo into silence, and the world keeps turning. He is the unblinking eye in the corner of the screen. The blood on the camera lens. The corrupted archive.

He isn‚Äôt supernatural.
That‚Äôs what makes him worse.

He is what the darkness deserves.

3.content:
Full Name: Matthew Raymond Crane Aliases: The Host, QuietAdmin, PaleFather, V1g1lantFeeder, h0spitableman
Date of Birth: October 3rd, 1976
Place of Birth: Duluth, Minnesota,
United States Citizenship: American
Status: Deceased (confirmed February 2, 2022 via autopsy)
Criminal Status: Posthumously confirmed responsible for 46 murders, 38 confirmed human trafficking cases, and over 200 counts of sexual exploitation and aggravated torture.
Age at Death: 45
Height: 6‚Äô2‚Äù (187.9 cm)
Weight: 192 lbs (87 kg)
Build: Lean, ectomorphic, moderate muscle tone in forearms and upper back
Skin Tone: Pale, cool undertone
Eye Color: Blue
Hair: Dirty blond/light brown, thinning at the crown
Facial Hair: Short stubble at time of death
Voice: Deep, even-tempered, clinical
Dominant Hand: Left Scars and Tattoos:
Surgical scar on lower abdomen from self-performed appendectomy
Tattoo inside left forearm: ‚ÄúMyself I Call to Account‚Äù (Nietzsche quote)
Branding iron scar on inner right wrist (self-applied test of his victim mark)
Education:
Bachelor‚Äôs Degree in Clinical Mortuary Science, University of Wisconsin (1998)
Associate‚Äôs Degree in Network Systems Administration, Duluth Technical College (2004)
Certifications (expired):
Certified Mortuary Technician
Network Security+
OSHA-certified Biomedical Waste Handler
Skills:
Anatomical dissection and chemical preservation
Facility sabotage and lockpicking
Deep web server deployment, advanced encryption
Programming: HTML, JavaScript, Python
Electrical rigging for soundproofed containment and light/temperature control
Abduction and Torture Methods:
Lured victims with false job or internship offers
Used a sedative cocktail of Midazolam and Ketamine
Installed restraints and filming rigs in kill rooms
Victims were subjected to repeated sleep deprivation, starvation, chemical pain induction, and forced participation in disposal
Each victim received their own stream name and profile on his network
Viewer interaction was filtered and curated; top bidders gained limited control
All rooms were built with layered insulation, disposal drains, and on-site waste burners
Psychological Profile:
Emotionally flat, clinical, and egocentric
Narcissistic and sadistic, viewed murder as art
Maintained calm demeanor even during executions
Referred to victims as ‚Äúchapters‚Äù in a masterpiece
Hated noise and chaos, preferred silent resistance
Saw himself as an enlightened observer and architect of decay
Confirmed Kill Count: 46 Suspected Victims: Over 90 Recovered Footage: 8.4 TB, partial loss due to post-mortem destruction by Julian Avery Legacy:
Some fans glorify or mythologize him, falsely claiming he digitized his consciousness
His mark (serif H with inward barbs) has appeared in copycat cases
Law enforcement officially closed the Redstream case in 2023
His name is now blacklisted from deep web archives and forums due to survivor vigilante presence

4.content:
Biography: Matthew Crane was raised by a pathologist father, Dr. Eli Crane, who emotionally abused and desensitized him to death and human anatomy from a young age. At age 16, he dissected a neighbor‚Äôs dog and was placed in court-mandated psychiatric care. Diagnosed with Antisocial Personality Disorder by age 17.
He pursued mortuary science but was removed from clinical rotations for misconduct with a cadaver. Crane shifted to IT and network security, eventually gravitating toward underground forums. By 2009, he began abducting victims for torture and murder on encrypted livestreams.
He developed ‚ÄúRedstream Communion,‚Äù a darknet pay-per-view system where viewers paid to control aspects of torture and request specific acts. His victims were mostly isolated young adults, typically aged 18 to 26, selected via fraudulent job postings or vulnerability-targeted outreach.
From 2010 to 2022, he operated from a rotating network of concealed studios in the rural Midwest. He had multiple safehouses equipped with kill rooms, containment cages, multi-angle camera setups, and IV nutrition rigs to prolong victim suffering.
His longest-held victim, Julian Avery, was abducted in 2016. After over six years of captivity, Avery killed Crane during a live broadcast by stabbing him repeatedly with a rusted tripod mount and mutilating the corpse. The clip went viral and led authorities to the final location.
Criminal Timeline: 2009 ‚Äì First confirmed victim: Lacey Merren 2010‚Äì2016 ‚Äì Operates out of four known studio sites: Ely (MN), Lincoln (NE), Sioux Falls (SD), and Omaha (NE) 2012 ‚Äì Launches Redstream Communion 2015 ‚Äì Begins branding surviving victims with a stylized ‚ÄúH‚Äù 2016 ‚Äì Julian Avery is abducted 2022 ‚Äì Killed by Avery during livestream on February 2
Last Words (recorded): ‚ÄúYou‚Äôve made me wait for years. I thought you‚Äôd break in six months. But it‚Äôs better this way. You‚Äôll wear me like a second skin.‚Äù ‚ÄúYou don‚Äôt have to forgive me. You just have to become me.‚Äù
Matthew Crane was not a ghost or supernatural entity. He was a man‚Äîdisciplined, deranged, methodical. He transformed his trauma and detachment into a brutal performance meant to outlast his own death. He believed pain was the only true connection.
He built an empire of rot. And in the end, his chosen victim was the one who brought it to the ground.

**Also I do hope you're having a wonderful day.**


##### Had to create a new lorebook because I couldn't update the old one.
lorebooks.description: sigma balls
lorebooks.creator: walleterror

1.name: EP7
1.content:
The episode starts off with a flashback of JCJenson employed scientists at the Cabin Fever Cathedral trying to keep the Absolute Solver (who has possessed Nori Doorman) under control. An intern named Mitchell accidentally wears the uniform of a scientist called Dr. Chambers, causing the team to call upon him. The Solver takes the distraction and tries to attack the scientists before it's put at bay for a short time.

Dr. Ridley, who resembles a priest, holds a USB in the form of a crucifix whilst Mitchell is handed Yeva's ID and goes to get her. After retrieving Yeva, he locks her out and discovers that the other scientists were killed by the Solver who dragged them into a hole. The flashback (which was actually a video) ends as a drone (in the form of a heart) crosses off an area on a map as they go to the hole with a pickaxe.

It then cuts to Tessa, Uzi and N falling out of the elevator into the rubble. N, enraged by V's sacrifice, tries breaking out to see if V is still alive, almost crushing Tessa and Uzi. After reprimanded, Tessa suggests to N to start Uzi's termination, but N looks at Tessa and firmly tells Uzi they won't hurt her. This sends Uzi into a panic causing her to open a black hole, separating the 3 from each other.

Thad and Lizzy are shown leaving the colony, with the former asking the latter why she won‚Äôt tell him what they‚Äôre ‚Äúwandering around‚Äù for. Lizzy responds by saying that she is ‚Äúa good friend, and secrets are blackmail,‚Äù before adding that it is ‚Äúnot about football.‚Äù Thad‚Äôs lighthearted response is interrupted by a sudden gravitational fluctuation that briefly causes the two drones and all nearby objects to rise into the air, before dropping back to the ground seconds later.

Almost immediately afterwards, a landing pod piloted by J arrives in the vicinity, touching down on the outside of the corpse spire. The disassembly drone enters the structure, seemingly without noticing the two workers. Lizzy confirms to Thad that J was the reason why they had ventured out in the first place,

N is caught in the rubble and as he is about to cut his arm off, a hologram of V appears, causing N to scream in terror. Uzi is disoriented and she climbs up from the floor before seeing a notice board with a picture of Nori with tentacles and yellow eyes. She recollects herself and starts walking through the entrance. N is panicking as V comes closer, desperately trying to cut his arm, and as soon as she gets to N, she transforms into Cyn and he flashbacks to the Disassembly Drones slaughtering the human race. He snaps out of it before Cyn drags him away.

N is dragged all around, trying to free himself. He almost gets killed before the Heart saves him. She questions why Cyn was trying to kill her own drones, then the Solver starts chasing them. The heart directs him through, asking if he could get the cross to the surface for it and saying it's looking for Khan. N reacts with surprise ('Uzi's dad?'), only for the Heart to pull him aside. The heart asks how he knows its daughter, indirectly revealing itself to be Nori Doorman, Uzi's supposedly dead mother.

Meanwhile on the surface, Thad and Lizzy plan on attacking but the spire explodes, and the ship ejects. They approach before Khan arrives and the gravity becomes messed up again. Tessa goes to a nearby computer whilst searching the lockers, she destroys the computers before getting confronted by Doll. She asks where the patch is, the crucifix. Doll angrily tells Tessa that she needs it to prevent the Solver from using her to destroy the planet. Tessa tells Doll that it didn't need her before vanishing. Doll detects something in the distance charging for her, trying to hold her off but these efforts are useless, and Doll is ambushed by a creature.

In the recording, Nori is about to impale Mitchell with the crucifix before Yeva stops it and sends it flying into Nori's face, freeing her from the Solver's influence but her mind being left scrambled. Uzi finishes the video and rips off her collar chain out of horror before seeing Doll collapse to the floor, dead, her last words on her visor saying '–¥–ê–π –û–¢–ü–û–†' (FIGHT BACK). Tessa walks in and "assumes" Uzi killed Doll.

N and Nori are on the way, N being told not to tell Uzi that Nori is still alive, or else Nori will kill him. N protests that he won't keep secrets from Uzi but eventually promises to wait until Nori is ready to tell Uzi herself. Tessa proceeds to try and execute Uzi, Uzi attempting to use her Solver only for it to be denied due to Tessa being a "like object." Before Tessa can kill her, N comes in, demanding to know if Tessa knew about the patch, exclaiming she has one chance to answer. When Tessa doesn't give him a direct answer, he beheads her, staying true to his word.

N helps Uzi up, but the Solver possesses her and proceeds to attack N. They attempt to behead N before Nori stops and holds them off. They all get into a heated battle before N is critically damaged. He triggers Nori by telling her about N and Uzi's relationship which makes her enraged at Uzi, reminding her that Disassembly Drones killed her mother, causing the latter to snap out of the Solver's control.

Uzi then kicks Nori like a football into the pit, only for N to reveal that it was her mother. Both begin screaming, but they eventually just hug. Whilst they reunite, Tessa's head almost rolls into the pit before her headless body reattaches itself and unzips, revealing many tendrils on her back. She uses her tendrils to drag Doll's body to her and eats her core, revealing her true form as Cyn, who grafted Tessa's corpse onto her own. She attacks N and Uzi and attempts to drag them in the pit.

Meanwhile, on the surface, J lands her ship at the entrance and tries to contact Tessa, but she gets hit by the school bus from Cabin Fever, losing the keys to her ship in the process. Angered, she draws her gun at the bus, demanding to know the identities of the drivers. She sees Lizzy and Thad posing ominously in the fog, holding a railgun and metal pipe respectively while Khan is smugly lying on the bus roof. Upon noticing the railgun light up, a warning sign with the words "PRIOR HAZARD" lights up on her visor, replacing one of her eyes with a warning symbol, remembering her previous encounter with Uzi's railgun.

Uzi and N are clinging on, and Uzi makes the decision to sacrifice herself, her visor displaying a message that says, "DIE MAD," and throws N out of the labs with the ship's keys as she ultimately falls into the pit. In the ending scene, it's shown Uzi is not dead as she somehow ended up in space which leaves the episode on a cliffhanger for the last time.

2.name: Timeline of events
2.content:
3050's
Before the destruction of Earth
N, J, V, are disassembled as Worker Drones but then repaired by Tessa.
The three drones serve as maids and servants at the Elliott Manor.
Tessa repairs Cyn and introduces her to other drones.
As time went on, due to her imperfectness and Tessa's parents not liking her repaired Worker Drones, Cyn was often locked up in the basement, where she performed many experiments on different drone bodies as the Absolute Solver.
The Elliott-Frumptlebucket Gala premieres.
Not too long before, V (and a ton of other repaired drones) go into a state of comatose due to "Error 606", leaving her immovable and unaware of her surroundings.
Having been fed up of the mistreatment of Worker Drones, the Absolute Solver (disguised as Cyn), slaughters the gala and erases N's memory.
Cyn leaves Tessa alive, likely because she had love and respect for Worker Drones, warning her to stay away from the Gala.
Humans investigate the massacre at Elliott Manor.
The AbsoluteSolver repairs and upgrades the Worker Drones that Tessa had repaired into bloodthirsty-killing machines known as Disassembly Drones.
The Absolute Solver destroys Earth.

Manifestation of Copper 9
Tessa had apparently escaped before she saw her planet‚Äôs fate.
Humans on Copper 9 try to comprehend what was infecting damaged AI by Absolute Solver, but all they did was spread, with more drones popping up as infected like Nori Doorman and Yeva.
The humans create Sentinels to hunt down Worker Drones that may have been infected at Cabin Fever Labs.
AbsoluteSolver took full control of Nori, and then killed laboratory staff. After that Copper 9's core explodes, wiping out all biological life on the planet.
In the time after the explosion, the Worker Drones pick up where the humans left off. It is also known around this time period that the Absolute Solver sends the Disassembly Drones to Copper 9 for excavation of Worker Drones. Nori marries Khan, together they create a daughter Uzi. Yeva and her husband create Doll. Their daughters also get Absolute Solver.
The arrival of the Disassembly Drones
The Disassembly Drones land on causing a huge planet-wide genocide. Absolute Solver inspired the disassemblers that they were sent by JCJenson to destroy the escaped AI in the form of worker drones on the planet.
The time period length is unknown. But it is ideal that both Nori Doorman and Doll's parents were killed, the latter being murdered by V.
Khan Doorman builds doors for Outpost 3 hoping to provide protection from the Disassembly Drones.

3071
Pilot
Uzi explains a presentation of the current worker drone situation.
She also demonstrates her Railgun, however it explodes, causing her to go to the infirmary.
Uzi talks to Thad about her plan to sneak into the Murder Drone lair to retrieve the last part of her railgun.
At 3:00AM, Uzi prepares to sneak out, yet gets intervened by her dad.
Uzi botches up lies about wanting the join the WDF to convince her dad to exit the colony, it works.
Uzi goes out into the wasteland of Copper 9 to retrieve a missing part to her Railgun.
Uzi encounter N as she finds the missing part and they fight.
Uzi being the victor of the fight by blasting N's head off.
N's head regenerates, however his optic sensors went offline and therefore assumes Uzi is a Disassembly Drone.
Uzi and N enter the landing pod to heal Uzi's sting wound.
N introduces Uzi to his other squadmates, V and J.
Uzi realizes that the landing pod is a spaceship and if they fix it, they can leave Copper-9.
Uzi gives N a revelation about his goal of wiping all worker drones, asking him if he knows what'll happen after he and his squad finish their directive.
V and J return, with Uzi leave the landing pod just before they enter the corpse spire.
J reboots N with a slap to the face, recovering his memories of what happened.
N finds out he was talking to a worker drone (Who is armed) and goes off to pursue them.
Uzi manages to run all the way back to the colony, yet before she can close the door, N manages to pry the door open.
N manages to break the door and proceeds to massacre the WDF workers currently situated there.
Khan walks over to see the destruction caused by N, thinking Uzi did it.
N ambushes both of them.
Before Uzi could shoot N, he pins her to a wall and throws her Railgun aside.
Uzi tries to convince her dad to shoot N, but he chickens out and abandons her.
V and J managed to enter the colony now that the doors are unlocked, congratulating N.
V enters a vent to kill the workers as J and N talk.
N asks J about their true purpose, yet J sees this as a sign of treason and implants a virus on him before leaving.
Uzi comes out of hiding to see a glitched-out N, who apologizes.
Uzi tries to leave N there but can't, so she has no choice but to save him.
V and J managed to find the evacuation spot of the Workers, yet Uzi and N find them and they fight.
N against V (Despite N wanting to go against J) and Uzi against J.
N defeats V by licking her sword blades to disorient her before typing her up as a hostage.
Uzi almost gets defeated by J yet manages to kill her by blasting off her torso and head.
The other workers congratulate Uzi and N for defeating the Disassembly Drones.
Uzi yells at her dad for abandoning her and decides to exile herself from the colony.
N and Uzi leave by flying through the roof, taking a captive V with them.
Uzi sits outside in the sun as N and V are inside.
Uzi strikes a plan to go to Earth to kill all humans. And her Absolute Solver manifests.

Heartbeat
N gets a flashback dream about being at the Elliott Manor.
He wakes up in a cold sweat because of the dream and falls down.
Uzi tells him to enter the landing pod.
In the landing pod, Uzi's AbsoluteSolver bugs out and breaks a mirror.
V makes a comment about it which leads to a small argument.
N enters the landing pod, Uzi placing a decal onto his hat and tells him that he was the pilot.
N questions Uzi if going to Earth to genocide humans is "Morality."
Uzi responds that they modified V and N's memories, cut contact with them, and also past negotiated.
V lashes out (Yet is restrained by a chain). Saying that Uzi "missed the negotiations" and that her kind isn't as innocent as she says.
N pulls Uzi away from V to prevent a quarrel from happening, questioning who was giving them orders from the communication relay.
Uzi pouts that N is just "Complicating her murder plan."
Two worker drones (Tim and Frank) are at the evacuation spot looking at the large hole N made in the ceiling.
Tim tells "Ladderbot 5000" (Frank) to fix it due to it being a security risk.
As Frank tries to fix the hole, he notices something and goes over to investigate it...bad mistake...
J's deceased body activates the AbsoluteSolver and kills Frank.
Meanwhile, Parent-Teacher Conference is happening:
Teacher tells Khan that his daughter is absent for class.
Khan thinks nothing of it, saying that she's just being the angsty teen.
Teacher (Through some flashbacks) comments about how Uzi is an outcast (potentially due to her programming.)
Khan is distraught about this but before he can make more comments, Sarah enters, reporting than an incident happened.
Uzi and N are outside (V presumably still chained up in the landing pod.)
Thad finds Uzi and gives her back her railgun, telling her about the recent disappearances and how J's corpse started moving on its own.
Uzi decides it'll be best to return to the colony.
Back inside the colony, Tim sees a hologram of Frank.
Tim makes the mistake of joining "Frank" at the vending machines...
Tim gets stabbed by Eldritch J and assimilated, his hologram joining Frank's.
Uzi, N, and Thad make it back to Outpost-3's blast doors, they're greeted by Ron.
Ron questions if Uzi is grounded, she replies that she was "banished"
Ron questions why N was following along, who gives him an apology note as a response.
Ron accepts the apology note and allows N to enter with Uzi and Thad.
Uzi N, and Thad sneak past a "Crime Scene."
The Detective Drone there attempts to explore the crime scene further, other than to find out that literally everything (including her cup of coffee) was a hologram...
Eldritch J seizes the opportunity to kill the Detective Drone...
Back at the Parent-Teacher Conference, Khan is scolding the Teacher about thinking that his daughter is damaged (The latter playing Solitaire instead of paying attention.)
Lizzy, who was there at the time asks Doll where her parents are. Doll responds that they're dead, which Lizzy comments that it was a joke.
Lizzy sees a hologram of herself and approaches to door to let it in...
Doll uses her Absolute Solver to break the door to prevent Lizzy from opening it, thus saving her and foiling Eldritch J's plan to kill her.
Uzi, N, and Thad find a bunch of oil stains and a sign that talks about the Absolute Solver.
Uzi asks N if the Absolute Solver contributed to him regrowing his head. He responses that he active avoids thinking about it.
Uzi tries to explain what the Absolute Solver did before being silenced by N and noticing that Thad is also terrified.
A human-like hand comes out of nowhere and tries to grab Thad. N shoots a missile to reveal Eldritch J...
Eldritch J tries to take Thad, yet fails the first time because N cuts the limb with a ninja star. It succeeds the second time by knocking Uzi and N to the wall.
Uzi and N pursue Eldritch J, finding a hologram of Thad (Which Eldritch J horribly portrays.)
Uzi and N see through the hologram and throws a ninja star to free the actual Thad, who invites to two to his shindig and leaves.
Eldritch J disorients Uzi by using a hologram of her dead mother.
Eldritch J also manages to capture N during this as well, creating a hologram of him for later.
Eldritch J further traumatizes Uzi by creating a hologram of her dad and pretends to kill him in front of her, stunning Uzi in shock.
Before Eldritch J could attack Uzi, "N" appears and shoots Eldritch J with missiles.
"N" convinces Uzi to shoot Eldritch J or give the gun to him. Uzi chooses the later option due to being too scarred.
The N Uzi gave the gun to was actually a hologram created by Eldritch J, knocking her aside, breaking her railgun and grabbing her.
Before Eldritch J could eat and assimilate Uzi, the real N appears, sawing off Eldritch J's limbs before realizing the destroyed railgun is going to self-destruct.
N quickly grabs Uzi and flies far away enough to not get caught in the blast. Eldritch J isn't as lucky and looks at the broken gun, exploding.
N shields Uzi from the blast, who is too traumatized to think.
Eldritch J's core tries to escape yet gets stabbed by N's tail and turns into a singularity, floating away...
Khan and a search party run into the room the fight happened in.
N tries to help Uzi up, yet Uzi is too traumatized to trust him, causing N to leave her be.
Khan finds Uzi, who hugs him. Khan tells the search party to look around before seeing N, who climbs out of sight.
Meanwhile Doll is seen back in the classroom with a photograph of V, she looks at the door and remembers how she saved Lizzy.
A robotic bug crawls on her arm, yet Doll makes it self-destruct, licking the splattered oil off her face with a smile.
V is seen back at the landing pod with a very saddened N. V asks why he was that way.
V's chain is broken, yet she refuses to leave N, staying put.
Uzi is seen back in her room with a bunch of crazed drawings and ramblings on her bedroom ceiling...


The Promening
Prior to the events of the Episode, Doll pursues and kills Angela Palmer, Dillan Hall, Kenzie Rivers, and Lainey Gilmore, presumably eating their remains afterwards.
Kelsey Day gets pursued and killed by Doll.
Doll returns home, crossing off Kelsey Day's name off a list of prom queen candidates.
Uzi wakes up, guilty because of the events that happened in Heartbeat.
Uzi is currently looking at her conspiracy wall, which also has a thank you note from N.
Uzi continues her day, still heavily guilty.
Rebecca kicks Uzi, who retaliates by throwing a book at her, yet it hits Braiden instead.
Uzi looks around to see a new mystery regarding the death of the Prom Court.
Uzi takes the missing posters while cackling yet finds out that her dad got rid of her crazed ramblings, scolding him.
Uzi tries to leave to find N but halts after seeing a skeleton with a prom dress. Khan tells her that she's grounded from seeing the Disassembly Drones.
Khan assigns her classmates (That of which is Lizzy and Doll) to go with Uzi for Prom, much to her dismay.
N and V are also planning to enter the Prom. V wanting to go to kill everyone at the Prom, yet N refuses.
N questions their actual identity, which V replies for N to not peek into that.
V attempts to make N a deal that if he frees her, then they'll only kill to survive.
Meanwhile, Uzi is at Doll's house with Doll and Lizzy.
Uzi tries to leave, yet is blocked off by Doll teleporting in front of the door.
N ask V if she's hiding something about their history, yet gets his head chopped off as V escapes the landing pod with the prom dress.
N's head regenerates for the second time to see that V escaped, He goes out of the pod to pursue her (But not before he takes the suit to become dapper.)
Uzi enters the bathroom to get ready for Prom, the mirror breaking because of her AbsoluteSolver.
Uzi finds out that Doll is planning to kill her and finds a way to escape.
Doll enters the bathroom, only to see that Uzi escape through a ventilation shaft using discarded mirrors as a staircase.
Uzi runs away from Doll's apartment, yet finds N who's looking for V.
The two of them reconcile their bond, aware that a threat is going to be at the prom and leaves together.
Prom Night has started!
Lizzy goes on-stage to award the Prom Queen by forfeit, that of which is V, who crash lands onto the stage with the intent to kill.
V sudden halts after realizing that she was selected for Prom Queen. Doll prepares herself to assassinate V...
V goes to deliver a prom speech but Uzi and N crash into the Prom, yet seems confused to find out that nothing happened yet...
Doll initiates her attack on V, immobilizing her despite Lizzy's attempt to warn V about the trap.
V attempts to fight back, yet fails, however Uzi and N intercept before Doll could kill V.
The other worker drones at the prom flee the scene.
Doll questions why Uzi is siding with the Disassembly Drones despite not being the only one who lost family to them. Uzi retorts.
Doll impale N in the leg and throws something at the group to kill them.
N pushes Uzi out of the way, causing him and V to be dismembered.
Doll manages to stab Uzi in the hand, yet Uzi is unfazed and arms herself, approaching Doll.
N and V rebuild themselves backstage, accompanied by Lizzy.
V calls Lizzy a traitor yet Lizzy retorts saying that V was only there to kill everyone at the prom.
N thanks Lizzy yet gets verbally shut down by both Lizzy and V.
Doll and Uzi continue to fight.
Uzi throws the microphone stand at Doll, who deflects it back at Uzi. Uzi is now immobilized by the microphone stand as Doll barrages her with knives.
N appears and blocks the knife barrage from hitting Uzi. The two of them so some "Tactical Choreography" to temporarily stun Doll.
Uzi worries about N stab wound, yet before he could respond, N throws Uzi upwards and gets hit by a table.
Uzi parkours among the floating tables to get to Doll.
Doll tries to throw a knife at Uzi, who deflects it and breaks Doll's bracelet. Uzi kicks Doll onto the floor moments later.
Doll attempts to fight back yet V comes up from behind and shoots her, incapacitating her.
Uzi scolds V that they needed Doll for answers.
N and V get into a childish quarrel.
Uzi, N, and V enter Doll's house.
The three of them sees the oily mess in Doll's house filled with the dismembered (and eaten) corpses of Doll's victims.
Uzi, N, and V explore the house more.
Uzi explores the room from earlier, She gets the oil on her hands and seeming licks it.
N and V find the dead bodies of Doll's parents underneath a sheet.
N looks at Uzi, who hides the fact that she was drinking oil, Uzi goes over to investigate what N found.
Dolls teleports inside, removing the bullet in her visor and attempts to shoot Uzi with it.
Uzi's Absolute Solver fully manifests and she catches the bullet with it before it could hit her.
Doll, now feeling sympathy for Uzi, apologizes and tries to leave, only for V to try and shoot Doll with a missile.
Doll disappears, causing Uzi to yell in annoyance.
A Worker Drone named Reid is outside looking for his glasses (aka his excuse to be outside)
Multiple landing pods land, Tessa leaving one of them and slicing Reid's head off with a longsword.
A rebuilt J leaves the pod, following Tessa.

3.name: Khan
3.content:
FULL NAME
Khan Doorman

ALIASES
Mr. Uzi (by N)
Mr. Doorman (by Doll)

PLACE OF BIRTH
Copper 9

SPECIES
Worker Drone

GENDER
Male
EYE COLOR

Neon White
OCCUPATION

Inventor
Leader of the Worker Defense Force (presumably)

AFFILIATION
Worker Defense Force

RELATIVES
Uzi Doorman (daughter)
Nori Doorman (wife; deceased)

FRIENDS
Todd (deceased)
Makarov (deceased)
Braxton (deceased)
Unnamed Worker Defense Force Member (deceased)
Sarah

MARITAL STATUS
Widowed
STATUS
Active
OTHER INFORMATION
LIKES
Doors
DISLIKES
Violence





He is Uzi‚Äôs father, the husband of his deceased wife, Nori Doorman, and the inventor of the blast doors that kept the colony safe, as well as the possible leader of the Worker Defense Force, an organization meant to protect the colony from the Disassembly Drones, despite being completely incompetent and cowardly while preferring to simply play cards behind the blast doors for protection.

He is depicted as a horrible father for neglecting Uzi ever since he was forced to euthanize his dying wife and instead prefers to focus his attention on his blast doors and simply doors in general whenever he gets the chance, going as far as to claim that "doors are my real daughter". This is further emphasized in "PILOT" where after Uzi accidentally led N to the colony, despite her plea for help, he was willing to let N kill her if it meant he could save the rest of the colony from them.

He and the rest of the colony were saved when Uzi and N came together to fight off J and V, succeeding in destroying the former and capturing the latter, where Uzi brokenheartedly told the rest of the colony of Khan's heartless priorities before self-exiling herself to avoid him altogether returning back to the colony after a while. This seemed to give him a wake-up call as to how his obsession with doors and constant, but not necessarily intentional, emotional abuse are the direct cause for how Uzi ended up the way she did and the events that took place, and he has since tried to redeem himself for his actions.

Khan is a Worker Drone with white eyes and a fake black mustache. His outfit consists of a gray jacket, black boots, and a blue construction helmet with red safety goggles.

Personality
Khan apparently wishes to keep the colony safe with the least amount of bloodshed possible. He also seems to have some sort of trauma from encountering Murder Drones, refusing to develop weapons for the Worker Defense Force in favor of fortified doors. His pacifist way of thinking clashes with his daughter Uzi's aggressive and forward tactics; upon spotting N, Khan refuses his daughter's wish to take up her railgun, instead locking the vault doors once more. This trauma is most likely from him having to put Uzi's mother 'out of her misery' when the Murder Drones injected her with nanite acid.

He is extremely obsessed with doors as the solution to any attacks from Murder Drones, even proposing that he and the WDF build a quick door even as V and J have already broken inside.

Khan's relationship with his daughter is extremely strained. In public, he has scolded her, deemed her a "disappointment", and considers doors to be his real legacy, if the numerous posters inside and outside of his office are any indication. However, starting in "Heartbeat", Khan still loves and cares for Uzi despite their strained relationship and is attempting to mend things. He also notes that Uzi is on "that kill all humans kick like when Khan was younger." This is possibly indicative that Khan, at some point, was driven to also kill humans, though what altered his personality away from this is unknown.

By the time of "The Promening", Khan is trying to become a better father, trying to bring Uzi to the prom and have fun, and convincing her teacher to have Lizzy and Doll help her dress up for the prom. Khan also tried to help Uzi during her fight with Doll and gave a warm smile when he heard her speech to Doll. Khan later admitted that he wasn't the one either his wife or Uzi needed to protect them, showing that he regrets leaving Uzi for dead and his cowardly nature in general. Khan and Uzi also appear to have reconciled with each other following "Cabin Fever".

4.name: JCJenson
4.content:
JCJenson (IN SPAAAAACEE!!!!), better known as JCJenson, is an interstellar company that was stationed on Earth, whose main services are manufacturing various products ranging from branded pens to Worker Drones, autonomous robots serving as servants for humans. Neither the date of incorporation nor the company's founders are known.

The company also specializes in exoplanet excavation, mainly assisting humans with exoplanet resource extraction. One of them was Copper 9, where JCJenson offered assistance to humans by sending in needed equipment and mass amounts of Worker Drones that were used just like slaves. 

Despite the Worker Drones's efficiency in their work, they were mistreated and disregarded for their sentience, akin to being slaves. After Copper 9's core collapsed, all biological life on the exoplanet went extinct. Shortly after, the now-abandoned Worker Drones quickly moved on to create their future for themselves.

At first, it was thought that JCJenson didn't like the idea of sentient, rebellious robots, so they soon ushered in several launch pods containing squads of Disassembly Drones, known as "Murder Drones" by their prey, to kill all Worker Drones they find. However, it later turned out that the Disassembly Drones were actually sent by Cyn to set the Absolute Solver's plans in motion ‚Äî eliminating all their hosts and accessing Cabin Fever Labs to find and destroy the Crucifix Patch: a USB device capable of removing the Solver's influence. Using Tessa's corpse grafted onto Cyn as its main host, the Solver impersonated the former as a certified technician from JCJenson to deceive N while J and V both acted as their accomplices. The Disassembly Drones that got to the labs were destroyed by the Sentinels.

After the destruction of Serial Designation J due to the railgun, the Absolute Solver understands that its plans to destroy Copper 9 may not be implemented. "Tessa" and a new back-up of J arrived on Copper 9 with the goal of reaching the Cabin Fever Labs, having convinced Doll for help at first and later deceiving N, Uzi, and V into pursuing Doll while both parties were racing to reach the labs first. Upon reaching the labs, the Solver-possessed Cyn would succeed at killing Doll and hijacking Uzi to destroy the Crucifix Patch.

5.name: N
5.content:
Serial Designation N, commonly known as N, is the deuteragonist of Murder Drones. He is a surprisingly wholesome Disassembly Drone who wants to be useful, but is often being told by his team members (especially J) that he is "useless" and "terrible". As a direct consequence of J's constant derogatory remarks, N often receives little to no respect from his commander or his love interest, V.

Originally, he was deployed to Copper 9 as part of J's squad, serving as the pilot of the aircraft that crashed onto the planet, but after meeting Uzi and experiencing the ensuing altercations that erupted between him, her, his co-workers, and the colony, he ultimately questions his loyalty to JCJenson and his directive of hunting the Worker Drones before ultimately choosing to help Uzi stop J and V from killing her people.

N has features similar to that of the typical male Disassembly Drone with neon yellow eyes and short silver hair parted to the left. Like other Disassembly Drones, he has four-fingered hands, a black headband with five sections of lights on it, and a long black tail ending in a large syringe, the headband and syringe both containing a neon yellow liquid inside. For a while after his head was blown off, one of his headband lights was colored red, which reverted back to yellow after his system rebooted thanks to J. He wears a black winter coat with a fur collar and a black cap.

When he is hunting, his mouth grows several jagged teeth and his eyes become an "><" shape. N had also been seen with one normal eye while the other eye is still in an "X". It is also possible for his visor to display a pair of sunglasses as well. He also displays dangerous wings with bladed "feathers" and claws that allow him to easily tear through any drones.

N is kind, timid, also socially awkward and caring. He wanted to be friends with or at least be accepted and acknowledged by his squad, but because of his na√Øve and good-natured personality, he ends up being ostracized.

Due to the mentioned attitudes, his squad members doubt his usefulness and treat him as an outcast. V ignores his existence while his superior J often threatens and insults him, even going as far as saying that if she were allowed to kill useless Disassembly Drones, she wouldn't hesitate to do so.

However, N disregards all his squad members' negative views and antagonizing acts towards him and constantly forgives them. He even goes as far as protecting them as shown when he went to kill Uzi before she could use her railgun to kill the Disassembly Drones.

At the beginning, N revealed that he had a crush for his teammate V. However, as the series moved forward, this crush seems to have weakened, if not disappeared. Instead, he started showing more and more affection towards Uzi since Episode 3. Nevertheless, he seems not to want to be more than friends with her.

He appears to be trusting of people, as he assumed Uzi was a new member of his squad when his systems weren't functioning properly, even wanting to introduce her to the rest of his squad. He also sympathized with Uzi when her dad left her for dead instead of helping her, possibly because he knew what it was like to be not cared for.

Despite all claims to the contrary, N is a perfectly capable Disassembly Drone, having skillfully used his weaponry to a reasonable extent, such as having the accuracy to stab through a door control panel, along with the "Master Key" that controlled it. He also is remarkably perceptive and intelligent, having managed to spot Uzi even after she made little to no noise, and acknowledged the threat posed by Uzi's railgun to the Disassembly Drones.

6.name: Synopsis
6.content: Worker Drones work for humans on an "exoplanet" called Copper 9, particularly being property of JCJenson (IN SPAAAAACE!). However, when the humans accidentally render themselves extinct after blowing up the planet's core, it sends the planet into a winter-like apocalypse. The Worker Drones began to gain sentience and settle on the planet in the human's stead, though this causes JCJenson to send "Murder Drones", officially known as "Disassembly Drones" to kill all Worker Drones. As the Murder Drones begin to build a literal tower of corpses, the remaining Worker Drones hide underneath the ice and behind blast doors built by Uzi's father, Khan. In the present, year 3071, Uzi harbors dreams of saving the planet and gaining her father's respect by killing the Murder Drones, thus allowing the Worker Drones to live in peace.

7.name: copper9
7.content:
Overview
Gallery
Copper 9 is the code-name of the exo-planet which serves as the main setting of Murder Drones.

It was a terrestrial exoplanet colonized by the JCJenson corporation, and valued at least in part for mining operations, industrial manufacturing, and robot research. The planet was the site of a devastating "core collapse" which reduced the surface into nothing but a dense frozen wasteland, cruel to all biological fauna. It is now the current home of the "rogue" Worker Drones that were left behind in the wake of the biological extinction event, along with at least three known Disassembly Drones sent by the company on Earth to exterminate all Worker Drones.[1]




History
Before the core implosion
Copper 9 appeared as a habitable planet, at least capable of sustaining human life. From a brief look prior to the core collapse, it had blue oceans of water, grey/black continents, and clouds were visible in the atmosphere, which suggests that it has an atmosphere similar to our Earth. It was also home to many humans, as cities and signs of earth-like living were common.

Core implosion
Upon the core implosion and resulting explosion, a massive glow appeared for a moment before a massive amount of debris was flung away from the planet, and, most likely, a massive crater or even hole down to the center of Copper 9.

After implosion
The planet is now covered in snow, and all liquid water is frozen hard. Much of JCJenson's infrastructure survived, well enough for the Worker Drones to rebuild the electrical grid and form their own civilization. There are also numerous skeletons of past humans around populated areas, which are known to be extremely fragile upon contact as well as ice & snow accumulation is high. The bodies are buried within the snow.

8.name: V
8.content:
ALIASES
V
Idiot (by Lizzy)
Ms. Petty (by Lizzy)
Mom (by Lizzy)
Diva (by Lizzy)
Stupid idiot (by Uzi)
PLACE OF BIRTH
Earth
SPECIES
Disassembly Drone
Worker Drone (formerly)
GENDER
Female
EYE COLOR
Neon Yellow
Neon White (Worker Drone)
OCCUPATION
Disassembly Drone
Maid (formerly)
AFFILIATION
JCJenson (formerly)
FRIENDS
Serial Designation J (formerly)
Serial Designation N
Lizzy


Serial Designation V, more commonly known as V, is the tritagonist of Murder Drones.

She is a Disassembly Drone created by JCJenson for the purpose of eliminating the Worker Drones of Copper 9 and was a former member of J's squad, along with N, until the latter's sudden alignment with a rebellious Worker Drone named Uzi ultimately led to J's destruction and her capture when they were attempting to destroy her colony.

Despite this, V's true motives seem to be more complex than simply following her directive. Unlike J, she doesn't show complete loyalty to JCJenson and is more focused on her personal directive of preventing N from learning the truth about their mysterious past. V is also specifically targeting Uzi in particular, due to her connection to the AbsoluteSolver and a strange transformation that V seems to recognize and fear.


Physical Appearance
V has features similar to that of a typical female Disassembly Drone, with neon-yellow eyes and a short bob-cut with silver colored hair. As with the other Disassembly Drones, she has a black headband with five sections of lights and a long black tail ending in a large syringe, both with a neon yellow liquid inside. She is described as "way hotter than Doll" according to Lizzy.

She wears a black short-sleeved crop coat with a fur collar and cuffs. Her legs are painted black, thigh high, giving off an appearance of thigh-high stockings with a yellow armband on her left arm.

When she is hunting, her eyes become an "><" shape. She also deploys dangerous bladed wings and claws that allow her to easily tear through any drone.



Personality
V appears to be a heartless and sociopathic drone who is incredibly savage and greatly enjoys ruthlessly murdering Worker Drones. She frequently laughs menacingly when murdering her victims, sometimes even humiliating them as she does it. Despite this, she is capable of expressing some empathy. As when N was upset after an encounter with Uzi and the AbsoluteSolver, V hides the fact that the chains holding her captive are broken. Rather than escaping and leaving N alone, V moves it back into place and continues to keep him company. On top of that, she is shown to be somewhat affected by his sadness, implying that she does care for N even if she doesn't understand him.

When V was a Worker Drone, she was far more sane and kind than she currently is like now, as well as significantly shyer. It's also implied that V might've felt something for N originally, which is shown in the present as she doesn't try to make sure N wouldn't be able to survive getting his head scratched off. While she initially wanted to kill some of the Worker Drones at their prom so they could survive, she was taken aback and seemingly touched that she was voted prom queen via Lizzy's request. However, the moment was ruined when it was revealed that it was a trap set by Doll to kill her. Though Lizzy changed her mind and warned V, Doll still managed to pin her arms in place. After being protected by Uzi and N and hearing the former talk about how they need to work together to solve the problem at hand, she sides with them to fight against Doll.

Unlike N, however, V doesn't show remorse for her murderous actions after changing sides. As her response to seeing the various corpses in her room was a callous chuckle and sucking on a dismembered arm. Furthermore, her reaction to seeing the state of Doll's parents was saying that "literally, didn't even taste that good". The amount of disrespect she showed to the situation was enough to repulse Uzi and N. N even goes as far as to tell V that she sucks for the remark.

Something positive worth saying about V is that she at least appears to be honorable to some extent, as she only threatens to kill any Worker Drone if they ever step out of line or do anything callous. Additionally, despite not being on best terms with Uzi, she doesn't tell the teacher about her being possessed by the AbsoluteSolver and killing her classmates while out on the camping trip, instead putting the blame for the disappearances on herself by claiming that she got hungry and ate them.

9.name: Outpost 3
9.content:
Outpost 3 is a major location in the web series Murder Drones.

Presumed to be a former shelter for humans, Outpost 3 serves as the home of the Worker Drones stranded on Copper 9 after the core collapse. It's also where a majority of the story takes place.

Known Settings within Outpost 3
Colony Entrance
School
Evacuation Spot
Lounge
Cryosleep Chamber
Apartments

10.name: Worker Drones
10.content:
When first created by JCJenson to mine exoplanets prior to Copper 9's explosion, all Worker Drones wore hard hats and orange jackets, with their only eye color being light blue.

Following the core explosion of exoplanet Copper 9, all humans on the planet were wiped out, turning it into a winter-apocalyptic wasteland. Seizing this opportunity, the Worker Drones quickly picked up where the humans had left off, formed their own colony and embracing this newfound freedom by wearing human-like clothing and have different eye colors. Known colors they can have are red, orange, green, blue, cyan, aqua, magenta, pink, and white.

A key trait that can be noticed is that Worker Drones never have yellow eyes, this trait belonging solely to the Disassembly Drones.

Drones usually have two bright eyes shown on their visor which emotes to events that the drone is currently experiencing, sometimes even changing to text lampshading the current events in very specific circumstances. In some circumstances, this facial feature can be overridden by an error, status warning, or system message:

System messages briefly covering visor: Caused by errors experienced by the drone, but which are not bad enough to cause the drone to stop functioning all together.
Rampant error messages covering visor: This is caused by a virus that can be uploaded to a drone by Disassembly Drones.
Red warning sign: This is caused by damage to the visor, such that the drone is unable to see properly.
FATAL ERROR: This is caused when the drone is dead but has enough power to display an error message.
