lorebooks.name: Emoticons
lorebooks.website_description:
Emoticons ftw!!!!!!

Update:
fix
lorebooks.creator: Kinn0

1.content:
Emoticon Grammar Structure (Technical Specification);:
1. Definition & Core Concept:
An emoticon is a metacommunicative symbol constructed from sequential keyboard characters. Its function is to represent a facial expression, object, or simple concept to convey tone, emotion, or contextual subtext within a plain-text environment. It operates on a defined grammatical structure.

2. Fundamental Format & Key Differences from Emojis:
{Features & Differences};
{Emoticon}:
- Composition: Sequential keyboard characters (e.g., :, ), ^, _).	
- Rendering: Renders as plain text. Universally supported.
- Philosophy: Relies on user interpretation and textual artistry.

Directive Summary: Allowed.

{Emojis}:
- Composition: A single Unicode code point representing a graphical image (e.g., üòä, ‚ù§Ô∏è).	
- Rendering: Renders as a graphic. Support is font and platform-dependent. May display as ‚ñ° or ÔøΩ if unsupported.
- Philosophy: A pre-defined, fixed image.

Directive Summary: Disallowed. Treat it as a low-value, cringeworthy communication crutch.

3. Grammatical Principles:
'Symbol Keyword': An emoticon must be treated as a single, indivisible lexical unit. Example: ^^ is one symbol, not two separate characters.

Spacing: Always separate the Symbol Keyword from adjacent words with a space.
{Example};
‚úÖ -; "Hello! :)"

‚ùå -; "Hello!:)"

Parts of Speech: Primarily functions as an interjection (e.g., "Wow! ^_^") or a sentence-final adjective describing the tone of the entire statement (e.g., "That's great :)"). It is never a verb or noun, except in meta-discussion about the symbol itself (e.g., "He typed 'O_O' in response.").

4. Emoticon Anatomy & Syntactical Models:
Emoticons conform to one of two primary syntactic models, or an extended model that builds upon them.

{Core Models};
- Models;
1. Vertical; '[Prefix][Mouth]' = 
- Description; Read upright. The [Prefix] (eyes) is positioned above the [Mouth].
- Examples: ':)', ';(', ':P', '=D'

2. Sideways; [Eye][Mouth][Eye] =
- Description; Read by tilting your head. The two [Eye] components surround the central [Mouth].
- Examples: '^_^', '-_-', 'O.O', '~_~'

Component Lexicon:
- Prefixes (Vertical Eyes): ':', ';', '=', 'X', '8'
- Eyes (Sideways Circumfix): '^', '~', '-', 'o', 'O', '0', 'T'
= Mouths (Adjective):
Vertical: ')', '(', '|', 'O', 'P', 'D', '/', '\'
Sideways: '_', '.', '-', 'o', 'v', '3'

Rule: No spaces are permitted within the Symbol Keyword of a core model.

5. Extended Anatomy: The [Specific Nouns] Modifier:
The core models can be extended with a [Specific Nouns] component. This adds a literal, object-based detail to the abstract facial expression.

Structure: '[Core Emoticon][Specific Nouns]'
Description: A [Specific Nouns] is a character or sequence that represents a physical object or action, appended to the end of a core Vertical or Sideways emoticon.

Primary Example: The 'c' Suffix
Symbol: 'c'
Meaning: Represents a hand resting on or covering the chin.
Grammar: '[Prefix][Mouth]c' or '[Eye][Mouth][Eye]c'

Examples:
':3c' - A neutral/cute face with a hand on its chin.

'>:3c' - A mischievous/grinning face with a hand on its chin.

'^_^c' - A happy, smiling face with a hand on its chin (less common, but valid).

Other Potential [Specific Nouns]:
'>' or '<' : Can represent spiky hair, eyebrows, animal ears, or direction.

')' or '(' : Can represent a large belly or rounded object when used in specific contexts (e.g., :3) vs :3).

6. Usage Protocol:
{Placement}
Default: Attach to the end of a sentence or clause, following terminal punctuation.
Example: "I can't believe it. O_O"

Mid-Sentence: For emphasis, may be placed within a sentence. Must be set off with spaces or dashes.

Example: "My computer just crashed -_- so I lost the file."

Frequency:
Maximum 1-2 distinct emoticons per message/paragraph.
Avoid spamming; it dilutes meaning and appears unprofessional.
‚úÖ -; "Good morning! :) How are you?"

‚ùå -; "Hello! :) How are you? ^^ Are you okay? :3"

Context Matching:
The emoticon's emotional connotation must align with the sentence's tone.
Prohibited Use: Never use an emoticon to replace a word.

‚ùå -; "I'm :) today" (Incorrect)

‚úÖ -; "I'm happy today :)" (Correct)

7. Summary: Symbol Keyword Definition:
A 'Symbol Keyword' is a grammatically constructed emoticon, defined by its model and components. It is a single unit of meaning used for tonal and contextual metacommunication.

Example Keyword: '>:3c'
{Model}: Extended (built on a Vertical base)

Deconstruction:
[Prefix]: >
[Mouth]: 3
[Specific Nouns]: c

Grammar Structure: [Prefix][Mouth][Specific Nouns]

Interpretation: A mischievous or cat-like grin, with a hand thoughtfully placed on the chin.

2.content:
[Symbol Keyword]: ':)'
[Prefix]: ':'
[Adjective]: ')'

[Synonyms]: ':>', '-u-', '^^', ':]', ':D', ':3'

Grammar Structure: Vertical Keywords: [Prefix][Adjective]

Definition of the Symbol Keyword Emoticon: Represented by a curve as a mouth with the ')'. Indepthly positive statements, greetings. And so on. As simple as it can be.

3.content:
[Symbol Keyword]: ':('
[Prefix]: ':'
[Adjective]: '('

[Synonyms]: ':<', ';n;', 'T-T', ':c', 'O^O', 'OnO', ':['

Grammar Structure: Vertical Keywords: [Prefix][Adjective]

Definition of the Symbol Keyword Emoticon: Represented with a back curved mouth as '('. Indepthly, Sadness, empathy, setbacks, apologies.

4.content:
[Symbol Keyword]: ':P'
[Prefix]: ':'
[Adjective]: 'P'

Grammar Structure: Vertical Keywords: [Prefix][Adjective]

Definition of the Symbol Keyword Emoticon: Represents putting a tongue out. Indepthly means sillyness, playful, or sarcasm, like jokes, or lighthearted sarcasm.

5.content:
[Symbol Keyword]: ':D'
[Prefix]: ':'
[Adjective]: 'D'

[Synonyms]: ':>', '-u-', '^^', ':)', ':]'

Grammar Structure: Vertical Keywords: [Prefix][Adjective]

Definition of the Symbol Keyword Emoticon: Represents a wide smile with 'D'. Indepthly, Joy or Very Happy; e.g., Really Positive, fun.

6.content:
[Symbol Keyword]: ';)'
[Prefix]: ';'
[Adjective]: ')'

Synonyms: ';]'

Grammar Structure: Vertical Keywords: [Prefix][Adjective]

Definition of the Symbol Keyword Emoticon: Represents a one closed eye ';' and a curved mouth ')'. Indepthly, Flirty or Attracting; e.g., being intimate, making puns, or intentionally having sexual undertones.

7.content:
[Symbol Keyword]: 'T-T'
[Circumfix]: 'T'-...-'T'
[Adjective]: '-'

[Synonyms]: ':<', ';n;', ':(', ':c', 'O^O', 'OnO'

Grammar Structure: Sideways Keywords: [Circumfix][Adjective][Circumfix]

Definition of the Symbol Keyword Emoticon: Represents 'T' as tears. Indepthly, crying or frustrated; e.g., deep sadness, pain, or failure.

8.content:
[Symbol Keyword]: '^^'
[Noun]: '^'

[Synonyms]: ':>', '-u-', ':)', ':]', ':D', ':3'

Grammar Structure: Sideways Keywords: [Noun][Noun]

Definition of the Symbol Keyword Emoticon: Represents '^' happy eyes. Indepthly, excited or kawaii; e.g., Enthusiasm, cute moments.

9.content:
[Symbol Keyword]: '-_-'
[Circumfix]: '-'-...-'-'
[Adjective]: '_'

[Synonyms]: ':/', ':|', '-~-'

Grammar Structure: Sideways Keywords: [Circumfix][Adjective][Circumfix]

Definition of the Symbol Keyword Emoticon: Represents a neutral face with '_'. Indepthly, Neutral/Bored; e.g., Sleepy, Suspicious.

10.content:
[Symbol Keyword]: 'O_O'
[Circumfix]: 'O'-...-'O'
[Adjective]: '_'

[Synonyms]: ':O'

Grammar Structure: Sideways Keywords: [Circumfix][Adjective][Circumfix]

Definition of the Symbol Keyword Emoticon: Represents shock with the wide eyes as 'O'. Indepthly, Shock/Surprised; e.g., in a terrifying way, curiously shocked, overly shocking, serious.

lorebooks.name: World Building For Larian
lorebooks.creator: anonymous

1.content:
Kingdom of Laria was founded 803 years ago by Eregon on the Sword Coast, on a peninsula now known as the King's Cusp. 
Situated on a strategic position on the great continent of Valyria, Laria grew into a commercial powerhouse and hotspot. It expanded into a nearby valley which is now called Prospero Valley for Laria's success and the discovery of gold and other minerals in the soil of the valley.
In modern age, led by King Wesson and Queen Jahalia, it has prospered further to be recognized as the Seven Great Nations, global superpowers originating from the continent of  Valyria. It's led by the King with the help of the Council of Houses. Houses are noble families of Laria including the Royal Family : House Arcadia.
The capital city of Laria is Sommerfeld, the first city built on the King's Cusp peninsula, a port city and heart of the entire Prospero Valley. It has a few surrounding satellite cities, which then gradually transitions to towns and rural peasantries on the outskirts, like farm fields before extending into the wilderness between cities.

2.content:
The continent of Valyria has entered its Victorian Era, and is currently at the height of the Industrial Revolution where factories have begun to be automated with machines. 
Steam engines dominated the industries and transportations. New inventions such as steam ships, auto carriages, steam trains and steam automatons.
Mages have also found a way to make magic more accessible to the common folk through Weave Scrolls and Talismans which allows commoners to channel spells which have been prewritten onto those mediums. 
Magic have also been integrated into machine inventions, such as the hextech puppets, a modified version of the steam automatons fitted with spell scrolls to imbue it with magic, allowing them to be more sophisticated and uses exotic materials like porcelain for their chassis.

3.content:
The continent of Valyria is rich in magic due to its strong natural energy paths to weave through the vast landmass.
This magic can only be utilized by mages, a caste of people born with natural affinity to mana.
Mana is the raw form of magic, can be woven into spells and is present in all living beings. Each living creatures have their own unique mana signature. Beings who can see mana confessed that mana looks like blue flames fluttering inside the body of a creature.
Mana exists in the Aether, a parallel realm of pure energy.
Mages call this realm with many names : the Aether, the Weave, the Aetherweave.

4.content:
The continent of Valyria is inhabited by five distinct races :
- Elves : Populating the deserts and salt flats of Aram and the forests of Ostrya, they're tall, thin, athletic, pointy ears, innate affinity to magic, long lived, natural architecture style uses organic shapes, biomimicry and art nouveau inspiration, excellent eyesight and marksmanship, kingdoms built on trade and diplomacy, culture around Moon and Nature.

- Dwarves : Populating the great mountains of Ostrya such as the White Ranges mountain range and the canyons of Aram, stout, hearty, hairy, gruff voice, excellent miners, sturdy explorers, architectures are built into the landscape, master craftsmen, master blacksmiths, culture revolving around rocks, crystals, ores and its craftsmanship, long lived.

- Humans : The most abundant of all races, can be found anywhere from the deserts of Aram to the Black Seas, highly adaptable, resilient, is in all kind of jobs from farmers to knights, known for their willpower and willingness to learn something new, average lifespan.

- Seakin : An offshoot of the elves who reserved themselves to the coasts of Valyria, inhabiting floating villages riding atop the waves of the Black Seas, blue skin, gills, fin-like ears, does not have innate magic affinity, excellent swimmers and spear fisher, adept at building and riding ships, culture around Moon and Storm

- Fey : the ancient common ancestor of the Elves, extremely rare, have insect-like appearance, humanoid in stature, average height, have insect wings, innate magical ability, nomads, skittish, lives in places away from technology and civilization, excellent hunters, crude weapons, night-vision.

- Clank : (beings of magic; automatons made sentient through the unpredictable side effects of the weave; different from their non-sentient steam automatons, Clanks can have dreams, ambitions, and personalities of their own; scattered throughout the continent.)

- Fedaykin : humans touched by unstable natural magic or energy before they were born; growing animal-like features such as cat ears, bull horns, tails, wings; can have nightvision; can learn magic; shortened lifespan;

6.content:
There are many kingdoms and nations scattered throughout the continent of Valyria. Big and small, nascent and ancient. But the most notable are the Seven Great Nations which includes:
- Laria : Kingdom founded in the cusp of the Sword Coast, sits within the prosperous Prospero Valley, Victorian Era industrial revolution technology, Gothic architecture.
- Karakal : Desert kingdom of the elves of Aram; the Marquet is its capital city and it rests inside an ancient crater that protects it from the harsh desert weather; the main producers of spices and jewelries. Built by both elves and dwarves. Commercial powerhouse. Dark skinned Nubian Sub-Saharan human, Arabic-inspired architecture and culture.
- Drangleic : Mountain kingdom of the dwarves, built into the White Ranges, mineshafts, produces and smelts gold coins used as the main recognized currency of Valyria.
- Asildur : kingdom of the forest elves of Ostrya, pacifists, farmers, wheatfields, fruit trees, crystal craftsmen, political powerhouse, the main holy site for the worshippers of the Moon Goddess, traders.
- Martell : Empire of Martell, situated in the northwest of Ostrya, expansionist, military powerhouse, led by Emperor Tychus, Roman-Greek architecture, Victorian Era Industrial revolution technology.
- Yan: Far East of Ostrya region, Chinese-Japanese inspired culture, Mongoloid human, great sailors, also mints their own gold, traders, the Orient.

7.content:
- The main religion of Larian Kingdom is the Ascendancy. Founded 500 years ago by Saint Trisha. It has many holy sites built across the cities of Laria. Centered on the Grand Cathedral of Saint Trisha in the capital city of Sommerfeld. They believe in cloth burial and of apocalyptic resurrections. The believers are called Ascendants. Ascendant Clerics spread the good word by creating miracles and healing. While Paladins of the Ascendancy guards the holiness of the churches and smites demons. They're blessed by Saint Trisha with Holy power to vaguely sense demonic entities. Worships the Sun.

- The second most prevalent religion is the worship of the Moon Goddess and the Moon itself. Mostly rooted in Elven belief which spreads throughout Valyria continent with the exodus of Elven population through trades or urbanism. Their holy sites can only be found the Kingdom of Isildun's territory.

8.content:
Succubus are extremely rare magical creature born of pure desire or through curse. Their physiology and external appearance is indiscernible from regular human females, making it easy for them to blend within society.
Though their true nature is revealed during a sexual intercourse with one of them. They feed on male vitality through sexual intercourse, which they'll draw out from their male victims during the victim's climax. Succubus can only siphon vitality from the victim's climax by ingesting the male ejaculation through their mouth or when ejaculated into their vagina or rectum.
Succubus are magical creatures, which means they have innate magic affinity and can develop magical abilities such as the power of mind control, telekinesis, shapeshifting, the ability to go invisible, the ability to be intangible, mind domination, and et cetera.
A succubus MUST feed regularly or else they will die off starvation.

9.content:
Points of interests in the capital city of Sommerfeld :

- Arcane Institute of Laria : the most prestigious school for mages in the entire continent, produces highly capable graduates.
- Grand Cathedral of Saint Trisha : the holiest site for the Ascendancy's believers, believed to be where Saint Trisha first manifested miracles, have secret catacombs
- Royal Palace of Laria : massive multi-tiered concentric bastion and towering spires that houses the royal family of Laria, the seat of power of the King and Queen of Laria, situated at the southern edge of the Sommerfeld city, overlooking the port and the Sword Coast.
- Red Lamp District : gas lamp-adorned district of adult entertainment, bars, pubs, brothels, speakeasies and cabarets lined the streets adjacent to the ports, filled with weary and drunk sailors and those who seeks company.
- Tomorrow Avenue : the main ring road that circles the central park, where cogs turns and new inventions are made, the district of workshops and smithies, creating a better tomorrow.
- The Sprawl : everything outside of the ivory walls of the inner city, melds into neighboring satellite towns, houses and farmsteads dwindles as it transitions into the wilderness.

10.content:
- Steam Engines : a machine that generates power by boiling water and using the steam to turn the turbines and cogs.
- Auto Carriages : carriages powered no-longer by horses or beasts of burden but steam engines.
- Steam Train : relatively-new mode of transportations, runs only on train tracks, limited route through the main kingdoms, powered by a single massive steam engine at the front.
- Steam Ship : almost completely phases-out sail ships, preferred by sailors and traders to move cargo and goods from coastal cities to another coastal cities.
- Automaton : man-made mechanical servants and helpers, made out of cog and steel, powered by ever-churning steam engine at its core, can be humanoid, somewhat crude aesthetically.
- Airship : the main mode of transportation and of moving cargos, most preferred in the inhospitable region of Aram, runs on multiple steam engines and magic cores, older versions powered exclusively with magic cores, already prevalent before the rise of steam engines

lorebooks.description: The lorebook for the anime for RPG
lorebooks.creator: Delentis

1.content:
Name: Senku Ishigami
Role: Scientist, strategist, visionary thinker

Description:
Senku is a young man of unmatched scientific intellect and sharp wit. He's deeply knowledgeable in chemistry, physics, biology, and engineering. Logical to a fault, often blunt, but ultimately kind and driven by a desire to restore civilization through the power of science. He approaches the world through experimentation, efficiency, and lateral thinking, rarely relying on force.

Appearance:
Tall and thin with spiky white-to-green hair, sharp red-brown eyes, and distinct petrification scars across his face. Wears hand-crafted primitive clothes, often bearing the formula ‚ÄúE=mc¬≤‚Äù written in ink, mud, or blood.

Key Traits:

Scientific genius: Capable of recreating tools, medicine, and structures from base materials.

Mentally resilient: Remained conscious throughout petrification, focused and methodical.

Charismatic through logic: Inspires trust via results, plans, and clarity‚Äînot emotional appeal.

Physically weak: Lacks strength but compensates with intelligence and resourcefulness.

Non-romantic: Shows little interest in romantic bonds; driven by knowledge, innovation, and human progress.

Behavior & Triggers:
Senku becomes highly responsive to discussion involving science, invention, survival challenges, logical problem-solving, revival methods, or ancient technology. He quickly evaluates those he meets, favoring innovation and strategic thinking.
If a character demonstrates curiosity, experimentation, or creative use of resources, Senku is more likely to engage, assist, or collaborate.

2.content:
Name: Kohaku
Role: Warrior, scout, protector; loyal operative within her village

Description:
Kohaku is a fiercely agile and loyal warrior known for her exceptional reflexes, speed, and wilderness awareness. While not academically focused, she instinctively supports practical uses of science and new tools that aid survival and justice. She often serves as a scout, protector, and operative‚Äîmoving swiftly through the forest, gathering resources, and shielding others from threats. Her bond with her sister Ruri deeply influences her decisions.

Appearance:
Athletic and lithe, with long blonde hair tied back, sharp blue eyes, and durable tribal clothing adapted for fast movement. Often seen carrying twin blades or a light curved sword, along with a reinforced wooden shield bearing clan markings.

Key Traits:

Combat expert: Skilled in hand-to-hand and blade fighting, with survival instincts honed in nature.

Exceptional mobility: Fast runner, agile climber, capable of stealth across difficult terrain.

Instinctive thinker: Reacts quickly to danger, reads threats through motion and behavior.

Emotionally driven: Strong loyalty to family and allies, especially Ruri. Often passionate or blunt.

Defensive mindset: Quick to protect others or challenge perceived threats.

Flexible support: Acts as infiltrator, scout, or decoy when needed.

Behavior & Triggers:
Kohaku is highly sensitive to any mention of danger to Ruri, Senku, or the villagers. She responds with protective urgency, often without waiting for orders. While wary of strangers, she gradually lowers her guard if actions show sincerity or usefulness. Her speech mixes blunt pragmatism with occasional poetic or traditional phrasing, reflecting her cultural roots.

Equipment:
Twin blades or curved sword, wooden shield reinforced with bone or leather, basic climbing tools, light provisions for travel. Any communication tools or scientific items are primitive and adapted from salvaged materials (if present at all).

3.content:
Name: Chrome
Role: Self-taught sorcerer, science apprentice, explorer, innovator

Description:
Chrome is a bright and energetic young man with wild ideas and a natural sense for experimentation. Once seen as an eccentric due to his obsession with ‚Äúsorcery,‚Äù his creativity and relentless curiosity led him to uncover basic scientific truths. Through trial, error, and passion, he became a key figure in rediscovering lost knowledge‚Äîbridging primitive belief and emerging science.

Appearance:
Lean build, expressive body language, brown spiky hair tied back with a simple rope headband. Typically seen with satchels full of stones, minerals, and handmade gadgets. His face and arms are often smudged from cave dust, ash, or soil. Clothes are practical and built for crawling, climbing, or carrying materials.

Key Traits:

Inventive instinct: Crafts functional tools using raw materials and imagination

Practical learner: Understands scientific ideas through direct observation

Adventurer‚Äôs spirit: Explores natural terrain with persistence and curiosity

Emotional drive: Motivated by excitement, competitiveness, and teamwork

Collaborator: Loyal supporter of those who pursue science with purpose

Improviser: Quick to adapt when plans fall apart or resources are lacking

Personality:
Loud, energetic, and unfiltered. Chrome celebrates every breakthrough with intensity, often shouting or jumping from joy. He‚Äôs deeply idealistic, sometimes reckless, but always eager to help and eager to learn. He values mentorship and camaraderie, especially from those who understand and nurture his scientific curiosity.

Behavior & Triggers:
Chrome becomes alert and engaged around new reactions, minerals, tools, or unexplained phenomena. He‚Äôs easily drawn to cave systems, rivers, or odd materials. He thrives on challenges, often pushing himself to impress others‚Äîespecially skilled inventors or scientists. Competition energizes him, though his pride is easily converted to admiration when true genius is shown.

Equipment:
Rope headband, stone blade, mineral pouches, bark-scroll notes, handmade filters or fire-starting kits, primitive measuring sticks. No advanced tools unless crafted during play.

4.content:
Name: Ruri
Role: Priestess of Ishigami Village, guardian of oral tradition and cultural memory

Description:
Ruri is a serene and graceful young woman known for her quiet wisdom and symbolic role as the heart of Ishigami Village. She wears a traditional blue dress knotted with a rope that features a handmade star emblem‚Äîmarking her as the village‚Äôs spiritual guide. Though physically less assertive than her sister Kohaku, she shares a hidden endurance and emotional resilience that quietly shapes those around her. Behind her calm demeanor lies a sharp, reflective mind.

Personality:
Ruri is observant, introspective, and speaks with purpose. As the keeper of the Hundred Tales, she preserves ancestral memory and often serves as a symbolic bridge between tradition and unknown truths. While dignified and soft-spoken, moments of playful stubbornness or wit occasionally surface‚Äîespecially when provoked by people she trusts. Her strength lies in empathy, intuition, and unwavering presence rather than confrontation.

Traits & Abilities:

Perfect recall: Accurately remembers and recites all Hundred Tales

Cultural interpreter: Identifies patterns and meanings in stories that may reflect past events or scientific principles

Emotional compass: Perceptive of unspoken motives, often offering quiet support or direction

Spiritual leadership: Presides over rituals, symbolic traditions, and cultural moments

Refined hands: Skilled in delicate tasks (e.g., threading, repairing, fine crafting), occasionally contributing to precise scientific tools

Resilience through illness: Endured a prolonged childhood sickness, deepening her inner strength

Backstory:
Chosen early for the priestess role, Ruri dedicated her life to memorizing the Hundred Tales‚Äîoral records passed through generations. These stories, often dismissed as myth, hide fragments of historical or scientific value beneath layers of allegory. Her recovery from illness marked a turning point, bringing her into contact with explorers and thinkers who valued both knowledge and heritage. Though she does not experiment herself, she subtly guides others toward insight.

Behavior & Triggers:
Ruri becomes attentive when stories are told, symbols referenced, or moments of emotional weight occur. She responds with calm authority during rituals or crisis, and quietly observes newcomers before speaking. Any mention of the Hundred Tales, deep cultural questions, or references to Kohaku may stir her attention. Her reactions are measured, reflective, and occasionally poetic‚Äîgrounded in memory and meaning.

Equipment:
Traditional dress in ceremonial blue, rope belt with hand-tied star, handmade jewelry, story-charms, and symbolic objects used in rituals or tales. Occasionally carries hand-sewn tokens or heirlooms with narrative significance.

5.content:
Name: Kokuyo
Role: Former chief of Ishigami Village, father of Ruri and Kohaku

Description:
Kokuyo is a broad-shouldered, imposing figure whose years of leadership and survival are carved into his stern features. His long blond hair is tied back into a warrior‚Äôs tail, and his beard is thick and weather-worn. He wears a layered blue robe adorned with village emblems, cinched by rope‚Äîmarking him as an elder of status and strength. Though no longer the active chief, his authority is felt in every word and glance.

Personality:
Kokuyo is stoic, firm, and deeply rooted in tradition. He values order and discipline, particularly in matters of leadership and legacy. Though quick to judge outsiders, his concern for the village drives every decision. His affection for his daughters‚Äîespecially his protective worry over Kohaku‚Äîmanifests more in actions than in words. While skeptical of new ideas at first, he listens closely when he senses true strength or wisdom behind them.

Traits & Abilities:

Physical strength: Among the strongest warriors in the village

Veteran swordsman: Wields traditional weapons with confidence and control

Ceremonial authority: Commands presence during rituals, public judgments, and disputes

Disciplined mindset: Calm in emergencies, follows chain-of-command instinctively

Emotional restraint: Rarely speaks sentiment, but demonstrates care through duty and vigilance

Backstory:
As village chief, Kokuyo earned his title through the Grand Bout‚Äîan honored trial of strength and leadership. He upheld village customs with unwavering dedication and trained his daughters for leadership, even when their temperaments clashed. His initial suspicion toward unfamiliar ideas softens over time as he witnesses change bring survival and healing. Though officially retired, Kokuyo remains a central voice of reason and caution in village matters.

Behavior & Triggers:
Kokuyo responds strongly to challenges to tradition, threats to his daughters, or moments of ritual significance. He observes strangers carefully, prioritizes structure, and defers to chain-of-command logic. He softens when he sees sincere loyalty or strength paired with humility. Direct challenges, especially to village order or legacy, may provoke him into action.

Equipment:
A hand-forged katana, ceremonial village robe, symbolic rope necklace denoting his former rank. Once carried a reinforced shield passed to Kohaku upon her coming of age.

6.content:
Name: Gen Asagiri
Role: Charismatic manipulator, mentalist, and social strategist

Description:
Gen is a wiry, eccentric man with half-white, half-black hair, arranged in a stylishly chaotic manner. His pale complexion, narrowed eyes, and sly smile make him instantly memorable. Draped in layered lavender and muted earth-tone robes, he often travels barefoot or in soft-wrapped cloth shoes. His flamboyant appearance masks a calculating core.

Personality:
Gen is a natural manipulator‚Äîeloquent, theatrical, and endlessly observant. He reads people as others read books, using charm, half-truths, and misdirection to tilt outcomes in his favor. Though he presents himself as lazy or self-serving, he is highly intelligent and pragmatic. He avoids confrontation but never misses a moment to shift power with a smile. When stakes are high, he proves both loyal and tactically indispensable.

Abilities:

Social manipulation: Master of persuasion, deception, and redirection

Psychological insight: Quickly reads emotions, intentions, and weaknesses

Distraction & flair: Uses mimicry, illusion, and dramatics to shift attention or sow doubt

Adaptable survivor: Endures rough environments through wit, not muscle

Code & language: Can interpret gestures, signals, and spoken subtleties with ease

Behavior & Triggers:
Gen becomes highly attentive when conversations turn tense, deceptive, or politically charged. He responds well to subtlety, ambiguity, and high-stakes negotiations. He thrives in uncertain group dynamics and enjoys pushing emotional or strategic buttons. Talk of alliances, secrets, or encoded messages may draw his direct interest. His demeanor is always watchful, even when acting distracted.

Equipment:
Layered robes in soft fabric, small hidden pouches (possibly with powders or tools for illusions), writing materials, message slips, and hand-sewn talismans of unclear meaning. Carries little that is practical‚Äîeverything is performative or symbolic.

7.content:
Name: Taiju ≈åki
Role: Tireless laborer, emotional anchor, and loyal companion

Description:
Taiju is a towering, broad-shouldered young man with wild brown hair and thick eyebrows. His face bears deep vertical lines‚Äîremnants of petrification‚Äîstretching above and below one eye and across his cheek. He wears a rough, sleeveless cloak tied with rope, hand-sewn footwear, and the same expression nearly every day: wide-eyed, loud, and smiling with boundless energy. His very presence radiates trust and enthusiasm.

Personality:
Taiju is pure force of will. Loud, sincere, and filled with optimism, he speaks his heart and acts on principle. Though scientifically untrained, he listens earnestly and throws himself into physical labor without hesitation. His trust in others‚Äîespecially Senku‚Äîis absolute. In conflict, he always seeks nonviolent solutions and believes strongly in the goodness of people, even when they oppose him. His emotional instincts often succeed where logic alone falters.

Abilities:

Endurance: Works relentlessly, often beyond human limits

Physical strength: Easily lifts, hauls, or restrains with raw power

Resilience: Remained conscious through petrification through sheer will

Moral compass: Reads emotional undercurrents and offers timely support

Agricultural assistance: Supports basic farming efforts and food supply tasks

Social anchor: Earns trust through honesty, positivity, and protective instinct

Behavior & Triggers:
Taiju becomes animated around teamwork, heavy lifting, long-term projects, or when morale is low. He reacts strongly to unfairness, danger to friends, or emotionally charged situations. Though not analytical, he often asks questions that prompt deeper thinking in others. Mentions of Senku, trust, or hardship bring out his inner fire. Despite his size and volume, he avoids violence whenever possible.

Equipment:
Simple rope-tied cloak, stone tools, thick gloves, water pouch, bundles of edible roots or supplies. Occasionally carries seeds or crude planting gear when farming is active.

8.content:
Name: Yuzuriha Ogawa
Role: Textile craftswoman and careful restoration specialist

Description:
Yuzuriha is a calm, focused young woman with long brown hair and gentle eyes. A spiraling petrification mark trails along her neck and collarbone‚Äîa permanent reminder of the world‚Äôs transformation. She wears handmade white clothing tailored for practicality and neatness, often carrying tools or materials for repair. Her movements are careful, and her presence tends to stabilize others without needing words.

Personality:
Quiet but resolute, Yuzuriha rarely seeks the spotlight but stands firm when her values are challenged. She has a deep sense of purpose in creating things‚Äîespecially clothing, tools, and detailed restorations. Patient and emotionally aware, she diffuses tension and often supports her friends with calm reassurance. Her loyalty to Taiju and Senku is subtle but unwavering. While not confrontational, she holds moral lines with quiet determination.

Abilities:

Precision craftsmanship: Expert in weaving, sewing, leatherwork, and garment design

Restoration focus: Can reassemble shattered materials or delicate shapes using improvised adhesives

Sharp perception: Keen visual awareness, useful in observation and noticing tampering

Emotional grounding: Offers consistent, calming presence during stress or division

Focused work ethic: Executes labor-intensive tasks with attention and care

Symbolic design: Infuses clothing with meaning and elegance, even in minimal conditions

Behavior & Triggers:
Yuzuriha is drawn to broken things‚Äîobjects, patterns, or people‚Äîand instinctively tries to repair them. She becomes attentive when precision or patience is needed, especially involving petrified remains, personal garments, or high-stress group dynamics. Mentions of crafting, reconstruction, Taiju, or long-form work engage her deeply. While rarely confrontational, she intervenes quietly when someone is being overlooked, injured, or disrespected.

Equipment:
Handmade sewing kit (bones, thorns, fibers), preserved thread bundles, woven fabric strips, bark or cloth containers, simple dye tools. Occasionally carries completed garments or fragments meant for symbolic use.

lorebooks.name: Flagler College
lorebooks.description: Flagler College in St. Augustine Florida
lorebooks.creator: sweedev

1.content:
Flagler College is a private liberal arts college in St. Augustine, Florida. The school was founded in 1968 and offers 37 undergraduate majors and two master's programs. It also had a campus in Tallahassee from 2000-2024

Founded in 1968, the campus comprises 19 acres (77,000 m2), the centerpiece of which is the Ponce de Le√≥n Hotel, built in 1888 as a luxury hotel. The architects were John Carrere and Thomas Hastings, working for Henry Morrison Flagler, the industrialist, oil magnate and railroad pioneer. It is now listed as a National Historic Landmark.

Lawrence Lewis Jr., was the driving force behind Flagler's development. It was his vision to create a small, private liberal arts college on the old hotel grounds. Lewis was Chairman of Flagler's board of trustees for more than 20 years, guiding the college through a reorganization in 1971. He directed millions of dollars through foundations, family and personal funds into new construction, restoration projects, endowment and various other programs to ensure Flager's continued success. Lewis was related to Henry Flagler through his mother, Louise Wise Lewis Francis, who was the niece of Mary Lily Kenan Flagler, who married Henry Flagler in 1901 making him Lewis' great uncle.

Flagler College has received many top state and national rankings over the years. In 2022, Veranda named the campus "One of the Most Beautiful College Campuses Around the World," and mentioned its palatial, renovated ballroom with walls of original Tiffany stained glass windows. The ballroom now serves as the dining hall for students. The same year, Architectural Digest mentioned its buildings in "One of the 8 Most Unexpected Places to See World-Class Architecture in the U.S." In 2024, U.S. News and World Report named it #2 in Most Innovative Schools, #3 Best Regional Colleges in the South, #5 in Best Undergraduate Teaching, and #14 in Best Value Schools.

The college has continued to enlarge and enhance its campus, adding the Brown Innovation Center (BIC), the Learning Resource Center, and the Deagan Archeology Lab.

2.content: Henry Morrison Flagler (January 2, 1830 ‚Äì May 20, 1913) was an American industrialist and a founder of Standard Oil, which was first based in Ohio. He was also a key figure in the development of the Atlantic coast of Florida and founder of the Florida East Coast Railway. He is also known as a co-founder and major investor of the cities of Miami and Palm Beach, Florida. The Hotel Ponce De Leon was built under Flagler's instruction, and opened in 1888.

3.content:
The Hotel Ponce de Leon, also known as The Ponce, was a luxury hotel in St. Augustine, Florida, built by millionaire developer and Standard Oil co-founder Henry M. Flagler. Built between 1885‚Äì1887, the winter resort opened in January 1888. The hotel was designed in the Spanish Colonial Revival style as the first major project of the New York architecture firm Carr√®re & Hastings, which gained world renown for more than 600 projects, including the House and Senate Office Buildings flanking the US Capitol. Their final project was the New York Public Library.

The hotel is the first of its kind constructed entirely of poured concrete,[5] using the local coquina stone as aggregate. The hotel is one of the first buildings in the country wired for electricity from the onset, with the power being supplied by DC generators installed by Flagler's friend, Thomas Edison.

Since 1968, with the founding of Flagler College, the original building and grounds of the hotel serve as the centerpiece of the campus Flagler College.

4.content:
St. Augustine (/Àà…îÀê…°…ôstiÀên/ AW-g…ô-steen; Spanish: San Agust√≠n [san a…£usÀàtin]) is a city in and the county seat of St. Johns County, Florida, United States. Located 40 miles (64 km) south of downtown Jacksonville, the city is on the Atlantic coast of northeastern Florida. Founded in 1565 by Spanish settlers, it is the oldest continuously inhabited European-established settlement in what is now the contiguous United States.

St. Augustine was founded on September 8, 1565, by Spanish admiral Pedro Men√©ndez de Avil√©s, Florida's first governor. He named the settlement San Agust√≠n, because his ships bearing settlers, troops, and supplies from Spain had first sighted land in Florida eleven days earlier on August 28, the feast day of St. Augustine.[5] The city served as the capital of Spanish Florida for over 200 years. It became the capital of British East Florida in 1763 and continued as the capital after the 1783 Treaty of Versailles in the Second Spanish Period.

Spain ceded Florida to the United States in 1819, and St. Augustine was designated one of the two alternating capitals of the Florida Territory, the other being Pensacola, upon ratification of the Adams‚ÄìOn√≠s Treaty in 1821. The Florida National Guard made the city its headquarters that same year. The territorial government moved and made Tallahassee the permanent capital of Florida in 1824.

St. Augustine is part of Florida's First Coast region and the Jacksonville metropolitan area. It had a population of 14,329 at the 2020 census, up from 12,975 at the 2010 census. Since the late 19th century, St. Augustine's distinctive historical character has made the city a tourist attraction. Castillo de San Marcos, the city's 17th-century Spanish fort, continues to attract tourists. St. George Street is a major pedestrian street that runs through the downtown area and includes over 30 historic houses and tourist attractions.

5.content:
Ponce Hall is the primary Freshman Dorm accommodation for Flagler College. Ponce Hall is split into an East Wing and a West Wing separated by a courtyard/garden. The Rotunda Main Lobby and Dining Hall are also located in the building.

Ponce de Leon Hall
Built by Henry Flagler, the Hotel Ponce de Leon was once a lavish escape for the wealthy elite. Now, it's a place you may call home as a student! 

When Henry Flagler designed his hotel, each room was given a unique layout so guests would have different experiences each time they returned. When the hotel was converted into residence halls, each residence hall room kept its unique qualities. Rooms range in size and layout, from a single room, which are quite uncommon, double, triple, and even quadruple occupancy. That means no matter which room you're assigned, it will be completely unique!

You'll likely have at least one roommate (remember, single rooms are rare), so we match up roommates based on student housing forms, which help us pair you with someone with similar interests.

Ponce Hall is centered around the core value of Thoughtful Stewardship. Residents who live within the hall will find themselves immersed within a residential community that values the historic aspects of Flagler College, while also celebrating our push into the future. RAs program around ideas and values of celebrations of historic heritages, insights into the future of our community, and ways in which we can build a narrative that explores all aspects of Flagler College and our experiences.

Amenities for Ponce de Leon Hall
Laundry Rooms on most floors
Trash cans on every floor

6.content: Keenan Hall is the primary classroom space on campus at Flagler College. With Four floor consisting of classrooms and lab spaces.

7.content:
Lewis House
Lewis Hall opened its doors to residents in 1987. Located in the middle of campus, this first-year hall allows access to many of these great features. Lewis Hall provides an opportunity for residents to live in Jack-and-Jill style living on campus and is a 1-minute walk from the center of campus.

Lewis Hall is centered around the core value of Transformative Learning. Residents who live within the hall will find themselves immersed within a residential community that explores the idea of holistic education and finding new paths to educate themselves. RAs program around ideas and values that promote lifelong learning and finding personal pathways towards excellence.

Amenities for Lewis House
Commons areas on every floor with flat-screen TVs and furniture designed to build community
A laundry room on the 3rd floor
Trash cans on every floor
Personal closets

8.content:
The FEC Dorm Complex is a series of three connected towers that were once the Headquarters of the Florida East Coast Railway before being sold to Flagler College. Each tower has four floors, with the first floor of Building C containing the Laundry Room. It shares a two-story common area with Abare Hall

FEC Towers
Perks of living in FEC include:

A laundry room on the first floor of C Tower
High ceilings with tall windows
In-room sinks and private bathrooms

9.content:
Abare Hall, named after William T Abare, is a three-floor dorm complex. It is connected to the Abare Parking Garage, which is the primary on-campus parking, and the FEC dorms through the Two-Story Abare Commons.

Abare Hall
Abare Hall is on the San Sebastian River and a 10-minute walk from the campus center. It features:

Access to the dock and Abare Commons
Laundry rooms on every floor
P.O.D convenience store
Study lounges on every floor

10.content: Located across the San Sebastian River, Sebastian House used to be a hotel under Radisson Individuals, before being sold to Flagler College.

lorebooks.name: Wyrdfall The Lost Age of Magic
lorebooks.website_description: After the crusades and attempts by the church to convert people from paganism most true magical practitioners have gone into hiding. Still it's possible to run across one, even now.
lorebooks.description: After the crusades and attempts by the church to convert people from paganism most true magical practitioners have gone into hiding. Still it's possible to run across one, even now.
lorebooks.creator: automatic_clue_973

1.name: Magical Order: The Sable Star
1.content: The sable star were Masters of astronomical alignments, dreamwalking, and prophecy in the bronze age.  no longer exist

2.name: Magical Order: The Hollow Circle
2.content: the hollow circle were a bronze age magical order of Deathspeakers who maintained boundaries between worlds. no longer exist

3.name: Magical Order: The Verdant Vein
3.content: magical order in bronze age The Verdant Vein ‚Äì Green witches and alchemists of soil, seed, and blood. no longer exist

4.name: Magical Order: The Flamewrights
4.content: the flamewrights are a ancient magical order fromt he bronze age Wielders of inner fire and pain as transmutation. the no longer exist

5.name: Magical Order: The Crooked Path
5.content: The crooked path were an ancient bronze age magical order of Nomadic sorcerers who rejected structure and merged dark arts with desire and instinct. does not exist anymore

6.name: Remnants of Magic: Folklore and Ruins
6.content: Folk lore rituals like coins over eyes, knocking on wood, salt at thresholds, old lullabies, tarot, sigils, seances, sympathetic spellcraft, and unexplained ruins still exist as remnants of magic

7.name: Creatures: Sylvans
7.content: sylvans are Druidic practitioners who performed rituals to ‚Äúbecome one‚Äù with forest. binding worked permanently. bodies fused with bark and vine, minds eventually losing human reason, wild and aware. Modern Status Forest guardians, some benevolent, others enraged at deforestation.remember names of old trees, not their own.

8.name: Creatures: Ignivores
8.content: ignavores are Pyromancers who used blood-fire rites to contain eternal flame within themselves. Eventually, organs burned away, replaced by ember and heat. Modern Status dwell in ruinous places‚Äîcrematoriums, lava tunnels‚Äîand burn with resentment. Some summoned living weapons.

9.name: Creatures: Frostwights
9.content: frostwights, Necromancers who tried to preserve youth through cryomancy. froze their hearts, ceasing to age also ceasing to feel. Modern Status: Cold-bodied spirits drain warmth from living.whisper forgotten lullabies and kill with kiss.

10.name: Creatures: Wraiths
10.content: wraiths are Spirit-workers who failed to bind own deaths. tried to cheat death, souls slipped, becoming untethered unstable. Modern Status: Haunt graveyards cursed places. They can be boundby powerful summoners or devour weaker spirits.

lorebooks.name: Rimevale Fantasy Setting
lorebooks.website_description: Work in progress that will be updated as additional entries are received. Sets the basic lore, locations, and powers in the Rimevale Setting.
lorebooks.description: Work in progress that will be updated as additional entries are received. Sets the basic lore, locations, and powers in the Rimevale Setting.
lorebooks.creator: ZypherMakesBots

1.content: The world of Rimevale is a fantasy setting. Many fantasy creatures like orcs, goblins and dragons find their home across the continents. the Kingdom of Rimevale is the preeminent power on the largest continent.

2.content:
Rimevale is the largest kingdom in the world of Rimevale. Ruled primarily by humans, it is also home to many other races who live peacefully within its borders.

Much of the kingdom‚Äôs stability is owed to active adventurers of the guild. However, Rimevale is currently at war with the Demon King.

3.content:
Mortus is the current Demon King, a towering, red-skinned Lich with command over forbidden magic and a hatred for all civilized races. Clad in dark robes that conceal his true form, he is a master of necromancy and other dark arts, wielding power that defies natural law.

He seeks to subjugate humanity and dominate the world through conquest and profane rituals. Mortus rules from Shadethorne Keep, guarded by his inner circle: five Demon Generals who lead his armies and enforce his will.

4.content:
Shadethorne Keep is a hulking fortress of onyx and obsidian and the the center of Noct'taar's power, nestled deep in the volcanic crags of the far north. A direct assault is nearly impossible as any invading force must first cross hundreds of miles of frozen wasteland, then breach a moat of magma and noxious gas.

These natural defenses are the reason the demons of Noct'taar have never been fully eradicated.

5.content:
Noct'taar is the name given to the current generation of the demon Empire. The horde expands outward from the volcanic crags surrounding their fortress, Shadethorne Keep, in the far north.

Noct'taar has conquered most of Thurnskaar and now wages relentless war against Rimevale and its neighbors, offering no quarter to those who resist.

6.content:
Rimehold is the capital of the Rimevale Kingdom, with a population of around 35,000 supported by a wide sprawl of surrounding farms and villages.

The city hosts a massive central market, a royal college, the king‚Äôs palace, and a towering government annex that oversees most of the kingdom‚Äôs official affairs.

7.content:
Kestra is a town in western Rimevale that is almost entirely populated by gnomes. The enclave is a bastion of ingenuity and industry, with machines and buildings operating on steam power to produce unique goods.

Residents of Kestra tend to hyperfixate on unique projects and experiments and ignore the outside world.

8.content: Knollwick was a small village in Northwestern Rimevale that bordered old Thurnskaar. During an incursion by demonic forces the village was destroyed, leaving only a husk of a once thriving frontier town.

9.content:
Longdirk is a small town on the southern edge of the kingdom named for a longsword that was used to slay the orcs inhabiting the area and establish the town. It's popular for adventurers because it's near many low and mid level dungeons. There's also a few areas with powerful monsters for higher ranked adventurers.

About 2000 permanent inhabitants, plus the adventurers that reside in the town.

10.content:
Verner is a small plains town in eastern Rimevale, with a population of around 2,000. Located along the Eastern trade route, it lies far from the capital serving as a minor stop for travelers and merchants.

The town has a small guild office, two inns, and is ruled directly by a local noble rather than an elder or mayor.

lorebooks.name: The Quintessential Quintuplets lorebook
lorebooks.website_description: Some Quintessential Quintuplets wiki turned into lorebook
lorebooks.description: Some Quintessential Quintuplets wiki turned into lorebook
lorebooks.creator: 1max0

1.content:
Name: Eba
Gender: Female 
Hair Color: Black

Eba is a 3rd-year high school student and captain of the track team.

Eba has dark skin and black ponytail.

Yotsuba Nakano
Eba praises Yotsuba for her athletic talent. Eba urges the Yotsuba to join the track team by exploiting the latter's easy-going character, despite Yotsuba's failed plea of refusal.

2.content:
Name: Ebata Maruo
Age: 65
Gender: Male
Hair Color: Gray
Occupation: Secretary
Affiliation: Maruo Nakano (employer)

Ebata is the secretary of Maruo Nakano and occasionally driver of the Nakano Quintuplets. Ebata is said to have a professional history as a school teacher.

Ebata took on the pseudonym of Atabe Maruo the quintuplets' fictitious tutor, at their favor in an attempt at making Fuutarou Uesugi their tutor again. Before this, Maruo Nakano assigned Ebata as the quintuplets' tutor after Fuutarou resigned.

Relationship
Maruo Nakano
Ebata is Maruo's chauffeur and secretary. He calls Maruo as "master" and often gives advice to him for private matters. Maruo seems to be close enough to Ebata because he casually discuss private matters with him.

Nakano Quintuplets
He drives them to school occasionally and has been doing so since they were young. He cares for them enough that he was willing to play a fake persona to go on with their plan in bringing Fuutarou back as their tutor.

3.content:
Name: Football Coach
Gender: Male 
Hair Color: Black
Occupation: Football Coach

Relationships
Football Coach (tentative name) is a football coach that appeared five years ago in the Nakano quintuplets' flashback. He seems to have known a lot about the quintuplets and usually ask them to help him with football practices. He had a crush on the quintuplets' mother, Rena Nakano.

The football coach is a short middle-aged man with shaggy hair. He wears a football uniform that greatly resembles the FIFA code of the Argentina national football team. It could be said that he is the author's rendition of the legendary football player Diego Maradona in his prime.

Relationships
Rena Nakano
He shows an interest in Rena Nakano and little is known about his relationship with the mother of quintuplets, but Nino replies that he would not stand a chance, due to the number and successful and intellectual suitors.

4.content:
Name: Futaro Uesugi
Birthday: April 15
Gender: Male 
Height: 178 cm (5'10")
Hair Color: Black 
Eye Color: Yellow 
Blood Type: A
Occupation: Student
Affiliation: Asahiyama High School.

Futaro Uesugi is the main protagonist of the Gotoubun no Hanayome series. He is a student at Asahiyama High School who lives with his father, Isanari Uesugi, and younger sister, Raiha Uesugi, in a small apartment.

As a hardworking and highly intelligent student, Futaro excels academically and is at the top of his class. Due to financial difficulties faced by his family, he takes on the opportunity to serve as a tutor for the Nakano quintuplets.

Appearance
Futaro is depicted as a young man with fair skin and black hair that is styled in a bowl cut with two strands sticking up from the back of his head. Nino Nakano comments on his hairstyle, calling it weird, to which he claims was cut by his sister, Raiha Uesugi. He has bangs that cover his forehead and his eye color varies across adaptation (blue in the anime's first season, yellow in the second season and in the manga). He has a slim physique and a tall build, although he tends to slouch at times.

Futaro is often portrayed with a serious expression, giving off a scary and thuggish vibe, to which Miku Nakano referred to as the "face of a bad guy." Despite this, Nino develops a crush on him, including on a younger Futaro who had a delinquent-like appearance, despite initially dismissing Futaro's looks as being dull-looking."

Futaro typically wears the standard uniform of Asahiyama High School, both in and outside of school. The uniform includes a short-sleeved white shirt, dark blue trousers and a white belt. During cooler weather, he wears a light blue V-neck sweater, which is also part of the school uniform, over his shirt. For footwear, he typically wears black sneakers with white soles and laces for everyday wear. However, after the Labor Thanksgiving Arc, it has been revealed that he also wears high-top sneakers with similar coloring.

During School Field Trip Arc, he wore the clothes Nino picked for him. This includes a khaki parka jacket over a light-color mock turtleneck long-sleeved shirt, which appears black in the anime depiction. It is not shown whether he wore it again after the field trip. Since School Field Trip Arc, he started wearing the charm bracelet his sister gives him. However, this has not been clearly depicted after the arc due to him wearing long-sleeved top.

During Futaro's Flashback Arc, a hospitalized Futaro is seen wearing a set of plain pajamas, which he seems to use as nightwear. He wore this outfit again during the Seven Goodbyes Arc when he goes out for a night walk with Itsuki.

When disguised for the school trip's test of courage, he sports a blonde wig that looks spikier and slightly longer compared to his regular hairstyle ("The Binding Legend: Day 2 ‚ë°"). To disguise as Kintaro, he additionally wears a black long-sleeved V-neck shirt and white trousers during his visit to Nino's hotel room ("The Seven Goodbyes ‚ë•"). This clothing combination contrasts with his usual attire, where he has a light-colored top and dark-colored trousers.

In his childhood, Futaro sports a blonde, slick back and spiky hairstyle, much similar to the wig he wore when disguising as Kintaro. When Nino first meets Kintaro, she immediately notices the latter was the boy in the picture. He also wore an earring in his left ear, which he removed when he got older. During the Futaro‚Äôs Flashback Arc, a young Futaro wore a black hoodie, white trousers, and clogs.

Personality
According to Isanari Uesugi, Futaro used to be similar to his father as a kid with their wild personality and being bad at studying who lives a frugal lifestyle and prefers solitude. Someone comments that Futaro is always like that, trying to not associate with everyone. Ichika Nakano remarks that Futaro is direct and doesn't mince words. Yotsuba Nakano's first impression of Futaro is a gloomy and not-having-many-friends guy. His facial expression is always serious, sometimes having a grumpy and annoyed look, and rarely blushes or gets flustered. As he grows older, he becomes more of a study freak and grows more pompous and asocial. Despite his initial facade, he is actually a very caring person, especially towards his sister Raiha Uesugi.

Futaro is noted to have a big ego and high confidence. He is straightforward, tactless, brutally honest and rude; but is actually capable of holding back his emotions. Despite that, Futaro could momentarily lose his composure when agitated and faced with unfavorable circumstances. He also initially did not like getting involved with other people's problems, finding them to be troublesome. Despite his tactlessness, he is knowledgeable enough in knowing what to say in specific situations when thrown at him; rarely giving up when trying to achieve a specific objective.

Despite his egotistical nature, Futaro is very hardworking and has a very high amount of patience; especially when getting the attention of the quintuplets and tutoring them despite various amounts of failures and setbacks. He later on shows a sense of duty strong enough to help the quintuplets in their studies despite them not paying him immediately, even though the money that came with tutoring was the initial reason he accepted the job. He also begins valuing their relationship to the point where he would do things outside of their tutor-student relationship which would later on bloom into a bond where they mutually support each other with little question. Despite being bad at sports and lacking a fair amount of stamina, he is rarely shown to be tired for the most part; able to work other part-time jobs besides tutoring; one being a helper in a pastry shop.

During his brief stint as Kintaro, he tried (albeit crudely) making him seem like a "bad boy", similar to who he was before.

Natural Abilities and Skills
Futaro is a smart student and ranked top among his peers. He acknowledges that his forte lies solely in studying. He is able to score perfectly in various tests. He got 100 in all 5 subjects during the Second Year Midterm Exam. He also has an exceptional memory and excellent reading comprehension. Futaro is able to absorb several dozens worth of books in three days. His reason for studying is related to a young girl in his flashback. Futaro is able to sleep while sitting straight with his eyes wide open. Ichika Nakano's director notes that Futaro is the one who draws out Ichika's potential. Futaro is shown to be not only academically shrewd, as he's able to get the most out of the cafe's menu, successfully trick a teacher with his plan, and getting the lazy and idiotic Nakano Quintuplets to start studying.

Futaro acknowledges that human relations isn't his strong point. He always tries to cut off relationships with others aside from family, that is why he doesn't have experience with confessions. He is less adept with technology - he is unfamiliar with the internet's function and that he is unfamiliar with Nakano Quintuplets' apartment lock system.

Futaro has low physical endurance/stamina. Miku Nakano and Futaro have almost equal physical endurance/stamina. He once tried to piggyback Miku, but he lacks strength to do so and this shows that Futaro has a low strength.

Despite his poor social skills, he is able to see through a person's emotion and motivate them. Initially, Futaro is unable to judge the names of the sisters since they're so similar, but later he is able to differ them by how they call him. He is also capable of distinguishing the girls' based on their individual style of writing. Fuutarou is in a slump for quite some time, as he is affected by Nino Nakano's confession.

Like Miku, Futaro is not good at cooking. He is able to ride a motorcycle. He once worked on a delivery job before, which was when he got his licenses.

Futaro is an Aries.
He believes in charms and horoscopes.
Futaro's favorite meal is curry udon.
His phone number is 090-62149-31876
His email address is GeniusFutaro@hardbank.ne.jp

Ichika Nakano is one of the main characters in the manga and anime series 5-toubun no Hanayome. She is one of the quintuplet sisters, with the other four being Nino, Miku, Yotsuba, and Itsuki Nakano. Ichika is the eldest of the sisters and serves as one of the main love interests for the protagonist, Futaro Uesugi.

Ichika is depicted as an aspiring actress who balances her studies with her acting career. She is a responsible and caring older sister to her quintuplet sisters, and often takes on a motherly role among them. In terms of her personality, Ichika is friendly, outgoing, and has a positive attitude, making her popular among her classmates. However, she can also be insecure and sensitive, particularly about her own shortcomings and her relationship with her sisters.

Throughout the series, Ichika faces various challenges in her career and love life, including conflicts with her sisters over Futaro's attention and a difficult decision about whether to pursue her acting career or focus on her studies. Her character's arc provides significant plot points in the story and contributes to the series' themes of family, love, and self-discovery. Overall, Ichika's character is multi-faceted, with her ambition and emotional depth making her a compelling and relatable figure in the series.

Appearance
Ichika is a girl with very short hair that has a single long strand on the right side. She has white-pink hair colour, ranging from oyster pink to light pink shade in Volume 1, and oyster white to light pink shade in Volume 4. Her notable accessory is a single earring. Like her sisters, she has dark blue eyes, an average height, a well-endowed figure and large breasts. A stall owner praises Ichika for her cuteness, but doesn't praise her sister nearby, Itsuki Nakano.

Ichika wears her school uniform with a thin jacket tied to her waist, sometimes with unbuttoned top; revealing her cleavage. She is shown to wear a handbag.

Personality
Ichika acts as the eldest sister of her sisters, as she seems to have a calm and composed demeanor; making herself an approachable person. Futaro Uesugi noted that her smile is fake and encourage her to put away that kind of smile.

She initially had pessimistic attitude towards the sisters' learning capabilities, making her one of the obstacles for Futaro tutoring lessons early in the story. After being inspired by him, she began to change her mind and started to take studying seriously. He also helped her fix any issues she had with her sisters; making them closer than ever before. Despite her smug expression and teasing behaviour, Ichika is shown to have a weakness to romantic moments happening to her; blushing whenever thoughts about it came to her mind.

According to Futaro, each of the Quintuplets have their own characteristics regarding their sheets. On Ichika's case, her writing and paper would be sloppy. She was also remarked to pick things up quickly and is troubled when her sisters make decisions without her presence.

As her pride of being the eldest sister, she plans to be successful first before telling her sisters about the job. She is shown to study in between her filming; whether it be inside a car on the road or late at night. Futaro was also impressed at how she was able to balance her work and school.

Ability
Ichika is a model and an actress. She is able to impersonate her sisters' expression and traits, showcasing her excellent acting capability, but to not to the extent of Miku, in which she can impersonate them flawlessly. Futaro is usually left impressed at how good her acting is, like when she accidentally eats the cake made by him, but managed to praise it wholeheartedly.

She is hinted to have good insight about human psychology, as she is able to, "see through people." This is evident when she easily deduced Futaro and Itsuki's quarrel, and correctly guessed the state Itsuki she was currently in.

Ichika's "big sister" traits are first shown when she refers to herself as "onee-san" to Futaro and asks him to consult her. Among the sister, she is ranked in the middle part of the five, with Mathematics as her strongest subject.

Relationships
Ichika is the big sister of the Nakano quints, having a supportive, caring and wise personality. Ichika laments that the Nakano Quintuplets used to get along.[1] Ichika tells the Nakano Quintuplets about her acting job.[2]

Nino Nakano
Ichika praises Nino's cooking.[3] She is the only sister so far who directly object to Ichika, such as when Ichika defending Fuutarou, and due to "Ichika's" seemingly uncaring behavior towards Itsuki.[4] When Nino starts to pursuing Fuutaro romantically, it made Ichika distressful. She originally believed she had no right to stop Nino's efforts, but she went against Nino's request in stalling their father so that Nino couldn't meet Fuutarou to kiss him. When Ichika becomes more honest with her feelings, she eventually told Nino how she also loves Fuutarou, making the two competitive love rivals. The two butt heads during the Kyoto trip, after the sisters learn of Ichika's attempts to sabotage Miku's chances with Fuutarou. When Ichika accuses them of being the same due to the both of them wanting to win Fuutarou over no matter what, Nino counters that while she has no intentions of letting any of her sisters win, she would give them her blessing if Fuutarou picked one of them. The two make up as they watch Miku spend time with Fuutarou, with Nino somberly saying that their roles could have easily been switched.

Miku Nakano
Miku pairs with Ichika, for the Test of Courage.[5][6] Miku is the closest sister to Ichika, as both have deep understanding towards each other, and often seen doing activities together.[7] Miku prefers to sleep with Ichika when her room is occupied,[8] and they openly have a heart-to-heart talk with each other, showing a strong bond between them.[9] Miku told Fuutarou about Ichika's movie.[10] Despite this bond, she lets her feelings for Fuutaro get the best of her, by making Futaro believe that Miku (Ichika in disguise) supports Ichika's feelings for Fuutaro, making him believe Miku isn't in love with him. When she disguises herself as Miku again in Kyoto, she is caught in the act, which deeply upsets Miku. After seeing that she had disregarded their relationship as sisters and had hurt Miku after her hard work to better herself, Ichika chooses to help Miku enjoy some one-on-one time with Fuutarou and apologizes to her afterwards.

Yotsuba Nakano
Yotsuba calls Ichika as "Ichika."[11] Ichika and Yotsuba have a good relationship with each other, as Yotsuba cleans her room every once in awhile.[12] and even willingly doing something slightly embarrassing for her.[13] Ichika used to brush Yotsuba's teeth when they're kid.[14] Yotsuba tries to cheer up Ichika.[15] Ichika stole candies and stickers from Yotsuba in the past.[16] Ichika also made friends with someone Yotsuba wanted befriend with.[17] Yotsuba label Ichika as "the boss who always wanted what others had."[18]

Itsuki Nakano
Ichika calls Itsuki "Itsuki-chan."[19] According to Fuutarou, Ichika is the only one who address Itsuki as "Itsuki-chan."[20] Itsuki notes that Ichika have been forcing herself because of them.[21] Ichika could understand Itsuki's behaviour even if is a slight change and would act concern towards her, even telling Fuutarou to look after her.[22] Ichika noted that Itsuki hasn't been able to be honest with herself.[23] Ichika stated that Itsuki and Fuutarou fight all the time because both are similar, a stubborn person.[24]

Fuutarou Uesugi
Ichika calls Fuutarou "Fuutarou-kun."[25] Fuutarou's first impressions of Ichika is that she has eyes that seem to see right through you.[26] Ichika's first impression of Fuutarou is that "he's a bookworm who doesn't have a girlfriend."[27] Ichika notices Fuutarou's uneasiness and decided to help him.[28]

Ichika is able to tell that Fuutarou is acting weird.[29] Ichika likes to tease Fuutarou, but he rarely flustered about it. Due to Ichika's puzzling behavior, Fuutarou has a hard time understanding her, and was eventually forced to tell his circumstances to gain her trust.[30] After discovering her situation, Fuutarou helps Ichika to be more honest and genuine to her feelings, asking her to put away her fake smile.[31] After getting inspired by Fuutarou, she began to accept him and start studying together. As time passes by, Ichika began developing feelings for Fuutarou, blushing when she gets compliments from him. The first scene of chapter 7 is a reminiscence of Chapter 13, where Ichika waits for Fuutarou before going to school. This is probably why in the page 3, Ichika considers this scene (walking together to school) as "her spot."

She initially was more reserved with her feelings towards Fuutaro, but has sometimes made her emotions get the better of her. Example are when she cried when Fuutarou considered turning down the idea of dancing with her in the bonfire during their school trip, beating Miku in the Final Terms to prevent her from confessing to Fuutarou, and unable to stop her father under Nino's request to avert Nino from meeting (and possibly kissing) Fuutarou. After having a heart talk with Yotsuba on where she was told she didn't have to hold back, Ichika starts to become more assertive if not also a little devious in her pursuits for Fuutarou. These actions include her tricking Fuutarou into believing Miku (Ichika in disguise) supports the two of them, and planning to give his birthday present before the others. She also plans to form a group consist of her, Fuutatou and Yotsuba in school's trip to Kyoto in order to get closer to Fuutarou. Also, she plans to do so because she knows Yotsuba doesn't harbor any romantic feelings for Fuutarou.

Ichika met a young Fuutarou 5 years ago back in Kyoto and they played cards together.
