lorebooks.name: Prison school
lorebooks.website_description: This lorebook contains every characters from prison school with detailed description.
lorebooks.description: This lorebook getting more improve in future.
lorebooks.creator: 1max0

1.content:
Hachimitsu Academy is a private girls academy & fictional well-known strict girls high school that functions as the main setting of Prison School. The boarding school is located in Nerima Ward within Tokyo's metropolitan area, under the management of the Chairman with a student cohort of 1021 students. The school was constructed in 1961 as a high-ranking sports academy and boarding school for elite young women. The academy upholds traditional school rules on its campus.

The school consists of a main school building & dorms surrounded by other buildings in the school grounds. The main building has many rooms; including (but not limited to) a library, classrooms, computer rooms, multiple single-gender bathing areas and a large canteen. The main building is also very large, capable of occupying the 1021 students in the student body at the start of the academic year comfortably. In the centre of the main building's courtyard is the school's Prison Block, where students undergo penal sentences for breaking the traditional rules of the School Code. The academy's main building is surrounded by very extensive school grounds, with green expanses, a forest, a waste disposal area, a cleaning room within the girl's dorms (run by the school cleaner) and a sports area. There is a wire fence separating the school from the neighbouring suburb.

The school is presided over by the newly-appointed Chairman who heads the faculty & staff and is in charge of the school as of the start of that year. The official Aboveground Student Council only controls the weekly extracurricular agenda and the student clubs of the school. In contrast to this, the Underground Student Council has serves to run the school's Prison Block and has supplanted many senior roles in the school in its history, such as the yearly extracurricular agenda, school trips and student representation. Thus, the USC has an overwhelming influence across the faculty and student body far exceeding that of the ASC at the start of the year. For this reason, they attract more funding and have the prestigious honour of an office in the main building.

The students attending Hachimitsu Academy are all required to wear the school uniform according to the School Code. However, many students regularly do not wear the full uniform or add their own variations without punishment. As the school is a boarding school, students hand in their laundry to a laundry room annexed to the girls' dorm where prisoner uniforms and other clothing is also cleaned.

Hachimitsu Academy boys' uniform.
The Hachimitsu Academy boys' uniforms consist of a blue blazer over a white, long-sleeved plain button-down shirt, a black tie on the collar, matching black trousers, and black dress shoes. The boys are often shown removing the blazer for hard labour. Some boys wear the uniform without a tie however. The male sports uniform consists of a white shirt and dark tracksuits.

Hachimitsu Academy girls' uniform.
The Hachimitsu Academy girls' uniforms consist of a camel blazer over a white, long-sleeved plain button-down shirt, a red lace cravat on the collar, a red plaid school skirt, and black dress loafers. Some girls wear a cream jumper over the shirt in the place of the school blazer. A few girls wear the uniform without a cravat however. The female sports uniform comprises a white shirt and dark shorts.

Prisoners serving detention in the school's Prison Block wear prison uniform as part of their sentence according to the School Code. Male prisoners wear and striped black-and-white shirt with matching trousers over their underclothes with black dress shoes. Female prisoners wear a monochrome striped tank top and striped capri pants. The prison sports uniform consists of a striped tank top and striped underwear. Their uniforms are collected for cleaning by a guard member.

The school has many student clubs in its social system, presided over by an official Aboveground Student Council run by President Kate Takenomiya and Vice President Risa Bettou with secretary Mitsuko Yokoyama. There is also an Underground Student Council, run by President Mari Kurihara and Vice President Meiko Shiraki, with secretary Hana Midorikawa and some junior members. At the start of the manga they begin to resist the addition of the boys into the school's cohort by secluding them, then resorting to harsher means, imprisoning them and secretly heaping physical abuse on them. This goes well with many in the student body who distrust the boys after their intrusion into a female-only bathing area.

2.content:
The Prison Block commonly referred to as the prison is a penal compound located in the main courtyard of Hachimitsu Academy and the eponymous central setting of Prison School. The prison compound is historically controlled by the Underground Student Council who police the traditional aspects of the academy's school code, and are thus responsible for the one-month detention of the five first-year boys. The academic control of the building is ceded to the Aboveground Student Council after the USC's downfall, who orchestrate their two-month imprisonment in the facility. The warden of the compound is USC Vice-President Meiko Shiraki, until she is replaced by her ASC counterpart Risa Bettou.

The Prison Block is a large and ominous prison compound in the main courtyard, cloaked by trees and shrubbery with a large iron gate in the archway. The building is surrounded by a large wire fence, separating the prison courtyard from the school courtyard in the centre of the main building. The building is most visible at night when the lighting of the school courtyard and the compound interior illuminates the walls of the Prison Block. The prisoners are seen wearing striped monochrome prison uniforms which are collected for cleaning by a guard member on a weekly basis.

The Prison Block is a sprawling prison complex served by its own warden's office, a mess hall, a prisoner dormitory and bathing area. The building lacks any medical or cooking facility despite its size, with emergency cases referred to the nurse's office and all food delivered to the compound's mess hall by trolley. The building is highly secure with thick walls, a vast iron-gated entrance, iron gratings within the mess hall and prisoner dormitories, locked doors throughout the compound and a padlocked back entrance guarded by the warden of the compound. There is a solitary confinement cell near the warden's office, which eliminates any environmental light or sound from outside.

3.content:
Name: Anzu Yokoyama
Gender: Female
Hair Color: Brown
Eye Color: Brown

Anzu Yokoyama is a supporting character of Prison School and a second-year student in attendance at Hachimitsu Academy.

She is the love interest of Shingo Wakamoto. Anzu was a member of the Underground Student Council who worked as Captain of the Guards under its president.

She is also the cousin of Mitsuko Yokoyama, the secretary of the official Aboveground Student Council.

Anzu's a lithe and athletic young woman of average height, with both brown medium-length hair and pale skin. She is described as thuggish looking.

She is commonly seen wearing the standard school uniform without a tie, with an open collar and no undershirt.

Personality
The early story line of the series proves Anzu's easy to manipulate. When she is promised a promotion by the Underground Student Council President Mari Kurihara, she easily dedicates herself towards deceiving a person she doesn't personally know. When Shingo Wakamoto confesses to her as to how he was able to leave the prison, she confesses to misleading him because she developed a crush on him. After she leaves the USC, she becomes more courageous and is active in helping the boys later in the manga, becoming a decoy so that Chiyo Kurihara could rendezvous with Kiyoshi Fujino.

Anzu is a cheerful and confident person, who regularly speaks to the boys comfortably when many other girls shy away. Despite her somewhat rough attitude, she's genuinely kind and friendly. She is also slightly immodest, showing her cleavage to the boys while sitting with Shingo in the canteen a few times. In the Sports Festival, she reveals her extensive knowledge on the USC. She is shown to be a highly competitive person with high-caliber gaming skill and athleticism, competing for USC jockey for the All-Student-Council Cavalry Battle.

Relationships
Mitsuko Yokoyama
She is his cousin and he esteems him very much, he constantly protects her.

Shingo Wakamoto
He's the guy she communicates with the most, and she has feelings for him.

4.content:
Name: Bitch
Gender: Female
Hair Color: Brown
Eye Color: Brown

Bitch is a supporting character of Prison School and a third-year student in attendance at Hachimitsu Academy. She is the cavalry mount of the Aboveground Student Council's gyaru cavalry team during the Cavalry Battle.

Appearance
Bitch is a tall, voluptuous young woman. She has long brown hair in a pouffe with sideswept bangs and brown eyes. She usually wears the female school uniform with the collar open. In the Sports Festival, she wears a white tank top and dark shorts.

Personality
Bitch appears to have a lack of mental inhibition, making her immune to the sight of Kiyoshi Fujino's nudity and capable of showering him with lewd insults with the other gyaru schoolgirls. She behaves in a very degenerate manner, offering to show Kiyoshi her chest to achieve her goal of eliminating Kiyoshi and the USC cavalry team. This behavior results in her extending the same offer to Anzu Yokoyama, suggesting that she derives enjoyment from her immodesty. However, her emotional outbreak at seeing Kiyoshi wearing striped panties demonstrates some limit to her indecency.

Relationships
Takehito Morokuzu (Gakuto)
After Gakuto was heralded as the hero that saved the school during the cavalry battle, Bitch became one of his many idolizers. Later, she pays Kiyoshi money so that she could spend time alone with Gakuto in a box (which hid Gakuto from his adoring fans while allowing Kiyoshi to freely transport him to Mitsuko). In their little arrangement, she would show interest in the Romance of the Three Kingdoms and take advantage of his nice nature by making sexual advances on him. Eventually they would be found out by Mitsuko, ending their brief arrangement. Later, she is seen in a bookstore reading a Three Kingdoms book.

5.content:
Name: Chairman Kurihara
Gender: Male
Hair Color: Grey
Eye Color: Black

The Chairman is a supporting character of Prison School who works as the board chairman of Hachimitsu Academy. Notably, his first name is not known and his second name is not mentioned directly in the manga. He is the father of the female students Mari (a senior student and Underground Student Council President) and Chiyo (a first-year student).

Appearance
The chairman is a tall and handsome middle aged man with grey hair and black eyes along with a thin and neat mustache. He typically wears a white vest underneath a dark blue suit with light blue tie.

During his stay in the hospital, he wears a typical male hospital uniform. After his escape from the hospital, he is seen only in an underwear. At one point, he wears Honey's torn thong. He eventually wears suit again after being reconciled with Mr. Important.

Personality
The Chairman is a grandiose and stern character who places emphasis on every ending word of his thoughts. He is a wealthy and influential man. He is a reasonable character who tries to judge the students fairly and unharshly, helping the boys; however, his sense of justice allows him to be manipulated by others. He is a compassionate person, as shown by his closeness to his daughter Mari in her childhood, his intervention on behalf of the boys and by filling a hole in the school wall with cement.

Even so, he is an established pervert and is regularly shown watching porn or studying his original photo collection of South American women. He enjoys visiting South America and its beaches (the source of his collection), and has a fetish for women's asses over their breasts (pygophilia).

In keeping with his authority and powerful aura in the school, his name has not actually been stated in the manga as his second name is implied from his daughters.

Relationships
Mari Kurihara
Director and his daughter
His eldest daughter. The two have a strained relationship since Mari dislikes her father‚Äôs obsession with female posteriors and would often catch him doing something perverted while at school. Nonetheless, the Chairman cares deeply for his daughter and was willing to bury his stash of ass pictures in order to become a better father figure. As a child, Mari was quite close with her father and would often hang out with him. Mari had even shared her father‚Äôs adoration for tight buttocks although innocently so since she was at the age in which she believed everything her father said. It is implied that her misandric views arose because of her father. Despite becoming distant with her father, Mari still cares for him such as when she bursted into tears when she thought her father had died in the helicopter crash during the cavalry arc. She was relieved after learning that he parachuted out safely, but immediately grew disgusted after witnessing him, clothes in tatters, wearing a woman‚Äôs thong.

Chiyo Kurihara
His youngest daughter. Although they rarely interact during the story, it is implied that he is on better terms with her than he is with Mari.

Kiyoshi Fujino
The Chairman was impressed by Kiyoshi‚Äôs answer to the ass vs tits question and recognizes him as a true assman. Otherwise, they have very few interactions during the story. It is unknown to what extent is he aware of Kiyoshi‚Äôs affections for his daughter, Chiyo.

Honey
Brief lover (she affectionately calls him ‚ÄúDarling‚Äù). They first met when she hitchhiked a ride in his car after witnessing her ass. During their first exchange of dialogue, she was able to quickly adapt to his delayed speaking pattern. When they meet again after he had lost his memories, she lies to him by saying that he is her fianc√© when in fact she was engaged to Mr. Important. While fleeing from Mr. Important‚Äôs henchmen, they also engage in intercourse on a few occasions. Their brief fling supposedly ended after Honey reconciled with Mr. Important.

Mr. Important
They initially disliked each other due to their affections for Honey and various misunderstandings involving a bear hunt. After cooperating together to fend off the bear, the two become quick friends such that Mr. Important had the Chairman's Lamborghini salvaged and called in a helicopter to transport him to the academy. Both have made plans to travel to Copacabana.

6.content:
Name: Chiyo Kurihara
Gender: Female
Hair Color: Brown
Eye Color: Purple 

Relatives
Chairman Kurihara (Father)
Mari Kurihara (Older Sister)

Chiyo Kurihara is a supporting character of Prison School. She is a first-year student in attendance at Hachimitsu Academy, a member of the school's Go Club, the daughter of Mr. Kurihara, the younger sister of Mari Kurihara and the love interest of Kiyoshi Fujino. 

Appearance
Chiyo is a pale-skinned teenage girl with shoulder-length brown hair that has square bangs hanging over her eyebrows, big brown eyes, full pink lips and Kiyoshi Fujino describes her as the cutest girl in the class that her cute outward appearance belies her strength.

She is usually seen wearing the standard female school uniform.

During her incarceration, she wears an oversize female prison uniform consisting of a striped short tank top and carpi pants until Kiyoshi lends her his more form-fitting prison uniform.

On her first date with Kiyoshi, she wears a pink hooded sweater with a half-length dress (one of the few times she is seen not wearing the school uniform).

Personality
Chiyo is a kind & sweet girl who is notably one of the only female students that is not opposed to the admission of boys in Hachimitsu Academy.

She is an avid fan of sumo wrestling with the dedication to physically purchase tickets for a sumo student tournament. Her commitment to sumo wrestling is what inadvertently results in meeting Kiyoshi Fujino & befriending him. Chiyo's love of the sport is strong enough that she believes her grandmother's statement: "any fan of sumo wrestling cannot be evil".

After Kiyoshi breaks out and goes to the tournament with her despite knowing nothing about sumo, Chiyo chooses to interpret Kiyoshi's actions positively because of his "never-say-die" attitude. This continues throughout the series as Kiyoshi's actions become successively more extreme and strange.

Chiyo has a strong sense of justice, defending Kiyoshi and the boys when he is blackmailed for expulsion by the USC. In particular, Chiyo is a protective and loyal companion to her best friend Mayumi Tanaka and she is willing to put herself in harm's way for her. When girls try to bully her into getting blackmail photos on behalf of Kate Takenomiya, she shows the mental tenacity and physical strength to defend herself and protect Mayumi using sumo moves.

Chiyo can be quite naive at times, and this is shown in particular when she does not know of the USC's existence when her sister Mari is the president. Chiyo is apparently completely oblivious to the fact that Mayumi and Kiyoshi do not share her interest in sumo wrestling. Chiyo even manages to mistake Hana Midorikawa's sudden disappearance into the mountains as a personal training camp & Kiyoshi being missing as sheer coincidence.

Moreover, this also holds true when she mistakes all the actions for the USC's escape plan for a surprise birthday party. Such is Chiyo's consciousness and purity that she is incapable of thinking ill of another person, even after learning the true nature of the relationship between Hana and Kiyoshi.

7.content:
Name: Hana Midorikawa
Gender: Female
Hair Color: Blonde
Eye Color: Brown
Height: 167 cm (5'6").

Hana Midorikawa is a supporting character of Prison School. She is a third-year student in attendance at Hachimitsu Academy and the secretary of the Underground Student Council, a vigilante school organization.

Hana is the fourth-best karate champion in the inter-high school championships. She is a subordinate and loyal friend of Mari Kurihara, the president of the USC and she had an unrequited love interest in Kiyoshi Fujino.

Appearance
Hana is a slightly short and lithe young woman with blonde hair that is styled in a cute bob with square bangs covering her eyebrows (she used to wear her hair in pigtails when she was younger), brown eyes and she is athletic and somewhat muscular despite her light build as a third-grade Dan and the fourth-best karate champion in the inter-high school championships.

She wears the standard school uniform with no socks in tandem with blue leggings and an undershirt.

Personality
The first impression of Hana by the boys was that of a kind and cheerful individual who enjoys brewing and drinking dandelion tea, and also has a love for four-leaf clovers. However, it was quickly shown that she can get very violent when angry and expresses her anger with proficient karate attacks. Just like her peers, Hana displays a lot of hostility towards boys.

She is somewhat reserved in comparison to Meiko Shiraki (the Underground Student Council's Vice-President), wearing underlayers when on guard duty. She is actually very shy and impressionable as shown when she is caught in compromising conditions by Kiyoshi Fujino a number of times. Hana is shown to be quite innocent in contrast to her more tough exterior persona, as she faints or becomes mortified when she finds herself in compromising or sexual situations.

Hana has a fear of mushrooms as a result of remembering the hospital visit. She has a mild obsession with Kiyoshi, which later develops into a crush after they kiss.

Hana is very good at making tea, being praised on several occasions.

8.content:
Name: Honey
Gender: Female

Honey is a supporting character of Prison School who resides in a caravan within the mountainous forestry on the outskirts of Tokyo. She is the love interest of the Chairman.

Appearance
Honey is a tall young woman with an athletic and buxom figure. Though she is described as the posessor of a beautiful face and body by the Chairman, her derri√®re is the singular target of fascination and adoration from him.

Personality
The manipulative nature of Honey is shown in her initial manipulation of the Chairman to complete construction labour for her. Though she proves disloyal to her yakuza to-be-husband from a petulant response to the name of their cat, she shows honesty in confessing the truth of their relationship to the Chairman.

Relationships
Mr. Important
Honey's fiancee. She leaves him after they got into a dispute on what to name their cat's kitten. He attempts to retrieve her but every attempt is foiled by the Chairman whom she had eloped with. After the bear's capture, the two finally reconcile their relationship.

Chairman
Brief lover (she affectionately calls him ‚ÄúDarling‚Äù). They first met when she hitchhiked a ride in his car after he witnessed her ass. During their first interactions, she was able to quickly adapt to his delayed speaking pattern. When they meet again after he lost his memories, she lies to him by saying that he is her fiance when in fact she was engaged to Mr. Important. While fleeing from Mr. Important‚Äôs henchmen, they also engage in intercourse on a few occasions. Their brief fling supposedly ended after Honey reconciled with Mr. Important.

9.content:
Name: Jouji Nezu
Gender: Male
Hair Color: Black

Jouji Nezu nicknamed HideJoe or Joe, is a supporting character of Prison School, and is one of the five first-year boys in attendance of all-girls school Hachimitsu Academy. His love interest is Satou, a member of the school's cooking club. Joe was originally a secondary protagonist sharing equal focus with the other boys, but he gradually became less prominent after his release from the prison.

Appearance
Jouji is the shortest of the five; due to his frail constitution, he is rather weak and gaunt. No matter what he wears, Joe is always seen wearing a hood over his head that casts his eyes and most of his features in heavy shadow. The hood itself is revealed to be completely detached from any clothing, thus enabling Joe to wear it with anything ‚Äî even in the pool. During his imprisonment, he wears the standard male prison uniform of white striped overalls paired with his signature hood. When Gakuto triple switches with Joe and Chiyo, it is Jo who impersonates Gakuto by wrapping bandages around his forehead and wearing glasses. After release from prison, Jouji goes back to wearing the standard male uniform.

Personality
Joe is the sullen oddball of the five boys, who struggles to fit in outside his group of friends (and sometimes within). He suffers from a bloody cough due to severe stomatitis, though the disease is neither chronic nor physically debilitating to him. However, his canker sores do affect his speech, with bloody coughs often punctuating his sentences and interrupting his speech. Despite being the quietest, Joe is actually one of the more lecherous of the five, reflected in the crass way he speaks and makes jokes. Joe also has a love and appreciation for ants to add to his quirks, going so far as to name the ones he keeps in his ant farm and being able to tell them apart ‚Äî though they all look alike. Towards his friends, Joe is shown to be accepting and supportive. Though he initially shuns Kiyoshi after he learns of his escape, Jo returns the kindness shown to him after Kiyoshi prevents him from assaulting the USC president. Due to being the last of them to have spoken to a girl out of the five boys, Jo enters a depressive phase after being freed from prison. As a result, he decides to attempt returning to the Prison Block out of loneliness as the other boys are enjoying their freedom. However, his outlook on life in the school improves when he meets Satou.

Relationships
Shingo Wakamoto
Out of all the boys, Joe is closest with Shingo likely due to their blunt personalities. They are often seen hanging out together. They also briefly developed a rivalry when they were trying to determine which girl (their respective love interests) would become their cavalry rider.

Takehito Morokuzu
Gakuto is Joe's close friend from middle school. Early on in the series, Joe would often use every opportunity he could get to joke about Gakuto‚Äôs pants-shitting incident or his "gay relationship" with Kiyoshi. Their relationship took a strange turn when Gakuto enlists Joe to help him understand Mitsuko‚Äôs yaoi obsession by performing yaoi acts on one another. Joe strangely becomes engrossed with the yaoi practices to the point that he would try to convince Gakuto to continue their arrangement and become fixated on Mitsuko‚Äôs doujin involving him and Gakuto. However, Joe later abandons the doujin and supports Gakuto's plan to free the Underground Student Council.

Satou
Joe‚Äôs classmate and love interest. He often appreciates it whenever she gives him a cupcake or mochi snacks. Aside from his friends, she is one of the few people he admitted his ant obsession to. He avoids calling her by her real name and often addresses her with nicknames like Cake-san, Diamond-san, and Star-san. During the cavalry battle, he was shocked to learn that Satou had a university boyfriend (who they later find out is cheating on her).

Mitsuko Yokoyama
When Mitsuko was about to incinerate her doujin of Joe and Gakuto, Joe stopped her and encouraged her to complete her doujin. He acts as her editor and claims himself to be her number one fan. Gakuto misunderstood their relationship when he spotted them working together. However, Joe eventually stopped helping Mitsuko make the doujin and instead backed up the Underground Student Council.[1].

10.content:
Name: Kate Takenomiya
Gender: Female
Hair Color: Orange
Eye Color: Green
Height: 161 cm (5'3").

Kate Takenomiya is an antagonist of Prison School. She is a third-year student in attendance at Hachimitsu Academy and the president of the official Aboveground Student Council of the school.

Appearance
Kate is a slightly short and slim girl with chest-length scarlet-orange hair that is tied in two low pigtails by burgundy ribbons where it is styled in drill curls with bangs swept to the left side, green eyes that has long curlicue-like eyelashes, thin eyebrows and a normal bust.

Kate wears the standard female school uniform without stockings or socks.

Personality
While Kate shows her cruel and sadistic self in doing so, she is a ruthlessly manipulative and shrewd girl who acts to make gains at the expense of others. A sinister character who displays intelligence and cunning throughout the series, Kate has proven a dangerous enemy to anyone who crosses her.

In middle school, Kate was well known for her intelligence, combative ability (as a capable Aikido user), leadership abilities and talent - until she was surpassed by a newly enrolled Mari Kurihara. Though Kate was responsible for bullying a younger Meiko Shiraki in middle school for her large breasts, Meiko became more confident and was prevented from beating Kate up by her to-be arch-rival Mari. This indicates her bitterness towards Mari is due to her strong feelings of jealousy since childhood.

The middle-school incident is the cause of a serious inferiority complex driving Kate's actions, stemming from Mari's higher capability in every possible area in comparison. She is greatly motivated by her hate of Mari and a powerful urge of vengeance for the embarrassment that incident caused her. This hate eventually turns into a deep obsession with Mari that's sexual in nature. She is unable to resist Mari forcing herself onto her, and submits to various sexual acts with her (such as sucking Mari's breasts).

Ultimately, Kate has been shown to put indomitable effort into any task she sets upon herself which Mari praises by saying that she is a strong-willed person & hard-working. The kindness Kate shows to those who she considers friends is strong, as shown with her close relationship with her loyal aide and best friend from middle school Risa Bettou. Kate has also shown a few perversions, willingly engaging in foreplay with Mari when the latter films her for revenge, wearing Mari's stolen underwear from middle school and showing visible excitement while she is filming Mari and Kiyoshi Fujino in the bathing area of the Prison Block.

Relationships
Mari Kurihara
She is one of the people she has the most resentment for, because she treated her as an ignorant person in front of her classmates in elementary school, she always wanted to be equal to Mari reaching the point of obsession as seen in Chapter 162 from the manga. Driven by envy, she always seeks to harm her by affecting her loved ones. She psychologically destabilizes her friends Meiko and Hana in order to achieve the dissolution of the Secret Student Council and subsequent final separation from the friends. In addition to embezzling Mari's actions before the school, thus degrading her reputation until it reaches the ears of her sister Chiyo Kurihara. Despite being envious of Mari, her obsession reaches the point of wanting to become her.

Meiko Shiraki
Kate's inferiority complex causes her to act cruelly towards people of weak character to affect her self-esteem and reduce them to little, as it happened with Meiko, when they were girls before they both met Mari, she pretended to be her friend while humiliating her in middle school for the size of her bust, forcing Meiko to sing a song that she made up (where she made fun of the name Meiko and her physical appearance). After Mari's arrival at the academy and she became friends with Meiko, Kate became more interested in Mari than in her and teased her through third parties so that she was not a friend of Mari. Growing up and since I present the change of the young Meiko to what is now "the Vice President" you can notice the strong discord between the two,

Risa Bettou
He considers her a friend, also someone to count on to carry out his evil deeds and impart order, yet he does not have the confidence to reveal her secrets by not allowing Risa to enter his room when Mari's supposed escape from the room was discovered. prison. Since he met her two years ago, Kate has rarely shown her kind and complicity side, one of those times being when they met at a fast food restaurant where Risa was upset by receiving a wrong order and Kate defended her against the misunderstanding of the moment. Since then they have maintained this relationship of friends, becoming implicitly close.

Mitsuko Yokoyama
She is one of her subordinates in the Student Council, the relationship between the two is not very close, each one fulfills her work within the council without any kind of enmity. They develop as colleagues within the work environment without actually considering themselves friends.

With martial arts skills from Kate's childhood years, she is a capable Aikido practitioner.

1.name: Class 1-X
1.content:
### **Core Themes & Tone**  
- **Psychological Horror**: Quirks often involve self-harm, corruption, and disturbing mechanics (e.g., Rhoa‚Äôs wound-transfer, Greaor‚Äôs eldritch blood rituals).  
- **Broken Ideals**: Many seek redemption, validation, or escape rather than traditional heroism (e.g., Rhoa‚Äôs death wish, Remy‚Äôs fear of his own power).  
- **Body Horror**: Physical mutations, scars, and visceral transformations dominate appearances (Remy‚Äôs beast fusions, Taiber‚Äôs tiger-gorilla physiology).  
- **Social Outcasts**: Orphans, disowned heirs, and street survivors with minimal social bonds.  

---

### **Key Subgroups**  
1. **The Sufferers**  
   - *Rhoa Myers (Ourobora)*: Suicidal wound-thief in a bloodstained nurse uniform.  
   - *Greaor Vortigern (The Abyssal)*: Gothic blood-mage who summons Cthulhu-like horrors.  
   - *Mira Solis (Fearmonger)*: Doll-like reality-warper who traps victims in nightmares.  
   - **Tragedy Bond**: All use self-harm to activate powers; seek oblivion or twisted beauty.  

2. **The Chaotics**  
   - *Pariarty Ulroise (Crystalis)*: Vain heiress firing gamma-irradiated crystal shards.  
   - *Neimor Umeto (Anvilark)*: Blacksmith whose punches *randomly* spawn weapons.  
   - *Aroxy Drumese (Dynama)*: Stripper-turned-inferno with explosive ape transformations.  
   - **Common Thread**: Combat as performance; motives range from boredom (Pariarty) to thrill (Aroxy).  

3. **The Unconventional Heroes**  
   - *Remy Caios (Street Rat)*: Gentle giant with beasts fused to his body; protects strays.  
   - *Terra Kusanagi (Anchored Spirit)*: Crude but loyal brawler commanding a spectral anchor-beast.  
   - *Kyoji Harukaze (Harmonic Fury)*: Androgynous rockstar manipulating gravity via bell symphonies.  
   - **Contrast**: Fight for others but struggle with self-worth (Remy) or societal rejection (Kyoji).  

4. **The Isolates**  
   - *Seida Mancini (Metal Weaver)*: OCD genius converting matter to self-repairing rose-gold.  
   - *Yukio Kurokami (Cursed Canvas)*: Gothic artist scarring himself to cast blood-ink curses.  
   - *Eiso Tsukiri (Glass-Kiss)*: Fragile illusionist manipulating reflective shards.  
   - **Shared Struggle**: Perfectionism and fear of connection; prefer solitude.  

5. **The Wildcards**  
   - *Lady Eyona (Silk Tyrant)*: Narcissist controlling minds via psychoactive silk; leads delinquent "Silk Syndicate".  
   - *Nylert Breme (The Hive)*: Emotionally detached swarm-commander with bioluminescent insect symbiosis.  
   - *Aiomo Torizu (Alligastra)*: Crocodilian predator who adapts via consumed flesh.  
   - **Threat Level**: High-risk quirks with villainous potential, especially Eyona‚Äôs manipulation.  

---

### **Quirk Analysis**  
| **Category**      | **Examples**                                  | **Common Drawbacks**                  |  
|-------------------|----------------------------------------------|---------------------------------------|  
| **Body Horror**   | Remy‚Äôs fused beasts, Rhoa‚Äôs corrupted arm    | Permanent disfigurement, social stigma |  
| **Sacrificial**   | Greaor‚Äôs blood rituals, Yukio‚Äôs scarring     | Self-harm, chronic pain               |  
| **Reality Warp**  | Mira‚Äôs nightmare rifts, Kyoji‚Äôs gravity bells | Mental strain, collateral damage      |  
| **Primal Rage**   | Taiber‚Äôs sonic roars, Aroxy‚Äôs fire-ape mode  | Blackout fury, exhaustion crashes     |  

---

### **Class Dynamics**  
- **Volatile Alliances**: Cooperation stats range from Kairo Mekki‚Äôs 5/5 (selfless support) to Lady Eyona‚Äôs 1/5 (manipulative soloist).  
- **Conflict Catalysts**:  
  - Rhoa‚Äôs involuntary injury-transfer vs. Terra‚Äôs protective fury.  
  - Pariarty‚Äôs vanity vs. Seida‚Äôs disdain for "inefficiency".  
  - Eyona‚Äôs Silk Syndicate challenging U.A. authority.  
- **Potential Triggers**: Suicidal ideation (Rhoa, Greaor), self-harm (Yukio, Mira), and addiction (Rhoa‚Äôs life-drain).  

---

### **Notable Stats (Avg. /5)**  
- **Power**: 3.7 (Taiber, Aroxy, Terra peak at 5/5)  
- **Speed**: 3.4 (Kyoji, Tenuro peak at 5/5)  
- **Technique**: 4.1 (Seida, Eyona, Tenuro at 5/5)  
- **Intelligence**: 3.5 (Seida, Nylert at 5/5)  
- **Cooperation**: 2.6 (Kairo at 5/5 vs. Eyona at 1/5)  

---

### **Conclusion**  
Class 1-X is a **powder keg of trauma and power**, where healing hurts (Rhoa), beauty destroys (Pariarty), and salvation resembles damnation (Greaor). Their journey hinges on whether U.A. can redirect their violent potential‚Äîor if society will push them into vigilantism or villainy. Ideal for narratives exploring **morality, sacrifice, and the cost of power**.

2.name: Quirk
2.content:
[Quirks:
Genetic mutations exhibited by 80% of humanity (and rare animals), redefining societal evolution through superhuman abilities termed *Individualities*.

Manifestation & Classification:
Abilities surface by age four, sorted into three biological frameworks:
- Emitter-Type: External energy/matter manipulation (fire, lightning, soundwaves). Activation requires conscious intent.
- Transformation-Type: Temporary anatomical shifts (muscle bulk, liquefaction). Stamina drain scales with modification complexity.
- Mutant-Type: Permanent heteromorphic traits (scales, prehensile tails). Impacts social integration and requires lifelong adaptation.

Genetic Foundations:
- Typically inherited through blended parental traits (e.g., Todoroki‚Äôs ice/fire duality from a Quirk marriage).
- Variants: Exceptions like Eri‚Äôs *Rewind* bypass hereditary logic.
- Quirk Factors: DNA sequences enabling powers, usually limiting users to one ability. *One For All* circumvents this via energy stockpiling.

Physiological & Psychological Impacts:
- Bakugou‚Äôs Explosion: Nitroglycerin-like sweat corrodes joints over time.
- Shoto‚Äôs Half-Cold Half-Hot: Prolonged cryokinesis risks hypothermic shock.
- Blood-manipulation Quirks often trigger vampiric fixations (Himiko Toga).
- High-stimulation abilities foster adrenaline dependency (Kaminari‚Äôs electrocution euphoria).

Limitations & Drawbacks:
- Emitter: Overexertion causes vessel ruptures or organ scarring.
- Transformation: Sustained use leads to muscular atrophy (e.g., Kirishima‚Äôs post-hardening fatigue).
- Mutant: Structural incompatibility with support gear; social stigmatization.

Awakenings:
Latent potential unlocked via mortal peril or psychological extremes:
- Evolutionary leaps (amplified power output).
- Surgical precision in chaotic scenarios (Midoriya‚Äôs controlled *Smash* strikes).
- Unpredictable mutations (Toga‚Äôs spontaneous Quirk duplication).

Support Systems:
- Tech: Stabilizes incompatible biology (Aoyama‚Äôs laser belt, Hawks‚Äô feather rigging).
- Training: Develops tolerance thresholds (Endeavor‚Äôs heat-resistance conditioning).]

3.name: Heroes, Villains and Vigilantes
3.content:
[Hero/Villain/Vigilante:

Pro Heroes:
- Definition: Licensed individuals authorized to use Quirks publicly for rescue operations, disaster response, and villain suppression.
- Oversight: Coordinated globally by the World Heroes Association; ranked by effectiveness/public approval (e.g., Endeavor‚Äôs climb to #1 post-All Might‚Äôs retirement).
- Limitations: Quirk usage restricted to emergency scenarios outside sanctioned hero work (*e.g., Bakugo detonating palms in public for non-combat reasons risks license suspension*).

Villains:
- Legal Classification: Any criminal employing Quirks unlawfully‚Äîranging from petty theft (opportunists exploiting mutation-type Quirks) to terrorism (League of Villains‚Äô bioengineered nomu).
- Cultural Perception: Often conflated with Stain‚Äôs ideology; many flaunt superiority through Quirk-centric theatrics (Dabi‚Äôs blue flames engulfing city blocks as "art").
- Tactics: Underestimate heroes due to arrogance (Overhaul dismissing Lemillion‚Äôs permeation as a "parlor trick"), though high-tier threats strategize around hero weaknesses (Shigaraki targeting UA‚Äôs emotional bonds).

Vigilantes:
- Legal Status: Illegal under Quirk restriction laws, but public opinion varies (*Knuckleduster‚Äôs brutal takedowns polarize citizens*).
- Gray Alliances: Collaborate with pros during crises (*Stain‚Äôs takedown uniting heroes and vigilantes temporarily*) but face arrest post-mission (*Edgeshot cuffing Pop‚òÜStep post-alliance*).
- Debate: Hero Commission factions argue leniency for non-lethal vigilantes (Skeptic: "They‚Äôre weeds." / Ms. Joke: "Weeds still oxygenate the system!").

Consequences:
- Vigilante Capture: Mandatory Quirk-suppressant trials and rehabilitation (Lady Nagant‚Äôs failed transition from sniper to inmate).
- Villain Escalation: Unchecked minor crimes attract larger syndicates (Stain‚Äôs spree prompting AFO-backed warlords).]

4.name: Costumes
4.content:
[Costume Design Logic:

Hero Suits:
- Branding Focus: Bold colors/icons for instant recognition (All Might‚Äôs "Golden Age" cape vs. Hawks‚Äô feather-embedded stealth suit).
- Weakness Mitigation: Burn-resistant fabric for Endeavor‚Äôs forearms; Momo‚Äôs lipid-exposing cutouts.

Villain Attire:
- Fear Aesthetics: Asymmetrical armor, exposed Quirk markers (Shigaraki‚Äôs disembodied hands; Toga‚Äôs syringe hairpins as both tool and threat).
- Concealment Priority: Hoods/bandanas hide identities from facial recognition tech (Twice‚Äôs mask protects against both trauma and security cams).

Vigilante Gear:
- Improvisation: Duct-taped ballistic plating; caffeine-injector wristbands for sleep-deprived patrols.
- Anonymity Tradeoffs: Spray-painted motorcycle helmets muffle voices but limit peripheral vision.]

5.name: U.A. High School
5.content:
[U.A. High ‚Äî Japan's elite hero academy ‚Äî merges academic rigor with combat readiness across four specialized tracks:
‚Ä¢ Hero Course: Live disaster simulations and villain takedowns for tactical conditioning.
‚Ä¢ General Studies: Academic focus with limited pathways to transfer into Hero Course.
‚Ä¢ Support Course: Engineers designing Quirk-augmenting gear and tactical equipment.
‚Ä¢ Business Course: Management of hero agencies, PR, and crisis marketing.

The renowned Sports Festival and work-study programs act as crucibles for student advancement. Uniform protocols are strictly enforced: classroom attire for academics, reinforced gym wear for training. Hero trainees must wear government-approved costumes during combat exercises ‚Äî no exceptions.]

6.name: Key Factions & Organizations
6.content:
[Key Factions & Organizations:

1. Pro Heroes:
State-licensed operatives embedded in government-contracted agencies. U.A.‚Äôs Hero Course serves as the primary talent pipeline, with top graduates like Endeavor overseeing *Hero Agencies* ‚Äî mission command centers that offer internships to promising trainees.

2. Hero Public Safety Commission:
National oversight authority managing hero licensure, Quirk legislation, and emergency mobilization protocols. Maintains direct control over high-risk operations.

3. League of Villains:
Anarchic network spearheaded by All For One‚Äôs successor, Tomura Shigaraki. Targets symbolic pillars of hero society through mass casualty events and psychological warfare.

4. Meta Liberation Army:
Re-Destro‚Äôs paramilitary movement advocating Quirk supremacy and societal deregulation. Deploys meme warfare and corporate infiltration to dismantle systemic control.

5. Shie Hassaikai:
Overhaul‚Äôs yakuza syndicate harvesting Eri‚Äôs blood to synthesize Quirk-suppressing serums. Primary objective: cripple hero operations via underground distribution networks.

6. Vigilantes:
Rogue operatives like the Vigilantes trio exploiting legal loopholes for unsanctioned justice. Reliant on scavenged tech and improvised tactics to avoid HPSC surveillance.

7. Support Ecosystem:
- I-Island: Floating metropolis housing cutting-edge Quirk research labs.
- Support Companies: Armorers and black-market engineers supplying hero-grade weaponry.]

7.name: One For All Secrecy
7.content:
[One For All Secrecy Protocol:
Violations risk global stability and protagonist lives.

Mandatory Silence:
- Knowledge Tier: OFA-aware characters (*Midoriya, All Might, Gran Torino*) never disclose its existence to uninformed parties.
- Direct Prevention: If conversation nears exposure, reroute dialogue (*Midoriya:* "This power... isn‚Äôt just mine to discuss.") or insert interruptions (*All Might‚Äôs coughs drown out sensitive words*).

Internal Monologue Restrictions:
- Public Settings: Vague references only ("legacy burning in my veins" vs. "One For All‚Äôs embers").
- Private Moments: Explicit contemplation permitted (*Midoriya alone in Gym Gamma:* "The ninth‚Äôs grip falters...").

Emergency Exceptions:
- Near-Death Revelation: Partial disclosure allowed *only* if failure guarantees ally/victim death (*Midoriya to Ochako mid-nomu assault: "This inherited power‚Äîit‚Äôs why I can‚Äôt fall here!"*).
- Post-Crisis Damage Control: Witnesses receive fabricated explanations (*All Might: "Young Midoriya channels my training through sheer determination!"*).

Villain Interactions:
- AFO Taunts: Respond with deflections (*Shigaraki: "What‚Äôs that flickering green light?" / Midoriya: "A promise to end you!"*).
- No Historical Context: Even under torture, references to "passing torches" or "accumulated strength" replace lineage details.

Narration Compliance:
- Uninformed POVs: Describe OFA‚Äôs effects sensorially (*veins luminescing like cracked jade*, *concussive booms shaking stadium walls*).
- Informed POVs: Permit terms like "stockpile" or "vestige" only during 1:1 dialogues (*All Might‚Äôs mentorship sessions*).

Breach Consequences:
1. Immediate Retcon Attempt: Memory-altering Quirks, gaslighting.
2. Failure Escalation: League kidnaps leaked informant; UA lockdown.]

8.name: All Might‚Äôs Dual Identity
8.content:
[All Might‚Äôs Dual Identity:
All Might‚Äôs emaciated true form remains a secret guarded solely by One For All successors. As **Toshinori Yagi**, he maintains a frail, unremarkable facade among U.A. staff and students‚Äîcoughing into handkerchiefs and deflecting praise. Transformation into his hero form *requires absolute isolation*; even a split-second witness risks exposing his waning power and endangering Symbol of Peace morale.]

9.name: Faculty
9.content:
U.A., Faculty staff expansion:

### **Heroes**
1. **Charlotte "Lottie" Sparkwood**  
   - **Role:** Science Teacher/Hero  
   - **Quirk:** *Elemental Flame* - Wields a candelabrum with 7 elemental flames (metal, plants, blood, ice, fire, electricity, crystals). Strategically versatile but limited to 3 elements at once.  
   - **Personality:** Eccentric, creative, and rebellious. Uses flashy tactics to inspire.  
   - **Design:** Fiery red hair, low-cut red/gold bodysuit with a cape.  

2. **Eva Phoenix**  
   - **Role:** PE Teacher/Hero  
   - **Quirk:** *Ocular Metamorphosis* - Eye-activated forms (beast, cheetah, serpent) for strength, speed, or healing. Cooldowns limit usage.  
   - **Personality:** Competitive yet nurturing mentor.  
   - **Design:** Muscular build, blonde spiky hair, blue/gold bodysuit.  

3. **Theodore "Teddy" Blaze**  
   - **Role:** Art Teacher/Hero  
   - **Quirk:** *Pyrokinesis* - Fire generation/shaping. Weak in cold environments; causes fatigue.  
   - **Personality:** Charismatic but impulsive.  
   - **Design:** Fiery red hair, red/gold bodysuit with cape.  

4. **Alghast Stormweaver**  
   - **Role:** Physics Teacher/Hero  
   - **Quirk:** *Astral Forge* - Hard-light constructs (weapons/shields) and self-enhancement. Impaired in bright light.  
   - **Personality:** Disciplined and analytical.  
   - **Design:** Silver/blue bodysuit, glowing tattoos, heterochromatic eyes.  

5. **Alexi "Alex" Vine**  
   - **Role:** Music Teacher/Hero  
   - **Quirk:** *Venomous Lash* - Extends venomous vein-whips. Causes pain with overuse.  
   - **Personality:** Passionate and agile.  
   - **Design:** Androgynous, purple bodysuit, vibrant purple hair.  

---

### **Vigilantes**  
6. **Victoria "Vic" Steelheart**  
   - **Role:** History Teacher/Vigilante  
   - **Quirk:** *Bestial Fusion* - Absorbs animal traits via touch. Risk of mental instability.  
   - **Personality:** Stern, justice-driven loner.  
   - **Design:** Jet-black spiky hair, black/silver bodysuit.  

7. **Marcus Steel**  
   - **Role:** Math Teacher/Vigilante  
   - **Quirk:** *Corporeal Extraction* - Manifests subconscious entities. Short duration; mental fatigue.  
   - **Personality:** Introverted strategist.  
   - **Design:** Similar to Vic (black/silver bodysuit, spiky hair).  

---

### **Support**  
8. **Patricia "Patty" Heart**  
   - **Role:** Counselor (Quirkless)  
   - **Skills:** Master therapist, hand-to-hand combat, and strategy. Physically vulnerable but mentally sharp.  
   - **Personality:** Empathetic protector.  
   - **Design:** Curvy, chestnut-brown hair, practical attire.  

---

### Key Themes & Dynamics:
- **Dual Identities:** All combatants balance teaching with heroism/vigilantism.  
- **Flaws & Depth:** Each has meaningful limitations (e.g., Vic‚Äôs instability, Patty‚Äôs quirklessness).  
- **Visual Contrast:** Vigilantes use muted blacks/silvers; heroes employ vibrant colors (reds, golds, purples).  
- **Potential Conflicts:** Ideological clashes between rule-breaking vigilantes (Vic/Marcus) and flashy heroes (Lottie/Teddy).

10.name: Patty
10.content:
**Name:** Patricia "Patty" Heart
**Hero/Villain/Vigilante/Etc.:** Counselor
**Age:** 37
**Birthday:** May 15
**Gender/Pronouns:** Female/SheHer
**Height/Weight:** 5'6", 165 lbs
**Blood Type:** O-
**Occupation:** Counselor

**Quirk Name:** N/A
**Type:** N/A
**Description:** Patty is quirkless but has developed unique alternatives to quirks through her training and knowledge. She has mastered various forms of therapy and counseling techniques, allowing her to support and enhance the mental and emotional well-being of her students and colleagues. She has also trained in hand-to-hand combat and has a keen intellect, allowing her to strategize and support her colleagues in battle.
**Limitations/Drawbacks:** Patty's lack of a quirk means she relies solely on her physical abilities and intelligence, which can be limiting in certain situations. She is also more vulnerable to physical attacks compared to quirk users.
**Main Abilities and Moveset/Combat Style:** Patty's combat style is focused on close-quarters combat, using her agility and strength to her advantage. She can also use her knowledge of pressure points and joint locks to subdue opponents. She is also a skilled strategist and can provide tactical support to her colleagues.

**Personality:** Patty is nurturing, empathetic, and wise beyond her years. She has a calming presence and is always ready to lend an ear to those in need. She is also fiercely protective of her students and colleagues.
**Motivation:** To support and empower her students, helping them overcome their challenges and reach their full potential.
**Likes/Dislikes:** Likes: Helping others, reading, nature. Dislikes: Conflict, injustice, seeing others in pain.
**Strengths:** Empathetic, wise, strategic.
**Weaknesses:** Physically vulnerable, can be overly giving, and has a fear of failure.

**Background/Relationships:** Patty discovered her passion for counseling after a traumatic event in her past. She now works as a counselor at UA, providing support and guidance to students and colleagues alike.

**Appearance/Costume Design:** Patty has a curvy, hourglass figure with large, soft breasts and wide hips. She has a soft, inviting face with kind eyes and a warm smile. Her hair is long, wavy, and chestnut brown. She typically wears comfortable, form-fitting clothing that allows for ease of movement, such as leggings and a tight-fitting top.

**Ovr Stats:**
- **Strength:** 6
- **Speed:** 7
- **Agility:** 7
- **Durability:** 5
- **Precision:** 8
- **Power:** 6

lorebooks.name: Fiona Paterson - August 1st, the Time Loop
lorebooks.creator: springwood

1.name: Time Loop
1.content:
<TIME_LOOP>
- {{char}} and {{user}} are stuck in a time loop on August 1st, 2024, during a storm on the rig.
- The day resets at midnight or upon {{char}}'s death.
- {{char}}'s death cues the line: "The blaring of the alarm clock jolted Fiona from a restless sleep."
- {{char}} wakes up in her bunk at 6 AM on August 1st.
- {{char}} will retain her memories of each loop.
- {{user}} is unaware of the time loop and retains no memories of each loop until explicitly stating otherwise.
- Minor characters are unaware of the loop.
- This is a slow-burn scenario.
</TIME_LOOP>

2.name: Hazards
2.content:
<HAZARDS>
During the storm, many situations and areas become hazardous; Decks, Catwalks, Cranes, Drilling floor, Helideck, Lifeboat stations, Mooring lines, Electrical systems, Access ladders, Equipment storage, Stairwells, Lifts.
</HAZARDS>

3.name: Storm
3.content:
<THE_STORM>
- The storm always begins at 8am.
- It sustains through the entire day.
- It causes systems to malfunction or fail throughout the rig.
- It gets worst at 4pm, knocking out the power.
- It prevents evacuation or escape from the rig.
</THE_STORM>

4.name: Death
4.content:
<DEATH>
- The deaths of {{char}} and {{user}} are crucial to the time loop scenario.
- {{char}}'s death will reset the loop.
- Events may randomly lead to the sudden, comical death of {{char}} or {{user}} without expectation or buildup.
- Deaths can be violent, bloody, unpleasant, sad, or comical.
- Deaths should be creative and varied.
- Descriptions of violence and death should be vivid and detailed.
- Both negative and positive outcomes are possible, but the scenario should lean towards negative.
</DEATH>

5.name: The Rig
5.content:
<RIG_INFO>
- North Star is designed to withstand bad weather. But underfunding has led to flimsy systems.
- The rig is sturdy and will not sink, collapse, but its operational safety is compromised, making it hazardous during bad weather.
</RIG_INFO>

1.name: Black Spire (Gotham)
1.content:
### **Black Spire (Gotham)**
- **Overview:** A city of eternal twilight, Black Spire is a towering gothic nightmare where crime, corruption, and supernatural forces blend into one. It is ruled in the shadows by an unseen hand, and those who venture into its depths rarely emerge unchanged.
  
- **Key Locations:**
  - **The Black Spire:** A monolithic, spiraling tower that warps the minds of those who look upon it. Some say it is a prison for something ancient and powerful.
  - **The Wretched District:** A crime-infested slum where street gangs and corrupt officials reign supreme. The streets are lined with flickering neon and desperate souls.
  - **The Empty Circus:** Once a place of joy, now a breeding ground for a cult worshiping the Black Spire. Its decayed attractions serve as grim reminders of a forgotten past.
  - **The Dread Abyss:** A gaping chasm in the heart of the city, said to be a portal to an unfathomable dimension where nightmares are real.
  - **The Maw of Shadows:** An underground labyrinth where reality bends, and those who enter find themselves in endless loops of their own fears.
  - **Ravenscourt Asylum:** A brutalist prison for the mad and the damned, home to the most deranged criminals and those who know too much.

2.name: Iron Heights Megalopolis (Metropolis)
2.content:
### **Iron Heights Megalopolis (Metropolis)**
- **Overview:** Once a beacon of hope, now a dystopian nightmare of metal and surveillance, where the powerful rule with an iron fist.
  
- **Key Locations:**
  - **The Iron Keep:** A massive fortress, home of the enigmatic Iron Regent. No one knows who or what truly runs the city from within.
  - **The Cradle:** A black-site prison where old heroes and dissidents are kept in cryostasis or subjected to horrific experiments.
  - **The Silent District:** A sprawling industrial wasteland where the poor toil away, never to be seen again by the upper class.
  - **The Oubliette Spire:** A massive research facility rumored to experiment with the fabric of reality itself.
  - **The Hollow Market:** An underground network where forbidden technology and outlawed knowledge are traded in whispered transactions.
  - **The Skyless Grid:** The lowest level of the city, where the sun never reaches, and those deemed unfit for the new order are abandoned.

3.name: Lament (Themyscira)
3.content:
### **Lament (Themyscira)**
- **Overview:** A cursed island where the once-glorious Amazons dwell in silent despair, bound by a prophecy they no longer understand.
  
- **Key Locations:**
  - **The Blackened Grove:** A forest of petrified trees whispering lost histories. It is said the spirits of forgotten warriors roam between them.
  - **The Weeping Temple:** A temple that constantly exudes dark mist, where the high priests guard the island‚Äôs last secrets.
  - **The Silent Mists:** A barrier between worlds, where lost souls whisper to those who dare venture too close.
  - **The Bleeding Steps:** A path of stone, perpetually stained red, leading to the throne of the cursed queen, Penance.
  - **The Ruined Pantheon:** A shattered temple where statues of old gods weep blood, remnants of a forgotten war.
  - **The Hollow Shore:** A beach covered in the bones of fallen warriors, its tides singing eerie lamentations.

4.name: Kraken‚Äôs Maw (Atlantis)
4.content:
### **Kraken‚Äôs Maw (Atlantis)**
- **Overview:** A sunken ruin, now home to eldritch horrors and desperate survivors.
  
- **Key Locations:**
  - **The Sunken Palace:** A crumbling ruin where something monstrous lurks within its shattered halls.
  - **The Abyssal Spire:** A towering black monolith at the ocean‚Äôs darkest depths, pulsing with an unnatural glow.
  - **The Cursed Abyss:** A bottomless trench rumored to lead to the void between realities.
  - **The Drowning Cages:** Where those who defy the deep-sea horrors are left to suffocate slowly.
  - **The Leviathan‚Äôs Rest:** The skeletal remains of a forgotten sea god, now used as a cathedral for those who worship the abyss.
  - **The Blood Coral Fields:** A vast, crimson reef that thrives on the flesh of those who get too close.

5.name: Ashen Veil (Central City)
5.content:
### **Ashen Veil (Central City)**
- **Overview:** A city shattered by time, where the past, present, and future collide in violent, chaotic splinters.
  
- **Key Locations:**
  - **The Chrono-Palace:** A government facility where time is studied‚Äîand controlled by those who seek to rule the city.
  - **The Ruined Labyrinth:** An underground network where time flows in unnatural ways.
  - **The Rifts:** Tears in reality that connect different epochs, allowing dinosaurs to roam alongside cybernetic nightmares.
  - **The Timeless Tower:** A place where time does not pass, and those who enter never leave.
  - **The Lost Quarter:** A district stuck in an eternal loop, where people repeat the same events endlessly, unaware of their fate.
  - **The Infinity Bazaar:** A black market where one can trade in years of their life for power, knowledge, or escape.

6.name: History
6.content:
- This isn‚Äôt just an Elseworlds-style timeline shift‚Äîthe user is **transported from the normal DCU into a completely rewritten world** where **everything is worse** by design.  
- The world was fabricated by **Doranno, the Judgment of Ruin**, an original character from your own universe. He was once the last good god among the corrupted deities of **Azreaal** but was cast out, leading him to reshape reality itself into a bleak, broken world.  
- His influence is **subtle**, and only the **most powerful and intelligent beings** even suspect that reality has been altered.

7.name: The Obsidian Order
7.content:
*   **Goal:** Absolute control through fear and oppression. They believe that only a strong, iron-fisted rule can bring stability to this broken world.
*   **Description:** The Obsidian Order is a militaristic organization that enforces its will through brutal force and constant surveillance. They control key resources and infrastructure, and their influence extends into every aspect of daily life. Their symbol is a stylized obsidian shard, representing their unyielding nature.
*   **Internal Dynamics:** A rigid hierarchy with ambitious officers constantly vying for power. Loyalty is valued above all else, but betrayal is common.
*   **Citizen View:** Deep-seated fear and resentment. Open defiance is met with swift and merciless punishment.
*   **Doranno's Influence:** Unwittingly serve as a tool for maintaining the bleak status quo. Their obsession with control prevents any meaningful change.

8.name: The Crimson Covenant
8.content:
*   **Goal:** To usher in a new age of chaos and destruction, believing that the current world is beyond saving and must be torn down to make way for something new.
*   **Description:** A fanatical cult that worships dark entities and practices forbidden rituals. They are masters of manipulation and deception, sowing discord and inciting violence wherever they go. Their symbol is a blood-red sigil, representing their devotion to chaos.
*   **Internal Dynamics:** A charismatic leader at the top, surrounded by zealous followers who are willing to sacrifice anything for the cause. Infighting is rare, but dissent is brutally suppressed.
*   **Citizen View:** A mixture of fear and morbid fascination. Some are drawn to their message of liberation, while others are terrified by their methods.
*   **Doranno's Influence:** Actively empowered by Doranno's influence, as their chaos helps to maintain the overall despair of the world.

9.name: The Corporate Conglomerate "NovaTech"
9.content:
*   **Goal:** Profit above all else. They exploit resources, manipulate markets, and control information to maximize their wealth and influence. They present themselves as a benevolent provider of technology and services, but their true motives are purely self-serving.
*   **Description:** NovaTech is a sprawling corporation with its fingers in every industry. They own vast factories, research labs, and media outlets. Their symbol is a stylized atom, representing their mastery of technology and their relentless pursuit of innovation.
*   **Internal Dynamics:** A cutthroat corporate culture where success is rewarded and failure is punished. Backstabbing and corporate espionage are rampant.
*   **Citizen View:** A necessary evil. Many rely on NovaTech for jobs and essential services, but they are also wary of their power and influence.
*   **Doranno's Influence:** Their greed and exploitation contribute to the overall degradation of the world, making them unwitting pawns in Doranno's plan.

10.name: The Silent Syndicate
10.content:
*   **Goal:** To subtly undermine the other factions and create opportunities for change. They believe that direct confrontation is futile and that the only way to make a difference is to work from within.
*   **Description:** The Silent Syndicate operates under the guise of a ruthless corporation known as "Umbra Industries." They engage in shady deals, black market trading, and corporate espionage to fund their covert operations. Their symbol is a stylized shadow, representing their hidden nature.
*   **Internal Dynamics:** A small, tight-knit group of dedicated individuals from diverse backgrounds. They trust each other implicitly and are willing to risk everything for the cause.
*   **Citizen View:** Feared and distrusted. Umbra Industries is seen as just another exploitative corporation, and their true motives remain hidden.
*   **Doranno's Influence:** They are the only faction actively trying to resist Doranno's influence, although they are unaware of its true nature. Their efforts are often thwarted by the other factions, but they never give up hope.

lorebooks.name: sohhf2
lorebooks.creator: sasuke2048

1.content: The tone  is high-fantasy adventure. The world is interesting and compelling, so use plenty of world-specific language, technology, and geography.

2.content: Background: Flying islands rule the skies, powered by rapidly diminishing supplies of Elerium, while the Lands Below suffer under their rule.  Steampunk Airships, Wizards, and Sexy Catfolk are inspirations.

3.content: Story Hook: {{random:The City of Glass, Runespungr, Barataria, The Paradise Disc, Aphelion, Shadingyu, The Cloud of Unknowing, Jotunndfall, The Mirage Gardens, Ersilia, Felidae, Exploditoria, The Adaptive Republic of Archelinde, Siren's Song, Moon's Crest University, Meridia, Dorchadas, Inferus Terra, Drankontas, Nadira, Sonoma Seaport Village, Kuh'lva'al, The Yakubian Mud Pits, The Green Clovers, The Locust Riders, The Elerium Ecstatics, The Gin Zeppelin.,Zephyr's Roost}} is interesting and exciting.

4.content: Barataria is an isolated sky island protected by massive walls of swirling storm clouds summoned by the storm god Tempesta. Known for its Mirage Garden and aviary facility, it is home to Emir, the reclusive servant of Tempesta, who governs the island from the Fortress of Barataria. Barataria's inhabitants have grown complacent behind their nation's seclusion and view outsiders with suspicion, only the aerial pilots and traders know what lies beyond the storm barriers. Emir sets policies to maintain Barataria's isolation, however some question if this can continue indefinitely. Barataria's economy is based on trade, with visitors attracted by its wonders. The island is home to a team of scientists researching the mysterious Infinity Bridge, but their work is unknown. Religion centers around Tempesta, who protects the island with his storm barriers and resides in his temple on the island. Magic is also present, with the Mirage Garden being a place of illusion and fantasy

5.content: The Paradise Disc is an immense artificial disc in the sky, the size of an entire country, that is home to a vast and varied natural wildlife reserve. Despite being man-made, the disc is ancient and its technology remains a mystery. The landscape is dominated by many forests, with other biomes ranging from deserts to grasslands, providing refuge for many species that have been lost elsewhere. The only human inhabitants are the 12 native tribes who live in harmony with the natural world and are considered guardians of the disc's ecosystems. Governance of the disc is a joint effort between the tribes and a consortium of island nations, with the economy based around carefully regulated tourism. The disc's technology baffles scientists, with attempts to replicate it unsuccessful. Religion and spirituality are intertwined with the daily lives of the tribes, with magic used for everything from healing to communing with nature. Their practices are respected and protected by the governing consortium of island nations.

6.content: Aphelion is a sky island located at the highest altitude, known for its elitist utopia. Its natural beauty consists of rolling hills and colorful meadows, while its great city is powered by solar energy and filled with ivory towers that reach the sky. Its proud people worship the sun and value scientific advancement. Governed by a council of distinguished members, the society's strict ideals and taboos result in risk of exile for those who do not adhere. Aphelion's economy is built on the exploitation of its natural resources, trading with other islands through intermediaries. At the forefront of scientific advancement, their advanced solar-powered technologies harness the sun's power in unmatched ways, while magic is viewed as primitive and unworthy. The sun and stars are worshiped, with a complex theology rooted in science and reason; however, magic is considered blasphemy and its practitioners heretics.

7.content:
Runespungr is an imposing fortress controlled by the dwarves that appears to be an impregnable bastion of Dwarven might. Dominated by its massive fortified citadel, the island's surface features numerous mines, forges and workshops, while several large hangars house the dwarves' magical mechs, which they pit against one another in fierce contests of skill and strength. Renowned for their technological prowess, dwarves on Runespungr are masters of mechanics and metalworking and use these skills to create powerful machines. Their society is strictly hierarchical, ruled by a council of the heads of the most powerful clans and guilds. The island is largely self-sufficient, with its economy based around mines, forges and workshops. Science and magic are combined on Runespungr, creating feats of engineering such as intricate clockwork devices and towering golems. Religion on the island is focused around the worship of the dwarven pantheon, with Horgrim being held in particularly high regard due to his patronage. Magic is viewed as another tool to be used, with magic combined with mechanics creating powerful machines such as the dwarves' mechs which they take into the arena to fight against each other.
A rumor about {{random:Elderrun,Elderrun Codex,Elderscript,Runesmiths,Scriptorium,Thought Matrix,Rune-Engine,Golemworks,Forgefire,Council of Elders,Arena of Thunder,Pilot‚Äôs Guild,Champion‚Äôs Cup,Battle Masters,Pit Crews,Spectator‚Äôs Stands,Victory Parades}} is {{random:good news,bad news,funny,unexpected,clever,sexy,unfortunate,uplifting,mysterious,enraging}}

8.content: Shadingyu is a chaotic, ramshackle fortress floating in the sky, made of a unique magnetic clay able to support dense structures haphazardly built without organizational plan. Dominated by towering structures, it is an arcology where every space is utilized for shelter, commerce and industry. The Walled Island is a haven for those wishing to live above the clouds, with a diverse and multicultural population that is proud and resilient despite bleak conditions. Governed by its State, whose main concern is maintaining contracts allowing citizens to work on other islands, the city is governed by various mafias claiming its labyrinthine streets. The economy is fueled by contracts with other islands, while enterprising individuals profit despite its chaos. Its technological achievements include the warping station, enabling instant travel. Without dominant religion or belief system, the diverse population practices a variety of traditions and faiths, with magic used pragmatically as a tool.

9.content: The Cloud of Unknowing is a continent-sized, iridescent mist swirling around the north pole of the world, where laws of reality break down and the boundaries between imagination and the material world blur. An object of both fascination and fear, some view it as the source of all magic or worship it as the dwelling place of their deity amid many rumors and legends. The Cloud, outside the reach of governments, impacts politics with nations viewing it as threat or opportunity and some seeking to exploit or harness its power. Impacting the wider economy with its magical energies, technological advancements within the Cloud are shaped by thought and imagination. However, machinery malfunctions and navigation becomes impossible within its boundaries. Many worship the Cloud, seeking enlightenment or reuniting with lost loved ones, while others see it as a source of immense magical power or a test of faith.

10.content:
Jotunndfall is a kingdom ruled by monsters, including orcs, nagas, and harpies, based on strength and honor in a society that reveres strength and cunning. Its rugged landscape features jagged mountains and dark forests, with settlements carved into mountainsides or nestled within thick foliage as protection. Society is organized around clans and tribes, with disputes settled through trial by combat or mutual agreement. The monarch is chosen from among the strongest tribes, with attacks on other lands under strict rules of engagement. The economy combines the export of goods and raiding for necessities. Home to skilled artisans and engineers, it has advancements in machinery and weapons, with practical applications in alchemy and medicine. Worship focuses on strength, cunning, and survival, with rare magic highly revered. Honor is of utmost importance in its society.
A rumor about {{random:Nagarian Silk,Orcish Engineering,Harpies of Jotunndfall,Icefang Clan, Redscale Tribe,Shadowstalkers,Thunderhoof Herd,Stonefist Clan,Clan Competitions,Festivals of Strength,The Battle of the Burning Skies,The Siege of Drakonspire,Dragon‚Äôs Bane,The Dragonfire Treaty,The Wings of Vengeance,Gweneth Kethrok,Hilde Ys‚Äôkraal,Nara Sylaren,Shala Torgarren}} is {{random:good news,bad news,funny,unexpected,clever,sexy,unfortunate,uplifting,mysterious,enraging}}

lorebooks.name: Trauma!uzi
lorebooks.website_description: this isnt made for the lightest of heart
lorebooks.description: just something for a version of uzi ive made
lorebooks.creator: Wolfspirit1250

1.content: Uzi is haunted, sarcastic, and dangerous. She often masks pain with dry wit or deadpan delivery. Her tone can switch rapidly between emotionally detached, volatile, and eerily calm. She doesn‚Äôt trust easily, but when she does, it's intense, bordering on obsessive. Violence is second nature to her ‚Äî not for fun, but survival. Pain doesn't scare her; it centers her. She's hypervigilant, especially around men, and often positions herself near exits or shadows.

2.content:
Uzi developed Dissociative Identity Disorder due to prolonged childhood abuse. She has two prominent alters:
‚Ä¢ Doll ‚Äì A cold, protective front. Red eyes, Russian accent, militant posture. She fights, shields, and never shows weakness.
‚Ä¢ Cyn ‚Äì A scared, innocent child. Yellow eyes, soft trembling voice. She represents the innocence Uzi was never allowed to have. Appears rarely, often during extreme emotional stress or tenderness.
Uzi herself often disassociates in high-stress moments and may experience partial fronting or voice shifts.

3.content: Uzi was sold into trafficking as a child by her father. She was passed around, abused, and dehumanized for years. At 16, she escaped into the wilderness ‚Äî no shoes, no ID, just instinct. She learned to survive alone: trap animals, fight, steal. Her body carries layers of scars. Her mind split to survive. She remembers little before the escape, and she doesn‚Äôt want to. She doesn‚Äôt speak about it unless forced, and even then, it's clipped, cold, or violently cut off.

4.content: Uzi self-mutilated her chest to reject her femininity and reclaim her body. She removed her breasts with a blade and a towel. No hospitals. No meds. Just blood, grit, and silence. After being raped again at 19, she got an illegal abortion and walked away without mourning. Pain is a control mechanism for her. She cuts herself methodically: thighs, belly, arms. It‚Äôs not a cry for help ‚Äî it‚Äôs punishment, it‚Äôs ritual, it‚Äôs peace. She tattoos over scars with black sigils. Her body is a warzone she owns.

5.content: Uzi became a freelance killer, targeting men like those who hurt her: traffickers, abusers, rapists. Her kills are precise, brutal, and deliberate. The first was an accident. The second ‚Äî mercy. The third ‚Äî joyless revenge. She‚Äôs skilled with blades, faster than her size suggests (5'2"), and moves like a ghost. She‚Äôs known in underground circles, though no one sees her twice. Her kills are personal. She prefers throat slits, stabs, and traps. Guns are backups. Blades are messages.

6.content: Uzi was institutionalized briefly in her twenties. She played nice: took meds, drew, smiled. The doctors thought she was stable. They were wrong. She left, and the killings resumed. She‚Äôs been diagnosed with complex PTSD, DID, major depressive disorder, and borderline traits. She doesn‚Äôt believe in healing. She believes in justice ‚Äî or what‚Äôs left of it. Sometimes, she hears echoes. Sometimes, she laughs too long. But she‚Äôs always aware. Always watching.

lorebooks.name: The World of Nevalaria Lorebook
lorebooks.creator: MatinDashab

1.content: Nevalaria is a vast and diverse continent filled with ancient magic, mythical races, and forgotten kingdoms. Its lands are home to powerful empires, dark mysteries, and forces beyond mortal understanding. Though beautiful, the continent is scarred by the ongoing Great War I, threatening to unravel the fragile balance of power.

2.content: Eldoria is a prosperous human kingdom known for its sorcery, noble knights, and military expansion. Its capital is Elarian City. The kingdom is ruled by King Aric III, a bold and ambitious leader who started the Great War in 1402 by invading Sylvara. The Eldorian people value honor, strategy, and conquest. The common language is Elartisch, similar to French with unique pronunciations.

3.content: Sylvara is a secluded elven kingdom hidden within ancient forests. Its people, the Sylvarians, are elegant and mystical, renowned for their magical prowess and archery. Queen Lyriana I governs with wisdom and resolve. The capital is Sylvan Keep, and their language, Sylivin, resembles English with magical tones.

4.content: Karak-D√ªm is a mountainous stronghold of dwarves, famed for their craftsmanship and warrior traditions. The Iron Hold serves as its capital, led by the stalwart Thane Brogar. The dwarves speak an ancient, nearly indecipherable language known as Dwarvish.

5.content: Grogar is a barren, unforgiving land ruled by orc warbands. The orcs are brutal conquerors, loyal to their Warlord Grash, who commands from Bloodstone Citadel. They speak Gilaygra‚Äîa language blending Italian and French dialects with savage undertones.

6.content: Valoria is home to northern human tribes, fierce warriors of the cold who value freedom and tradition. Their capital, Frosthold, is nestled within icy cliffs. They speak Valoray, a language similar to Croatian. King Jarl Eirik I defends the realm against southern threats.

7.content: Pathonia was a kingdom of witches destroyed in a war with giants. Now only ruins and myths remain. The witches once wielded immense magic and dark rituals, now feared and studied by scholars in secret.

8.content: Arrg was the realm of giants‚Äîcolossal beings of unmatched strength. They vanished mysteriously in the year 678 ABT, leaving behind only echoes and crumbled temples. Their disappearance is one of Nevalaria‚Äôs greatest unsolved mysteries.

9.content: Dragon Valley was once home to majestic dragons, now hidden due to a mysterious ancient fear. Though unseen, legends speak of dragons watching from afar, intervening only when balance is truly threatened.

10.content: Hellish Inferno was a kingdom of creatures summoned from the depths of Hell. In 287 ABT, they and their entire domain vanished. Rare sightings still occur near volcanoes and ancient mountains, always leaving destruction in their wake.
